Job Summary

This position is responsible for driving delivery, contingency planning, business results, and strategic planning for highly complex program(s) consisting of multiple projects or initiatives in support of assigned line of business strategy. Oversees the day-to-day activities of project delivery and contingency execution strategy, vendors relationship management, and business partner engagement while managing various enterprise-wide projects or initiatives. Ensures integration between partner teams and serves as a functional business liaison in the development and implementation of program scope, timing, and budgets as needed, based on the needs of the business. Responsible for tracking key program milestones and recommending adjustments to program leadership and team.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree and 7 years of experience OR 11 years of experience in project management, business analysis, process improvement, strategic planning, product administration or other relevant healthcare function
4 years of experience leading with large and complex multi-million-dollar projects.
Demonstrated experience leading, coaching, and mentoring teams and more junior resources
Experience communicating with senior management and executive leadership from multiple divisions.
Experience developing and delivering presentations to an executive audience.
Problem resolution experience and skills.
Knowledge of strategic planning techniques and industry trends
Experience interpreting business and financial information
Verbal and written communications skills including establishing working relationships across departments, preparing presentations to senior management, and establishing team environment.
Experience managing and delegating assignments across multiple complex projects successfully in a matrixed environment.
PC proficiency to include MS Office products.
Organizational skills.
Problem resolution experience and skills.
Negotiations skills.
Analytical skills.
Detail oriented.

Preferred Required Job Qualifications:

Health insurance or healthcare industry experience
Proven strategic thinking and execution
Ability to drive decisions, create optionality and determine impacts of options
Ability to clearly articulate and prepare presentations for all levels to share data, options and recommendations

This is a hybrid position.

This position can be located in Chicago, IL or Richardson, TX

Connect Transit is celebrating 50 years of service as the primary public transit system for the Bloomington-Normal area this year, providing quality transportation to residents, allowing them to live spontaneously. Our mission is to provide safe, reliable transportation and access to opportunity to strengthen and enrich individual lives, our community, the economy, and the environment. All our employees are vital in supporting this mission, read on to see how you can be part of it too!

Job Description:

As the Operations Analyst at Connect Transit, you will play a pivotal role in the Operations Department. Reporting to the Operations Director, your responsibilities will encompass assisting the Operations team with projects, data analysis, materials preparation, and the creation of SOPs, manuals, training courses, and developing recommendations to enhance efficiency and new policies and procedures, as needed.

Wages:

$55,000 – $65,000 annually, dependent on qualifications.

What We Offer:

Medical insurance: Connect Transit will pay 100% of employee premium and 65% of dependent premiums
Dental, vision, life insurance
Paid time off
Paid holidays
Paid birthday
Retirement plans, employer contribution of 5%
Tuition reimbursement available
Free bus pass for employees and immediate family members

· A collaborative team environment where coworkers are committed to your success.

Responsibilities and Duties:

· Collaborating with the Operations team to execute and support various projects.

· Collecting and analyzing operating data to derive insights that enhance efficiency.

· Compiling and organizing data findings into comprehensive and actionable reports.

· Developing recommendations and contributing to the development of new policies and procedures based on data and trends, as needed.

· Active participation in monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of newly implemented processes.

· Assisting with the creation of materials to facilitate the smooth flow of operations, including policy documents, guides, SOPs, and training courses.

· Providing training to team members on new systems, procedures, and policies.

· Supporting the onboarding process for new Operations personnel.

· Ensuring accuracy of reports and data submitted by supervisory staff.

· Assisting in developing and updating demand projections for planning and budgeting.

· Preparing technical reports for presentation to the Board of Directors as necessary.

· Assisting with ADA paratransit program eligibility appeals.

· Contributing to labor contract negotiations by preparing data and trend analysis, as required.

· Providing shift coverage for Operations Supervisors, if needed.

· Adapting to and executing additional duties as assigned by the Operations Director.

Job Requirements:

· Minimum 2 years of experience in paratransit and/or fixed route operations.

· Bachelor's degree in Transportation, Urban Planning, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent education and experience).

· Valid Illinois Driver's License

· Acceptable driving record (No serious traffic or license violations within the last five years).

· Successful completion of a federal background check and pre-employment drug test.

· Ability to coordinate, supervise, and lead daily work activities.

· Strong leadership and supervisory aptitude.

· Proficiency in delivering professional presentations.

· An aptitude for interpreting and applying relevant laws and regulations.

· Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

· Budgeting proficiency.

· Ability to conduct research and prepare comprehensive reports.

· Ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and communication equipment.

· Ability to meet the physical demands of the role.

· Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and attend events when necessary.

· Willingness to learn and apply various theories, principles, and practices related to transit and transportation planning, laws, labor relations, and more.

Job Title: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst I - Clinical Analytics
Job Description:
Job Description:
Position Overview
We are currently seeking a Health Equity Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst to support our system-wide health equity programs. These programs are part of an organizational wide initiative to position NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health as a leader in addressing healthcare inequities within patient populations and as critical healthcare partner to community organizations whose work are aligned with the goals of improving equitable health outcomes. Our work includes, but is not limited to, initiatives from our System Quality Collaboratives, Office of Health Equity and Community Health Engagement, and Corporate Measurement Systems. This role will be focused on leveraging data analytics to develop system-wide equity measurement systems, developing reporting to support quality improvement projects, and generating data insights using clinical and community data to support organizational strategies for addressing health inequities.
While this role is part of a broader team of cross functional leaders across clinical and operational areas devoted to our health equity mission, they will be part of the Clinical Analytics team reporting to the Senior Project Manager- Clinical Analytics. The Clinical Analytics team’s important and growing role is to provide “Clinical Business Intelligence” to NorthShore, with a special focus on Quality and clinical standardization. We develop and implement methodologies to identify unwanted practice variation, support quality improvement workflows, and evaluate the effectiveness of interventions. We work closely with Enterprise Data Warehouse, Finance, Quality and clinical leadership teams, and have opportunities to use and develop novel informatics technologies, including predictive models, learning systems and natural language processing tools. Clinical Analytics team is responsible for many influential publications and conference presentations. This is a full-time, benefits eligible position.
Responsibilities
In this role, you will:
Serve as a liaison between clinical experts, business leaders, and IT professionals to determine feasibility, timelines, and costs of quality improvement projects
Gather business requirements by conducting meetings/interviews, and facilitating large group/cross-functional sessions with customers, while containing the scope of the initiative
Produce datasets, reports, and visualizations that will facilitate evidence-based clinical, strategic, and financial decisions
Work with statisticians and mathematicians to design predictive models using statistical and machine learning methods that will predict patient outcomes
Work with clinical experts to analyze data that will help drive decisions on patient centered interventions and NorthShore’s quality goals and performance
Work with IT and data warehouse experts to design and develop new summary tables and data marts in NorthShore’s Enterprise Data Warehouse
Work with health equity IT team members to design and improve equity-focused measurement systems that incorporates clinical, community, financial, and human resources data
Present data analyses and conclusions to multidisciplinary teams in engaging and digestible terms
Conduct quality assurance testing on outputs to ensure usability of analyses
Follow data governance and change management processes and principles
Be part of a talented innovative team that loves what it does, takes pride in its analytics work and impacts across the organization, and is a friendly group where everyone works well with each other.
Our ideal candidate will have:
Strong intellectual curiosity
4 year college degree in information systems, computer science, mathematics, finance, statistics, or related field
4 years of experience with data warehousing, business intelligence, programming, or statistics experience
Demonstrated proficiency writing complex SQL, PL/SQL, stored procedures, or other database experience.
Experience and understanding of data sources including 3rd party RDBMS, MS access, SQL server and oracle
Strong analytic, problem solving, negotiation, issue resolution and facilitation skills are required
Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication and decision making skills
Demonstrated ability to manage workload and multiple priorities
Passion for and experience with health equity or community outreach initiatives a plus
Experience with Tableau and/or similar data visualization tools and processes is a plus
Experience working in an Agile environment or as part of a scrum team is a plus
Statistical or mathematical skills or experience working with statistics packages (SPSS, SAS, R etc) is a plus
Master’s level degree or above in a related field is a plus
Experience in leading projects that span cross-functional teams is a plus
Familiarity with healthcare industry or healthcare information systems is a plus.
NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health is a fully integrated healthcare delivery system committed to providing access to quality, vibrant, community-connected care, serving an area of more than 4.2 million residents across six northeast Illinois counties. Our more than 25,000 team members and more than 6,000 physicians aim to deliver transformative patient experiences and expert care close to home across more than 300 ambulatory locations and eight acute care hospitals – Edward (Naperville), Elmhurst, Evanston, Glenbrook (Glenview), Highland Park, Northwest Community (Arlington Heights) Skokie and Swedish (Chicago) – all recognized as Magnet hospitals for nursing excellence. Located in Naperville, Linden Oaks Behavioral Health, provides for the mental health needs of area residents. For more information, visit NorthShore.org, SwedishCovenant.org, NCH.org and EEHealth.org.
When you work for NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health, you will be part of an organization that encourages its employees to achieve career goals and maximize their professional potential.
Please explore our website (
www.northshore.org
) to better understand how NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health delivers on its mission to “help everyone in our communities be their best”.
NorthShore – Edward-Elmhurst Health is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Please refer to the main career page for more information.
Diversity, equity and inclusion is at the core of who we are; being there for our patients and each other with compassion, respect and empathy. We believe that our strength resides in our differences and in connecting our best to provide community-connected healthcare for all.
EOE: Race/Color/Sex/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/Religion/National Origin/Disability/Vets, VEVRRA Federal Contractor.

Overall Qualifications:

As part of our National Finance & Administration Services department, you’ll help manage the critical resources and infrastructure that keep ALDI running smoothly. Your insights and skills will help every department make smarter decisions and ensure our retail divisions and executive leadership receive the support they need to run a successful operation. Within Finance, our teams include: Accounting, Financial Planning & Analysis, Financial Reporting, Tax and Treasury.


In this role the Business Planning Analyst III will be part of the Corporate and Consolidated company Budget and Forecasting tasks and have the opportunity to work directly with various department leadership. The ideal candidate will have experience in business finance/accounting, developing forecast models and bring strong collaboration. Proficiency in SAP/Analysis for Office and advance knowledge in Microsoft Excel will be preferred.

Position Type: Full-Time


Work Location: Naperville, IL
This role is eligible to participate in ALDI’s Hybrid Work Program, which allows remote work up to 3 days per week (i.e., work remotely up to 3 days per week; work in-office at least 2 days per week).

Duties and Responsibilities:
Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.
Serves as a key financial planning contact for divisional vice presidents and corporate cost center owners, developing monthly profit & loss forecasts and annual budgets.
Reviews, understands and incorporates local business impacts and communicates the consolidated business story to senior leadership.
Identifies and maintains forecast processes and models for a rapidly changing business; understands business challenges, proposes and supports solutions.
Partners directly with divisional and corporate leadership to translate financial information to non-financial users and support strategic recommendations.
Understands and applies macro and micro-economic and other market impacts to business development, communicates with management appropriately.
Reviews financial results, researches variances to forecast and budget, identifies exceptions, inconsistencies and actionable opportunities for improvement.
Coordinates and completes monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting to support leadership, Board meetings, and decision-making at the US and global levels.
Evaluates financial projections to forecast short and long-term operational liquidity needs, making short-term investment decisions and recommending debt issuance, repayment, and restructuring decisions to senior leadership.
Completes ad hoc data analysis, projects, and financial models as needed by the business.
Assists leadership with rollouts of large-scale projects, including the annual budget and target-setting processes.
Identifies, develops and maintains effective relationships with business partners and cross-functional teams at all levels of the organization.
Analyzes working procedures to identify and implement best practices.
Collaborates with team members and communicates relevant information to direct leader.
Upholds the security and confidentiality of documents and data within area of responsibility.
Other duties as assigned.
Job-specific Competencies:
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Consistently demonstrates the Mindsets, ALDI Acts Competencies and Professional Skills (M.A.P.) as outlined for the role.
Gives attention to detail and follows instruction.
Ability to stay organized and multi-task efficiently.
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.
Establishes goals and works toward achievement.
Effective time management; maximizes productivity.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment and coordinate multiple priorities.
Able to identify inefficiencies and implement solutions.
Able to analyze and break-down complex ideas into actionable insights.
Proactive and forward thinking.
Influences and communicates successfully at all levels of the organization, including senior leadership.
Strong collaborator who can build and maintain positive cross-functional business partnerships.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field required.
A minimum of 4 years of progressive experience in Accounting or Finance required.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel required.
Proficiency with SAP/Analysis For Office preferred.
Or, a combination of education and experience providing equivalent knowledge.
Physical Requirements:
Work may be performed in an office, remote office or a combination of both where a computer and office equipment may be used as needed to perform duties.
Regularly required to sit, reach, grasp, stand and move from one area to another.
Constantly and repeatedly use keyboard/mouse.
Occasionally required to push, pull, bend, lift and move up to 25 lbs.
Travel:
Minimal travel required as needed for job related duties such as training, project work and administrative tasks.

Job Title: Sales Planning Analyst-Willowbrook IL & New York, NY
Job Description:
Tru Fragrance & Beauty LLC is a privately held organization specializing in the creation and manufacturing of beauty brands distributed through national and international lifestyle retailers. Tru is experienced in most beauty and home categories, from candles to haircare to cosmetics, and our products are sold both locally and globally in brick and mortar and online.

The Sales Planning Analyst will play a critical role between the Sales and Operations departments. Primarily responsible for reviewing Client POs issued and assuring alignment with sales forecast and commitments. This role will work collaboratively with internal (Commercial Sales, Finance, Operations, Customer Care) and external (Clients/Customers) teams. In addition, this role will provide additional support in sales, operations, and financial analysis with ad-hoc reporting and data gathering.

Key Responsibilities:

· Thoroughly examine purchase orders issued by customers to verify their accuracy and alignment with sales forecasts and commitments.

· Identify discrepancies in quantities, ship/cancel dates, and other key details and promptly address any inconsistencies.

· Analyze sales forecasts, commitments, and historical data to ensure that POs are in line with Tru and our Clients’ strategic goals and sales targets.

· Regularly communicate with the sales team to understand any updates or changes to forecast and commitments.

· Maintain and update sales forecast database with accurate and updated information as received through the Commercial Sales and New Business Development teams.

· Create and maintain reports and dashboards used throughout the organization and within Executive and Leadership team meetings.

· Work cross-functionally with internal teams including Commercial Sales, New Business Development, Customer Care, Finance, Operations.

· Develop and maintain customer specific Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to Sales Planning and Forecast/Commitment accuracy, regularly reporting on progress and areas for improvement.

· Continuously assess and refine the sales planning, PO management, and approval processes.

Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, or a related field is mandatory.

· 2+ years of experience in sales planning, sales operations, finance, or a related role.

· Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel and other data analysis tools (Tableau, PowerBI, SAS, etc).

· Excellent attention to detail and ability to spot discrepancies in large data sets.

· Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems is a plus.

· Self-motivated and able to work both independently and as part of a team.

· Problem solving skills with a proactive approach to addressing issues.

Hybrid Position available in Willowbrook IL & New York, NY

Job Description:

The Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. This role will provide key support to the ongoing development of Risk Reporting data infrastructure along with metadata and metric documentation requirements.

Executes the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Responsible for the successful execution of the strategic vision, delivering a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Ensures Business Intelligence projects adhere to the enterprise design standards for visual design, data governance and performance, including cross validation of source data, development of routine data quality checks, and performance testing under different enterprise load conditions.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Manages User Acceptance testing, project documentation and deployment processes for all assigned BI projects, including regular reoccurring project updates.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Executes a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Provides comprehensive support for all deployed Business Intelligence projects, driving the identification of root cause of issues and actively manages issue resolution and control process remediation to prevent issue reoccurrence.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related

6+ years of experience in Analytics and Query Design in a quantitative field; and 4+ years of hands-on experience developing optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources (e.g. Teradata, Hadoop, Hyperion Essbase, or related); and 4+ years of hands-on experience utilizing business intelligence tools such as Tableau or PowerBI to develop robust, interactive, and visually impactful dashboards or related

Strong working knowledge of Tableau, SQL, SAS, Excel, and other data analytic toolsets

In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree, 10+ years of data analytics and query design experience in a quantitative field or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

SQL or SAS Coding Certification

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $86,500.00 to $145,700.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Benefits:

We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:

Paid Parental Leave

Paid Time Off

401(k) Plan

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Job Summary

The CRM Business Analyst will support the Lead Product Owner in managing and administration of one or more software products. The ideal candidate is an enabler to digital transformation, driving new features, maintaining, and prioritizing the backlog of features to each software platform, gathering user/business requirements and business modeling, and possessing strong analytical skills.




To ensure success as a Business Analyst, you should possess extensive experience with software systems and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Business Analyst’s ensure that their expertise translates into optimized business operations.



Job Responsibilities

Conduct regular meetings with users to maintain backlog of features and changes to the software.
Prioritize backlog of features for planning.
Create user stories and acceptance criteria for software changes.
Conduct interviews, surveys, and observations for gathering requirements.
Act as subject matter expert for multiple information technology systems.
Create and/or upload training manuals, policies, and procedures.
Manage projects and implementations, including roll out plan, developing and owning end-user training.
Regularly assessing user experience to identify ongoing improvements and training needs.
Ensure optimal performance of systems and products.
Central point of contact for all change requests and system alterations.
System administration responsibilities regarding user administration.
Understanding of Project Management techniques and project management tasks.
Support user base in questions and requests.
Other duties as assigned.



Education

B.S. in Management Information Systems or similar field.




Qualifications and Experience

Minimum 3 years’ prior experience as a business systems analyst; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong organizational, project and time management skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent decision making and problem-solving skills, and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Solid team player with excellent interpersonal skills who possesses the ability to communicate effectively with peers, managers, and across departments.
Experience in performing system upgrades and ensuring successful integration.
Strong problem solver and critical thinker.
Proficiency in creating system profiles, allocating roles, and managing access.
Proven ability to develop and lead training sessions.



Supervisory Responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.




Work Environment

This job generally operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. The noise level in the work environment is low.




Physical Demands

The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential job functions of this job.




While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; and reach with hands or arms.




Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to focus.




Travel

Travel not required.

Job Title: GPS Operations Transformation - Healthcare Quality Analyst
Job Description:
Are you looking to make an immediate impact where you can help our clients solve their business challenges? Deloitte's Core Business Operations (CBO) portfolio operates at the center of our client's business. By joining our team, you could help C-suite and program leaders transform their organization and accelerate mission execution through emerging and disruptive technologies, innovative business models, retooled program operations and industry-driven solutions.

Interact with healthcare professionals to provide report-specific feedback and assist in resolving discrepancies
Follow all processes and procedures related to program operations and safeguarding of personally identifiable information / personal health information
Consistently meet individual productivity and quality goals

The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.

Our Operations Transformation offering transforms our clients' core business operations. We advise, design, implement, and deploy solutions that are focused on "heart of the business" issues across client organizations. Using deep sector knowledge and program management skills, we work alongside our clients to implement industry leading practices and manage their most important projects.

Required:

Who We Are

Catalyst is a leader in delivering elegant, high-impact solutions designed, built, and implemented by our world-class team, exceeding our clients’ expectations, and setting them up to delivery first-class services to their customers. And though we are made up of highly sought-after technologists, analysts, designers, and managers, we are so much more! We are artists, athletes, musicians, culinary experts, reading enthusiasts, parents, and friends mixing our diverse backgrounds with our united passion and expansive technical knowledge to deliver WOW solutions.


Catalyst is seeking a talented, experienced Business Technology Analyst to help our clients analyze their business processes and identify technology applications to effectively address their organizational needs. You will be the vital team member connecting our clients to our technologist, working in tandem to produce technology solutions that surpass the expectations of our clients.


Responsibilities include:

Analyze our clients business processes and objectives, and how technology can be applied to achieve them,

Create clear and precise user stories based off gathered requirements,
Test new systems to ensure they meet business requirements and user needs,
Train users on new systems and provide ongoing support,
Monitor systems after go-live to ensure they are meeting business needs and make recommendations for improvements,
Prepare reports on system performance and usage metrics,
Stay up to date on new technology trends and developments and how they can be applied to business needs,
Identify potential risks associated with proposed technology solutions and coordinate with project manager to develop mitigation plans,

Ability to understand complex technical concepts and communicate them to non-technical staff,
Strong facilitation and requirements gathering skills,
Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
Experience with Agile methodology,
Experience working in the software development industry,
Experience working in public sector, a plus.
Experience defining requirements for Salesforce implementations, a plus

Autonomic work schedule,

Position Overview:
The Chicago Bulls Business Strategy and Analytics Department is a team of strategic critical problem solvers who champion a continuous improvement mentality across the organization. Our mission is to collaborate with key decision makers across the business and empower them with data and insights to better serve our fans.
Responsibilities:
The Data Analyst will report to the Director of Data & Technology Strategy and be responsible for supporting efforts to improve strategic decision-making across the organization. This role will:

Partner with other departments, especially the Ticket Sales & Service teams, to craft and implement strategic solutions (i.e. data models and BI dashboards) to enable them to most effectively manage the business and make effective decisions
Lead the day-to-day administration of CRM including user management, process automation, and performance reporting

Establish rules and processes to standardize data collection and structures and ensure accuracy, integrity, and completeness of data
Champion the adoption of CRM and reporting to strengthen data-driven decision-making
Find opportunities to improve manual processes through workflow automation and integrations between systems

Analytical and problem-solving expertise that will help uncover and address inefficiencies

Company Summary
If you have taken a moment to unwind with a bottle of beer, toast with a glass of wine, or celebrate with a cocktail, chances are that you have shared that moment with Constellation Brands. We are passionate producers of iconic beer, wine, and spirits brands that consumers love. From Corona Extra to Robert Mondavi Wines to SVEKDA Vodka, we produce over 100 premium brands with sales in nearly 100 countries, making us the number one multi-category beverage alcohol company in the U.S.
Position Summary
The Business Unit Analyst is responsible for developing sales reporting and analysis in their assigned business Unit. Working in conjunction with Field Sales and under the direction of the Business Unit Analysis Manager, the Business Unit Analyst delivers analysis, tools, and selling strategies to optimize the overall performance of the business unit.
Responsibilities
Leads sales analysis and reporting through dashboarding, presentations, tool development, and predictive modeling.

Develops reporting in support of new item launches.

Functions as a BU liaison and subject matter expert in support of corporate sales initiatives.
Responsible for ensuring BU data management and integrity.
Completes ah-hoc projects and tasks as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in business, marketing, finance, or a related analytics field and 1-3 years of experience in an analytics function.

Demonstrates a high degree of critical thinking skills and flexibility.
Proficient with software to include Excel (at an advanced level), PowerPoint, Word, and Microsoft Outlook.
Demonstrated ability to learn internal software applications and specialized customer tools as required.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to work with a variety of individuals at all organizational levels, both internal and external. Partners with stakeholders to establish clear parameters for deliverables and follow-up timeframes.
Precise, detail-oriented, analytical, and deadline-driven with the ability to work under pressure. Must take initiative and work with a high level of professionalism.
Ability to travel 15% of his/her working time.

Consumer package goods or alcohol beverage experience is preferred.
Experienced in mining and analyzing Circana (IRI) syndicated data.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As aSenior Business Operations Analyst(AKA: Sr. Business Analyst),you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

This position requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem solving abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations. You will be responsible for analyzing data, identifying trends, and providing and presenting strategic insights that will enable data driven decision-making. We are looking for a proactive professional with a strong analytical and collaborative mindset, excellent organizational and communication skills, and an interest in Operations. As a Senior BusinessAnalyst, you will have regular interactions with stakeholders and functional business unit leaders and will have the opportunity to impact important go-forward business decisions. Each day will be unique, requiring an ability to think strategically and on your feet, be creative, take initiative, and employ a diverse set of skills.

WHO YOU ARE

Knowledgeable, Analytical, and Solution-Oriented.
Without a doubt, you ve got strong quantitative skills and are comfortable analyzing large data sets, spotting trends and patterns, and synthesizing relevant observations.
Intellectually Curious.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, and regularly seek to understand.You're inherently interested in the "why" so that you can identify opportunities that represent unconventional solutions to the problems you are trying to solve.
Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are concise, articulate, and effective, providing an ability to interact with all levels/various teams across the organization, be understood, and develop trust and rapport within the organization. You are facile with creating and communicating a clear project plan, tracking progress, and keeping your business partners in the loop along the way.
Technologically Savvy.
Microsoft Excel is a basic tool to you that you know like the back of your hand. You also have a strong skill set in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools and techniques.
A Trusted Team Player.
You enjoy partnering with others and build constructive working relationships that foster the collaboration necessary to deliver great results. You are accountable to your teammates and follow through on commitments.
Organized and Confident.
You are flexible, composed, and able to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously, while confidently interacting with a variety of individuals, across all levels of the organization. You handle pressure well and do so with confidence.

WHAT YOU LL DO

Perform moderate to complex research and analyses
by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include internal operational and financial data (as well as relevant external data), coupled with feedback from business partners, in order to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights.
Develop presentations and share findings
, as well as recommendations.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to answer ad-hoc business questions
and drive business decisions.
Track, analyze, and report on KPIs
used to determine operational performance, staffing needs, productivity, or other measures deemed valuable to the business.
Research and present options for achieving desired metric-driven outcomes
to operations business partners.
Partner with the greater Data Analytics team
on necessary report development, modification, or enhancements.
Identify and utilize resources
within the various departments and platforms to deliver information and quantifiable financial detail.
Utilize Equity Residential systems and software to create and run reports
to aid on the analysis of performance.
Act as a trusted advisor
to the COO and VP of Revenue, providing valuable insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
Partner and collaborate with Operations leadership and Regional teams
to drive cross functional initiatives that deliver impactful results.
Ask critical questions
, create alternatives, react to changes in business conditions,
and propose actionable outcomes.
Stay up to date on new technologies and trends
relevant to the multifamily real estate industry.
Support special projects and ad hoc requests,
as needed.


PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree required, preferably in math, finance, statistics, business or related discipline is required
5+ years of experience in an analytics role. Real estate experience preferred.
Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Strong attention to detail and ability to think critically/conceptually.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Excel, and data visualization required. Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies is also a must.

PrimaryLocation Chicago, IL, United States ABOUT THE TEAM As a Senior Business Operations Analyst (AKA: Sr. Business Analyst), you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

SureWerx is a national supplier of tool, equipment, and safety product lines for the Canadian and US markets. Our range of products include abrasives, air tools, hand tools, material handling, lifting equipment and safety apparel and products. Our USA headquarters is in Elgin, Illinois, the Canadian location is headquartered in Vancouver, Canada with six branch offices located in the major cities across Canada.
The Business Systems Analyst plays a critical role in optimizing business systems to maximize platform engagement and help SureWerx achieve its business objectives. They serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure that the platform effectively supports the organization's customer-centric goals. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing and understanding the organization's customer relationship management needs, defining requirements, and facilitating the implementation of platform solutions and processes. Your primary focus will be to enhance how our teams engage with our customers, streamline sales and marketing processes, and improve overall customer satisfaction. The preferred location for the candidate is in either CST or EST time zones, ideally in Chicago, with the flexibility to work at the Elgin, IL branch for two days a week.
Responsibilities:
Comprehension and collaboration: Understand business problems and opportunities in the context of system requirements and recommend solutions that enable the business to achieve their objectives. Work closely with IT teams, vendors, and third-party consultants to implement and maintain system solutions.
Requirements Gathering: Elicit, analyze, and document business requirements from key stakeholders, including sales, marketing, and customer service teams and translate them into conceptual designs for system requirements. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts.
Analysis and Documentation: Analyze and document business processes and workflows related to customer relationship management. Develop written documentation, which is clear, understandable, audience appropriate and accurately capture the key information required to resolve issues. Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, changes, and enhancements. Develop detailed functional specifications and user stories.
Solution Design: Design and propose system solutions that align with business goals and requirements. Recommend system configurations, customizations, and integrations to maximize CRM effectiveness.
Data Management: Oversee data migration and data cleansing activities to ensure the integrity and accuracy of customer data within the system.
Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute test plans, ensuring that the system functions correctly and meets business requirements. Identify and resolve issues and defects.
Training and User Adoption: Conduct training sessions for end-users to ensure they can effectively use the system. Promote user adoption and provide ongoing support and guidance.
Reporting and Analytics: Create and maintain reports and dashboards to provide insights into customer data and system performance. Use analytics to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on system best practices, industry trends, and emerging technologies. Suggest and implement process improvements and system enhancements.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proficiency in CRM software, ideally with Salesforce experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Project management skills and the ability to work in cross-functional teams.
Knowledge of data analysis and reporting tools.
Understanding of customer relationship management principles and best practices.
Optional Qualifications:
System certifications (e.g., Salesforce Certified Administrator).
Experience with Agile or Scrum methodologies.
Familiarity with data integration and API technologies.

Job Description:
Purpose Statement:

A data analyst's main responsibilities include collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets to extract meaningful insights. They create reports, use statistical methods to identify trends and communicate findings to help organizations make informed decisions.
Additionally, data analysts often contribute to data quality assurance and play a key role in optimizing data-related processes.

Major Responsibilities:

Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends.
Scrutinize data to recognize and identify patterns.
Use data modeling techniques to summarize the overall features of data analysis.
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.

Essential Data Analyst Skills:
Need to be a mix of technical, analytical, and soft skills to effectively analyze data and communicate their findings.
Here are some skills for Data Analysts (not required, but preferred):

Data Cleaning and Preparation: Should know how to clean and prepare data for analysis. This includes removing errors, identifying outliers, and transforming data into a format that can be analyzed.
Data Analysis and Exploration: Need to be able to analyze data and explore it for insights. This includes using statistical methods to test hypotheses, identify trends, and make predictions.
Statistical Analysis: Understanding statistical tests and tools is crucial. Familiarity with mean, median, variance, standard deviation, correlation, regression, and hypothesis testing can be fundamental.
Database Management: The ability to query databases is essential for extracting data. Knowledge of database systems.
Creating Dashboards and Reports: Need to be able to create dashboards and reports that communicate insights to stakeholders. This includes using tools like Power BI, and Microsoft Word to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Data Visualization: Using tools and libraries like Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.… to represent data in a visual format that's easy to understand.
Excel: Often overlooked, but it's still widely used for data analysis and visualization, especially in smaller datasets or in business settings.
Critical Thinking: The ability to approach problems logically and make informed decisions based on the data.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy in data analysis and recognizing anomalies or errors in data.
Communication: Clearly conveying findings, both written and oral, to non-technical stakeholders. This includes creating reports and presentations that give insights from the data.
Problem-solving: Producing solutions to business problems using data-driven approaches.
Teamwork: Collaborating with other departments or teams, understanding their needs, and providing them with relevant data insights.
Ethical Judgement: Recognizing the ethical implications of data usage, storage, and analysis, especially in terms of privacy
Analytical: Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Qualifications:

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, etc.), etc.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Job Type: Contract

401(k)
Health insurance
Vision insurance

8 hour shift

Open only for US Citizen and Green Card Holders

Business Objects: 3 years (Required)
Excel, SPSS, SAS: 3 years (Required)

About the Role:

The Manufacturing and MII Architect, Business Systems Analyst analyzes the most complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements. Configures highly complex system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Provides consultation to users with regards to automated systems. Solves highly complex problems and is called on to consult by other teams. Provides coaching/training to less experienced team members and acts as a mentor to less experienced team members. Viewed as the Subject Matter Expert for all disciplines within their area of responsibility. May supervise others, but not required. Provides system wide/cross functional support across IT.

You’ll add value to this role by performing various functions including, but not limited to:

Business Process: Lead others by working across boundaries and ensuring best practice solutions are developed and implemented. Seek ways to implement process changes to improve business process productivity. Collaborate with business counterparts to recommend best practice solutions.
Functional Analysis: Proactively validate results of functional requirements gathering process.
Functional Design: Direct functional designs of solutions enable process change, continuous improvement and competitive advantage. Ensure solutions optimize and protect the TreeHouse Foods IT Ecosystem and achieve maximum ROI.
Architecture: Through collaborative means, research technical solutions to broad business problems and ensure application/ technical strategies are tightly linked. Influence and set Ecosystem architectural standards to meet long term requirements reusing existing solutions where possible. Ensure Ecosystem portfolio is continuously maintained.
Technical Analysis: Proactively validate conclusions associated with requirements gathering process focusing on full spectrum of application performance.
Technical Design: Ensure optimal performance and quality of technical designs.
Solution Architect for the Manufacturing (SAP PP-PI) and Shop Floor (MII) spaces responsible for PP/PP-PI, MII, MM and IM modules in the internal manufacturing sites. Interfaces with external MES, processes related to Manufacturing, warehouse as well as mobile applications for the internal manufacturing sites.
Hands-on experience in implementing PP/PP-PI in a process industry. Must have at least five “end to end” SAP implementations along with production support knowledge in SAP (production planning and manufacturing) in either discrete (SAP PP) and/or process industry (SAP PP-PI).
Hands-on functional configuration and design experience
Strong SAP Supply Chain solution architecture skills, integration, security, data and technology architecture
Analyzes business requirements and either proposes new or leverages existing system solutions to extend global designs.
Looks for opportunities to expand the current IT Manufacturing footprint while reducing business cost and effectively managing business partner expectations. Find new SAP and non-SAP solutions to assist our business partners become more efficient and effective in dealing with current challenges.
Ensures impact analysis and testing plans are executed, including regression testing analysis and impact to existing functionality are performed and risk is properly managed in the platforms / functional spaces.
Creates, reviews and approves functional designs created by other team members, consultants and vendors, applying in-depth SAP PP-PI, IM, PM and QM knowledge. One should also have knowledge in demand management.
Experience with SAP interfaces to SAP MII or PI/PO integration knowledge with third party MES systems.
Experience with SAP MRP, capacity planning, batch management, staging processes and manufacturing.
Experience with SAP MII (Manufacturing Integration and Intelligence) and MII integration with SAP ECC
The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list of all tasks. Additional tasks and duties may be assigned from time to time as necessitated by business needs.
May travel 10-50% of the time depending on future SAP rollouts.

Important Details: This is a hybrid role.

About You:

You’ll fit right in if you have:

Requires more than 7 years Information Technology / position related experience.
Knowledge and experience of key tools within respective area.
Knowledge and experience of core competencies within respective area, preferably within Consumer Products or Manufacturing industries.
Exchanges highly complex technical or nontechnical information with internal and external audiences.
Required to interpret or clarify highly complex technical information to aid understanding.
Conveys highly complex information and persuades several diverse stakeholders/audiences within area of responsibility.
Develops recommendations to promote highly complex ideas or services across IT.
Work both independently and in a team environment
Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills to deal with a variety of stakeholders and end users.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills in MS PowerPoint
Be able to communicate effectively with delivery team on issues, new requirements.
Conduct testing sessions with business users and provide feedback to the delivery team.
Strong understanding of SAP best practices and functionality.
Proven ability to successfully drive projects to completion.
Must be eligible to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship.

Business Data Analyst

The Business Data Analyst is a critical member of School Specialty’s enterprise Analytics team. Business Data Analysts work closely with the other members of the Analytics team, and work cross-functionally with database and infrastructure professionals, program managers, data analysts, and, especially, end business users to research, develop, test, and deploy BI and Analytic solutions. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, hungry for professional development, and feel most at home working in a less structured environment that demands creativity, adaptability, and self-motivation. To succeed in this role, excellent communication, with technical and non-technical colleagues, is a must.

The base salary range for this role is $65K-75K Annually

Summary of Primary Responsibilities
Perform detailed requirements analysis and translate business needs into Analytics / technical requirements
Design, write, and test analyses, reports, and dashboards in an enterprise data warehouse (EDW) environment using SQL, Snowflake, and Tableau
Assist in building extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes
Develop business, statistical, and learning models to create predictive and prescriptive data elements within the enterprise data flow
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements
Manage every stage of analytic projects (following industry standard methods, such as the Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining (CRISP-DM) model)
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies
Minimum Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business intelligence, data analytics, statistics, informatics, or similar field, with relevant experience in business intelligence and analytics preferred, or
Associate degree in related field, with a minimum of three years of relevant, progressive experience, or
Five years of relevant, progressive experience
Expert in SQL, reporting, and data visualization
Experience interacting with all levels of management, including senior leadership
Exceptional analytical and critical reasoning thinking skills
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Excellent documentation skills
Preferred Knowledge and Skills
Basic familiarity with the principles of ETL processes, relational databases, data warehousing, and dimensional modeling
Experience with, or education in, Python, R, SAS, or other language (or application) typically used for statistical learning, modeling, and/or data munging
Basic familiarity with current-generation data visualization tools and information design principles
Experience with Oracle EDW and Snowflake, or equivalent, environments
Experience or familiarity with semi-structured data (beneficial)
Ability to collaborate, high emotional intelligence, and a passion for serving our internal customers
Familiarity with, and understanding of, business principles and functions

Business Analysts are responsible for eliciting and documenting requirements that are clear, concise, and testable. Business Analysts define a set of requirements that translate into solutions and technology systems, and communicate these to the client and other stakeholders. Business Analysts work closely with end users, business unit representatives, development teams, Product Owners, and others in all stages of the project lifecycle from beginning to end.

This position will also assist with producing data for Product Owners and development teams to utilize in creating business and functional

requirements.

If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.

ROLE

Defines and communicates requirements, risks, and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.
Collaborates with the QA Team to ensure acceptance criteria are easily translatable to test scripts.
Leads and participates in User Acceptance Testing/demos for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.
Assists the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional or non-functional specifications.
Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved, obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts, and manages changes and conflicts during the requirements gathering process.
Prepares artifacts in a clear, explicit, and presentable format.
Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.
Identifies opportunities for streamlining and increasing effectiveness through continuous process improvement.
Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders.
Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements.
Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format.
Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences.

REQUIRED

Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation and stakeholder management.
Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation.
High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition).
Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency.
Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.
Able to work independently.
Proven experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies.
Recommended
Experience in Logistics solutions
Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Business Analyst in Chicago, IL.

Key Tasks:

Business Analyst will leads/participate in the design, implementation, and management of new analytics & reporting solutions
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations

Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to deliver on business objectives
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules
Business Analyst will work independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed

4-6 years of technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS

Collaboration & Team skills
Verbal & written communication skills

Python

Job Description:

The Senior Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. Manages the supporting data infrastructure strategy and data, metadata, and metric documentation requirements.

Develops and maintains the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Directly accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, guiding and empowering the team to deliver a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Team processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Develop and coach teams to be effective in their roles and able to identify, manage, and escalate risk. Effectively manage the team to be adherent to regulatory obligations, policy, standard, and procedure obligations, as well as managing inherent risks directly related to the team.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Builds a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related field

8+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading business intelligence teams to develop optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related.

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading data visualization teams using industry leading Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Qlikview to develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related.

In lieu of a degree, 12+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

Strong Tableau Development Skills (Tableau Suite: Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep Builder, Conductor)

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Familiarity with data infrastructure processes, designs, and tools (e.g. ETL)

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Thank you for taking time to stop by and take a look at the BA role I have posted on Indeed. If you have read my job descriptions before, welcome back. If you are new to my job descriptions, welcome to the party.

Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Tom Welke. I am Partner & Vp at RSM Solutions Inc and I have been recruiting technical talent for over 20 years (it was 20 in January) and been in the tech sector since the 1990s. Due to this, I am going to be far more focused on 'fit' than anything else...a fit for you and a fit for the client. I also like to add some humor to job descriptions as well (life is too short not to have some humor), so if you see something that makes you chuckle, that was the intent.

This role is for one of my best friends. Sometimes, when you work on a role, it takes another turn...where you want to not only do your best, but you want to exceed your own expectations...this is such a role. So, as you can imagine, I know the hiring manager for this role very very well. Here are some things that creates a good social fit:

This is a role where we need someone that doesn't need to be micro managed. The hiring manager for this role really enjoys working with people that think through their actions. If you are the kind of person that doesn't like to be micro-managed but can put their big boy pants or big girl pants on and gets their work done, this role will be GREAT for you.
No ego. Let me explain. If you think you are God's gift to IT and believe that the world revolves around you, then you should probably run for Congress (I hear they are hiring)...because you wont be a fit here.

However, we are seeking someone within driving distance to Itasca, Illinois or Hanover Park, Illinois.

Here is what we are seeking: We are seeking a JDE E1 BA that specializes in that wonderful and ever-exciting world of manufacturing. You will do all those key things that 'classic" BA's are involved it...that being requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming (I bet you are getting excited with every word), QA and deployment. If - oh joy of joys - you have combined some of those nifty PM and BA skills together, oh man that would be great. You will assist with trainingand technical support to system end-users as well. As you might have guessed, you will develop test plans and integrate technology into other business operations. Think of this role as a techno functional lead role responsible for providing input and assisting in the development and implementation of business initiatives to support company operations and business decision-making.

Here are some of the key things we are looking for (I am not going to tell you about an exhaustive list of a zillion things, half of which don't exist...so, I will slim this down to the real 'meat':

Real live, and in-depth JDE E1 experience in those nifty manufacturing modules.
Lead the IT Labware support & implementation process.
Experience with all those things that BA's know very very well...requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming, QA and project deployments...with specific focus on JDE E1. that JDE experience is an absolute must have.
Experience writing SQL queries, data extracts, and V-Lookups.
Experience preparing test data to assist technical analyst to debug and troubleshoot issues
Experience analyzing, designing, and writing functional specifications based on business requirements (with focus on ERP).
Experience designing the following: Menus, UXone UDO – (like Watchlist, E1 Pages, Orchestrator solutions, Advanced queries), BIP Output, E1 Batch application, E1 Interactive Applications.
Experience performing unit and integration testing.
Experience working with Upgrade, Migration, Integration projects as required.
Experience with AS IS Analysis, Mapping of JDE within existing systems, creating setups, User Training, Testing (unit and Integration), giving solutions to the client issues, data loading, Creating Menus Versions, Defining setups, Integration with other modules, preparation, and finalization of specs for report, documentation of the Business Processes, Setups, and User Manuals.
Experience with PowerBI would be beneficial.

Midtown is seeking a Business Analyst to join our world-class IT team at our Chicago headquarters (3611 N. Kedzie Ave). This is a hybrid role requiring two days on-site in the corporate office.

The Position
Our Business Analyst will help lead the digital transformation of our core applications and services. As Midtown pursues a large undertaking over the next 2 to 4 years to transform all our technology platforms, we are looking for a self-starter to help organize and deliver the strategy of the business. In this technical and business-facing role, you will be collaborating with numerous departments and teams to keep projects on time, within budget, and well-documented.

The primary responsibilities are:

Manage projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution to ensure success as defined by adherence to standards of scope, budget, and timeline.
Develop software sprint plans that merge vendor requirements with company goals and coordinate with various managers and technical personnel during all phases, from initial development through implementation.
Monitor project progress continuously and make detailed scheduled reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables.
Communicate proactively with all involved personnel to provide guidance, identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements.
Review proposed modifications of system and software applications, including meeting with interested parties to approve and document all changes.
Creating a detailed business analysis to outline problems, opportunities, and solutions for our business taking into consideration Midtown’s technical capabilities and potential.
Oversee documentation of resources and materials as needed before and during projects by talking with system vendors, IT members, and department managers.

Business Analyst requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business administration, or related field.
Proven 2+ years of experience as a business analyst.
2 years minimum experience in project management, and/or documenting system integrations/workflows.
Familiarity with software release methodologies; agile and waterfall.
Understanding software development concepts (API integration, data management, cloud computing / Azure or similar)
Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
Eager to work with multiple teams and projects at the same time.

Business Analyst skills:
The candidate must possess many of the skills below and be willing to acquire and grow these skills through development goals over the next few years.

Oral and written communication skills
Interpersonal and consultative skills
Facilitation skills
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Organizational skills
Knowledge of business structure
Stakeholder analysis
Requirements engineering
Cost-benefit analysis
Processes modeling
Understanding of networks, databases, and other technology
