Kellanova is a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, plant-based foods, and North America frozen breakfast, and a portfolio of iconic, world-class brands, including Pringles, Cheez-It, Pop-Tarts, Kellogg’s Rice Krispies Treats, MorningStar Farms, Incogmeato, Gardenburger, Nutri-Grain, RXBAR, and Eggo. We also steward a suite of beloved international cereal brands, including Kellogg’s, Frosties, Zucaritas, Special K, Krave, Miel Pops, Coco Pops, and Crunchy Nut, among others.

This position oversees the analysis of current processes, identify process improvements, develop detailed business requirements, and perform functional testing to support changes to Stericycle's software systems.
Key Job Activities:
1) Analyze existing IT process, identify problems and resolutions and write requirement specifications according to standard templates using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously and concisely.
2) Perform functional testing and coordinate and assist User Acceptance Testing to ensure developed solutions meet the business requirements in accordance with quality standards. Provide training/documentation on system changes.
3) Participate in requirements prioritization.
4) Participate in reviews of work products derived from requirements specifications to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly and provide post-deployment support of changes
5) Manage requirements traceability information and tracks requirements status throughout the software development life cycle.
6) Manage changes to baseline requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools.
7) Establish and implement effective requirements practices, including use and continuous improvement of the requirements process. Assist with the development of the organization’s requirements engineering policies, procedures and tools.
8) Performs other related duties as required or requested.
Education:
Required Education: in Bachelors or Equivalent
Experience:
Education equivalent to bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business, or other related discipline, demonstrating the ability to reengineer processes to make them more effective for the organization
Two or more years of business analysis experience in a medium to large size corporate environ-ment
Targeted experience with financial systems, transportation logistics, warehousing, and/or telepho-ny systems a plus
Multilingual a plus
Benefits:
Stericycle currently offers its employees the option to participate in a full range of benefits, including a health care program which includes medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage, healthcare and dependent care flexible spending accounts, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, an employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation and sick time, a 401(k) plan, and an employee stock purchase plan. Participation in some programs requires that employees be regularly scheduled to work a minimum number of hours and/or to have fulfilled a waiting period after they begin employment with Stericycle.

Company Description


Chamberlain University, an Adtalem Global Education institution, continues to raise the standard of nursing and healthcare education through a growing community of over 100,000 alumni who are making an impact in their communities around the world. Chamberlain has the largest school of nursing in the U.S. and is the leading grantor of Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degrees to underrepresented minority students in the country. The university is committed to addressing the national nursing shortage through the development of innovative programs to ensure nurses are practice ready as they step into the workforce. Chamberlain is comprised of the College of Nursing, with online and campus-based programs, and the College of Health Professions, offering a variety of bachelor’s, master’s, doctoral, and certificate programs. Chamberlain University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

Visit chamberlain.edu for more information, and follow on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.



Job Description


The Business Process Analyst will work closely with Project Managers, functional groups, stakeholders and technical staff to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of data and information in support of projects. The role requires strong partnership with business stakeholders to drive process improvement delivery through exemplary process design/improvement/management skills using proven best practice techniques and methodologies.


Works with a variety of project teams during various stages of the project to define, analyze, document and publish project data, surveys, business processes, and information exchange requirements.
Build relationships across the enterprise, and understand at a high level what initiatives are moving forward in other areas of Adtalem Global Education.
Conducts business systems process analysis and needs assessments in an effort to identify business process improvements.
Identifies and works with the appropriate Subject Matter Experts to understand and produce business/project data.
Coordinates User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of respective department functions.
Communicates with project teams after UAT execution to inform them of results, including any issues, problems or risks with the process or application.
Manages multiple assignments according to documented plans, monitors, and reports progress to ensure that required work is delivered on time.
Works closely with all stakeholders to ensure smooth "go live" when new systems or processes are moved into production.
Develops and maintains a solid knowledge of the federal, state and institutional policies and business processes. Displays willingness to share such knowledge with other stakeholders.
Archives project documentation, test results and any relevant information according to business standards and processes.
Work with projects that include a significant strategic delivery to deliver successful results.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Complies with all policies and standards


Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business
One (1) plus year experience modeling/designing business processes and/or analyzing data to support business decisions/hypotheses. Required and
Business operations experience/background.
Experience with IT systems analysis/design.
Demonstrated success establishing clear priorities to achieve business outcomes.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with all levels within the organization and work with multiple projects simultaneously.
Superior written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organization skills; must be able to manage tasks and projects with minimal guidance.
Ability to work independently and make sound decisions with minimal supervision and direction.
Software skills required (Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio and Outlook).

Additional Information


In support of the pay transparency laws enacted across the country, the expected salary range for this position is between $51,962.03 and $93,918.96. Actual pay will be adjusted based on job-related factors permitted by law, such as experience and training; geographic location; licensure and certifications; market factors; departmental budgets; and responsibility. CMG – Capital Markets Group

CMG is a multi-national financial services firm that has pioneered the online brokerage industry by streamlining OTC markets through electronic trading. While the landscape of our industry continues to change, our culture of innovation to make financial markets accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in transparency, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first.

In 2017, CMG joined AXI Corp, a prominent global leader in the industry. CMG’s partnership with AXI Corp plays an important role in expanding what we can offer to investors. We now provide our investors with instant access to Currencies, Precious Metals, Energies, Futures, and Equity CFDs (TRS).

Job Description

Position: Operations Analyst (Entry Level)

CMG is currently seeking a talented and passionate Operations Analyst to play a critical role in maintaining and perfecting the firm’s international operations and trading function. As an Operations Analyst, you will report directly to the Head of Operations and be responsible for a variety of day-to-day tasks that include onboarding of clients/products, running daily reconciliation reports, assisting with ongoing product development initiatives, and providing day-to-day support internally with different departments and externally to our clients.

Team members are required to be enthusiastic, dynamic, flexible, client-service-orientated and focused on control, accuracy, and maximizing efficiency. The successful applicant for the Operations Analyst position will be required to work full-time hours spread across the usual business week.

Job Responsibilities:

Work with internal departments/group to ensure proper trade processing and reporting
Onboard new clients to our platform and product suite
Provide solutions to clients, acting as a key point of contact for onboarding and production issues
Assist with new product integrations
Review and create daily reports and prepare metrics for senior management
Assist on any issues and provide timely escalation to internal departments and senior management
Assist with the development and modification of product announcements and client communications
Reconcile positions and products on a daily basis
Work directly with Head of Operations and other infrastructure groups to support business initiatives
Identify and implement continuous improvements to systems and processes to enhance efficiency and controls
Identify gaps and opportunities and recommend creative business solutions

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance or STEM concentration preferred
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Intermediate proficiency level with Microsoft Office Suite – Strong Focus on Excel
Maintain internal and external relationships
Self-starter, extremely organized with strong commitment to accuracy and detail
Advanced knowledge of securities industry with high aptitude for learning
Ability to multi-task, manage priorities effectively, work independently
Risk awareness, escalation, and responsive attitude
Process multiple client communication streams and make high-quality decisions under pressure
Proven trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills

Base Compensation & Benefits:

Base Salary - $42,000 USD per year
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions
Health Insurance – Individual Health Care Plans offered for US based employees after completing 90 days of employment
Employee Pension Program – Employer will provide an employee retirement pension plan after 2 years of employment that is equivalent to 10% of the base salary

Excellent written and oral communications skills are necessary
Strong organizations skills and experience with managed care contracting is essential
Knowledgeable in A/R, Claims Management or Patient Accounting functions
Proficiency in data analysis

Dream Exchange is creating a new stock exchange that will focus on small business capital formation and diversity using the power of the American investing public. This new stock exchange will allow investors to empower innovators and emerging businesses in a way that has never been done before.

The purpose of the Business Analyst in the Dream Exchange is to discover, gather and document all information needed to create our functioning exchange.

The sources of information are regulatory, our exchange partner, external exchange entitles such as clearing, surveillance, Security Information Processors, and others.

The Business Analyst will organize the information along each purpose line, so it is readily available to each of the stakeholders that need it and the implementation team.

The Business Analyst will work with the legal team in identifying, defining and documenting regulatory procedures.

Role Objectives:

Discovering, gathering and documenting all requirements, large and small.
Creating a system of organization so that the information is readily available, before it is needed.
Working with Quality Assurance to ensure the requirements are verifiable in the finished product.

Responsibilities:

Use all avenues of communication to gather all needed requirements.
Form an image of competence and can-do attitude when representing the Dream Exchange.
Work with project manager and implementation team to ensure all knowledge is established and known in the form required.
Track changes in requirements for change control needs.
Ensure that all work products that are defined in regulation are mappable back to a stated or referred regulatory requirement.
Qualify all requirements with an eye towards usability.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Mid to senior level experience working in a tight organization
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Securities regulation experience
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Detail oriented
Stakeholder analysis
Both collaborative and independent work practice
Responsibility level necessary to provide solutions and not problems
Information organization skills
Willingness to consider alternate views
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software

Preferred Skills and Qualifications:

Understanding of networks, databases and other technology
Prior experience working in a National Market Exchange
Comfortable working in a highly regulated environment

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working at a computer
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

Chamberlain Advisors is currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for our direct client, a leader in the medical waste management industry. This is an initial 3-month contract with conversion to permanent. The ideal candidate will support the Revenue Realization Team and will be integral to enabling insightful data analytics to aid in decision-making. Click apply now and join the Chamberlain experience.

Summary
This Business Data Analyst role will support the Revenue Realization Team and will be integral to enabling insightful data analytics to aid in decision-making. This role shall serve as a lead analytical individual contributor specializing in uncovering entitled revenue opportunities, modeling, and estimating the respective revenue impact. Takes further actions necessary to support the revenue recovery. Additionally, this person shall oversee, guide, and support the day-to-day activities of the data analytics team assuring performance goals and expectations are met. Offers suggestions to management with ideas on how to improve analytics, results, employee morale, and streamline processes.

What You Will Be Accountable For
Utilize business acumen and Excel to manipulate and understand the data and numbers to report the "story"/analysis to the business.
Bridge the communication and analyses between the data extraction team and the business unit.
Build data tracking and information spreadsheets in Excel for individual projects that allow input from Realization Team.
Build and use SQL queries to produce data from multiple internal sources that will support the work of the Revenue Realization Team in projects on an Ad Hoc Basis
Produce documents and mass uploads that update pricing based on findings by Revenue Realization team to collect entitled revenues.
Producing reports and tracking process of Revenue Support Reps efforts to recover entitled revenues.
Self – Educated on other internal data sources as they are introduced, that will allow the Revenue Realization Team to expand their reach on Projects and collect additional entitled revenues in a accelerated manner.
Perform other duties and activities as assigned by Leadership.

What Qualifications You Need
Bachelor of Science degree in quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research) or the equivalent in related work experience.
2+ years of recent experience as a Business or Sales Analyst
2+ years of experience and knowledge building reports within a standard reporting application (i.e. SAP Business Objects, Cognos BI, SQL Reporting Services) and producing queries as needed from each of the data points and systems, along with ad hoc data marts for analysis using business intelligence tools (i.e. SQL, Alteryx, SSIS, etc.)
Billing and/or pricing experience preferred
Experience in service business preferred but not require
Experience with (understand, develop and execute queries) SQL, SAP Hana Enterprise and relational databases preferred
Advanced Excel experience (V Look-up, Pivot Tables, Formulas and other calculations) and comfortable using other Microsoft Office products
Willingness to expand upon know technical skills and continually develop/learn new technical skills in support of new tools/methods
Ability to work independently and manage several projects simultaneously while maintaining a focus on results.

Join our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and be an integral part of creating innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. Become a part of a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, and North America frozen foods, with iconic, world-class brands including Pringles, Cheez-It and Pop-Tarts.


At the heart of the Kellanova Company is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell, and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe. We have an opening for you to grow with us as a IT Business Analyst Lead on our Collaboration Technologies Global Delivery team. This is a remote position and it is estimated that this individual will be asked to be in office once a quarter. We are looking for top talent in the Chicago, IL or Battle Creek, MI areas however there may be flexibility for individuals in other remote US Locations.


A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing




Release Management - Working with Microsoft to determine the O365 changes to our tenant, together you will work to understand their technology roadmaps. You will collaborate with the global IT teams to review changes and determine impact to the tenant. Managing the established release management process you will also implement ways to improve it.
Governance and Adoption - You will manage all new releases coming in to O365, owning the governance process and committee engagement. Analyzing the current O365 adoption and recommending ways to improve will be key to your success.
Strong Analysis - Your strong Microsoft solutions knowledge will be used to understand and identify changes that will impact our tenant.
Teamwork - Use your IT experience to work across technology and business to bring an understanding of O365 changes. Challenge the status-quo and bring ideas to the table to deliver. Bring improvements to our Communication and Collaboration environments through process automation and innovation approaches.


Your Recipe for Success




High School Diploma or GED
Experience in Microsoft based applications, communications, and collaboration enterprise solutions including strong experience managing O365 in a large enterprise environment.
Ability to work across functional silos and promote adoption of new tools and processes across the O365 environment.
Ability to balance multiple concurrent priorities and deliver results independently.
Strong technical problem solving, teamwork and communication skills.
Able to coach and mentor junior staff and enable them to understand and manage new platforms along with the ability to present to senior leaders.
Must be a confident, self-starter, self-motivated individual who really enjoys the challenges that come with managing a large-scale enterprise collaboration environment.




What’s Next

In the meantime, visit our How We Hire page to get insights into our hiring process and how to best prepare for a Kellanova interview.

This is where you save and sustain lives

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.

Your Role At Baxter

You’ll have the opportunity to partner with all levels of the organization in this critical Sr. Analyst, Business Analyst role managing multimillion-dollar trading partners in our Channel Operations team.

The Senior Analyst is responsible for the manual resolution of different operational issues that requires day to day routine processing for the Channel Operations (CHOPs) area. CHOPs team works within tight deadlines in order to ensure that all financial transactions between Baxter and Distributors are processed efficiently and ensure the cash application and chargeback generation activities are in accordance with our Distribution Agreements. CHOPs also interacts with Cash Application activities related to CHOPs customers and resolution of inquiries and communicates frequently with the Customer Master team, Sales Team, Incentive Compensation and Contracts.


What you'll be doing:

Resolve all complex errors related to trace and chargebacks, cross reference errors, pricing errors, etc.
Ensure that pricing between Baxter and trading partners are aligned correctly and resolve discrepancies when pricing is out of sync
Support BAS (Baxter American Services) team with uploading the complex debit memos received from the trading partners into BAM (Baxter Agreement Management System)
Follow up on high impact open errors and Accounts Receivable (A/R) within a timely manner.
Support BAS (Baxter American Services) team with monthly offset activities via Calendar to ensure compliance with established Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Perform monthly Channel Operations responsibilities such as inactive account process, generating daily reports, and responding to inquiries from different channels.
Properly follow up on requests sent by BAS (Baxter American Services) team, Sales Team and Managers
Continuously evaluate current operations to provide innovation ideas to optimize and improve the processes in all CHOPs activities
Responsible for contributions to and/or creations of standard operating procedures and the maintenance of those procedures


What you'll bring:

Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of experience in Analytics & Reporting, Accounting and/or Finance, and Contracts
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, JDEdwards, Outlook, SharePoint, and Tableau usage to resolve requests/issues
Technical expert (macros, BAM, Cognos, Excel)
Detail oriented, proactive, able to organize workload and prioritize tasks effectively
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment both independently and as a team member

Business Acumen: Knows how businesses work; knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practices, trends, and information affecting his/her business and organization; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.

Keller Postman LLC is a national law firm that represents a broad array of clients as plaintiffs in complex litigation at the trial and appellate levels. We act for plaintiffs in federal and state court across a variety of claims and practice areas. We take on complicated cases—frequently class and mass actions, arbitrations or matters in multiple jurisdictions—where our legal and strategic counsel can add significant value.


We are looking for a proactive individual that can join our Salesforce team as our Salesforce Business Analyst. In this role, you will be the driving force behind our data visualization and insights strategy, ensuring that our legal professionals have access to meaningful and actionable information within Salesforce. As our Salesforce Business Analyst with a focus on reports and dashboards, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our Salesforce system to support decision-making and enhance our legal services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, enabling a swift understanding of our current setup to ensure effective reporting.


Essential Functions:

Collaborate closely with legal professionals and stakeholders to understand their reporting needs.
Design, create, and maintain a variety of reports and dashboards using Salesforce's reporting tools.
Run an inventory on existing reports and dashboards to consolidate where applicable.
Perform in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement for both the legal team and case staff.
Provide user training and support for report and dashboard usage.
Create training materials and documentation to ensure user adoption and proficiency with reports and dashboards.
Work with development teams to build custom report solutions or integrations when standard Salesforce reporting tools cannot meet specific requirements.
Utilize data visualization best practices to present data in a clear, meaningful, and visually appealing manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.

Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a meticulous eye for detail

Available and responsive to questions
Active in the Salesforce community
Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language
Ability to work independently or as part of a team
Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly
Ability to collaborate across functional teams
Maintain a strong understanding of technology and its application to achieve business objectives

Job Title: HR Business Analyst Early Careers Associate
Job Description:
IT Business Systems Analyst Associate – HR Information Systems (2024 Start)
Pure Ambition Graduate Program

At Glanbia, we are dedicated to delivering better nutrition for every step of life’s journey. We differentiate ourselves by doing not only what is right for our business, but also what is good for our people and the communities in which we live and work. So if you’re looking to develop your career, stretch your ambitions, and work for a company that has the ability to succeed on the world stage, ours is a journey you’ll want to share.

Are you looking for a graduate program to match your ambition?
The Early Career Rotational Program is a 2-year rotational program for recent college graduates designed to accelerate professional growth by providing training, exposure, and experience in a variety of key functional areas that impact our business. Being selected for our Program is a significant first step in an exciting and invigorating career. At Glanbia, we support you in fulfilling your potential and helping who you are today become who you want to be tomorrow.

Through the Pure Ambition Graduate Program, you’ll have the opportunity to make a big impact every day. We offer an engaging and immersive experience-driven development journey where you’ll learn and develop not just the skills required for today, but the skills required for tomorrow.

Program Highlights
Associates will complete approximately three rotations within their area of focus
Rotations may include a functional role where they will work in their field of study and a leadership role where they will hold a position as a Team or Project Leader.
Throughout the program, talent will be assessed and opportunities will be identified to ensure an effective rotation match is made with the business.

What you will be doing
Developing marketable skills in Success Factors cloud solution
Using HR systems to help deliver solutions to enable increased employee engagement and productivity
Developing knowledge of key Talent Management and Employee Lifecycle processes
Working within an HR center of excellence and assisting with the implementation of HR system projects: including preparation of project scope and design proposals, system configuration and deployment activities, testing, user training, cut-over planning, and post-live support
Developing an in-depth understanding of Employee Analytics
Shaping, Listening, Understanding, and acting on improvements to our overall employee experience
Focusing on our ‘moments that matter’ to ensure a great employee experience
Researching emerging technologies and trends in HR
Availing of an excellent training program to develop your business analysis skillsets
Working closely with the business to improve the uptake and utilization of HR solutions

Who we’re looking for
We know it’s our people and their passion for delivering superior quality and value to our customers that sets us apart. We’re looking for graduates with the following qualifications and attributes:
Requires a bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related discipline;
Relevant HR or HR systems internship experience is an advantage
Ambition to progress successfully in a career in HR systems in an exciting, ever-changing, and challenging environment
Thinks commercially and delivers customer-centric solutions
Drives collaboration and builds partnerships to meet shared objectives
Communicates clearly and can influence at all levels
Demonstrates a thirst for knowledge with a desire to continually learn and grow
Analytically minded with the ability to develop creative insights and execute change

Where and how you will work
The opportunity will be based in Aurora, Illinois with hybrid working arrangements available through our Smart working model which allows you a greater choice in how you work and live, giving you a better work-life balance.

What we would like to offer you!
The opportunity to develop your career on a global stage, continuous learning through an on-demand learning platform, and a competitive compensation package including staff discounts, generous family leave policy, health & and dental plan, competitive salary, and 401K.

At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a wide variety of candidates, and we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

At Glanbia our culture will celebrate individuality, knowing that together we are more.

Job Description:

Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Customer Operations team. In this role you will act as a day-to-day data analyst, developing, interpreting, and deriving insights from data to drive business impact across our CX and broader go-to-market organization, in collaboration with our GTM, data, and product teams. Areas of focus will include customer-centric initiatives including customer health / churn, product adoption, voice of the customer, etc. You will perform data analysis and build effective, well-designed reports and dashboards to deliver insights, support data-driven operational improvements, and maximize the ability for our business partners to achieve their objectives. The ideal candidate will have expertise in data visualization tools (Tableau or Looker), as well as experience working within large, cloud-hosted datasets (e.g., GCP).


What You’ll Do

Manage data integrity and build effective, well-designed reports and dashboards.
Create an end-to-end, robust reporting framework working closely with key stakeholders in CX.
Define, develop, and maintain KPIs and regular reporting in Salesforce & Tableau, along with delivering ad hoc analyses, to help monitor the business and inform business decisions.
Transform complex datasets into digestible, actionable insights for review by a wide range of potential audiences and with fast turnaround times.
Over time, develop a strong understanding of CX and overall business strategy, leveraging data insights to suggest operational improvements and measurable outcomes.
Generate data insights and ongoing reporting in support of CX initiatives including customer metrics, churn, product usage data, account planning, and more.
Uncover and correct data fidelity issues, reconcile data discrepancies, and support data governance initiatives.
Become an expert on key internal and external data sources.
Work cross-functionally within the organization to identify opportunities to improve data quality and related data architecture practices.
Other duties as assigned by immediate manager or management team.


What You’ll Need to Succeed


We’re looking for someone who:

Can work hybrid from our Applied Systems Chicago offices.

Your experience should include some or all the following:

Four (4) or more years of professional work experience in business analysis, reporting, strategy, analytics, business intelligence, or financial planning and reporting.
Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, economics, mathematics, or other highly quantitative fields.
Demonstrated performance and success in performance dashboard creation, mapping, and presenting data insights to various audiences preferably in a Customer Experience or Operational capacity.
Prior systems usage, including Salesforce (built & deployed Salesforce reports and dashboards).
Advanced BI tool proficiency (Tableau, Alteryx, Looker, etc.).
Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
Motivated problem solver: high attention to detail, with the ability to troubleshoot complex or ambiguous problems on tight timelines while navigating conflicting priorities independently.
Present through business acumen: communicate (verbal & written) and translate business requirements into technical solutions to all levels of the organization.

Additionally, you may have:

Worked in a Customer Experience environment / Operations background.


What You’ll Gain

Benefits from Day One

Health insurance plans, dental, and vision
Wellness incentives
401(k) and/or RRSP retirement savings plans with employer match

Work-Life Balance

Competitive paid vacation time and a free day for your birthday
Personal/sick time
Paid holidays
Flex Time
Paid parental leave (U.S. candidates)
Volunteer time off

Lead Business requirements discussions, working closely with Epic Owners, Business Owners, Product Managers and Architecture to relay business context while documenting functional and non-functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
Partners with Business Product and Technology teams

Understand business processes, gaps, and challenges and convert that knowledge into effective and efficient solutions (i.e., requirements/user stories) that meet business objectives. Writes and discusses feature canvases and user stories to gain agreement and understanding of the requirements.

Experience with Data Analytics and Reporting Suited (Power BI, Tableau, or similar toolsets)

Ability to structure and communicate needs, requirements, and solutions in a business context for business stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree or above in a technical field or equivalent work experience.

About us

Velvetech is an international company, based in the US, with 20+ years of experience in software and hardware development for clients all around the world, especially for US clients. As an official Microsoft Gold Partner, our company is listed in the top 5 software development companies in Illinois, USA.

US clients are leading trading and financial organizations, insurance companies, large healthcare associations, pharmaceutical and energy companies, equipment manufacturers, hi-tech startups, etc.

Areas of expertise are consulting, development, implementation, and support of software solutions. We implement modern backend solutions that support microservices architecture with the following technologies: NET Core, Node.js, Java, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, RabbitMQ. For the web UI front-end development, we opt for React, or Angular, and for mobile development — Swift, Kotlin, Java. Most of the systems are designed for cloud infrastructures like AWS, Azure, GCP, and heavily rely on Docker, Kubernetes while modern CI/CD is made using GitLab CI or TeamCity. In September 2021, Velvetech LLC received the status of the official Training Provider of the International Institute of Business Analysis. This status gives us the right to conduct regular quality trainings for Business Analysts and anyone performing BA activities regardless their job title.

Principles are based on Agile Methodology, Scrum and Kanban. Various projects coded in GitLab or GitHub are built with multiple coordinated teams, collaborating via Jira, Confluence, MS Teams, and Slack. Velvetech constantly follows the Tech trends and actively cooperates with startups in such breakthrough areas as Machine Learning, the Internet of Things, Blockchain, FPGA, and AI.

Responsibilities

Would you like to improve our processes and systems? If your answer is YES, then we are offering to start conducting research and analysis in our company, to come up with solutions for business issues and to introduce these systems to our clients.

By working fully remotely from the coziness of your home, you will be able to organize your schedule and have a performance-based salary with many benefits from our company. You would be acting as the key interface between the users and the project managers to gather information, document processes, and confirm the final documents with users.

Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
Eliciting business needs and collaborating with the clients
Communicating with project stakeholders and managing the requirements lifecycle
Analyzing requirements and elaborating technical design specifications
Evaluating solutions: creating test plans, preparing test data, use cases description
Managing communication between the client and the development team: preparing meeting agenda, conducting online meetings with the client, producing meeting notes, creating the list of action points and controlling their implementation, collecting and processing feedback
Producing and delivering weekly and monthly reports, release notes
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects
Project Types

Future projects as highly loaded SaaS web-based services for automating business processes in the field of medicine, insurance, finance, energy, including modules for processing large data arrays, integration with external data sources, mobile applications, and others.

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
1-3 years of experience in business analysis

Ability to define the best business solution among available options
Ability to effectively communicate with clients and stakeholders
Natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users

We are a friendly team of 130+ professionals where everyone is able to achieve high results and grows professionally not only due to their own knowledge and skills but also with the support of colleagues. The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.


You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.


Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection.


We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.

Job Summary:

The Business Analyst partners with Life Technology Services (LTS) product teams in the analysis of technology decommission requirements. Leads the analysis of business requirements and requests from the business, operations, and other users of IT services in relation to ecosystem decommission. Acts as a lead and contact for these product teams while progressing through all aspects of the technology decommission process. Coaches and leads other staff members to educate them on the decommission process and strategy. A Business Analyst supports projects of moderate to high complexity.

Key Responsibilities:
Provides expertise through analysis and understanding of business needs existing technology assets; applies a broad knowledge of programs, policies, and procedures in a business area or technical field
Provides knowledge and support for resolving technology issues across multiple areas of the organization during the technology decommission process
Uses appropriate tools and techniques to elicit and define requirements for the LTS product teams that ensures inclusion of all technology decommission considerations
Assists with project initiation or planning for projects of moderate complexity
Consults on the functional test plans and conditions for assigned applications or projects of moderate complexity; ensure that the test plans cover the testing of all defined functional requirements; supports data analysis and validation from functional tests
Build trust and confidence with LTS product teams by executing with professionalism and expertise
Executes change control process to manage changes to base lined deliverables and scope for projects of moderate to high complexity
Leads information gathering sessions
Has flexibility and willingness to assist in other roles, training and coaching, and problem-solving abilities.
Education and Experience:
Experience in the roles of either Product Owner or Portfolio Manager
4 year Bachelors Degree (Preferred)
3 or more years of experience (Preferred)
In lieu of the above education requirements, an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
No Certification, License or Registration is required for the job.
Functional Skills:
Experienced in writing technical requirements
Familiarity with Life Technology systems and wider ecosystem and teams a plus
Insurance Industry knowledge
Notes:
The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.

Compensation offered for this role is $68,500.00-$121,375.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Job Title: Lead IT Analyst - Operations and Supply Chain
Job Description:
We're Not Just in the Packaging Business–We're in the "Wow" Business

Pregis is Hiring!

Why Join Pregis?

Pregis is in the packaging business to protect what matters. We are committed to providing our customers and employees sustainable growth through purpose-driven innovation and customer-centric packaging solutions. If you are looking for a company that is thriving across various high growth industries and is innovative, customer focused, high integrity, believes in strong teamwork and collaboration, Pregis is the company for you. Check out the Pregis Purpose to learn how sustainability and social responsibility is at the very core of our company DNA.

Summary Statement
The Lead Analyst of Operations and Supply Chain will play an integral role indesigning, implementing, and supporting IT application solutions (SAP, bolt-on, external services, etc.)used by the planning, manufacturing, and distribution functions. This role is ultimately accountable forensuring that the appropriate solutions are recommended and rolled out. Specifically, solutions that arebased on best practices, flexible, and extendable as new needs arise. The Lead Analyst of Operationsand Supply Chain will be a key member of the IT application team and will report to the Director ofEnterprise Applications.

Representative Duties

Manage threads of projects in support of executing the application roadmap required for continued business growth.
Lead requirements gathering efforts for business transformational needs (SAP rollouts, optimization efforts, etc.) and support project frame up while working closely with Director of Enterprise Applications, Business Process Owners, and Business Process Leads.
Play the role of project manager on Operations and Supply Chain related initiatives.
Recommend enhancements and provide support required to enable process standardization and optimization.
Work independently to manage day to day deliverables (documentation, configuration, testing, training, etc.) and guide business counterparts through process re-engineering activities.
Support a change management and training program to ensure application solutions are adopted and leveraged post implementation.
Build effective relationships across operations and the supply chain with Business Process Owners, Leads, and individual contributors to deliver value added improvements.
Train Business Process Owners, Business Process Leads, and End Users on SAP related changes.
Requirements and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, computer science or related field
10-12 years of experience implementing, enhancing, and supporting SAP solutions (spanning all phases of full life-cycle implementations)
Minimum of 8 years of experience in SAP MM/PP, PM and IM implementations and related platform management initiatives
Expert understanding of the following:
Production Planning (PP): Planned Orders, Production Orders, Work Centers, Capacity Planning, BOMs, Routings, etc.
Purchasing and Material Management (MM): Material Requirements Planning (MRP), Scheduling Agreements, Contracts, Sub-Contracting POs, Intercompany STOs, Material Master, MM Pricing, Supplier EDI
Quality Management (QM) – Inspection plan, Inspection lot, Usage Decisions
Logistics Execution (LE) – Delivery Processing, Picking, Packing, Handling units, Shipments, Warehouse Management (WM)
Awareness of current SAP trends and product offerings and the ability to present recommendations on the technology roadmap
Exposure to project management highlighting an ability to execute low to medium complexity IT projects according to ASAP methodology
Proven ability to make decisions without formal authority and the ability to meet
Proven quality management (including testing and project stage gate reviews) skills
Value creation through process improvement efforts leveraging SAP solutions
Effective problem solving skills and various requirements gathering techniques
Strong business acumen within operations and supply chain functional areas
Ability to travel occasionally if required
Overtime if project deadlines dictate
#corp

Diversity and Inclusion

We believe in diversity of thought and bringing together other traits and characteristics that make an individual bring a unique experience to Pregis. We strive to foster an inclusive environment where behaviors and social norms ensure people are welcome.

Affirmative Action/EEO Statement/Inclusion

We offer equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We support inclusion and believe in welcoming a collective sum of individual differences, thoughts, traits, and characteristics to represent Pregis’ culture and achievements.

Visit us at www.pregis.com for more information about Pregis LLC.

About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
We are looking for a Payment Operations, Senior Analyst
Summary:

The successful candidate is responsible for processing electronic movements of funds within Payment Operations.

Major Duties


Ensures day to day SLA & Quality parameters are met. Checklists are prepared and submitted to the supervisor on a daily basis.
Day to day operation activities and client deliverables are met.
Ability to handle, escalate & resolve queries in a timely manner.
Builds a strong understanding of Payment Operations and develop knowledge within the team.
To actively be involved in creating/ capturing process updates/ workflows pertaining to business & process.
Able to identify route cause analysis of errors and suggest/ implement controls in consultation with the Supervisor/ Manager.
Ability to collaborate and work with the team.
Ability to provide training sessions to new joiners and existing partners in the team.
To actively work on identifying and implementing process improvements in consultation with the Supervisor.
To initiate and lead team building activities within the team.
Able to facilitate discussions and reach decisions.

Knowledge/ Skills


A College or University degree and/or some relevant work experience.
Related industry qualification / or studying towards, is preferred.
Attention to detail and accuracy is required.
Analytical and problem-solving skills is required.
Excellent written & oral communication skills.
Data organization/interpretation skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel/ MS Office.
Proven ability to multi-task, work under pressure, and meet tight deadlines.
Understanding of operations and business knowledge of payment systems is an added advantage.

Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
Reasonable accommodation
Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at
MyHRHelp@ntrs.com
.
We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

As an IT Business Analyst Lead you will learn, grow, and create innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. This critical role will establish and maintain a strategic relationship with our key North America and global stakeholders and others in Research & Development (R&D), defining IT strategy and delivering solutions that enable the function to meet its goals.




At the heart of Kellanova is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe. Be a part of a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, and North America frozen foods, with iconic, world-class brands including Pringles, Cheez-It and Pop-Tarts.


A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing




Partner with IT and the R&D business Function - This critical role will be the IT Business Analyst for all KNA R&D technology solutions for our function. In this role, you will be working closely with R&D leadership and global key stakeholders across the organization in designing and delivering technology capabilities and driving projects, roadmaps, strategy, and total cost of ownership.
Business Case Development - Works with business teams to understand project requirements, shapes the initial project request, and provides a high-level estimate of the project effort and cost used in cost-benefit analysis. Plan expenditures based on the size, scope, and cost of hardware and software components. Reviews and evaluates business cases to confirm identified financials and risks, validate value and business alignment, and recommend a course of action.
Requirements Documentation – Works with business and project teams to capture and document requirements and expected functionality of the proposed solution. Leads clarification and validation of requirements during the development and delivery of the solution. Works closely with IT architects, security, delivery partners, and others to ensure a safe and successful solution launch.
Deliver IT Projects - You’ll deliver the technology platform strategy by providing leadership to our project teams and driving the successful delivery of capabilities within the function. You will manage the Regional R&D platform(s) from an IT product perspective including vendor and Global IT relationships.


Your Recipe for Success




Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Experience implementing and working with industry-leading Research & Development platforms such as SAP Recipe Management, SAP Product Lifecycle Management, Ideation technologies, Microsoft Portfolio Management Tools and Analytics (ie. Tableau, Power BI) solutions. Experience managing a product line and clearly articulating the total cost of ownership to leadership
Strong analytical, project management, and team leadership skills
Strong background in systems/software development lifecycle
Excellent written and verbal communications
Experience in CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods) industry
PMP, Agile or similar Certification

What’s Next

After you apply, your application will be reviewed by a real recruiter – not a bot. This means it could take us a little while to get back with you so watch your inbox for updates. In the meantime, visit our How We Hire page to get insights into our hiring process and how to best prepare for a Kellanova interview.


If we can help you with a reasonable accommodation throughout the application or hiring process, please email USA.Recruitment@Kellanova.com.


About Kellanova


Kellanova is a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, plant-based foods, and North America frozen breakfast, and a portfolio of iconic, world-class brands, including Pringles, Cheez-It, Pop-Tarts, Kellogg’s Rice Krispies Treats, MorningStar Farms, Incogmeato, Gardenburger, Nutri-Grain, RXBAR, and Eggo. We also steward a suite of beloved international cereal brands, including Kellogg’s, Frosties, Zucaritas, Special K, Krave, Miel Pops, Coco Pops, and Crunchy Nut, among others.


At Kellanova, we are committed to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (ED&I), uplifting each other and embracing our differences to achieve our common goals. High-Frequency Trading Firm is seeking a Technical Operations Analyst in Chicago to oversee operational processes related to technical change management, exchange interactions, and new trading initiatives.

Scope of Work:

Prioritization of front-office technology deployments
Oversee all aspects of external execution venue session processes and external risk limits
Maintain a roadmap for exchange upgrades/migrations
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and Project Management on-boarding new exchanges or venues
Work with cross-functional teams to establish best practices

5+ years of experience in industry operational roles
Proficiency in exchange protocols and session types

Job Profile Summary:

CAI is hiring!

CAI is seeking a Business and Systems Analyst for a large not-for-profit corporation. This is an ONSITE contract opportunity with the potential to convert to a direct hire. Our client is based in Evanston, IL.

Due to our end client, candidates must be able to work in the US without a need for sponsorship now or in the future.

This position is 100% onsite in Evanston, Illinois. Core business hours are Monday – Friday from 8:30am – 4:30pm with a 1-hour break. This is a 35-hour work week.

Our client is seeking a hard-working professional individual. This position requires an individual with strong interpersonal communication, project management capabilities, and analytical and documentation skills to coordinate the maintenance and development of various application and infrastructure projects for the corporation. This individual will work with IT vendors, internal business and technical staff, and external subject matter experts to gather and document the business and system requirements and oversee the design, testing, and implementation efforts. This individual will facilitate the resolution of system issues, design and implement the solutions to approved system enhancements, and perform project SDLC management. All of this must be accomplished in a cost-effective manner to help the corporation meet the full potential of its mission.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Work closely with the corporation’s management team to understand the business, mission, goals, and objectives.
Gain in-depth knowledge of the corporate functions, processes, operations, and IT environment, and learn how business applications are used to achieve these.
Improve systems by studying current practices and designing modifications.
Maintain system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Assist in determining the need for, and selection of, any outside resources or tools.
Clearly define the project objectives and scope.
Complete a project plan (i.e., project charter) and other management documents following project manager or PMI standards.
Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions.
Work with business stakeholders to understand priorities and order the Product Backlog accordingly.
Elicit business requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements, and deliver the following artifacts as needed: construct and develop user stories, functional requirements (business requirements documents), use cases, GUI (Graphical User Interface – screen layout and usability), system outputs (reports and correspondence), business rules and interface designs.
Manage and monitor the intake of projects using JIRA and update ticket project status promptly.
Drive and challenge business and technical units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
Effectively collaborate with developers and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to establish the technical vision and analyze the tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Oversee the development and implementation of system testing plans, scenarios, and scripts for enhancements and projects.
Document the requirements, processes, workflows, and Standard Operating Procedures using Confluence.
Assist the IT Team in smoke testing the applications and infrastructure after Change Management (patch updates, release updates)
Perform various other duties as assigned by the management.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, or related field.
3-5 years of experience in business and systems analysis.
3-5 years of project management experience.
Strong analytical and project management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with a diverse group of executives, managers, subject matter experts, and vendors in a detail-oriented, professional organization with extremely high standards.
Must be able to work independently and with groups of various sizes.

Desired Education and Experience:

PMI certification
Any certification in Agile or Scrum methodologies.
Experience with systems engineering concepts.
Experience with multiple project/SDLC methodologies desired (e.g., waterfall, Agile/Scrum)
Experience working with Microsoft Teams Foundation Server (TFS) or similar project tracking software.
Experience with test management software.
Experience with managing complex simultaneous software development projects.
Experience with web-based application projects.
Experience with managing project teams from various vendors in dynamic office environments (on-premises and remote working).
Experience with relational database technologies (ability to run SQL queries).
Experience with User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Effective people management (soft skills) to foster and grow high performing collaborative teams.
Experience with secondary or post-secondary educational institutions is a plus.

Skills:

Attention to detail, strong corporate awareness.
Professional in demeanor and presentation.
Commitment to academic excellence.
High energy and self-motivated.
Business-like communicator familiar with structured environments and deadlines.
Ability to effectively present ideas in detail to senior management.
Strong commitment to the highest ethical business practices.
Ability to manage multiple projects or initiatives simultaneously.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by staying up to date/current on industry developments and standards through continuing professional education.

Environment:

Our client’s current IT landscape primarily includes .NET, SharePoint, Java, AS/400 with SQL Server, Postgres and DB2 database backends. The following Project Management methodologies are adopted: Agile/Scrum (software development) and Waterfall (infrastructure projects).

Physical Demands

Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA and other federal, state and local standards.
Sedentary work that involves sitting or remaining stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.
Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard, and monitor.

Job Description:

The Senior Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. Manages the supporting data infrastructure strategy and data, metadata, and metric documentation requirements.

Develops and maintains the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Directly accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, guiding and empowering the team to deliver a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Team processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Develop and coach teams to be effective in their roles and able to identify, manage, and escalate risk. Effectively manage the team to be adherent to regulatory obligations, policy, standard, and procedure obligations, as well as managing inherent risks directly related to the team.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Builds a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related field

8+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading business intelligence teams to develop optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related.

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading data visualization teams using industry leading Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Qlikview to develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related.

In lieu of a degree, 12+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

Strong Tableau Development Skills (Tableau Suite: Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep Builder, Conductor)

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Familiarity with data infrastructure processes, designs, and tools (e.g. ETL)

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $100,500.00 to $170,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Benefits:

We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:

Paid Parental Leave

Paid Time Off

401(k) Plan

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Infor M3 System - REMOTE
Job Description:
Description:

We are HALO! We connect people and brands to create unforgettable, meaningful, and lasting experiences that build brand engagement and loyalty for our over 60,000 clients globally, including over 100 of the Fortune 500. Our nearly 2,000 employees and 1,000 Account Executives located in 40+ sales offices across the United States are the reason HALO is #1 in our $25B industry.

HALO is looking for a Business Analyst with strong Infor, M3, ERP experience to join our high-growth company. This Business Analyst will be the subject matter expertise in our M3 system and business processes to make an immediate impact at HALO. As this successful Business Analyst you will be helping internal business users assess better ways to initiate and improve processes and procedures in a systematic perspective. As an active listener, you will pinpoint specific challenges, articulate the business requirements, and translate them to functional designs for developers.

HALO believes in bringing teams and individuals together in a collaborative environment. For candidates who live within a 30-mile radius of our Illinois offices, the following will apply:

If you reside within a 30-mile radius of our Sterling, IL office, you are required to work a hybrid schedule, working in-person anywhere from 1-3 times a week.

Responsibilities

Serve as the Info, M3 system and process expert on system and business transformation projects.
Gather business requirements through interviews with business area subject matter experts to create better business/process efficiencies.
Identify business needs, create user stories, and translate requests into functional requirements for the development team.
Translate business requirements into functional design documents.
Collaborate with internal business users and the software development team to ensure designs and deliverables meet the documented requirements.
Train and assist users with ERP related information and tools.
Provide demos with suggested UI layout and application changes for approval by the business
Oversee software projects through the software development life cycle.
Organize and maintain each project’s respective backlog through grooming sessions, daily standups, sprint planning, and sprint reviews.
Perform and coordinate software acceptance and regression testing.
Perform and help coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) and post-implementation validation.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
3+ years of strong working knowledge of Infor M3 system is a MUST.
3+ years of experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or System Analyst with demonstrated accomplishments in implementing projects and other initiatives.
Candidate must be able to demonstrate a history of repeatedly leading successful project execution.
Prior work experience with development methodologies including Waterfall, Scrum, Agile, and/or Lean.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively present and communicate complex solutions to technical and non-technical audiences.

Evaluate business processes to develop functional requirement specifications that ensure full understanding of team deliverables for software developers.

Identify test requirements from specifications, map test case requirements, and execute software quality tests.

Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at www.circana.com.

At CIRCANA, we deliver growth to clients based on big data—our predictive analytics and forward-thinking insights help CPG, OTC, health care, retailers, and media companies remain relentlessly relevant, capture marketing share, connect with consumers, and deliver market-leading growth. The convergence of our proprietary, on-demand cloud-based technology and our client-focused colleagues leads to a seismic shift in drivers of success in all industries.

For CIRCANA colleagues, we focus on the moments that matter. From meaningful work and impact to continuous improvement we challenge ourselves to grow both professionally and personally. You’ll feel a true sense of connection and purpose in your work and will craft the direction of your career in a highly personalized way. No matter the department you join, you’ll find yourself constantly growing and developing the skills of the future to deliver client growth. We are committed to nurturing a dynamic culture that embraces and celebrates growth, feedback, recognition, flexibility, belonging, and wellbeing for all.

Job Responsibilities:

The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in transforming the Retail industry and how retailers conduct analytics and generate insights to deliver optimized experiences & personalized value to their shoppers. Delivering simple, easy-to-use insights solutions, like Collaborative Gateways, will be central to how Retailers embed data into their day-to-day decision-making. This role will be responsible for helping Circana develop a portfolio of solutions to help our retail clients achieve these objectives.

The successful candidate will be a highly skilled Business Analyst who is comfortable working in a start-up environment where speed-to-market must be achieved in tandem with game-changing innovation. She/he will be experienced in driving complex, multi-faceted solutions across the vast landscape of Retail channels leveraging diverse, cross-functional teams including Technology, Product Marketing, Commercial Sales, and HR. She/he will be responsible for documenting and constantly improving Circana’s standardized collaborative insight solution across new markets; demonstrating expert-level written and spoken articulation of the business ideas, systems, processes, steps, wire-frames and test-criteria into comprehensive technical requirements that enable our developers to successfully build new solutions. While activities will vary and evolve, the Business Analyst can expect to spend 80% of their time building the requirements associated with the Collaborative Gateway solution. The remaining 20% will be allocated to assisting the Product Manager in developing & delivering impactful project communication that will be used to inform the Senior Leadership team as well as all key stakeholders up to the level of CEO.

Reporting Relationship:




The Gateway Business Analyst will report to the Gateway Product Manager. The Product Management function resides within Circana’s Technology division. The Gateway Product manager reports to the Executive Vice President Global Retail Solutions.




Job Requirements:

Ten or more years of SaaS solution requirements development experience in one or more of the settings below:
Retail insight solution & data experience (Grocery, Drug, Mass, Club, etc.)
Market research supplier with a defined software offering
SaaS solution company (retail-oriented software company preferred)
Category Management function (Category/Brand manager, DMM, CPO)
Expert requirements documentation, organization, and explanation skills required
Business Analysis Certification highly preferred (i.e. IIBA, CBDA, CPOA, etc.)
Knowledge of cloud, hybrid, and on-premise computing concepts (i.e. Azure, Google, etc.)
Knowledge of Data & Database Management concepts (i.e. MongoDB, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Knowledge of BPA & ETL concepts (i.e. Ab-Initio, Apache Airflow, etc.)
Category Management certification preferred (CMA, SIMA)
A flexible approach to communication; able to adapt their message quickly to the appropriate level or function with poise and polish. A history of strong performance at the C-level is a plus
Self-motivated; a healthy sense of impatience; start-up-level urgency
Proven skills to thrive and drive project results in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment; comfort/confidence making decisions with 70% of the facts in-hand
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to articulate complex technical issues in a concise and polished manner to a diverse audience
Ideally, reside in or be willing to relocate to Chicago, Illinois or vicinity
Experience with client facing projects
A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. An advanced degree is a plus
