Job Description – Business Systems Analyst, Master Data Quality

Business Systems Analyst, Quality

Great opportunity to join a wildly successful company! Medline Industries has enjoyed 54 of 55 years of double-digit growth and again has been named a Chicago Tribune Top Employer. Our growth has enabled us to create a new role. We seek a talented individual to manage our Master Data Quality Team.

Medline is looking for a Business Systems Analyst who will be responsible for designing and implementing business solutions to support Quality/Regulatory initiatives. The analyst will work closely with other I/S Business analysts to perform functional analysis for designing solutions, evaluating options that include but are not limited to new program development, configuration of existing systems, business process redesign, new package/system evaluation or a combination of these options. The analyst will work closely with the quality team to ensure all processes adhere to the Drug Supply Chain Act.

Key Responsibilities and Competencies:

Provide comprehensive technical support of the RFXCEL application to end users.
Investigate, diagnose, and resolve application-related issues reported by end users promptly and effectively. Troubleshoot and escalate complex problems to the appropriate teams/vendors when necessary.
Conduct routine maintenance tasks to ensure optimal performance and stability. Proactively identify potential issues and implement preventive measures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including system administrators and business stakeholders, to address application-related concerns.
Plan, coordinate, and execute application upgrades and patch deployments. Ensure compatibility and proper integration with existing systems.
Conduct rigorous testing of new application features and updates before deployment to ensure smooth and error-free implementation
Learn cross-functional business processes that support Corporate Quality/Regulatory.



COVID-19 Vaccination

Please be aware that Medline requires all employees starting in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated by their start date. Medline is an equal opportunity employer and will provide reasonable accommodations to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated for COVID-19 consistent with federal, state, and local law.

Qualification and Requirements

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related Information field. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
3+ years of proven experience as a Business Systems Analysis or in a similar role, supporting enterprise level applications.
Familiarity with Antares Vision Group RFXCEL and SAP ECC is preferred.
Strong technical knowledge of application functionality, configuration and troubleshooting methodologies.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical users.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.

More about Medline:

Medline is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.

Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $20+ billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.

Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For,” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.

OVERVIEW

We are seeking an IT Business Systems Analyst (BSA) for our US-based healthcare client.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with IT and Operations to streamline the business application portfolio.
Establish standard operating procedures (SOPs) for application support and maintenance.
Define business application requirements.
Manage projects associated with business applications and solutions across Lincolnshire, Pleasant Prairie, Lakeview facilities, and any future facilities.
Support the IT strategy through active leadership in application portfolio rationalization, software selection, and fiduciary discipline.
Generate and maintain business application SOPs and perform required system administration and maintenance activities.
Define, document, and implement support and administration standards for the client's applications and solutions.
Lead the installation, maintenance, qualification, validation, and upgrade of new and existing business applications and solutions.
Recommend acceptance of the computer system, as determined from validation performed on the protocol, and actions to be taken if the system is not accepted. Generate a final/validation report in accordance with actual FDA concepts.
Assist in the development of validation documentation of computerized systems and support validation activities as per approved validation plans and protocols.
Provide ongoing training to users on procedures, protocols, and computer systems.
Perform project management functions for the requirements, design, development, and implementation of new solutions, upgrades, and/or replacement of business applications and solutions. Prioritize projects and schedules as needed.
As required, provide Level II and III support for application issues reported to the Service Desk.
Participate in, lead, or author investigations and root cause analysis exercises for the Information Technology department and company issues of non-compliance.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in computer science/Information Management preferred. A bachelor’s degree in a science or engineering related field (e.g. Chemistry, Biology or Electrical Engineering) with relevant experience may be considered.
Training in computer validation methodologies and technologies.
Five (5) years of computerized system administration in manufacturing operations with proven skills in management and implementation of computerized system validation projects and developing validation plan and protocols.
Knowledge and experience in Software Life Development Cycle (SLDC), GAMP5, and 21 CFR Part 11 regulations.
Ability to impact and influence people/areas within and outside company to deliver superior business results.
Thorough knowledge of cGMP and FDA regulations with direct interaction during regulatory audits with agency staff.
Experience and Knowledge in application administration of custom, COTS, and cloud based solutions.
Excellent communication skills (oral, written and comprehension)
Proven skills in project management and validation of manufacturing and quality related systems.
Knowledge of Client Server environment, Windows 2008 and higher, SQL Server 2008 and higher, ERP systems, Quality systems, Lab systems, Analytics systems, etc.
Availability to support site operations during weekdays, weekends, holidays and after hours as needed.

McCormick IT seeks a Business Analyst Senior. McCormick IT provides broad-based, high-impact solutions that facilitate research, enhance teaching and learning, and improve administration and process. This role reports to the Developer Team Lead.

The Business Analyst Senior contributes to the design, implementation, support/maintenance, and enhancement of NU's enterprise, vendor, and in-house developed applications; documents detailed requirements; analyzes business needs; considers current and future business implications; translates business requirements into functional requirements; validates solutions; and drives business process improvement efforts.

The analyst also serves as a subject-matter expert for content and processes related to complex technical and functional systems and mentors other staff. Analyst must manage complex projects independently.

Specific Responsibilities:

Strategic Planning

Partners with and/or consults with leadership, end users, developers and peers to document and analyze business and functional requirements, identify gaps and alternative approaches to meet requirements, and ensure all deliverables completed (adhering to approved methodology and documentation standards). Often convenes and facilitates working groups in this capacity.
Partners with and/or consults with functional users and technical and reporting staff to determine best approaches, ensuring that approved solutions are implemented in a timely and correct fashion.
Contributes to defining methodology and documentation standards, and periodically reviewing them to integrate appropriate industry practices.
Represents organizational area regarding advisory groups, planning committees, and peer work groups whose purpose is to develop requirements related to the implementation of enterprise business systems.

Acts as a subject-matter expert, reviewing and verifying that documentation of training materials, process, procedure and system/application configuration is accurate.
Documents implementation scope and complex use cases.
Coordinates project resources to ensure that tasks are completed on schedule and that issues, risks and variances are identified and escalated in a timely manner

Development

Writes user test scripts and performs detailed testing for complex use cases to ensure that the implemented software functions correctly.
Facilitates iterative feedback processes among users, developers, and analysts to ensure software functionality aligns with requirements. Influences decision making based on prior implementation experience.

Performance

Evaluates software and enters complex configurations to meet user needs.
Collects feedback from users on application performance and escalates complex critical performance issues with technical resources and management.
Facilitates troubleshooting with technical, reporting, and application resources to analyze and resolve production issues in a timely manner. Able to identify root causes based on prior system knowledge and advanced analytical skills.

Supervises

Provides work direction and/or supervises staff such as contractors, vendors, students, etc.
Manages moderate to complex projects ensuring timelines, deliverables and expectations are met.

Miscellaneous

Performs other duties as assigned.

5+ years translating complex requirements to hand over to development team

ITSM process documentation


Education

As aSenior Business Operations Analyst(AKA: Sr. Business Analyst),you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

This position requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem solving abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations. You will be responsible for analyzing data, identifying trends, and providing and presenting strategic insights that will enable data driven decision-making. We are looking for a proactive professional with a strong analytical and collaborative mindset, excellent organizational and communication skills, and an interest in Operations. As a Senior BusinessAnalyst, you will have regular interactions with stakeholders and functional business unit leaders and will have the opportunity to impact important go-forward business decisions. Each day will be unique, requiring an ability to think strategically and on your feet, be creative, take initiative, and employ a diverse set of skills.

WHO YOU ARE

Knowledgeable, Analytical, and Solution-Oriented.
Without a doubt, you ve got strong quantitative skills and are comfortable analyzing large data sets, spotting trends and patterns, and synthesizing relevant observations.
Intellectually Curious.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, and regularly seek to understand.You're inherently interested in the "why" so that you can identify opportunities that represent unconventional solutions to the problems you are trying to solve.
Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are concise, articulate, and effective, providing an ability to interact with all levels/various teams across the organization, be understood, and develop trust and rapport within the organization. You are facile with creating and communicating a clear project plan, tracking progress, and keeping your business partners in the loop along the way.
Technologically Savvy.
Microsoft Excel is a basic tool to you that you know like the back of your hand. You also have a strong skill set in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools and techniques.
A Trusted Team Player.
You enjoy partnering with others and build constructive working relationships that foster the collaboration necessary to deliver great results. You are accountable to your teammates and follow through on commitments.
Organized and Confident.
You are flexible, composed, and able to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously, while confidently interacting with a variety of individuals, across all levels of the organization. You handle pressure well and do so with confidence.

WHAT YOU LL DO

Perform moderate to complex research and analyses
by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include internal operational and financial data (as well as relevant external data), coupled with feedback from business partners, in order to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights.
Develop presentations and share findings
, as well as recommendations.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to answer ad-hoc business questions
and drive business decisions.
Track, analyze, and report on KPIs
used to determine operational performance, staffing needs, productivity, or other measures deemed valuable to the business.
Research and present options for achieving desired metric-driven outcomes
to operations business partners.
Partner with the greater Data Analytics team
on necessary report development, modification, or enhancements.
Identify and utilize resources
within the various departments and platforms to deliver information and quantifiable financial detail.
Utilize Equity Residential systems and software to create and run reports
to aid on the analysis of performance.
Act as a trusted advisor
to the COO and VP of Revenue, providing valuable insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
Partner and collaborate with Operations leadership and Regional teams
to drive cross functional initiatives that deliver impactful results.
Ask critical questions
, create alternatives, react to changes in business conditions,
and propose actionable outcomes.
Stay up to date on new technologies and trends
relevant to the multifamily real estate industry.
Support special projects and ad hoc requests,
as needed.


PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree required, preferably in math, finance, statistics, business or related discipline is required
5+ years of experience in an analytics role. Real estate experience preferred.
Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Strong attention to detail and ability to think critically/conceptually.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Excel, and data visualization required. Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies is also a must.
Must be able to effectively organize and prioritize workload for numerous projects/tasks simultaneously.
Must be able to exhibit flexibility, working with different teams in multiple and diverse work environments.
Effective written and verbal communication skills required.

Job Description:
About Us:
TreeHouse Foods (NYSE: THS) is a leading manufacturer of private label packaged foods and beverages, operating a network of production facilities across the United States and Canada. At TreeHouse Foods, our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products and revolves around our people. We are investing in talent and creating a performance-based culture where employees can do their best work, directly impacting our mission to make high quality, affordable food for our customers, communities and families. We hope you will consider joining the team and being part of our future.
What You Gain:
Leaders that are invested in supporting your accelerated career growth, plus paid training and tuition reimbursement to support you along the way.
An inclusive working environment where you can build meaningful work relationships with a diverse group of professionals. Take advantage of opportunities to build on our team-oriented culture, such as joining one of our DE&I Employee Resource Groups!
Competitive compensation and benefits program with no waiting period 401k program with 5% employer match and 100% vesting at time of enrollment.
Comprehensive paid time off opportunities.
Enrollment in our wellness and employee assistance programs.
About the Role:
The Manufacturing and MII Architect, Business Systems Analyst analyzes the most complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements. Configures highly complex system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Provides consultation to users with regards to automated systems. Solves highly complex problems and is called on to consult by other teams. Provides coaching/training to less experienced team members and acts as a mentor to less experienced team members. Viewed as the Subject Matter Expert for all disciplines within their area of responsibility. May supervise others, but not required. Provides system wide/cross functional support across IT.
You’ll add value to this role by performing various functions including, but not limited to:
Business Process: Lead others by working across boundaries and ensuring best practice solutions are developed and implemented. Seek ways to implement process changes to improve business process productivity. Collaborate with business counterparts to recommend best practice solutions.
Functional Analysis: Proactively validate results of functional requirements gathering process.
Functional Design: Direct functional designs of solutions enable process change, continuous improvement and competitive advantage. Ensure solutions optimize and protect the TreeHouse Foods IT Ecosystem and achieve maximum ROI.
Architecture: Through collaborative means, research technical solutions to broad business problems and ensure application/ technical strategies are tightly linked. Influence and set Ecosystem architectural standards to meet long term requirements reusing existing solutions where possible. Ensure Ecosystem portfolio is continuously maintained.
Technical Analysis: Proactively validate conclusions associated with requirements gathering process focusing on full spectrum of application performance.
Technical Design: Ensure optimal performance and quality of technical designs.
Solution Architect for the Manufacturing (SAP PP-PI) and Shop Floor (MII) spaces responsible for PP/PP-PI, MII, MM and IM modules in the internal manufacturing sites. Interfaces with external MES, processes related to Manufacturing, warehouse as well as mobile applications for the internal manufacturing sites.
Hands-on experience in implementing PP/PP-PI in a process industry. Must have at least five “end to end” SAP implementations along with production support knowledge in SAP (production planning and manufacturing) in either discrete (SAP PP) and/or process industry (SAP PP-PI).
Hands-on functional configuration and design experience
Strong SAP Supply Chain solution architecture skills, integration, security, data and technology architecture
Analyzes business requirements and either proposes new or leverages existing system solutions to extend global designs.
Looks for opportunities to expand the current IT Manufacturing footprint while reducing business cost and effectively managing business partner expectations. Find new SAP and non-SAP solutions to assist our business partners become more efficient and effective in dealing with current challenges.
Ensures impact analysis and testing plans are executed, including regression testing analysis and impact to existing functionality are performed and risk is properly managed in the platforms / functional spaces.
Creates, reviews and approves functional designs created by other team members, consultants and vendors, applying in-depth SAP PP-PI, IM, PM and QM knowledge. One should also have knowledge in demand management.
Experience with SAP interfaces to SAP MII or PI/PO integration knowledge with third party MES systems.
Experience with SAP MRP, capacity planning, batch management, staging processes and manufacturing.
Experience with SAP MII (Manufacturing Integration and Intelligence) and MII integration with SAP ECC
The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list of all tasks. Additional tasks and duties may be assigned from time to time as necessitated by business needs.
May travel 10-50% of the time depending on future SAP rollouts.
Important Details: This is a hybrid role.
About You:
You’ll fit right in if you have:
Requires more than 7 years Information Technology / position related experience.
Knowledge and experience of key tools within respective area.
Knowledge and experience of core competencies within respective area, preferably within Consumer Products or Manufacturing industries.
Exchanges highly complex technical or nontechnical information with internal and external audiences.
Required to interpret or clarify highly complex technical information to aid understanding.
Conveys highly complex information and persuades several diverse stakeholders/audiences within area of responsibility.
Develops recommendations to promote highly complex ideas or services across IT.
Work both independently and in a team environment
Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills to deal with a variety of stakeholders and end users.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills in MS PowerPoint
Be able to communicate effectively with delivery team on issues, new requirements.
Conduct testing sessions with business users and provide feedback to the delivery team.
Strong understanding of SAP best practices and functionality.
Proven ability to successfully drive projects to completion.
Must be eligible to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship.

You may be perfect for this role if you have...

Strong planning and organizational skills - the ability to balance competing demands and focus on multiple, varied topics at a time.

Excellent oral and written communications skills - the ability to interact with the team and clients.

You want to start a career path toward project management for digital projects

Our Business Analysts exhibit these key competences:

EXPERT COMMUNICATOR - with clients and team members to achieve a shared understanding. You don’t have to know all the answers - you just have to be able to find them.

EXPERT ORGANIZER - Handle a number of small, but important requests from different projects at a time. People that come from a fast-paced, agency setting tend to have the right skills for this.

EXPERT RECORD KEEPER - on both projects you lead and project teams you support, it is critical that you are able to keep effective meeting minutes, write thorough feature tickets, and keep receipts of all major project and feature decisions.

PROFICIENT TROUBLESHOOTING - You may or may not have experience with the products we’ve built, but you are a problem solver. You are able to retrace steps and document how a person could follow those steps.




Responsibilities for our Business Analysts include...

Managing client support requests (bugs, new work, troubleshooting, software updates, etc)

Initial troubleshooting and filing issues so that they can be estimated and worked on by the team.

Managing expectations as needed to maintain positive client relationships and quality delivery.

Estimating work with the team and delivering work within that budget and/or getting additional approval as needed.

Preparing/distributing internal and client-driven project progress reports, invoices for work, documentation, proposals and presentation materials.

Participating and note-taking in planning meetings, whiteboard sessions, and backlog grooming for larger projects

Acting as support for the product management team with writing thorough feature tickets for product teams.

Other tasks and responsibilities as requested.




We do have a few requirements...

Experience juggling priorities and projects - can be in tech or other industries.

Availability to work onsite at the Caxy offices during our regular business hours.

Ability to work within a team environment as well as independently as needed.




We’re on a mission to improve the digital world...

For nearly 20 years, we’ve been the firepower that clients trust to revolutionize their markets. We’re open-source specialists and firm believers in an iterative approach to software development (#AgileLife). We are a team of talented developers who work in cross-functional teams with seasoned Product Managers, UX architects, and digital designers. We believe in the importance of our company culture and value the contributions and unique perspectives of each team member.


We are inspired thinkers and dreamers committed to delivering value with every interaction and output. We combine thoughtful user experience, effective communication, engaging design, quality execution, and strong coffee… to create products that our clients and their end-users love. We’re on a mission to create digital experiences that tie brand experiences together, and we hope you’ll join us.

Business Intelligence Analyst

Concerto Renal Services is an industry leader in nursing home dialysis. We are a rapidly expanding business with a simple mission: reimagining dialysis care, one community at a time. Our model focuses on ensuring those with end-stage renal disease receive the best possible care through a more convenient, centralized, continuous care model.


Summary/Objective

Concerto Renal Services is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to manage data retrieval and analysis and transform data into insight to productively improve Concerto’s overall business.


Responsibilities:

Collect, interpret, and analyze data to produce finance and market intelligence reports
Design and provide ongoing live-reports utilizing Microsoft Power BI
Proactively deliver insightful, actionable, and accurate financial reporting analysis to key business owners in the organization. Must be able to communicate the information so that others can understand.
Assemble periodic and ad-hoc analysis reports on company operations
Build successful partnership with key internal customers and cross-functional teams
Identify development needs to streamline and improve the operations of Concerto for efficiency and profitability




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with a major in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or related major
2-3+ years of consistent work experience specializing in Business Intelligence/Business Analytics
Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal, as well as strong interpersonal and teamwork skills that fosters a collaborative and continuous improvement environment
Well adept in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, & Word.
Experience utilizing MS SQL and NetSuite, preferred

Why work at Concerto?

Medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability benefits
401k match of 50% up to 6% of salary
PTO
Paid holidays
Discounts through Nectar
Employer Paid Employee Assistance Program

Associate Analyst, Business Process - GROWMARK, Inc - Bloomington, IL

GROWMARK is an agricultural cooperative serving almost 400,000 customers across North America, providing agronomy, energy, facility engineering and construction, and logistics products and services, as well as grain marketing and risk management services. Headquartered in Bloomington, Illinois, GROWMARK owns the FS trademark, which is used by its member cooperatives. GROWMARK also owns and operates SEEDWAY, the largest full-line seed company in the United States. More information is available at growmark.com.
See what it's like to work at GROWMARK: https://youtu.be/CSVMnKCySsY
PURPOSE AND SUMMARY STATEMENT
Analyzes and supports the performance and control of key billing and vendor invoice payment business processes for all GROWMARK divisions – US and Ontario. Assists with efficient and effective analysis, design, and implementation of business and data management processes comprising, and impacting, key Business Process department functions.


Performs key compliance and control activities involved in the purchase and sale of GROWMARK’s various product lines.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Coordinates required dealership activities, including title and license custody, filing requirements, and sales tax and Federal Excise Tax reporting related to the sales of motor vehicles.


Performs sales and purchase order placement and processing, as well as related internal control monitoring activities for various product lines.


Ensures control and timely and accurate processing for payment of vendor invoices related to inventory procurement for various product lines.


Prepares and monitors various dashboards, reports, and analyses for management related to customer billing and vendor invoice processing performance, and reports on the financial impact of process performance.


Assists in the management of ongoing business process design and improvement efforts. Identifies and analyzes opportunities for optimizing business performance by aligning and integrating information technology related processes.


Collaborates with appropriate personnel within Controllers, Agronomy, IT, Logistics, suppliers, customers, and third-party providers to develop and implement changes to processes affecting order entry, customer invoicing, supplier payments, and customer and supplier contracting programs.


Provides relevant inputs for required month-end accruals and reconciliations.


Maintains knowledge of SAP functionality and uses specialized query software to identify the causes of problems, and evaluate related process design, making recommendations for and supporting process reengineering efforts. Supports testing of system or process changes to ensure effective implementation.


Maintains operating knowledge of the GTTC billing, vendor payment, and reconciliation systems used and related interfaces to SAP.


OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS
Provides guidance and assistance in annual physical inventory observations and cycle counts and investigates variances.


Assists in audit work paper preparation and information gathering for the annual audit by external auditors.


Follows GROWMARK’s Code of Conduct and Corporate Compliance Program, Environmental Health and Safety, OSHA and DOT policies and procedures, as they apply.


Performs all other duties as assigned.


REQUIREMENTS
Normally requires a bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business, or the equivalent thereof, and prefer two years or more of business analysis, finance, or accounting-related work experience to demonstrate knowledge of business and financial analysis expertise.


Ability to earn an advanced degree (MBA) or professional certification (CPA/CMA/CFP&A) to demonstrate an advanced knowledge of business and data analysis.


Understanding and experience with billing, invoicing, internal controls, query design and development using Business Objects, report generation, account reconciliation, accounting systems, order fulfillment, and other control functions, along with analysis and problem-solving skills.


Demonstrates essential abilities including business knowledge, collaboration, communication, customer focus, decision-making, and skill development.


Proven attention to detail skills.


Ability to work hours other than those considered “normal”.


Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record.


Ability and willingness to participate in required training that may include education on GROWMARK’s policies and procedures and additional training as it relates to the requirements of the position.
We are an equal opportunity employer, including protected veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities. Employment may be contingent upon receipt of an acceptable and job-related background check, drug test, motor vehicle report, and/or reference check, as applicable and permissible by law.

About Us
Freeman is a global leader in events, on a mission to redefine live for a new era. With a data-driven approach and the industry’s largest network of experts, Freeman’s insights shape exhibitions, exhibits, and events that drive audiences to action. The integrated full-service solutions leverage a 96-year legacy in event management as well as new technologies to deliver moments that matter.
Summary
The EPMO Business Analyst is a highly visible position and will play an integral part of the Transformation Organization by contributing to and driving Freeman’s digital transformation.
The role is also intended to inspire new thinking and bring a fresh perspective to facilitate more efficient and effective processes. A sizable portion of the role will be focused on driving process, data, organizational, and technology-related initiatives.



This position will support our Transformation group under our Business Operations team. It is eligible to work a hybrid schedule, generally requiring work in-office 1-2 days per week. The ideal candidate will be based out of any of the following locations:


Dallas, TX
Chicago, IL
Las Vegas, NV
Orlando, FL
Washington D.C.
Nashville, TN
Atlanta, GA
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Serves as primary owner leading business requirement-gathering and documentation via meetings, individual discussions, and team-based collaboration from an enterprise view.
Consults with business stakeholders, Development, Project Management, Administrators/other technical resources, and Analysts throughout the requirements documentation process and drives requirements to meet needs outlined in the project scope.
Create detailed requirements documents including process flows, use cases, user interface designs, scenarios and maintains outputs in project documentation system of record.
Performs data analysis, mapping, transformation incorporating key performance indicators, demographic data, and other future state analysis to guide informed requirements development.
Assist in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing.
Participate in quality management reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements.
Ability to review project deliverables for completeness and quality, and compliance with established project standards.
Provides ad-hoc analytical documentation and project support to the business.
Provides documentation of current and future state processes.
Education & Experience
5-7 years’ experience as a Business Analyst demonstrating the above skill sets for enterprise technology-related projects
End-to-end enterprise systems implementation experience, such as SAP, Salesforce, MS Dynamics, MDM
Enterprise system integration experience including use of integration tools
Computer Information Systems, IT, or Business Bachelor’s or equivalent degree required
Strong problem-solving skills; able to synthesize multiple information inputs into clear, actionable business recommendations.
Able to communicate clearly and succinctly with multiple stakeholder organizational levels, from technical resources, front-line employees, User Communities, Business Leads, and Executives (verbal and written).
Highly organized with ability to manage multiple competing priorities and meet deadlines.
Ability to create wireframe documents with information architecture.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, Teams, SharePoint, Azure DevOps as well as other project management and time tracking tools.
Travel Requirements
Travel up to 25%
Diversity Commitment

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

The primary role of a Business Analyst is to bridge the gap between business stakeholders and technology teams, ensuring that the software and systems developed align with business requirements. The following is a comprehensive job description for a Business Analyst:

Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Summary: The Business Analyst will collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements, processes, and workflows. They will translate these requirements into functional specifications for technology teams and work closely with project managers, developers, and testers to ensure successful project delivery. The Business Analyst will also be involved in identifying areas for process improvement and recommending solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, objectives, and challenges.
Elicit, document, and analyze business requirements, processes, and workflows.
Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications for technical teams.
Collaborate with technology teams to design solutions that meet business needs.
Propose innovative and practical solutions to address business challenges.
Ensure that proposed solutions align with the organization’s strategic goals and technological capabilities.
Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technology teams.
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Present findings, recommendations, and project updates to various audiences.
Create detailed documentation including business requirements, process flows, use cases, and user stories.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation throughout the project lifecycle.
Collaborate with project managers to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
Assist in project planning, estimation, and resource allocation.
Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or deviations from the plan.
Participate in system testing, user acceptance testing, and validation of implemented solutions.
Ensure that delivered solutions meet the specified requirements and are of high quality.
Identify areas for process optimization and efficiency enhancement.
Recommend process improvements and assist in their implementation.

Qualifications:

Master’s degree in business administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or in a related role.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques, process modeling, and documentation.
Familiarity with project management methodologies and software development lifecycle.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Knowledge of relevant tools such as Microsoft Visio, JIRA, Confluence, etc.

Education Requirements: Master’s degree only

Job Title: IT Senior Business Analyst- Manufacturing & Operations
Job Description:
Job Title: IT Senior Business Analyst - MFG OPS

Location: Vernon Hills, IL

Department: IT – SAP Applications

Department: IT – SAP Applications

Reports To: Debra Watkins

Direct Reports/Manages others: No

Hybrid Schedule: Our hybrid work environment includes two (2) remote days/week.

Rust-Oleum Corporation is a worldwide leader in protective paints and coatings for both home and industry. We offer a wide range of products including decorative fashion paints, durable industrial roof repair coatings and, of course, our famous rust-fighting formula that started it all.

JOB PURPOSE:

The Sr. Business Analyst – MFG OPS will support corporate initiatives and business practices by providing a business system the supports Rust-Oleum’s internal and external requirements and achievement of the revenue plan and providing effective system modification and support to facilitate control and decision making.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Typical tasks for this position include (but are not limited to) the following:

Current with trends and technology across the digital manufacturing landscape.
Maintains existing system functionality while initiates new SAP features and other software applications.
Enhancement of SAP installation (hotpacks, projects, upgrades).
Writes and maintains system documentation in accordance with Rust-Oleum I.T. standards.
Provide staff and users with assistance solving software related problems.
Attends educational workshops; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; benchmarks state-of-the-art practices; participates in professional societies.
Utilizes project management skills includes but not limited to development of detailed project plans, scope and design documents, issue tracking tools, adherence to project management and upper management communication.
Communicates issues, concerns and problems to supervisors and team members. Work in a respectful manner with both internal and external partners.
Consult with management to ensure agreement on system principles.
Confer with clients regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs a software program is to address.
Read manuals, periodicals, and technical reports to learn how to develop functionality that meets staff and user requirements.

REQUIREMENTS:

Required job knowledge and skills:
Demonstrated configuration skills in designated SAP module, including go live and post implementation support
Thorough understanding of the impact of an integrated system on the business processes
Strong time management skills and multi-tasking capabilities as demonstrated by completion of tasks in compliance with deadlines
Strong analytical skills as demonstrated by troubleshooting and end user support in a post go live environment
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Self motivated with ability to play differing roles on functional team
Qualifications or previous experience (BFOQ):
Degree in Information Systems, relevant business discipline or equivalent experience
6+ years SAP configuration including, resulting in an implementation.
Computers and Electronics — Knowledge of computer software, including applications.
English Language — Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
Customer and Personal Service — Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
Mathematics — Knowledge of arithmetic, and its application to this role.

Administration and Management — Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership techniques , and coordination of people and resources.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

To help save our customers green, we need an amazing team who knows all about it. Job Title: Sr Business System Analyst - Supply Chain
Job Description:
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we’re guided by a shared purpose – helping people be their best in the moments that matter – and we’re living up to our purpose every day by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. We’re solving for safer - safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals, safer businesses – safer everywhere. We’re building integrated technologies that help protect people, property and places. We’re connecting public safety agencies and enterprises – enabling the collaboration that’s critical for a more proactive approach to safety and security. We’re committed to solving for safer every day because the work we do here matters.

Department Overview
Our IT organization has a critical role in driving extraordinary business results. Through a strong partnership with other areas of our business, we bring innovative thinking to every conversation and deliver with integrity. We’re looking for people who bring great ideas and who make our partners’ ideas better. Intellectually curious advisors (not order takers) who focus on outcomes to creatively solve business problems. People who not only embrace change, but who accelerate it.

Job Description

We are seeking an IT professional who is passionate about the use of technology to achieve business goals. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, thrives on working across multiple teams, and can use technology to solve complex business problems. The role focuses on advancing the capabilities of our supply chain business systems using the latest best of breed cloud and edge technologies that are integrated as part of our broader Oracle ERP environment.

As a Sr, Supply Chain Business Systems Analyst you will work with business and IT teams to deliver innovative solutions as part of our major transformation program that includes major initiatives in Supplier Collaboration, Supply Chain and Scenario planning, and End to End Procurement. You will partner with a solution architect and have primary responsibility and accountability for the implementation and configuration of the design into the new technology platforms.

The desired candidate must have a proven track record of experience in the deployment of business system capabilities and transformation projects. In addition the candidate should have a working knowledge of the following:

Oracle / Oracle Cloud Supply Chain Modules including Supply Chain Planning (Demand and/ or Supply)

Any additional experience in the following modules would be a plus - Inventory, Manufacturing, Procure to Pay, and Order Management

Hands on experience with requirements gathering, solution design, system configuration, testing, and documentation.

Strong analytical skills to analyze and interpret business needs and translate them into application and functional requirements

Experience in emerging technology platforms including one or more cloud-based applications that cover such areas as supplier collaboration, supply planning and procure to pay is strongly desired.

The candidate must be a self-motivated team player who has the ability to work and communicate well with technical and business partners. We expect that the person in this position will proactively identify impactful solutions for the future or find improvements to the existing systems. In addition, the candidate should be able to provide subject matter expertise and collaborate with various IT support teams for resolution of critical production issues.

Note: Candidate must reside in the Chicagoland Area (will be in Elgin office 3 days a week)

#LI-MP2
#LI-HYBRD

Bachelors Degree with 8+ years of professional experience

Discover. A brighter future.
With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.

Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.

Job Description:
At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers, and which is consistently awarded for both. We’re all about people and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.

Responsible for designing, developing and supporting dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions for a wide variety of business intelligence data sets in support of assigned business partners. Directly accountable for designing and building complex queries into enterprise data stores to retrieve information in a manner that allows current and future BI tools to express the data in meaningful ways and answer the analytic questions being asked by their customers. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.

Responsibilities:
Develops creative and innovative ways to answer critical business questions by augmenting existing data assets or driving the development of new ones. Leverages technical expertise and data storytelling abilities to transform the business requirements into impactful and efficient analytic solutions, leveraging the full power of all enterprise Business Intelligence tools available.

Functions as a BI technical consultant, partnering with business users to gather, document, and develop data and information requirements to answer the business questions being asked. Researches and identifies the correct enterprise data stores to use as the source of truth for the information, working in close partnership with the technology and business teams.

Ensures all assigned projects adhere to the enterprise design standards for visual design, data governance, and performance, including cross validation of source data, development of routine data quality checks, and performance testing under different enterprise load conditions.

Guides the User Acceptance testing, project documentation, and deployment processes for all assigned BI projects, including regular-reoccurring project updates on completion status to project sponsors.

Provides all facets of support for all deployed Business Intelligence projects, identifies root cause of issues, and actively participates in guiding resolution.

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics
1+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related
1+ years of hands on experience developing optimized, complex SQL
queries across large volumes of data in both relational and
multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop,
Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related
1+ years of hands on experience utilizing industry leading Business
Intelligence Tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Qlikview to
develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:
Ability to independently explore and analyze unknown data sets
Collections experience
Strong SQL experience
6+ years of Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven
industry or related
2+ years of hands on experience developing optimized, complex SQL
queries across large volumes of data in both relational and
multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop,
Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related
2+ years of hands on experience utilizing industry leading Business
Intelligence Tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Qlikview to
develop robust, interactive and visually impactful
dashboards or related
Inquisitive mindset to find issues and a proactive attitude

In Lieu of Education Experience:
8+ years of Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven
industry or related

Position Overview:
The Senior Business Analyst Lead is responsible for the logical design and functional documentation of business processes needed to support the Product Structure application. This includes working with stakeholders to understand and document functional requirements, conceptualizing the methods and techniques to obtain solutions, and facilitating requirement gathering sessions and design reviews. The Senior Business Analyst Lead also works closely with the development team and technical analysts to ensure that project deliverables meet the goals and expectations of the business.
Responsibilities:
Provides the logical design and functional documentation of business processes needed to support Product Structure application solutions.
Acts as the liaison between stakeholders, development team, and technical analysts to ensure project deliverables satisfy the goals and expectations of the business.
Works in coordination with Technical Analysts to help conceptually determine a technical design and solution. Tests deliverables to ensure project objectives are met.
Assists the project managers in developing project plans and providing status. Will need to be able to work on multiple projects at one time.
Can train, guide, and mentor other business analysts (BAs) with less experience. Will utilize Navistar’s Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes for software configuration and development work.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
At least 8 years of business analyst experience
At least 1 year of lead experience
OR
Master’s degree
At least 6 years of business analyst experience
At least 1 year of lead experience
OR
At least 10 years of business analyst experience
At least 1 year of lead experience
Additional Requirements:
Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)
Desired Skills:
Ability to work with stakeholders to understand and document functional requirements and conceptualize the methods and techniques to obtain solutions. Experience facilitating requirement gathering sessions and design reviews.
Experience with engineering processes and concepts (parts master, different types of bills of material, engineering release, etc.).
Experience with data analysis, process modeling/mapping, user interface design, and use case diagrams to document functional requirements.
Comprehensive understanding of application, process, and data flows.
Ability to work on solutions supporting multiple business areas, integration points, and components.
Ability to analyze and decompose relevant business processes.
Update/Maintain Functional Process Flows
Create and maintain the visual appearance and UI design for screens/forms/reports.
Experience creating test plans/cases and performing system testing.
Experience with the Software Development Life Cycle, waterfall, iterative, agile practices, and methodologies. Ability to follow Navistar IT standards and operating model.
Ability to work independently with minimum guidance, to understand complex processes and solutions, and to easily adapt to changes.
Has strong analytical and problem-solving skills as well as sound judgment and reasoning skills.
Is self-motivated, responsible, dependable and works with a sense of urgency. Is energized by challenges.
Experience with Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio, and Project)
Experience querying data using SQL from multiple databases. Experience analyzing queried data.
Dedicated to exceeding the expectations of customer.

Years of Experience: use position description
Company Overview:
Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.

Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.

With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.

About Rivian:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Role Summary:
This position will perform a support role to the Yard Operations Planning Manager and will be primarily responsible for the day-to-day management of system accuracy for the shift’s Yard Operations team. The Yard Ops Analyst will be looked to as the on-site subject-matter expert on all items related to the YMS and TMS systems, scanner functionality, reports, dashboards, etc. They will also collaborate with other shift admins as well as Outbound Logistics’ Software Support Analyst on OTA’s and other software-related items on Rivian vehicles. Your primary duties will include identifying trends and issues, developing and implementing logistics strategies, supporting shift group leader, and collaborating with other departments to ensure that logistics operations are aligned with business goals. We are looking for an independent self-starter who can excel through operational excellence, servant leadership, continuous improvement, and a detail-oriented work style.
Responsibilities:
Assure daily performance numbers are gathered and are an accurate depiction of the team’s work performance.
On call support to yard team to investigate and correct any delivery blockers
Support shift leader in monitoring KPI’s by coaching staff on compliance to operations SOP’s
Produce performance reports on an as – needed basis for operations leadership
Identify and correct any system blockers to delivery daily
Be the subject-matter expert on YMS and TMS functionality and be the primary POC when communicating with IT support on these 2 systems.
Represent shift leadership in meetings when manager or lead aren’t available
Assist with yard capacity analysis, and identify and execute alternative plans for capacity shortfalls
Review system discrepancies daily and correct to maintain accurate records.
Coordinate necessary repairs with service and factory teams to streamline delivery
Facilitate the processing of damaged units or other units requiring special attention by arranging transportation in OTM
Provide guidance and technical support to team members on an ongoing basis regarding changing work procedures, safety precautions, etc.
Work in other Outbound Logistics roles as needed
Must work 1-7pm Central Wednesdays and 7am - 7pm Thursday - Saturday
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and one year experience or equivalent experience in supply chain, computer science -related or business administration-related fields in lieu of degree
Ability to stand, walk and work outdoors in various weather conditions
Familiar with Word, Excel, Outlook, and Inventory Control systems
Hands-on experience working with SAP, Transportation Management System (TMS), and/or yard management systems preferred
Fundamental knowledge of EOL / PDI processes is preferred.
Organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously (prioritization methodology)
Must be able to work nights/weekends
Minimum age of 21
No driving related suspensions or revocation of Driver License (within a 3-5 year period)
No drug or alcohol related driving incidents in the last 3 years
No more than 1 serious moving violation in the last 3 years
Must have a valid driver's license in the state of residence that you will be driving/operating a vehicle
Will be subject to continuous Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) monitoring

Job Title: Senior Digital Business Analyst - IL Lisle
Job Description:
Ryerson has an opportunity for a Senior Digital Business Analyst position. As a Senior Business Analyst you are responsible for completing system analysis, developing enhancements, and functional designs.

The future will be made from metal. At Ryerson, you have the opportunity to grow in your career, work with teammates that feel like family, and help make our world a better place.

This position will adhere to a hybrid schedule, subject to change at anytime.

Roles and Responsibilities:


Work closely with the eCommerce team (business), ERP programmers, and the 3rd party web designers to prioritize and complete systems analysis efforts for the eCommerce solution
Authorize programming specs and work closely with the programming team to develop enhancements, interfaces, and updates to the eCommerce solution
Gather requirements and develop functional designs
Define and execute test cases
Define and execute use/test cases to ensure quality, functionality, and performance
Be a problem solver. Identify, investigate, and/or confirm reported issues. Determine the source of the issue and coordinate its resolution
Other duties as assigned

Job Title: Capital Raise (Fund Raiser) Merger & Acquisitions specialist
Job Description:
Location: Onsite (Corporate offices based in Schaumburg, IL)

Years of Experience: 3+ years of experience in capital raising and fundraising (minimum of $5M per transaction)

Base Salary: DOE USD (plus bonus / commission)

Job Type: Full-time (Exempt position)

Rely Services is a leading professional services firm established in 1997. The core of our business is professional services partnering with clients such as Marriott and Carnegie Mellon University on outsourced IT and project management—as part of business we actively seek acquisition opportunities which require additional capital.

As we launch new ventures, we are seeking an experienced venture analyst with experience in raising capital. Additional must haves are well-versed in structuring & leading the fundraising process, developing investor pitch decks, advising founders, and communicating the story of our to investors. In addition, the capital raise will be expected to identify acquisition targets, perform due diligence, and lead transactions end-to-end.

Responsibilities:

Build and execute equity and debt financing and to structure complex transactions and presentations
Achieve fundraising targets, objectives, and aspirations
Identify potential financial opportunities and develop proper points of contact, in order to establish direct relationships for capital raising
Build network or institutional investors relationships as a foundation for future capital raises
Review and refine the industry's sales forecasting model and pitch deck to present to companies and investors
Work alongside the executive team to define the pitch used in investor meetings; practice the pitch with the executives and help the management team preempt investor questions
Lead process of the development of all marketing materials used in the capital raising process
Lead complex fundraising assignments across a broad range of industries (Mortgage processing, BPO, Cannabis, and Real Estate)
Define the strategy on which firms to target, identify acquisition targets, perform due diligence, execute transactions, and lead post-close integration management

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree / MBA (preferred) in finance, operations, research, statistics, math, economics, or related analytical discipline preferred
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), and proven track record fundraising success period
3 to 5 years of fundraising success in working with companies, investors, and financial sponsors to originate and review financials, analyze the market, and guide transactions
Must have a proven record of raising minimum of $5M per transaction
Financial management experience with planning, forecasting, and business analysis
Advanced Excel proficiency. 3+ years of experience of using Excel to build and maintain financial models
Comfortable with public speaking and arrange groups can range (10 to 50 plus)
Comfortable with technology and well versed in google suite tools, and heavy phone and email communications
A visionary to see the big picture
Good organizational skills; experience partnering with an executive team
Experience coaching executives on the delivery of investor pitches
Experience within multiple industries and must deliver 10 to 15 presentations per year

Perks:

Travel required - (Corporate offices is based in Schaumburg, IL)

Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits

Generous Bonus structure

Employment Development Assistance

Holiday/Sick/Vacation Time in accordance with our employment agreement

Become part of a growing team!

Position Overview:
Navistar has a great opportunity for a Lead Business Intelligence Consultant.

In this new position the individual will act as an internal consultant within the organization on a variety of projects and initiatives. We are looking for a data driven critical thinker who can make educated and appropriate assumptions when data is lacking. The position will be based in our Lisle, Illinois headquarters and report into our Vice President, Corporate Strategy.
Responsibilities:
Provide guidance and governance for programs and projects that span the enterprise (this includes conducting strategy workshops, content development support, developing standards and best practices, monitoring progress, and driving projects forward)
Maintain continuous alignment of project scope with strategic business objectives
Build credibility and rapport with the stakeholders at multiple levels
Identify process efficiencies by analyzing, re-engineering, and improving business processes across work streams within the organization
Support the VP, Corporate Strategy with comprehensive corporate strategic planning aligned with the company’s long-term goals and objectives
Assisting with additional projects and activities as determined
Lead and conduct analysis to:
Identify trends
Characterize operational situations and financial implications
Develop hypotheses and recommendations
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
At least 12 years of analytics experience
At least 2 years of lead experience
OR
Master’s degree
At least 8 years of analytics experience
At least 2 years of lead experience
OR
At least 14 years of analytics experience
At least 2 years of lead experience
Additional Requirements:
Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)
Desired Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, or related field
5+ years of consulting experience
Background in strategy or business development
Ability to manage self and others’ work across several work streams on complex projects
Experience with business process improvement analysis, requirements development and documentation
Excellent problem-solving, communication and negotiation skills
Ability to work with a diverse group of stakeholders including business leaders, project leaders and individual contributors
Comfortable communicating at executive level
Business and operations analytics highly preferred
Advanced Microsoft Excel capabilities (pivot tables, modeling, etc.) preferred
Excellent Microsoft PowerPoint capabilities (high first-time quality presentations) preferred
Experience in commercial vehicle and/or disruptive technologies preferred
Company Overview:
Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.

Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.

With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.

Job Title: Senior MS Dynamics Analyst (Industrial Sales & Service) (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Ecolab is seeking a Senior Technical Analyst to work as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to identify, document, and validate business system requirements to provide the functionality necessary to meet business objectives and project goals.

What’s in it For You:
The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments
The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth
The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our best

Position Details:
Location: This position in based out of our St. Paul, MN or Naperville, IL office and is Hybrid
No immigration sponsorship available for this position

What You Will Do:
Partner with global team & business partners to provide innovative/creative solutions to enable business requirements
Gathers & documents business and functional requirements from business stakeholders
Manages and communicates across multiple levels of businesses
Participates in prioritization and scope for release management
Lead analysis of business process for Industrial business units
Ensure business alignment between Industrial businesses on CRM platform
Complex CRM configuration & workflows
Experience implementing packaged software
Act as Scrum Master, as needed, on prioritized business efforts
Assist and/or lead coordination of testing cycles
Data analysis and design within Sales and Service digital tools and integrations
Works with subject master experts to ensure proper workflows
Manages users, roles, profiles, groups, sharing rules, and other setup options

Bachelor’s Degree

Proven ability to understand business needs, build strategic partnerships, and document and implement software solutions
Experience working with D365 Field Service mobile solution and resource optimization solution
Strong understanding of basic CRM foundations, system integration including data cleansing, loading and integrations.
Experience managing relationships with 3rd party vendors and teams.

Excellent verbal and written communication and organization skills
Ability to maintain critical thinking while balancing multiple tasks

Ability to work well within a team, focusing on building relationships with all project stakeholders.
Proven ability of learning new skills, technologies, and passionate about conveying knowledge
Solid understanding of the strategic and commercial drivers for CRM projects

A trusted partner at nearly three million commercial customer locations, Ecolab (ECL) is the global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions and services. With annual sales of $13 billion and more than 47,000 associates, Ecolab delivers comprehensive solutions, data-driven insights, and personalized service to advance food safety, maintain clean and safe environments, optimize water and energy use, and improve operational efficiencies and sustainability for customers in the food, healthcare, hospitality, and industrial markets in more than 170 countries around the world.

When you come to work at Ecolab, you get to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges and have the opportunity to learn and grow, shape your career, make an impact and quickly see the importance of your work.
