Why project44?

At project44 we’re on a mission - to make supply chains work.

project44 optimizes the movement of products globally, delivering better resiliency, sustainability, and value for our customers. As the supply chain connective tissue, we operate the most trusted end-to-end visibility platform that tracks more than 1 billion shipments annually for the world’s leading brands. The undisputed leader in the market, project44 was named the Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, #1 in FreightWaves’ FreightTech 25, and the Customer’s Choice in Gartner Peer Insights’ Voice of the Customer report. project44 is headquartered in Chicago with a diverse and fast-growing, global workforce.

If you’re eager to be part of a winning team that works together to solve some of the most challenging supply chain challenges every day, let’s talk.

Role Overview:

We are building a world-class Sales Operations team to enable our next stage of growth, and we are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Sales Operations Analyst to join the p44 team. You will collaborate closely with our sales, marketing, and finance teams to build and maintain the operational processes driving our revenue growth.

Responsibilities

Partner with our North America Sales team at all levels to support planning, including forecasting, pipeline reporting, territory assignments, capacity planning, and quota setting
Set up goals, reporting, and analyses to continuously evaluate sales team productivity
Create critical strategic analyses that provide insight into ARR and pipeline growth trends
Drive business-critical operational process improvements cross functionally with sales, marketing, finance, and other teams

2+ years in a Sales Operations role at a B2B company; experience in tech companies a plus
Strong analytical skills that go beyond creating reports to drive insights for the business
Exceptional skills in analytical tools including Excel and extensive experience working with large data sets
Familiarity with Salesforce reporting
Ability to independently prioritize tasks and drive projects to completion in a fast-paced environment



Diversity & Inclusion

As we work to deliver a truly world-class product and experience, we are also intentionally building teams that reflect the unique communities we serve. We’re focused on creating a company where all team members can bring their authentic selves to work every day.

We’re building a company that every one of us at project44 is proud to work for, and our journey of becoming a more diverse, equitable and inclusive organization, where all have a sense of belonging, is shaped through the actions of our leadership, global teams and individual team members. Job Title: Business Risk Strategy and Insights - Lead Data Analyst
Job Description:
Discover. A brighter future.
With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.

Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.

Job Description:
The Lead Data Analyst role will be responsible for the ongoing development of the Risk Reporting framework and strategy and the analysis of Risk Reporting data. This role will support the strategic design of the Risk Reporting framework, playing a key role in identifying and analyzing Risk Reporting metrics and partnering and coordinating with key stakeholders. Provide insights and recommendations based on data and engages with technical analysts to develop analytic and reporting solutions (models, strategies, analyses and/or analytical reports) that adequately meet program needs. Coordinates with the supporting program owner and business partners, plays a key role in delivering on committee/forum responsibilities, supports regulatory response/commitment responsibilities, and ensures strong relationships, alignment, communication, and quality across the Compliance Management framework.

Supports the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, empowered to deliver a high throughput of projects while working around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Responsibilities

Responsible for gathering, structuring, and analyzing data from multiple sources, and providing recommendations to management and process owners.

Partners with the business to identify the appropriate data sources and analysis methodology.

Supports the development of standard data analyses, reports, and dashboards.

Demonstrates technical knowledge of analytical tools.

Develops an understanding of the business, strategic direction, organizational structure, and overall business goals.

Consults with business partners to identify intelligence gaps and oversees the build out of new data solutions, end user reporting support, and self-service analytical solutions.

Leverages knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, empowered to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business partners, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Executes Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Embraces a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Analytics, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Information Technology, or related

4+ years of experience in Data Analysis (and relevant tools) or related

Knowledge of Tableau, SQL, Excel, or other data analytic toolsets

In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree, 8+ years of related experience

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:
Tableau Certification

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation: The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Benefits:
We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:

Paid Parental Leave

Paid Time Off

401(k) Plan

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com .

What are you waiting for? Apply today!

All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.

Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. Job Title: Business and Process Analyst, Community & Partner
Job Description:
Are you looking to make an impact in your community and be a part of a dynamic team?


As a member of the Community Impact department, the Business and Process Analyst, Community & Partner role involves analyzing community and partner-focused systems and processes, identifying areas for improvement, and collaborating cross-functionally to implement new ways of working – all with an eye toward making the greatest impact for our partners as we look to end hunger in our community.


This role will work closely with our Strategic Relationships & Community Planning and Partner Services & Support functions:

Strategic Relationships & Community Planning works cross-functionally to lead the development and implementation of strategic community building and relationship plans in Cook County. Ensures that activities executed at the community-level are in alignment with community voice and Food Depository strategy by collaborating bi-directionally with partners and other functions in the Community Impact and Policy and Advocacy departments.
Partner Services & Support oversees day-to-day operations and support of partners and logistics needed to activate their work toward mission. This function includes comprehensive oversight of the Food Depository’s portfolio of programs operated through partnership.


We are entering the design phase for a Partner & Program Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solution, where we will leverage StratusLive. The Business and Process Analyst, Community & Partner role will work closely with internal staff from multiple teams to configure and integrate the people, process and technology into an improved set of processes enabled by this new technology. Once implemented, this role will continue to provide critical CRM support.


The ideal candidate will be a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst.


Key Responsibilities and Essential Functions:


Process Documentation & Improvement

Learn the business processes of the Strategic Relationships & Community Planning, and Partner Services & Support functions and how those processes are enabled by technology (specifically, Partner & Program CRM (StratusLive) and Ceres)
Work cross-functionally to identify, analyze, optimize, and document key community and partner-focused processes
Ensure cross-team coordination to ensure consistent development, application, and access to standard operating procedures
Monitoring the efficacy of updated workflows
Collaborate with stakeholders on how best to use the Partner & Program CRM (StratusLive), and other key systems, to support ongoing changes in the business
Make recommendations for solutions or improvements that can be accomplished through new technology or alternative uses of existing technology
Analyze and communicate stakeholder needs by translating business requirements into software requirements
Collaborate with the Information & Technology department regarding the systems that support partners


Data Analytics and Reporting

Learn the data that supports Strategic Relationships & Community Planning, and Partner Services & Support functions and be able to perform data analysis and reporting to support the function leads, in collaboration with the Research, Evaluation & Business Analytics department
Lead the data analytics and stewardship efforts for Strategic Relationships & Community Planning, and Partner Services & Support functions, in collaboration with the Research, Evaluation & Business Analytics department
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement
Foster data usage/communication across team members
Create, maintain, troubleshoot, and optimize all Power BI reports related to Strategic Relationships & Community Planning, and Partner Services & Support functions, in collaboration with Information & Technology and the Research, Evaluation & Business Analytics departments
Learn and use the Azure Data Warehouse tools that are being developed at the Food Depository
Serve on project teams to support with partner focused data collection and interpretation to drive informed decisions
Collaborate with other departmental data analysts to advance the Business Analytics function at the Food Depository


Data Entry and Database Management

Responsible for ensuring all data entry processes and procedures are followed for our department, working in close partnership with functional area data owners and Research, Evaluation & Business Analytics
Work cross-functionally to ensure data accuracy and drive data clean-up initiatives, as needed – in support of strengthening our commitment to data quality best practices
Key departmental systems include (but are not limited to): Ceres, Partner & Program CRM (StratusLive) and Neighbor CRM (ClientTrack)


Project & Change Management

Lead or support projects to implement changes in business processes, ensuring projects are completed on time and to a high standard
For IT projects, participate in the implementation of the selected software applications and platforms. This includes following our IT Project methodology with the assistance of an IT Project Manager and a selected vendor / partner
Proactively manage change, with attention to transparent communication at all levels
Other duties as assigned
5-7 years of experience as a business analyst, in process improvement, data analysis, project management or a related field
Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications, including Office, Excel, Visio, PowerBI
High proficiency with database management
Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with a wide array of individuals
Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner
Experience in generating process documentation and reports
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement
Excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Diverse experience in problem-solving and willingness to seek out continuous process improvement
Strong work ethic, fast-learner and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities
Commitment to the Food Depository’s mission of ending hunger


Preferred skills and qualifications:

Project and/or change management certification
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics
SQL & Power Query Editor experience


Exposure:

General office environment; exposure to warehouse environment
Interacts with Food Depository staff, partners, and neighbors

Working for Silgan Containers will be the best decision you make!
JD Edwards IT Business Analyst 2

The IT Business Analyst (BA) will focus on providing support across the Silgan enterprise for JD Edwards Enterprise One Sales and Distribution modules. The BA serves as a liaison between the business and the development team and manages multiple projects, deadlines, and deliverables while providing business analysis to develop new applications or maintain existing ones. This position requires significant time outside the office and a willingness to travel domestically by up to 30% annually.

What we can offer you:
A great culture where you are like a member of our family - achievements are recognized, acknowledged and celebrated.
Competitive salary & comprehensive benefits including health, dental, vision, life, short & long-term disability, critical care, AD&D, dependent life.
Add-on benefits include pet insurance, Perks Program for buying power, Hinge Health for customized online workouts, Teledoc, and more.
401k with a 6% employer match after 90 days.
15 days of vacation which you’re encouraged to take, plus 10 holidays, annually.
Tuition assistance.
Stability in a growing, environmentally conscious, publicly traded company.
Opportunity to work alongside America’s most respected brands and food manufacturers.

What you’ll do:
Support the JD Edwards end-user community throughout the Silgan enterprise.
Gather requirements from end-users regarding application technology issues and queries.
Respond to customer needs with a sense of urgency and provides high attention to detail.
Troubleshoot issues with the Distribution Modules including Order to Cash, EDI, Transportation, and Procurement
Lead implementation BA on projects for Order to Cash modules.
Configure Distribution modules for implementations including related DMAAI’s.
Conduct training sessions for new systems or refresher courses on current systems.
Execute testing scenarios for new or changed applications or programs.
Prepare documentation.
Creates and maintains reports using Enterprise One tools.
Travel to Silgan facilities to provide on-site expertise and support during implementations.
What you need to have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, IT, or a related field.
3+ years’ experience supporting JD Edwards Enterprise One.
3+ years of JD Edwards implementation or upgrade experience.
3 + years of business analysis experience.
Functional knowledge of JD Edwards Sales, Procurement, Shop Floor Management, Transportation, Warehouse, Manufacturing, & EDI.
In Depth knowledge of Order to Cash, Transportation, Procure to Pay
Solid understanding of integration with JD Edwards Customer Service and Sales Order Entry, Inventory, Finance, and Procurement modules.
In Depth knowledge of DMAAI’s particularly related to Order to Cash and Procure to Pay.
Demonstrated experience providing JD Edwards Order to Cash application training to end-users.

Who We Are:
Global fortune 500 packaging company with 109 manufacturing facilities in North and South America, Europe, and Asia.
A leading supplier of sustainable metal and rigid packaging solutions for consumer goods products for food, beverage, health care, garden, home, personal care, and beauty products.
Trusted by America’s most respected brands, our reputation is based on a foundation of quality, excellence, and unsurpassed technical expertise.
We pride ourselves on being a solution-based partner to our customers and work hard to earn their business every day.
America's largest metal food packaging producer.
A company that strives toward sustainability by reducing our carbon footprint, selecting like-minded suppliers, and providing recyclable products.
Silgan Containers has set sustainability targets through 2030 to source more renewable energy, reduce our greenhouse gas emissions, and divert our waste from landfill to foster environmental stewardship.

Job Summary

The position is responsible for supporting the end-to-end process of implementing member experience and communication strategies for a variety of marketing channels, including: letters, bi-folds, flyers, newsletters, digital platforms, emails, and texts. All within a highly regulated environment. This position will provide operational support, business analysis and guidance to ensure alignment and integration across functional areas in support of Medicaid divisional strategies and to ensure consistency and efficiency. Project management skills, including strong organization, prioritization and problem solving skills; strong oral, verbal and interpersonal communication skills; ability to accept direction and feedback
Experience interacting with personnel of multiple departments and at various levels in the organization

Experience interpreting business and financial information

The Opportunity
Huron is a global consultancy that collaborates with clients to drive strategic growth, ignite innovation and navigate constant change. Through a combination of strategy, expertise and creativity, we help clients accelerate operational, digital and cultural transformation, enabling the change they need to own their future.

Join our team as the expert you are now and create your future.
Position Summary
When you roll up your sleeves and starting thinking about your career in technology consulting, what do you see? At Huron we see a visionary who’s skilled in system design and configuration…in identification of business process modifications…in design document creation. We see someone who can execute on test script identification and end-user training development. We see a road warrior—an energetic optimist who works well with project managers and client team members alike.
But it’s not just the number of skills you perform that matters; it’s also the quality of your communication. Can you prepare and deliver first-rate presentations to clients? Can you write basic reports with minimal supervision? Do your verbal, written, and interpersonal skills reflect the professionalism and authenticity that define Huron?

This isn’t your low-profile tech desk job. Plan on hitting the pavement in multiple territories where you’ll sharpen your talent for prioritizing and multitasking—and for sharing vital analytical skills. You can count on playing a key role in furthering Huron’s reputation as a forward-thinking, tech-driven consulting maverick.

Let’s get to work – together.
Qualifications
2-5 years of experience in Salesforce
Experience working in a Healthcare environment or with clients in Healthcare and preferably with Providers
Extensive experience in writing BRD, Functional Specification documents and Process flows
Experience in conducting Feasibility Studies, Gap Analysis and Root Cause Analysis (RCA)
Experience in Quality Assurance testing including: functional, integration, system, regression, and data driven testing experience in creating and developing strategic test plans, cases and reports
In-depth understanding of the capabilities and constraints of the Salesforce core platform and preferably Health Cloud
Experience defining business solutions leveraging Salesforce for the purposes of driving business value
Practical experiences in the entire SDLC from solution definition, solution architecture definition to design, development and testing of Salesforce preferably in a hybrid Agile methodology
Experience in the creation of integration/migration plans, integration/migration mapping to/from external systems and Salesforce
Experience in developing Salesforce custom objects and work-flow business rules
Experience with third-party tools (e.g. SFDC Excel Connector, SFDC Data Loader, etc.)
Understanding of SFDC toolkit (e.g. Visual force, Apex, Triggers, Chatter, Apex Data Loader, Apex Explorer, etc.)
Ability to manage work of remote Salesforce Developers both onshore and offshore
Applied knowledge of the solution definition, design, layout and configuration of the SFDC implementation and related applications
Recommend cost effective technology solutions for business challenges
Salesforce certification highly preferred
Willingness to travel as needed

Job Summary

This position is responsible for providing operational support to multiple technology teams. Under the direction of senior technology leadership, primary responsibilities include managing financial and operational reporting, developing meeting materials and handling various team communications. Key skills required include organization, communication, and project management.

This position will participate in a cohort of other project coordinators to share cross-team responsibilities and provide cross-team coverage as needed. Perform tasks include developing and managing projects; financial management; Develop and facilitate training & communication management with departments; KPI/metrics management, operation support to department, maintaining project plans, issue logs, and status reports. Also lead or participating in department meetings and workgroups with multiple, simultaneous projects. Manage the relationship between IT and internal/external client organizations in business and technical environments.

NOTE: This hybrid role can be located in CHICAGO IL or RICHARDSON TX ~ relocation will not be offered; sponsorship is not available.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :

Develop and manage small to medium complex projects including project planning, issue logs, reports and documentation. Supports financial management for IT department such as managing Utilization Reports, IT Core financial management, Product Core Tracking & Product Funding Reports. Manage Metrics/KPI/ for OKR the departmental goals and publish and maintain them regularly. Responsible for departmental communication management, like monthly newsletters, creating & maintaining FYI Blue presence, respond to operational questions from staff. Lead and/or participate in project meetings and workgroups. Schedule and coordinate meetings and workgroups, departmental staff Meetings, townhall Meetings & leadership Meetings (multi-day/off-site) Provide operation support to the department like on-boarding/off boarding team members, coordinate and communicate division specific events such as training dates, blue pulse and other operational needs. Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with co-workers, management, etc. Gather critical and/or sensitive data and disseminate it appropriately based on the overall project need and sensitivity. Develop and manage relationships with IT and internal/external client organizations within business and technical environments. Develops thorough understanding of IT organizations and IT division and technologies. Comply with HIPAA, Diversity Principles, Corporate Integrity, Compliance Program policies and other applicable corporate and departmental policies. Maintain complete confidentiality of company business. Maintain communication with management regarding development within areas of assigned responsibilities and perform special projects as required or requested.

*Business acumen

Position Title: Sr. Financial Analyst, NA Sales

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Oakbrook Terrace

Requisition ID: 25724


For us, for family!


We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way that reflects our values.


Our Senior Financial Analyst is a key player within the North American Sales Finance team, supporting and partnering with the Sales and related teams to profitably grow the businesses.




The primary responsibility is to bring strong financial and general business acumen and add value with a customer-centric focus. The role includes:




Thoroughly understanding key customers’ operations and how it impacts McCain’s current profitability and future growth opportunities;
Comprehensive Trade Spend management for all customers (accruals, analysis and reporting);
Supporting the Demand Planning cycle from a top-down (Targets and Forecasts) and bottoms-up (Sales feedback) perspective;
Contributing to enhancing internal systems and processes and enable faster and higher-quality decision-making for Senior Leaders;
Providing various ad-hoc data extraction, consolidation, re-organization and analysis to help the business understand trends, and assess customers and products from a ‘Volume-Price-Mix’ context;
‘Stakeholder’ and ‘Ownership’ mentality is a must; you must feel that you are a major stakeholder in the business and ‘own’ the numbers (alongside your counterparts). High-quality work is expected; you should be proud of the work that you do for the business as you’ll be a key player in the team


This role will be based in Oakbrook Terrace, IL.


How You’ll Add Value:




Act as financial business partner to Sales and related teams supporting Customer and Product profitability via Sales, Trade and Cost-of-Goods-Sold analytics
Contribute to improving sales forecast and proposing actions to mitigate trade related risks and maximize growth and profit opportunities
Drive research and analysis of key product drivers, trends and performance indicators
Support financial information reporting to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for business-critical decision making
Build strong working relationships with business partners across the organization
Work on other assigned priorities and contribute to organizational development of the North American finance organization in support of our North American businesses


About You:

Bachelor Degree required (Business, Finance, or Accounting)
3+ years of work experience in finance, business, or accounting
Understanding of accounting and finance practices
Strong results- and action-oriented mindset
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities with a sense of urgency
Natural collaboration skills
Agility in being able to work with different teams, particularly Sales and Marketing, in addition to Finance counterparts and other functions as required

Purpose of Job:

The HR M&A and Operations Analyst will report the Vice President Total Rewards and HR Systems. Working with the VP Total Rewards and HR Systems, this position will work with the M&A team to support due diligence through integration for target partners. This support may include internal knowledge or leveraging third party partners to support diligence and integration. Additionally, this position will support the development and support of our platform HCM and other technology solutions.




Essential Functions:

Administer and maintain UKG Pro HCM which includes security administration, configuration, managing enhancements, maintenance, and system upgrades.
Lead and participate in the review, testing and implementation of UKG releases and communicate the potential benefit of these features to stakeholders.
Champion and serve as the technical expert for UKG and any additional HR technology applications by partnering to drive long term direction, design requirements, implementation, functionality, and future enhancements.
As the SME, drive efficiencies and partner with field HR and the business to increase user adoption through employee and manager self-service activities.
In partnership with HR and business leaders, help identify data needs throughout the organization, develop reporting, dashboards, and analytics to help drive strategic business decisions.
Ensure data integrity and maintenance across the platform in alignment with company policies and practices.
Build and execute project plans and work with the HR Team to establish technology priorities.
Support integrations between UKG and other systems to assist with continued seamless performance capabilities.
Responsible for resolving complex/escalated requests and technical issues.
Collaborate with stakeholders (internal/external) in understanding business requirements and ensure results meet necessary business requirements.
Ensure data integrity and confidentiality within all HR technologies and vendor systems, through routine auditing, data validations, and corrective actions.
Build and grow positive business relationships across HR, Payroll, Benefits, Finance and IT departments as well as external vendor teams, to provide the proper support and analysis to leverage technology solutions across the company.
Identifies risks and system issues across all platforms and calls out as necessary.
Maintain and develop deeper proficiency in technological advancements.
Responsible for helping to understand acquisition deal structures and the businesses, to help identify any HR risks or concerns and to ensure HR considerations are aligned to the deal and business.
Consult with M&A development team, Functional Team Leads, Employment Legal, Business Leaders, and Integration Team members throughout the lifecycle of an expected transaction.
Ensure HR M&A tasks are identified and completed timely and accurately and keep stakeholders apprised of progress on key tasks.
Provide support and guidance to other M&A and integration representatives on active deals.
Develop and ensure completion of HR integration plan including integration of new company in HR systems.
Partner closely with HR business partners on change management, communications and employee engagement throughout the process, as necessary.
Serve as an escalation contact with the target company HR team after close to support a successful integration.

Education, Experience and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, business, related field or equivalent
At least five years of progressive HR experience; preferably with a service organization and dispersed workforce.
Strong knowledge of UKG required; ADP, Business Intelligence and D365 a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong skills in Excel, proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a high degree of initiative and creativity.
Excellent interpersonal, time management, active listening, and organizational skills.
Able to manage sensitive situations and maintain confidentiality at all times.
Knowledge of federal, state and local regulations governing equal employment opportunity and civil rights, compensation, wage and hour issues, and labor relations, including but not limited to the following statues and their comparable state and local laws (where applicable): Title VII, ADEA, Equal Pay Act, FLSA, ADA, FMLA, and ACA.
SHRM or PHR certified a plus

At Allianz Commercial (AzC), we are the global leader for insuring corporate and specialty risks in the Allianz Group. Whether it’s aircraft, satellites, the world’s biggest ships and tallest building, cyber-attacks or climate change impacts, AzC has the major risks covered when it comes to protecting businesses.
We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst.


The Impact You Will Have
Based on customer and sponsor requirements, for board-approved projects and initiatives, deliver cross-functional and cross-regional analysis / consultancy / training to improve Allianz Commercial (AzC) ability to deliver its value proposition to clients. Ensure a rigorous and methodical approach in executing analysis / consultancy / training which is in line with Allianz and AzC standards. This role is of senior nature and includes the management of project team members and external consultants. It can include line management.


Some of your specific responsibilities include:
Deliver analysis / consultancy / training to improve global Allianz Commercial (AzC) business operations as part of board-approved projects and initiatives.
Ensure high quality work results which are delivered in time and budget through a clear understanding of the customer's needs and deploying rigorous, methodical approach to improve AzC's delivery towards clients in line with strategic priorities.
In alignment with business priorities identify AzC business improvement opportunities relating to organization, business processes, organizational capabilities and business IT applications.
Create proposals for management and support the creation of project proposals, including, but not limited to Voice of the Customer (VoC), cost / benefit analysis, work package definitions, time & resource planning for delivery.
Ensure that global standards and guiding principles are followed in projects and initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to AzC Global Operating Framework (Operating Model, Process Landscape), Business Process Management (BPM) Standards, Training Standards.
Compile best practices and share with own department, OBT and business functions as relevant. Best practices can include, but are not limited to project approaches, lessons learned, application of methods and tools. Deliver proactive sharing through written communication, presentations, conference calls, workshops as appropriate.
Act as a champion for methods which includes but is not limited to Lean, Six Sigma, OPEX, OREX, Train-the-Trainer, Test Management. Act as sparing partner for management and coach team members.
Manage project teams as part of business improvement initiatives, consisting of analysts and business experts. For higher levels, line management of analysts / consultants can be included in the role.
What You’ll Bring to the Role
3-5 years experience in the domain of practice of the role
3-5 years experience in project management experience
3-5 years experience in line management experience
1-3 years experience in the insurance industry domain
3-5 years experience in cross-cultural and international work experience
Business Administration Degree of similar, Master’s preferred
Professional certification qualification in the domain of practice preferred

The base pay is just one component of the AzC total compensation package. About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
This role sits in the Asset Servicing, Technology Servicing and Solution Business Management Function and will incorporate Business Management, Data Analytics and Financial Analysis.
This role is suitable for somebody who enjoys working in a fast-paced and dynamic function working across a multiple range of diverse initiatives. The business manager role would give the candidate significant access to senior management so they must be comfortable interacting with a wide range of stakeholders across all areas of the bank.
Key responsibilities:
Core Member of the business management function which will support senior execs across a wide-range of deliverables around business management, data analytics and financial analysis
Track core financials/expense management and ensure senior management has information needed to make key decisions on moving forward with key initiatives
Create comprehensive, interactive, automated reports of financial data for client customization work
Digital consulting and ability to utilize analytical tools and data visualization platforms for data analysis and reporting, Power BI and Alteryx
Problem solving and working directly with financial information to drive meaningful analysis, reports and presentations for senior management
Ensure accurate financial reporting for expenses
Coordinate the quarterly, monthly and/or weekly MIS deliverables working in cooperation with the different businesses to pull the key messages and updates. Additionally will review the overall presentation of the MIS and provide feedback on enhancing to meet deliverables
Partner with Sr Business Manager or CAO to develop a robust governance structure and process, management reporting and business processes as appropriate for the oversight of the business and the discussion of key issues.
Develop and implement processes to automate manual processes to enhance efficiencies
Write and build strong materials to represent the group internally and externally, ie. powerpoint presentations, publication copy
Communicate complex and important messages to key stakeholders in a succinct fashion and act as key point of contact with the many stakeholders for the broader asset servicing organization
Assisting with adhoc initiatives and presentations and propose potential solutions across a wide range of initiatives
Will interact daily with the different businesses within the practice with specific requests to help support the day to day operating of the business
Supports offsites and all staff meetings and other events ensuring materials and agenda are completed along with follow-ups.
Your experience and skills:
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and confidence in presenting ideas and analysis to senior management
Strong Microsoft Excel skills, Power BI, Alteryx, financial acumen and ability to analyze/evaluate financial data
Proven track record of interfacing with a wide range of people and have excellent time management and organizational skills
Strong business writing and editing skills – ability to take complex/technical content and simplify for a non-technical audience
Strong powerpoint skills – ability to decipher key messages create slides that deliver poignant information with creativity starting from paragraphs of information or with very little direction
Demonstrable success with executive-level initiatives, complex problem analysis and resolution, and handling multiple projects of various sizes simultaneously to deadline
A strategic and creative thinker, able to generate ideas and influence senior management
Comfortable with data, able to identify risks and opportunities and react accordingly
Flexible self-starter with the ability to work independently or collaboratively, across multiple regions
Proficient across the Microsoft Office application suite
Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.

Job Title: Underwriting Analyst - Small Business - Naperville, IL
Job Description:
Company Details:

A constellation in the southern hemisphere, Vela means "sails of a ship" in Latin. In 1996, Vela Insurance Services began operations writing excess and surplus lines casualty business. In the beginning, the primary focus was on construction and manufacturing risks but expanded to write a variety of general casualty and professional liability classes. Today, we offer both national service and local knowledge to our exclusive wholesale broker network and the businesses they serve.

The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer.

https://www.vela-ins.com/
Responsibilities:
The person in this position participates in underwriting accounts by gathering, synthesizing and clearly presenting all specific account information to underwriting to decide on the risk.


Gather underwriting information to properly evaluate commercial risks for acceptability within company guidelines. Underwrite for profit.
Research and solve more complicated problems and make decisions with supervision of underwriter or manager.
Review and summarize claims and loss information on individual risks and take the appropriate action.
Determine coverage and pricing options for routine commercial risks for underwriters.
Determine if a risk fits within the guidelines.
Identify unfavorable risk characteristics and take the appropriate underwriting action as directed.
Maintain quality and time standards as established.
Stay informed and knowledgeable about current industry issues and activities.
Draft quotes for underwriters based on individual risk characteristics.
Issue quotes, declinations and other communications to brokers.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Four (4) year College Degree.
Excellent math, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal.
Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.

Job Title: Onsite Work - W2 only - Need Sr. Salesforce Business Analyst in Chicago IL
Job Description:
Share only 2 profiles
W2 candidates only

I am hiring a Sr. Salesforce Business Analyst. Candidates MUST have Banking Domain experience and FSC (Financial Services Cloud). Long term contract onsite in Chicago.

Below we have captured more details on the specific work activities that the our INTL

BA's are responsible for, in general, across all funnel teams.

Requirements Management

Understand all requirements associated with a new EPIC or Initiative.

Work with Product Manager/Owner and Sr Developers/Leads on documenting requirements associated with a particular initiative or EPIC.

Develop and maintain functional specifications or "How to Use This Feature" documentation (when appropriate).

Manage and lead the requirements gathering sessions.

Ticket Development & Refinement

Create and refine detailed User Stories consistent with the High Level

Requirements noted in the associated EPIC.

Refine Stories as needed so that they have required detailed to be actioned by thefull scrum team.

Elicit and document ticket dependencies, ensuring that information is taggedcorrectly and captured in the Dependency Huddle board.

Ensure all stories meet the agreed "Definition of Ready" before being taken intosprint planning session

Note: for Critical tickets brought in mid sprint, analyze and refine ticket tomitigate risk of ticket issues

Contribute to work estimates as appropriate so that sprint planning is effective.

Maintain a "healthy" backlog consistent with agreed upon targets for INTL. (2Sprints ahead).

Manage and lead the ticket refinement process.

Partnering with Third Party Teams (internal/external)

Facilitate necessary conversations with teams outside of INTL, ensuring necessary tickets are created to address the requirements.

Facilitate meetings with third parties as required to ensure the work is progressing in such a way as to meet overall EPIC or Project timelines.

Ensure cross team collaboration is occurring as needed and that any blockers are resolved or escalated as appropriate to keep the work progressing.

Close out as required and per agreed prioritization (set by the Product Manager/Owner) any outstanding issues that exist post go-live i.e How-To documents

Process Improvement:

Help ensure a continual process improvement focus exists across the team, supporting an environment of experimentation and new practice trials.

Ensure consistency with lulu's INTL common practices.

Contribute to and lead Process Improvement activities as appropriate and per PI roadmap plans, etc.

Partner with peer Business Analysts to share and leverage lessons learned, fostering a PI culture at all times.

Test Plan Review

ensure they can be linked back to requirements

Operations Support

Support the Scrum Master in creation of intake requests for external teams as needed

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst on the Information Technology team, your prior Accounting or Finance experience will be valuable as you recommend & implement technology solutions that will make processes more efficient and employees more productive within our Finance and Investments groups. Core responsibilities include translating business requirements into technical documents, mockups, and test scripts; becoming the subject matter expert on how your business partners use our software; and working in a dynamic team of BSAs and developers to deliver technology solutions that empower your business partners.

WHO YOU ARE:

Knowledgeable & Analytical.
Your background includes a combination of Accounting/Finance and Information Technology and you are comfortable with Accounting concepts, specifically the routines related to closing financial books. You re skilled at gathering requirements, data collection & analysis, problem solving, process documentation, and identifying areas for improvement.

Technologically Savvy.
You ve got a solid proficiency in writing SQL queries. You re also comfortable working with relational database concepts and have a knack for quickly mastering new software. You re familiar with how data can flow between systems via integrations/APIs.

Business Liaison.
You re comfortable collaborating with business partners and third party vendors to gather needs, review viable solutions, test new functionality, and track post-implementation results.

Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are clear, articulate, effective, and demonstrate your ability to interact with all levels both within and outside the organization. By delivering clear communication, you help to ensure that projects stay on time, deliverables meet budget, and key stakeholders are aware of project statuses.

Passionate. Motivated. Eager to Learn.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and regularly seek to understand.

WHAT YOU LL DO:

Work closely with teammates and business partners to analyze and document business requirements
for projects and software customizations or configurations. You ll then translate those business requirements into technical requirements for development staff.
Provide project management to coordinate efforts between business partners and IT.
Deliver clear communication on status, timing, deliverables, and budget to leaders, team members, stakeholders, etc.
Implement new technology and evaluate upgrades.
You ll present new features to business partners, test new functionality, and assist with the creation of training documentation.
Identify opportunities for automation.
Implement technology solutions such as workflows or Robotic Process Automation to enhance business processes and eliminate administrative burden.
Document data relationships and write basic SQL statements.
You ll analyze and compare datasets and look for trends, issues, or areas for improvement.
Implement and manage standard testing procedures for system changes.
Create, review and execute test plans and validate that it meets the business and technical requirements. Responsible for proper tracking of test results.
Provide assistance to IT Support to review issues reported from users.
Compare data from multiple sources to reconcile discrepancies, determine cause of errors and establish procedures to correct them.
Challenge the status quo. Be willing to look at processes with fresh eyes and questions on whether there s a better way.
Represent the Company in a professional manner at all times.
Consistently maintain a professional, courteous attitude when dealing with residents, coworkers and the general public.
Perform other duties as necessary.

Previous Experience & Requirements:

A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Business, Accounting, Finance, or computer science with previous business analysis and/or project management experience is preferred.
5+ years relevant Accounting/Finance, business analysis and/or consulting work in related fields is preferred.
Key competencies: requirements gathering, data analysis, conceptual thinking, problem solving, customer focus, managing work efficiently, strong written and verbal communication skills.

Machines, Tools and Equipment, Software:

Experience with MRI or other ERP/Financial Software products strongly preferred
Experience with Blackline Accounting software preferred.
Must be proficient in creating/executing SQL queries and possess thorough understanding of relational database concepts.
Must be adept with the Google Platform and Microsoft Office suite of products.
PrimaryLocation Chicago, IL, United States

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management

About Kirkland & Ellis

At Kirkland & Ellis, we are united in our ambition and drive to move forward. We share core values that help us achieve excellence: collaboration, talent empowerment, service, inclusion, respect and gratitude. Our people are our greatest asset, and we invest in the brightest talent and encourage a diversity of perspectives and strengths to create dynamic teams that operate at the pinnacle of their field. Our talented professionals show up every day knowing they will engage in meaningful work, continuous learning and professional development.

As one of the world's leading law firms, we serve a broad range of clients with market-leading practices in private equity, M&A and other complex corporate transactions; investment fund formation and management; restructurings; high-stakes litigation and trials; and government, regulatory and internal investigations. We handle the most complicated and sophisticated legal matters because we don't just meet industry standards, we create them. We bring innovation and entrepreneurialism to every engagement and, as a result, have long-standing client relationships with leading global corporations and financial sponsors. With 6,500 employees (including 3,500+ lawyers) operating from 19 offices across the United States, Europe and Asia, we are one of the largest law firms in the world and a top financial performer.

Essential Job Functions

This position is assigned to the HR Operations department, whose goal is to support the efficient operation of the Firm's Human Resource function, by effectively managing systems, data, and information processes.

The HR Operations department is primarily responsible for accurate HR and Benefit-related data entry into the Firm's Core HCM system (PeopleSoft), providing seamless customer service through the use of standard email response templates, ensuring that HR data is regularly audited and reliable, maintaining and training on an HR Business Glossary of Terms, and understanding and updating HR Data lineage.

The HR Operations team is responsible for understanding the data needs of our upstream and downstream consumers, responding to report requests for HR Data, and training staff to report on HR Data using the Firm's HR System.

The HR Operations team is also responsible for leading and participating in all HR data-related initiatives such as new system implementations and upgrades that dovetail with HR data, system enhancements and bug fixes, and any other business process change involving the Human Resource function. This includes leading change management efforts through the lens of the end-user, to drive adoption and improve the end-user's experience with HR software.

The HR Operations department is seeking a Specialist/Analyst to support the team's Management with planning and executing on department programs, as assigned, including and especially the implementation of new initiative and enhancement projects. Projects can be limited in scope such as targeted data clean-up in one field, or broader in scope such as fit-gap analysis and implementing HR process redesign.

The Specialist/Analyst role is a broad role that supports the entire team's efforts and is responsible for creating reliable and repeatable business processes that largely revolve around HR data, or data-related business processes or systems.

The Specialist/Analyst role requires a results-driven professional who is highly organized and can effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. The role is expected to operate with efficiency, enthusiasm and encourage positive adoption of change.

Essential Job Functions:

Identify and operationalize opportunities for improvement on behalf of the team, all while maintaining an attitude of "no task is too small and no project too big". Includes creating PowerPoint presentations and step-by-step process documentation.
Participate in data security efforts including consulting on enhanced roles and access to HR data, as well as train users on the Firm's HR system screens and reporting functionality. Includes participating in efforts to educate downstream users of HR data on data sensitivity categories.
Respond to report requests for HR data, consult on the Firm's HR data used within Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, and/or Qliq, as well as be able to create new HR metrics and Analytics using Excel and PowerBI.
Participate in HR system enhancement and bug/fix projects.
Serve as the primary lead for all new Technology roadmap projects; be the voice of the team while representing Human Resources and relay project activities to Management. Provide requirements and assist with testing all assigned projects. Use project management skills when managing projects including creating and updating project-related documentation.
Reconcile HR data against the Firm's Payroll data and other sources, to confirm the accuracy and trustworthiness of the Firm's HR data.
Assist the team's Assistants/Coordinators with data entry during key cyclical heavy workload periods.
Foster excellent cross-functional relationships with all HR and Payroll application departments including the Firm's HRIS Analysts, HR Business Partners, Local-Office HR Staff, Benefits and Wellbeing, Compensation, Employee Relations, Staff and Legal Recruiting Talent Acquisition (Recruiting), and Time and Absence.

The ideal candidate will possess the following key competencies:

Results-driven, based on strategy and direction set by management
Self-managing: ability to set and prioritize goals and be responsible for staying focused in order to accomplish objectives
Proven ability to manage competing priorities in a high-pressure environment
Ability to meet deadlines for project assigned projects
Accountable for personal and team performance
Functional knowledge of the Human Resources discipline and applicable laws and regulations around data and data privacy
Strong problem-solving, decision-making, and customer service skills, even under rapidly shifting circumstances
Strong attention to detail
Project management skills (particularly with respect to organization, planning, and time management)
Demonstrated ability to identify the root cause(s) of problems/inefficiencies in business processes
Ability to present data in a logical, concise manner
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality at all times
Ability to work effectively with attorneys and all levels of management

Qualifications & Requirements

A Bachelor's degree in or equivalent experience in a related field and a minimum of five (5) years of experience in Human Resources required. Proficiency with MS Office, particularly Excel, is also required. Experience in a law firm or professional services environment preferred. The Specialist/Analyst must have excellent judgment; exceptional problem-solving skills; superior oral, written and interpersonal communication skills; and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. In addition, the successful candidate will be self-motivated, organized, and able to multi-task and effectively prioritize competing demands on his or her time and attention.

How to Apply

Thank you for your interest in Kirkland & Ellis LLP. To complete an application and submit your resume, please click "Apply Now."

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions, including the recruiting, hiring, placement, training availability, promotion, compensation, evaluation, disciplinary actions, and termination of employment (if necessary) are made without regard to the employee's race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, personal appearance, family responsibilities, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, political affiliation, source of income, place of residence, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, marital status, military veteran status, unfavorable discharge from military service, physical or mental disability, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Closing Statement

The www.kirkland.com job postings and recruiting mailbox are for candidates only. If you are a recruiter, search firm or employment agency, and do not have a signed contract with Kirkland & Ellis LLP ("K&E") and have not been asked specifically to submit candidates, you will not be compensated in any way for your referral of a candidate even if K&E hires the candidate. About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. This role’s responsibilities will include revenue reporting, forecasting, and annual planning processes for Northern Trust Asset Management (NTAM), in partnership with other members of the NTAM Finance Team. The role will also execute analyses supporting value-add insights through process improvement and utilization of BI tools.

This individual should be self-driven yet prepared to collaborate and display leadership skills while working with the NTAM Finance team as well as in partnership with other Finance and business teams across Northern Trust.

The key responsibilities of the role include:


Partner with the team on monthly and quarterly revenue reporting.
Implement disciplined processes, leveraging BI tools, to augment trending analyses and deliver business insights.
Conduct data analysis projects to support ongoing business objectives.
Build and maintain financial models as needed.
Drive ongoing efficiency efforts with creative and analytical mindset

The successful candidate will benefit from having:


Degree in Finance or Accounting preferred, but other relevant degrees will be considered
7+ years in a financial analyst role or similar role with proven experience in accounting, reporting and financial analysis.
Financial services industry knowledge strongly preferred but not required.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required. Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Power BI) and financial applications (e.g., COGNOS, Hyperion, TM1) strongly preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including management reporting and presentation experience.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Highly adaptable to change with exceptional organization and time management skills
Previous experience driving strategic and tactical process improvement initiatives is highly desirable

.

Operations Analysts provide 24/7 coverage of CDWs Network Operations Center and play a fundamental role in ensuring we meet or exceed the expectations of all clients as defined in our service level agreements. Analysts apply the necessary technical breadth to providing top level technical support services and operational leadership, including problem resolution, and technical change implementation for Managed Services clients. Analysts at CDW are smart, hardworking individuals with top level experience and enjoy working on highly visible, technically challenging service offerings. They are high caliber, well rounded professionals who are passionate about emerging technology, with exceptional customer service and communication skills


Key Areas of Responsibility
Understand and Deliver Managed Service offerings as outlined in the CDW Service Descriptions and Service Catalog
Understand and follow the processes and procedures defined in the CDW ManS Standard Operating Procedures manual (SOP).
Primarily responsible for providing top-level technical support, including problem resolution, technical change implementation, telephone and one-on-one technical support within defined service level agreements for clients.
Provide detailed and effective communication to internal and external customers
Clearly and concisely articulate problems and solutions for issues to clients both over the phone, via e-mail and in person.
Provide 24 X 7 support to critical systems and ensure availability objectives are met.
Provide alert response as well as email and telephone technical support for data center and managed services clients
Take ownership of the incident/request and drive it to resolution
Document and track troubleshooting steps, incident solutions and support requests
Keep clients informed throughout the process and follow up with them to ensure satisfactory resolution
Guide and mentor less experienced teammates by providing technical support, training, and direction
Document and record time


Responsibilities
As a Operations Analyst II provide Intermediate technical services with some supervision from Supervisors, Team Leads, and Technology Owners
Ability to follow through with tasks, projects, troubleshooting with some supervision.
Handles several tasks simultaneously (ie: troubleshoots and develops internal network, responds to emergencies).
Communicates with Manager all events that are not anticipated (new product requirements, equipment failure, design changes, schedule changes).
Responds to all customers professionally and courteously and relays any customer questions or concerns to manager.
Demonstrates and actively promotes an understanding and commitment to the mission of CDW through performing behaviors consistent with the CDW Way.
Assist in creating and documenting policies and procedures.
Understand SLAs in a production environment and proactively strive to meet the commitments.
Provide support to Service Account Managers, Situation Managers, Project Managers and product developers.
Review assigned service requests daily, following up and providing status updates to clients; ensure data pertaining to the status of service requests is entered into the problem tracking systems accurately and promptly to provide an up-to-date picture of service delivery status and backlog.
Supports and conducts self in a manner consistent with customer service expectations.

Minimum Qualifications
Minimum 1 year of technical experience
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable.
Associate’s degree in a computer-related field, plus one year of experience in a relevant technical role, OR
If no post secondary degree, a minimum 2 years in a technical support or systems administration role maintaining high service levels in a demanding environment


Other Required Qualifications
Capable of resolving critical issues in a time sensitive manner, cognizant of requisite service levels.
Ability to establish customer trust and confidence in the CDW Managed Services knowledge of and concern for customers’ business needs.
History of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the customers while meeting deadlines.
Critical attention to detail and solid creative problem solving skills.
Ability to perform intermediate root cause analysis.
Strong organizational, analytical, and problem solving skills.
Customer Service focused and a high level of professionalism.
Ability to consistently follow policies and procedures.
Strong communication and documentation skills.
Excellence verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with all coworkers and stakeholders, in including senior leadership.
Ability to prioritize work and handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced, diverse and growth-oriented environment.
Must know when to ask for assistance. Must be approachable, teachable, a team player with a strong desire to continue learning and expanding their experience in a highly evolving technical environment.
Must have good time management skills and be able to meet rigid and urgent assignment schedules.


Preferred Qualifications
Hands-on experience in a large Data Center environment
ITIL Foundations Certification

Location: Chicago, IL; Des Moines, IA; Fargo, ND; Sioux Falls, SD or Remote

Create, maintain and support Distributed and z/OS jobs and schedules using BMC CONTROL software’s. Create and maintain workload policies using the same.
Monitor and implement data processing workflows, assigned from our change management system and general email requests.
Create and restore output reports via our report management system.
Promote Job Control Language (JCL), procedures and programs via our source code library manager.
Experience with BMC Control
JCL familiarity and creative skill in Excel

As a Technical Business Analyst on the Commercial/Agribusiness team, you’ll have an integral role transforming business requirements into software solutions. You’ll partner with business units to understand their business strategies, operations, and opportunities and develop technical capability roadmaps that align with the business and is used by the technology development team.
As a member of a project team, you’ll also be a liaison between the technology development teams and the business units during the development and implementation of the new Guidewire PolicyCenter policy administration system supporting all farm and commercial lines of business.

This position offers a hybrid work schedule and can be based out of our corporate offices in Bloomington, IL, Alpharetta, GA or Minneapolis, MN. 100% remote work is also an option, based on candidate location.

How does a Technical Business Analyst make an impact?

Develops and documents detailed requirements containing solution architecture that can be utilized for building, testing, training, and support operations.
Develops capability roadmaps and business cases; scope definition and management, stakeholder analysis, and creates and manages analysis activities.
Communicates and presents capability and scope plans to all levels of business and technical staff.


Do you have what we’re looking for?

Experience with Commercial Lines Property/Casualty insurance products.
Digital first thinking with experience modernizing systems and platforms to create best in class customer experiences.
Knowledgeable of Guidewire’s PolicyCenter policy administration system.
Experience creating and fostering a SAFe Agile environment.
Ability to develop and document detailed requirements containing solution architecture that can be utilized for building, testing, training, and support operations.
Takes lead in recommending solutions and driving results through the team and business.
Ability to develop capability roadmaps and business cases; define and manage scope of work, perform stakeholder analysis, and manage analysis activities.
Drive to learn new business systems, industry requirements and understand the needs of their business partners.
Able to apply established standards, resolving a wide range of complex problems and diverse scope.
Looks to implement best practices based on knowledge of internal and external business issues to improve products, services or processes.
Typically requires 7 years of relevant experience or a combination of related experience, education and training.

Why work with us?
Our employees and representatives serve nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as well as retirement and investment services. We build relationships and work together to create a stronger, more secure future for our clients and our communities. We’re a big company, yet small enough you can make an impact and won’t get lost in the shuffle. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow throughout your career, either within this role or by exploring other areas of our business.

You’ll be able to take advantage of our benefits package, which includes insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life), 401(k) with company match, parental leave, paid time off, paid company holidays and time off to volunteer in your community.
