Job ID 2023-4812
Overview

Dexter, the premier manufacturer and supplier of axles, suspension, brakes, doors, venting products, trailer parts, accessories, and towing components serving the commercial trailer, RV, heavy-duty, marine, agriculture, and manufactured housing markets has an opportunity for an eCommerce Business Intelligence Analyst at our distribution facility located in Lisle, IL.

Headquartered in Elkhart, Indiana, Dexter employs over 3,800 people throughout the U.S. and Canada, operates 18 manufacturing facilities, and distributes trailer parts and accessories through over 30 company-owned distribution locations. Employing state-of-the-art robotics, precision welding equipment, and automated machining processes, Dexter has achieved many years of success through a commitment to the principles of superior quality, continuous improvement, and unparalleled customer service.

For more information about our company, access Dexter's web site at www.dextergroup.com.

Position Summary

Position Overview

As an eCommerce Business Intelligence Analyst the primarily focus will be on the management, analysis, and reporting of data related to Dexter’s e-commerce business.

The BI Analyst will help the e-commerce team understand how e-commerce is performing, identify areas of opportunity, and, in the long term, increase the company’s overall analytics and data governance capabilities. The role will effectively blend disparate data, perform exploratory data analysis (EDA), draw conclusions, and synthesize findings into visual charts/tables and reports. Over time, we expect this role to take a larger responsibility with BI reporting and expand into dashboard development.

A Typical Day in the Life of an eCommerce Business Intelligence Analyst at Dexter:

Develop and maintain scalable, automated dashboards and reports that benchmark and track progress against key operational performance goals and initiatives.
Work with management and/or internal stakeholders to define business requirements and analytical needs and execute against them.
Develop a deep understanding of existing eCommerce performance, customer, and productivity metrics, and develop new KPI's, metrics, and measures to gauge eCommerce performance.
Own regular and ad-hoc analysis on operational performance and projects to continuously improve and scale Albertson's eCommerce operations.
Understand and communicate root causes of impacts to performance and attainment of business objectives.
Develop actionable insights and areas of opportunity for eCommerce operational performance, make recommendations to operating teams, and present findings to business stakeholders.
Conduct data mining, regression analysis and other quantitative analysis using industry standard statistical and business analytics techniques.
Perform data modeling using/modifying existing models.
Work to define and structure eCommerce customer and operational data and ensure reliability and integrity of data sources.
Partner across departments or business groups to obtain information, align priorities, and obtain buy-in from stakeholders and functional owners.
Flag opportunities and challenges using data in the current processes and metrics to ensure proactive response and help business course correct or seize opportunities.
Partner with eCommerce Product Managers on improving in-store customer experience measurement and reporting with the goal of driving highly actionable results.
Partner with Data Science teams to build Power BI dashboards that are more predictive of future outcomes to get ahead of the opportunities and/or issues
Requirements

A Successful eCommerce Business Intelligence Analyst Typically Has:

Bachelor’s degree and minimum 2 years of experience monitoring, managing, and drawing insights from data. In lieu of a bachelor’s degree, candidate can be actively progressing towards a bachelor’s degree in business analysis, data science, operations research or similar field.
Strong Excel skills are required for analysis and automation.
Some training or background is required in statistical concepts and EDA methods and how to perform in Excel (e.g., Solver and Analysis toolpacks)
Some exposure/background to a BI visualization tool such as PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik is a nice-to-have.
Understanding of the end-to-end data supply chain.
Solid communication skills, including written, spoken, and presentation communication, with the ability to effectively communicate and influence across disciplines and levels of the organization.
Experience working collaboratively at all levels and across business lines using influencing skills.
Be adaptable and exhibit a growth mindset, demonstrating flexibility and the ability to learn from both success and failures.
Be a strong team player, a natural innovator and builder.

Career Area:
Business Technologies, Digital and Data
Job Description:

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. Your Work Shapes the World

Whether it be groundbreaking products, best in class solutions or creating a lifelong career, you can do the work that matters at Caterpillar. With a 95-year legacy of quality and innovation and 150 locations in countries around the world, your impact spans the globe.

When you join Caterpillar, you are joining a team of makers, innovators, and doers. We are the people who roll up our sleeves and do the work to build a better world. We don’t just talk about progress and innovation. We make it happen. And we are proud of that, because it helps our customers build and power the world we live in – the roads, hospitals, homes, and infrastructure. Without a dedicated workforce Caterpillar could not effectively meet our customer’s needs. Join us.

Description

The Digital Operations Support Analyst in the Global Planning & Demand Management team is responsible for supporting the order and inventory planning for the enterprise Sales & Operations planning (S&OP) community and worldwide dealer network.

This position has a depth of knowledge in quantitative analytic methods, data management and web development suitable to handle the most complex issues. Challenges include meeting expectations in delivering results, learning to refine solutions to better fit complex situations, making timely decisions, ensuring quality of deliverables, and communicating effectively with all project stakeholders.

Job Duties

Support Caterpillar enterprise Sales and Operations planning efforts by developing web applications using a variety of languages and technologies and supporting data and server management strategy.
Work with business partners to understand functional needs, gather requirements, and dive into data to rapidly prototype new ideas, concepts, and designs
Collaborate with a team of developers to design industry-leading systems and analytical solutions utilizing the full development lifecycle, including analysis, design, test, and delivery
Use data quality best practices to ensure the integrity of the data being used and thoroughness of results.
Minimize technical debt and focus on reproducibility (keep docs/code up to date, prepare for future use cases, etc.) and automation of reports by building end to end pipelines.
Present tools and solutions to internal and external users as well as senior leadership.
Leverage business acumen to recognize new opportunities for analytics to improve Sales & Operations planning process.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferably in engineering, information technology, statistics, or a similar field.
5+ years of progressive experience in web development, data analysis and Sales and Operations planning processes.
5+ years of experience using Python, ASP.NET, Oracle SQL and server administration.

Top Candidates will also have

Master’s degree
Experience in C#, Javascript (Jquery), HTML, Snowflake, and machine learning algorithms is a plus.
Desire to maintain diverse skills and stay abreast of new technologies to apply to a wide variety of projects.
Self-start with ability to learn, adapt, improvise, and problem solve with poise in a rapidly changing environment.
Exhibit strong planning and organization, excellent initiative, the ability to delegate tasks effectively, and well-honed interpersonal and leadership skills.
Strong team player and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Growth mindset - ability to learn and take initiative to keep up with the latest technology.
Contribute to Caterpillar’s culture and uphold company core values.
Knowledge of Caterpillar Inc., its products, and services; its internal systems, processes, and procedures is a plus.

Additional Information

The primary locations for this position are Peoria, IL and Dallas TX.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position. Any relocation costs incurred would be the responsibility of the selected candidate.
This position will require less than 10% travel.

Employee benefit details

Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world.

Here you earn more than just a salary because we value your performance. We offer a total rewards package that provides benefits on day one (medical, dental, vision, RX, and 401K) along with the potential of an annual bonus.

AA Medical is a PE backed platform focused on connecting the world with life sustaining medical equipment. As a Strategic Finance Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Sales, and Operations. Your primary responsibility will be to analyze industry data, market trends, and internal metrics to formulate effective pricing strategies for our range of used medical devices. Other responsibilities will include analyzing internal financial data and external customer data, providing actionable insights into that data, and working with teams to develop strategic business plans around those insights. By working closely with key stakeholders, you will contribute to the development and execution of strategies that align with the company's goals and market positioning.

Key Responsibilities:

Utilize industry data, market research, and internal performance metrics to conduct thorough analyses.
Work closely with the Marketing team to understand product positioning, target customer segments, and promotional strategies.
Collaborate with Sales to gather insights from the field, understand customer needs, and align pricing with market demand.
Engage with Operations to assess cost structures, supply chain dynamics, and production constraints.
Identify pricing trends, competitive landscapes, and market opportunities to inform pricing decisions.
Develop and refine pricing models based on a thorough understanding of product value, market dynamics, and competitive landscape.
Propose and implement pricing strategies that maximize profitability, market share, and customer satisfaction.
Effectively communicate pricing strategies to internal teams, ensuring alignment and understanding of the rationale behind pricing decisions.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management, providing actionable insights for decision-making.
Monitor the effectiveness of pricing strategies through ongoing analysis and performance tracking.
Recommend adjustments to pricing models based on changing market conditions and business objectives.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, Economics, Finance, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.
Proven experience in business analysis, preferably with a focus on pricing strategy.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Familiarity with the medical device industry and regulatory considerations is advantageous.
Proficient in data analysis tools, such as Excel, and experience with pricing software is a plus.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.

401(k) with 4% company match
Health, Vision, and Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Generous PTO and Holiday Calendar
Quarterly Paid Mental Health Day
Onsite Fitness Center
Pet Friendly Office in Mokena

Job Description:

About Us:

TreeHouse Foods (NYSE: THS) is a leading manufacturer of private label packaged foods and beverages, operating a network of production facilities across the United States and Canada. At TreeHouse Foods, our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products and revolves around our people. We are investing in talent and creating a performance-based culture where employees can do their best work, directly impacting our mission to make high quality, affordable food for our customers, communities and families. We hope you will consider joining the team and being part of our future.

What You Gain:

Leaders that are invested in supporting your accelerated career growth, plus paid training and tuition reimbursement to support you along the way.
An inclusive working environment where you can build meaningful work relationships with a diverse group of professionals. Take advantage of opportunities to build on our team-oriented culture, such as joining one of our DE&I Employee Resource Groups!
Competitive compensation and benefits program with no waiting period 401k program with 5% employer match and 100% vesting at time of enrollment.
Comprehensive paid time off opportunities.
Enrollment in our wellness and employee assistance programs.

About the Role:

The Manufacturing and MII Architect, Business Systems Analyst analyzes the most complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements. Configures highly complex system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Provides consultation to users with regards to automated systems. Solves highly complex problems and is called on to consult by other teams. Provides coaching/training to less experienced team members and acts as a mentor to less experienced team members. Viewed as the Subject Matter Expert for all disciplines within their area of responsibility. May supervise others, but not required. Provides system wide/cross functional support across IT.

You’ll add value to this role by performing various functions including, but not limited to:

Business Process: Lead others by working across boundaries and ensuring best practice solutions are developed and implemented. Seek ways to implement process changes to improve business process productivity. Collaborate with business counterparts to recommend best practice solutions.
Functional Analysis: Proactively validate results of functional requirements gathering process.
Functional Design: Direct functional designs of solutions enable process change, continuous improvement and competitive advantage. Ensure solutions optimize and protect the TreeHouse Foods IT Ecosystem and achieve maximum ROI.
Architecture: Through collaborative means, research technical solutions to broad business problems and ensure application/ technical strategies are tightly linked. Influence and set Ecosystem architectural standards to meet long term requirements reusing existing solutions where possible. Ensure Ecosystem portfolio is continuously maintained.
Technical Analysis: Proactively validate conclusions associated with requirements gathering process focusing on full spectrum of application performance.
Technical Design: Ensure optimal performance and quality of technical designs.
Solution Architect for the Manufacturing (SAP PP-PI) and Shop Floor (MII) spaces responsible for PP/PP-PI, MII, MM and IM modules in the internal manufacturing sites. Interfaces with external MES, processes related to Manufacturing, warehouse as well as mobile applications for the internal manufacturing sites.
Hands-on experience in implementing PP/PP-PI in a process industry. Must have at least five “end to end” SAP implementations along with production support knowledge in SAP (production planning and manufacturing) in either discrete (SAP PP) and/or process industry (SAP PP-PI).
Hands-on functional configuration and design experience
Strong SAP Supply Chain solution architecture skills, integration, security, data and technology architecture
Analyzes business requirements and either proposes new or leverages existing system solutions to extend global designs.
Looks for opportunities to expand the current IT Manufacturing footprint while reducing business cost and effectively managing business partner expectations. Find new SAP and non-SAP solutions to assist our business partners become more efficient and effective in dealing with current challenges.
Ensures impact analysis and testing plans are executed, including regression testing analysis and impact to existing functionality are performed and risk is properly managed in the platforms / functional spaces.
Creates, reviews and approves functional designs created by other team members, consultants and vendors, applying in-depth SAP PP-PI, IM, PM and QM knowledge. One should also have knowledge in demand management.
Experience with SAP interfaces to SAP MII or PI/PO integration knowledge with third party MES systems.
Experience with SAP MRP, capacity planning, batch management, staging processes and manufacturing.
Experience with SAP MII (Manufacturing Integration and Intelligence) and MII integration with SAP ECC
The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list of all tasks. Additional tasks and duties may be assigned from time to time as necessitated by business needs.
May travel 10-50% of the time depending on future SAP rollouts.

Important Details: This is a hybrid role.

About You:

You’ll fit right in if you have:

Requires more than 7 years Information Technology / position related experience.

Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Position Summary:

Kemper Auto is seeking a Senior Market Analyst, to work out of our Kemper office in Chicago, IL, or remotely. Work as a member of the Advanced Analytics team, by using data research/analytics to provide insights to help achieve profitable growth for auto and home insurance products. Create reports for leadership and consult on projects across the business, assisting in automation and business strategy driven by analytics.

Position Responsibilities:

Collect and clean different types of data sources (SQL, Excel, SAS, etc.) ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Analyze data and collaborate with leadership and technical teams to generate actionable insights for decision making.
Present complex analyses in a clear and actionable manner.
Provide solution strategy and make best practice recommendations to various levels of management.
Implement a higher level of thinking – are we using the correct metrics for the asked question? Can we design an experiment and analyze the results to determine customer behavior? Ask questions and utilize advanced statistical techniques (Python, R, machine learning techniques, etc.) to assist in acquiring profitable business.
Pass on your knowledge – train others across the company in your skillset and collaborate with a multitude of teams, from product managers to data scientists.

Position Qualifications:

3+ years of analytics experience preferred.
Insurance experience preferred but not required.
Experience/interest in statistical and business analysis.
Education equivalent to a college degree in mathematics, statistics, risk management, business, data analytics, actuarial studies or related fields, or the equivalent in related work experience.
Experience in SQL, Python, Tableau, Power BI, and/or other data and statistical tools required.
Automation, modeling, and machine learning skills recommended.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface at all levels of the organization.
Superb relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
Sponsorship not accepted for this opportunity
This position is a remote role and can work from a US based home.

Business Analyst will work closely with end users, user experience designers, business unit representatives, development architects/engineers, quality assurance, and others in all stages of the project lifecycle, including discovery, design, development, testing, and implementation.

This position will be responsible for developing detailed business requirements, process flow diagrams, user journeys, along with other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The individual in this role will be involved in program/project implementations, as well as support multiple customers and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle to help realize business benefits and define a set of business requirements and user journeys that will translate into valuable business solutions and technology systems.

If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined

ROLE

Defines and communicates requirements, risks, and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.

Collaborates with the QA Team to ensure acceptance criteria are easily translatable to test scripts.

Leads and participates in User Acceptance Testing/demos for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.

Assists the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional or non-functional specifications.

Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved, obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts, and manages changes and conflicts during the requirements gathering process.

Prepares artifacts in a clear, explicit, and presentable format.

Possesses product knowledge and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively propose solutions.

Identifies, builds, and manages stakeholder relationships (i.e., business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members, and management leaders).

Evaluates project complexity, assumptions, constraints, and dependencies to determine the appropriate business analysis approach.

Leads in requirements gathering and project scoping.

Manages product requests for enhancements and makes recommendations/provides feedback to the development team for enhancement implementation.

Supports the business post go-live and creates and/or assists in the training of the process in the new system.

Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.

Identifies opportunities for streamlining and increasing effectiveness through continuous process improvement.

Stakeholder and team interaction:

Determines business influence and relationship needs.

Builds and manages business relationships including business partners, end users, suppliers, customers, project team members, and management leaders.

Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions.

Elicitation and communication:

Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements, journeys, and other artifacts.

Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders.

Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements.

Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format.

Leads and participates in Business and User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements.

Requirements management process:

Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors.

Ensures that all requirements and journeys support the delivery of business value, fulfill goals and objectives, and meet stakeholder needs.

Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences.

Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements.

Conducts competitive analysis research to better understand prevalent interaction solutions.

Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions.

Manages requirements, traceability, and future reuse.

Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.

REQUIRED

Minimum 8 years’ Business Analysis and ecommerce experience.

Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation and stakeholder management.

Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation.

High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition).

Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as a positive attitude.

Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills.

Proven leadership skills; demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.

Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency.

Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.

Able to work independently.

Excellent organizational and planning skills.

Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.

Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables.

Proven experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies.

Strong process knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles.

Experience with executing project governance, including change control and issue/risk management.

Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.).

Ability and willingness to travel globally as needed.

Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including evening, weekend, and holidays; 24x7x365 operations; able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams.

Recommended

BA in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, or equivalent.

Professional business analysis certifications, such as CBAP or CCBA.

2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge.

Experience in Ecommerce Solutions, specifically SAP Commerce Platforms.

Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems, specifically Logistics Reply.

Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions.

Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics.

Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.

Required Documents

Cover Letter
Resume

Company Description
We're Nagarro. We are a digital product engineering company that is scaling in a big way! We build products, services, and experiences that inspire, excite, and delight. We work at scale — across all devices and digital mediums, and our people exist everywhere in the world (18,000+ experts across 33 countries, to be exact). Our work culture is dynamic and non-hierarchical. We're looking for great new colleagues. That's where you come in!

Procurement Business Analyst

This position reports directly to the Director of Procurement at West Star Aviation. The purchasing analyst actively manages suppliers to ensure on-time delivery of products to WSA facilities. The analyst will coordinate with buyers to ensure proper quantities are purchased to achieve strategic inventory and service level objectives.

In this role, you will provide the analytical and strategic leadership required to support decision-making for the procurement of parts and services in the aircraft maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) industry. You will manage and analyze high volumes of data, facilitating thelaunch several projects to support subsequent development ofLong-Term Agreements.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Identify strategic procurement opportunities
Manage inventory price vs. price paid to capture savings on negotiated cost reductions
Develop and foster relationships with select suppliers to drive consistent performance
Recommend purchase quantities and collaborate with buyers and managers to improve accuracy
Negotiate cost, lead time, minimum and economic order quantities to WSA's benefit
Analyze and troubleshoot supplier invoicing and purchase order discrepancies
Maintain a comprehensive and current fact base on suppliers
Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis to guide decision-making
Critical analytical activities include demand analysis, supplier evaluation, and sourcing value
Provide analytic and strategic implementation support to both strategic and tactical procurement professionals involved in the implementation of identified strategies
Collect data and calculate internal and supplier KPIs by site, project, category, buyers, and suppliers
Present analysis of performance measurements to senior managers.
Ensure organizational compliance with inventory management policies, contractual requirements, or other regulations.
Lead/coordinate contract procurement activities
Other projects and duties as assigned
Requirements:
Skills & Knowledge
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related field
Strong aptitude to solve problems and improve processes
Strong ability to negotiate, influence and resolve conflict with diplomacy and partnership
Exceptional organization, attention to detail and communication skills
Ability to work effectively with a minimum level of supervision

Job Title: Business Analysis Associate I - Controls Support
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


As a Business Analysis Associate I, you will have the opportunity to leverage your analytical skills in a dynamic and creative environment. This role offers you the chance to work with multiple levels of leadership and contribute to important control initiatives, providing a platform for career growth and skill development. Join us and be part of a team that values high performance and results.

As a Business Analysis Associate I in the Claims, Disputes, and Recovery team, you will be tasked with analyzing, documenting, and communicating with various leadership levels to address a range of risks and control gaps. Your role will involve working on control-related initiatives such as Controls Testing, Controls Monitoring, Controls Evaluation, and Issue Management, ensuring that outcomes align with Control and Regulatory requirements. You will operate in a setting that encourages creativity and latitude, with the expectation of high performance and results.

Job Responsibilities:

Provide controls support (Controls Testing, Controls Monitoring, Controls Evaluation, and Issue Management) and create/analyze reports relevant to Business Control Support responsibilities
Interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Demonstrate organizational skills and ability to handle working within strict timelines
Lead groups and process improvement initiative
Propose process reengineering solutions to resolve current process breaks and identify areas of opportunity for improvement
Elicit project or initiative requirements using document analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis

Required Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills:

3+ years of managed account experience with strong leadership experience; focus on project management or controls
Strong analytical and time management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Organizational skills and ability to handle working within strict timelines
High level of professionalism in leading groups and process improvement initiatives
Experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills:

Experience in Controls Support (Controls Testing, Controls Monitoring, Controls Evaluation, and Issue Management)
Accelerated skills in MS Office, including Excel, Power Point, Share Point and Visio
ABOUT US


Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.


We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans




ABOUT THE TEAM

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.



We offer a broad array of credit cards to meet the needs of individuals and small businesses, including Chase-branded and co-branded cards in partnership with well-known companies and organizations. Merchant Services is a leading provider of payment, fraud and data security for companies, capable of authorizing transactions across global currencies.

eCommerce Business Analyst (Hybrid)
NorthShore Care Supply, a fast-growing internet retailer named one of Crain's Chicago Business Top 100 Best Places to Work in 2023, is seeking to add a new member to our eCommerce team in Green Oaks, Illinois. The eCommerce Business Analyst is responsible for providing day-to-day support for eCommerce systems and issues. This role will work with internal teams and external partners to support our eCommerce platform to ensure it meets business requirements and provides a superior online shopping experience.
Responsibilities include:
Identifying and analyzing business process issues and guiding
business and technical team for a timely resolution for production issues.
Providing operational support to debug and troubleshoot issues.
Fielding Web support submissions. Investigating issues, providing analysis and recommending resolutions.
Creating and managing Jira tickets. Escalating issues as needed.
Managing backlog. Working with internal and external resources to prioritize and schedule sprints and fixes.
Serving as main point of contact with external development team.
Working with developers and other stakeholders to design, develop, and implement solutions.
Working with business teams to identify, understand, prioritize and document business requirements, systems impacts and acceptance criteria.
Supporting the development team to write scenarios / user stories / agrees to work within sprints after estimate review.
Owning and maintaining formalized internal testing plan and documentation. Providing support to the QA and business teams to complete functional and acceptance testing.
Creating and maintaining operations documentation, including standard operating procedures (SOPs) and system configurations, to ensure accurate and up-to-date reference materials.
Serving as the primary point of contact for internal ecommerce systems users, providing training and ongoing support and documenting and escalating recurring issues and requests.
Supporting the integration of eCommerce systems and tools to ensure seamless data flow and optimal customer experience.
Performing regular monitoring and escalate issues as required.
Staying up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in eCommerce to provide recommendations for system enhancements and process improvements.
Collecting business and functional requirements and conducting research for third party software and plugins. Scheduling demos and coordinating POCs.
Conducting lessons learned sessions to identify feedback to improve efficiency.
Communicating effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in business, information technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Experience of working in a business analyst role, preferably within ecommerce channels.
Experience of working within an Agile / Scrum project environment.
Ability to translate complex business problems and requirements into well written, concise user stories that can be read and understood by business owners, developers and testers alike.
Experience managing external resources.
Highly organized. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience with/basic understanding of: Agile Frameworks, Web Experimentation, Content Management (CMS), eCommerce platform (Optimizely or similar), project management software (Jira), SQL and other data analysis tools (preferred), TeaLeaf, Clarity or similar session management/heatmapping software.
Previous experience with e-commerce preferred.
An ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, team environment, is enthusiastic about eCommerce and be willing to assist others in any aspect of company operations. Must be detail oriented, convey trust and confidence, be a good listener and quick learner to better understand the department’s needs.
NorthShore Care Supply offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including medical, dental and vision, healthcare and dependent care flexible spending accounts, company-paid life, short and long term disability, 401(k) plan with great company match, and generous paid time off policies.
If you’re the ideal candidate, please submit your resume, with cover letter and salary requirements, on our Careers page at http://NorthShore.com/Careers. No phone calls please. Only local candidates with unrestricted authorization to work in the U.S. will be considered. An Equal Opportunity Employer

The Chicago-based People Operations team is seeking an individual who possesses insatiable curiosity and can navigate complex challenges with a high degree of autonomy and ownership. This role will develop a birds-eye view of the function through regular collaboration across the People team, eventually being able to predict the business' needs and solve underlying inefficiencies before they become bottlenecks. The right candidate's skills in process optimization, project management, and independent problem-solving will play a vital role in strategically supporting a high-performing, fast-paced proprietary trading firm.

Who we are:

Optiver is a tech-driven trading firm and leading global market maker. As one of the oldest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner of 70+ exchanges across the globe. Our mission is to constantly improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilizing force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for everyone who participates.

Optiver Chicago's culture parallels the energetic city we're immersed in. Home to the Chicago Board of Trade, Chicago Board Options Exchange, and Chicago Mercantile Exchange, Chicago has established itself as the trading capital of the US. Active on leading US exchanges, Optiver's Chicago office trades a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange.

What you'll do:

Manage end-to-end operational processes for the People function, serving as a sought after and reliable SME across the business
Analyze problems from multiple angles, exhibiting creative thinking to devise effective and scalable solutions
Proactively seek opportunities to explore, understand and question People processes before issues arise
Leverage data to ensure control and advocate for enhancements that align with organizational goals
Engage with cross-functional teams both locally and in other regions to gather insights and diverse perspectives, driving a deeper understanding of process intricacies, business needs and stakeholder impact
Inspire confidence in your ability to lead a project through a close attention to detail, open communication and timeline management
Continuously seek out best practices, emerging trends, and innovative solutions
Thrive in an environment where direction may be ambiguous and chart a course to address complex challenges
Validate and maintain accurate employee data records, ensuring consistency and compliance through meticulous data verification and audit processes

Who you are:

2-4 years of relevant experience in a fast-paced setting, preferably within the Proprietary Trading or Financial Services industry
Demonstrated experience managing impactful projects on time and within scope
Proven ability to deliver operational excellence by streamlining processes, cultivating a culture of continuous improvement
Capable of dissecting complicated challenges, and formulate innovative solutions that drive impactful outcomes and are built to scale
Experienced in data analysis using Microsoft Excel, including proficiency in functions, formulas and data visualization
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to convey complex concepts clearly to a variety of stakeholders
Self-motivated and driven to take initiative, especially when direction is unclear

What you'll get:

Work alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.
Performance based bonus structure that is unmatched anywhere in the industry. We combine our profits across desks, teams and offices into a global profit pool fostering a truly collaborative environment to work in.
Ownership over initiatives that directly solve business problems.

Alongside this you will get great other benefits such as 25 paid vacation days and market holidays, fully paid commuting expenses and health insurance, daily breakfast and lunch, training opportunities, 401(k) match up to 50% and charitable match opportunities, regular social events and clubs, and many more.

At Optiver, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment of mutual respect. Optiver recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, or other legally protected characteristics.

Description:

TITLE: Senior Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Sales Finance

REPORTS TO: Head of Sales Finance

Lactalis Heritage Dairy is currently seeking candidates to join our team in Chicago.

Lactalis Group, the world leader in dairy, is a family-owned business with more than 85,000 pragmatic and ambitious professionals worldwide, committed to providing healthy and delicious dairy products that bring people together every day. At Lactalis, our core values of AMBITION, ENGAGEMENT, and SIMPLICITY are at the heart of everything we do.

If you’re looking for a unique experience with a company that offers strong brands, professional expertise, and a dynamic work environment that champions entrepreneurial spirit, hands-on responsibility, and real opportunity for career development, we want to hear from you!

Lactalis Heritage Dairy: inviting you to share with us your STORY, your PASSION, and your EXPERTISE.

From your PASSION to ours

The Senior Analyst, Sales Finance is responsible for working with the West Area + Channels sales teams to execute regional and customer specific trade plans within Lactalis Heritage Dairy. The role will work with field sales to build bottom-up business plans that align with our annual budget and sales objectives and work with the field team to transform customer specific plans or strategic requests into actionable plans for each customer.

From your EXPERTISE to ours

Key responsibilities for this position include:

Assist the field in creating bottoms up sales plans as part of the planning cycle and monitor the execution and performance of the plan
Prepare financial analysis for monthly business reviews, monthly trade forecasts
Manages the trade budget process, partnering with sales
Oversee the preparation, analysis and recommendations on Trade, Slotting, and Shopper Marketing spends
Consistently analyze the promotion effectiveness. Look for opportunities to improve trade dollars.
Provide financial support to the Sales Teams in the areas of ROI analysis, Ad Hoc reporting, and special projects
Liaise with 3rd party TPO provider to ensure timely resolution of any customer claims that fall into disputed status
Partner with Sales team to understand profitability by customers and optimize accounts
Manage reporting of net sales by customer and retailer
Ensure financial controls by leading monthly trade reconciliation and budget management process.
Develop reporting enhancements and process improvements
Support Sales Team P&L activities, including profitability metrics
Ad-hoc analysis and reporting to support business needs
Requirements:

From your STORY to ours

Qualified applicants will contribute the following:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Communications, or Economics
3+ years of sales, revenue management or sales finance experience preferred with proven track record of delivering results
Advanced Excel skills
Strong analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to relate to others, become a trusted partner with Sales
Disciplined approach toward execution, attention to detail, and ability to navigate within large and complex data environments
Proactive and results-oriented in a time-sensitive environment
Strong oral and written communication skills, including reporting and presentation skills
Demonstrated ability to maintain flexibility in an ever-changing environment

Lactalis Heritage Dairy is an equal employment opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against applicants with regard to any legally-recognized basis including, but not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, and physical or mental disabilities.

Job Summary

Job Purpose:
This position plays a unique role in driving the delivery of strategy using integrated views of the enterprise to align the business motivation, business operations and technology landscape in realizing the desired business outcomes. This role works heavily with leadership across all levels of the organization as well as collaborating with multiple areas in interpretating strategy into clearly defined scoped and prioritized courses of action.

Job Responsibilities:

Bachelor’s degree and 5 years’ experience driving the delivery of medium to large scale transformations in complex, cross-functional organization OR 9 years’ experience driving the delivery of medium to large scale transformations in complex, cross-functional organization.
Create and use holistic, multidimensional business views such as: Business Capability Model, end‐to‐end value delivery models, information models, and organizational models; and the relationships among these business views to strategies, products, policies, initiatives, and stakeholders.
Capture strategic and tactical enterprise imperatives (e.g. goals, gaps and/or opportunities) and provide the traceability using enterprise views in the realization of these imperatives
Define the set of strategic, core and supporting processes that transcend functional and organizational boundaries; identify and describe external entities such as customers, suppliers, and external systems that interact with the business; and describe which people, systems and controls are involved in the processes.
Develop strong relationships with business and IT leadership across all levels of the organization to ensure strategic imperatives are clearly defined into business cases, initiatives and business roadmaps
Support Program/Project management in understanding risks, dependencies, and issues in the implementation of strategic business cases / initiatives
Facilitate delivery of solutions incorporating process execution, decision and exception management across multiple organizational roles and systems/applications
Follow standards, procedures, and methodologies

A broad, enterprise-wide view of the business and varying degrees of understanding for strategy, processes, and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance
The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and to high-priority business issues
The ability to apply architectural principles to business solutions
Experience using model-based views that can be adjusted as required to collect, aggregate or disaggregate complex information about the business
Experience planning and deploying business and IT initiatives in a complex, cross-functional organization
Experience modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques
Exceptional communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations
Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus

Possess, or be on the pathway to possessing, industry-recognized architecture credentials, such as the Certified Business Architect designation from the Business Architecture Guild or the TOGAF 9.2 Practitioner designation from The Open Group.
Substantial experience in at least one of the following disciplines: Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis, Business Process Management, Corporate Strategy, Program/Project Management, or Business Analysis
Healthcare experience preferred but not required

Job Title: Senior Manager Business Excellence - Data & Analytics
Job Description:
At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career.

Come join us and be part of a purpose driven company who is invested in your future!

Job Summary

Within the Data & Analytics Solutions division, the Strategic Initiatives & Partnerships team at HCSC has a history of providing innovative solutions/products that consistently beat the expectations and needs of our business customers. As we look to continue to grow and enhance our data and analytics offerings, we are in search of a Senior Manager to lead our Business Excellence team. This function leads advancing our data-driven culture model and enhancing the experience of data and analytics employees by designing enterprise data and analytics education programs as well as more technical training and professional development opportunities. Using thought leadership and critical thinking skills, this position will drive collaboration across data, analytics and technology teams at various leadership levels. This position includes management of a team of analysts and consultants with high visibility in the division. A part of the Data & Analytics Strategic Initiatives and Partnerships team, this role is key to successful evolution and elevation of the value story of Data & Analytics at HCSC.

Job Description/Key Responsibilities:

· Owning the enterprise data & analytics education objectives;

o partnering with Data Science and AI teams, corporate communications, HR Learning and Dev and other stakeholders to deliver content,

o identifying opportunities to share learning activities for an enterprise-wide audience

o monitoring and measuring adoption of program components

· Broadening the existing development model for data and analytics employees; enhance content and reach of messaging; partner with L&D on content and tooling

· Building the data and analytics talent strategy; planning and execution to meet strategic objectives

· Running cross-functional collaboration forums at various levels to ensure data and tech teams are in lockstep; piloting new programs and tools for engagement and collaboration

· Leading the data & analytics internship, new grad and other engagement programs; evaluating program effectiveness and identify opportunities for improvement

· Driving the D&A new employee onboarding program

· Designing and delivering data and analytics events

· Influencing leaders across various divisions

· Leadership and day to day management and development of a team of employees and contractors



Required Skills and Experience:

· Bachelor degree with 6 years* experience in analytics, business intelligence, or support function OR 8 years* experience in analytics, business intelligence, or support function

· Experience directly managing a team with multiple employees

· Experience with enterprise content and document management tools, disciplines, and processes, including Microsoft SharePoint

· Experience with project and budget management

· Leadership, change management and communications experience

· Experience managing multiple, medium-to-large, cross-functional teams or projects

· Business and financial acumen

· Strategic /analytical thinking and creative ability

· Experience utilizing a project methodology and associated deliverables

· Verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding across all areas and levels of the organization

· Negotiation, management, and strategic problem-solving skills

Preferred Skills and Experience :

· Master’s Degree in business administration or data and analytics-related field

· Experience in establishing engagement programs contributing to the development of high performance teams (may include onboarding, talent development, talent strategy, etc)

· Data and analytics experience

· A track record of independently delivering programs from inception to adoption and measurement

· Strong project management skills – ability to define needs and then design, fine-tune, and make recommendation for solutions

· Experience managing early-in-career talent

· Three (3) or more years of experience in a client-facing role producing final deliverables

· Proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Grainger is a leading broad line distributor with operations primarily in North America, Japan and the United Kingdom. We achieve our purpose, We Keep the World Working®, by serving more than 4.5 million customers with a wide range of products that keep their operations running and their people safe. Grainger also delivers services and solutions, such as technical support and inventory management, to save customers time and money.

We're looking for passionate people who can move our company forward. As one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For, we have a welcoming workplace where you can build a career for yourself while fulfilling our purpose to keep the world working. We embrace new ways of thinking and recognize everyone is an individual. Find your way with Grainger today.

Position Details:

As an Operations Analyst, you will lead and work cross-functionally for end-to-end execution of supplier contracts and important activities with Grainger's suppliers and strategic initiatives. You will be a subject matter expert in best-in-class processes to enable industry-leading procurement and function as a thought leader for the team with a continuous-improvement mindset to help define standards and processes. You will report to the Senior Mgr, Procurement.

You Will:
Resolve procurement transaction issues
Analyze data to identify outliers and trends to identify opportunities and action plans
Follow standard purchasing operational processes and procedures
Continuously improve global procurement operation processes to maximize effectiveness and ensure improvements are customer-focused and aligned with our strategic direction and goals
Assist in the measurement of the effectiveness of assigned business processes through value added reporting and metrics
Help ensure connectivity and accountability of partners by maintaining communication channels
Drive both cultural and procedural changes across a global organization
You Have:
Bachelor's degree required or extensive experience in operations
1+ years of experience in Supplier Management, Operations Management, Logistics Management or related experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office functionality (e.g. Word, Excel, Access dB, PowerPoint)
Rewards and Benefits:

With benefits starting day one, Grainger is committed to your safety, health and wellbeing. Our programs provide choice and flexibility to meet our team members' individual needs. Check out some of the rewards available to you at Grainger

Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans
Paid time off (PTO) and 6 company holidays per year
Automatic 6% 401(k) company contribution each pay period
Employee discounts, parental leave, 3:1 match on donations and tuition reimbursement
A comprehensive set of emotional, financial, physical and social wellbeing programs

Join Reynolds Consumer Products …and Drive Your Career across a world of opportunities! We provide amazing job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun workplace environment. If you are looking to build a strong career, we have an opportunity for you! We currently have an opportunity for a Business Analyst - Automation to join our team located at our headquarters in Lake Forest, IL.

Your Role:
As an Business Analyst - Automation, you will play a pivotal role in discovering and assessing new opportunities in the rapidly evolving fields of Automation and Generative Artificial Intelligence. Your responsibilities will encompass gathering and analyzing business requirements, evaluating the return on investment for new initiatives, and overseeing the creation and maintenance of key performance indicators to effectively measure the ongoing impact on our business after implementation. We embrace and accept individual experiences and backgrounds to achieve a diverse and inclusive workplace.

You will have the opportunity to:
Conduct in-depth sessions with Business Process Owners to deeply understand their processes, deriving comprehensive requirements and performing value/feasibility analysis for potential automation and AI enhancements.
Actively interact with the development team lead to facilitate the strategic planning and execution of projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and technological capabilities.
Develop and disseminate business communications and training materials to support effective change management, particularly in transitioning to automation and AI-enhanced processes.
Create and manage key performance indicators to monitor and report on the success and impact of deliverables on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
Lead workshops and webinars to promote and educate the organization about the benefits and applications of automation and generative AI technologies, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
Regularly assess and report on the continuous business impact of implemented automation and AI solutions, ensuring they align with evolving business strategies and objectives.

You will love it here if...
Are naturally curious and enjoy exploring new technologies and their business applications.
Possess strong analytical skills and can translate complex data into actionable insights.
Value collaboration and excel in communicating with diverse teams to drive project success.
Have a proactive mindset, taking initiative to identify and act on opportunities for improvement.

You Need to Have:
Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or a related field.
1-3 years experience required.
Prior professional experience in business analysis, including internships.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong skills in facilitation and requirements gathering.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Icing on the Cake:
Experience or familiarity with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platforms such as Automation Anywhere and Power Automate.
Knowledge of or experience with Large Language Models like OpenAI's ChatGPT and Anthropic Claude, showcasing an understanding of their capabilities and
applications.

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members by using technology to improve health outcomes around the world. As a diversified, national organization, Centene's technology professionals have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


Position Purpose: Collaborates with the business and technology stakeholders to translate high-level business requirements into functional data tables and reports for healthcare plans

Gathers and validates business / technology requirements to establish scope and parameters of requirements and define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Supports production functions, troubleshoots data and analyzes data for healthcare plans
Field tickets from business units and resolve batch job errors
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards
Creates systems and business process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Interprets user requirements into feasible options and communicate these back to the business stakeholders
Plans user acceptance testing (UAT)
Monitors and review levels of IT services specified in the service-level agreements (SLAs) with the business
Research, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirement gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes; quantify potential efficiency opportunities and track accordingly
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; provide help desk support; train users
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Performs other duties as assigned
Complies with all policies and standards

Education/Experience: A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative or business field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science).
Requires 2 – 4 years of related experience. Or equivalent experience acquired through accomplishments of applicable knowledge, duties, scope and skill reflective of the level of this position.

Technical Skills:

MS Access
SQL querying
Batch scheduling


Soft Skills:

Intermediate - Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty
Intermediate - Ability to identify basic problems and procedural irregularities, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Intermediate - Ability to work independently

We are global, we are impacting the lives of millions every day, we are making a difference!
At Amcor we are inspired to change the packaging industry and are taking on the aspirational challenge to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Through our products and global footprint, we are in a unique position to truly make a difference in the packaging space. Our products impact the lives of millions of people across the globe every day from food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home- and personal-care, and other essential products. Amcor is a thriving S&P 500 organisation listed both on the NYSE (AMCR) and ASX (AMC) with US$13 billion in sales. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860’s and come a long way from a single paper mill based in Melbourne to becoming the global leading packaging company. Today, Amcor is an international organisation empowering its 50,000 employees in over 40 countries and across 250 sites.

Will you be next to join our journey towards a more sustainable future? At Amcor we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to providing sustainable packaging solutions. To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit
www.amcor.com
.
Job Description
The FICO Application Specialist will be responsible for leading the strategic business initiatives through the management of large projects, effectively applying the Amcor project Management Methodology and intricate support activities for multiple application/functional areas.

Perform the assigned activities to fulfil the business requirements in Project delivery in the domain of SAP cFIN, Finance, Controlling, FSCM, Profitability Analysis, Product Costing and Asset Accounting.

Work in Roll-out projects Delivery as the internal solution owner for the domain. The role is a combination of Business Consulting and Solution Delivery and will ensure value at stake is delivered as a #1 project outcome.

Work as a Strategic advisor between information technology and business stakeholders/BRM by driving the resolution of business problems, change needs, assessing the business impact of those problems/changes, capturing, analyzing and documenting requirements, configuring the application, partnering with developers, leading test strategy, and supporting the communication and delivery of requirements with relevant stakeholders.
Key Job Responsibilities
General Accountabilites
Works with Finance stakeholders to understand specific business processes, business drivers and business strategy across multiple areas while being able to instinctively recommend to-be-solutions to resolve new business needs.
Identifies, proposes, initiates and leads significant improvement projects for IT. Defines requirements for the implementation of changes in business functions and supporting IT services.
Analyzes and documents business requirements in Finance and Responsible for delivery of IT projects
Leads strategic projects that drive value (cost improvement and/or top line growth)
Leads the writing of functional requirements, configures, develops test plans and scripts, conducts component, integration and user acceptance tests. Lead data conversion, data validation efforts, cut over activities, and post live support for system implementations.
Coordinate and facilitate business stakeholder engagement and user acceptance testing for Finance and Accounting.
Proactively evaluate opportunities to streamline and optimize existing business processes
Offers consultation to business stakeholders bringing new ideas and best practices to help the company become more effective with IT systems
Manages advanced production support issues and service requests using ServiceNow while committing to timely resolution and SLA adherence. Lead major incident events.
Analyzes, resolves and documents system changes needed because of defects, enhancements, incidents, missing requirements or other root causes
Shares industry standards/trends with customers and peers within the area of responsibility
Identifies issues and leads resolution efforts. Escalates issues appropriately
Develops and assists in the presentation of business cases and system roadmaps
Manages day-to-day interactions with vendors. Work closely with vendors to complete required tasks.
Works under general direction within a clear framework of accountability. Exercises substantial personal responsibility and autonomy. Plans own work to meet given objectives and processes.
Provides support to other functional teams to ensure success of IT initiatives
Provides level 3 support to issues raised by Helpdesk or Business Support teams.
Project Deliveries
Prepare, organize & drive workshops with business key users to collect and discuss business requirements together (Depending on projects, external consultants may drive delivery and role becomes advisory)
Performs system testing taking into account the business requirements, and as well supports solution documentation according to Amcor standards . When leading externals validates the solution adherence to Amcor standards and consistency with overall solution
Participate in project planning discussions and clear define dependencies in WBS
Provide guidance through the implementation of the SAP solution
Identify/anticipate roadblocks and communicate it to PMO; Collabrate with Senior managers and work towards successful delivery of project.
Provide key-user or end-user support during and after go-live
Advises other project members in terms of desired evolutions & value creation at stake
Qualifications/Requirements
BS or MA in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, Accounting or a related field
Minimum 10-12 years of experience in SAP FICO (FI – GL, AP, AR, AA and Banking modules, CO – CCA, PCA) configuration, development. Nice to have experience in CO – Profitability Analyasis and Product costing
Minimum 2 years of experience in Opentext VIM
Understanding of Third party tools like Vertex, Winshuttle
Good Understanding of RICEF objects – development, test cases.
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in IT project management/business analysis
Experience managing Customer relationships at various organizational levels.
Experience with formal SDLC methodology desired, as well as with system validation processes
Strong end to end business process knowledge
Strong understanding of SAP master and transactional data and reporting interdependencies
Good Organizational and time management skills.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills.
Great collaboration and communication skills.

Job Title: Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Specialist
Job Description:
Who We Are: It all starts with purpose.

We are a purpose-driven nonprofit with a dynamic staff culture.

With a meaningful purpose, motivated staff, and excellent benefits, working here will definitely have you smiling! The ADA’s headquarters is located just steps from Chicago’s Magnificent Mile and close to public transportation. With more than 400 colleagues, the ADA Staff are some of the most talented people in the Chicago, Washington D.C., and Maryland area.

We were named a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune in 2019 and 2021! Come join our team!

Job Responsibilities:

The Manager, Business Analytics and Intelligence serve the non-dues revenue generators within the ADA Business Group to help make better decisions and drive results. Incumbent works with the Sr. Director International Business Development, Business Analytics and Improvement to outline and implement critical business analytics and services for the Business Group – which currently includes: Product Development, Continuing Education, & Meeting Engagement, Dental Professional Career Services, Publishing and Sales Enablement, Business Development and Innovation, International Business Development, Business Analytics and Improvement business units. As part of the Business Analytics team, this role is responsible for developing actionable data and insights working with the business units to help them achieve their key performance indicators, primarily sales targets for each area. This position provides the data and insights necessary to improve gross sales per business unit, and in order to create packaging and cross-selling opportunities of products.

This position acts as the Business Group’s lead expert on the ADA’s Data Collection, Data storage, and Data consumption, including the ADA’s Data Mart, our AMS, CRM, and other audience engagement data capture systems. This positions continually seeks to improve data integrity related to the data sources used by the ADA Business Group. This position will ensure that the ADA Business Group is aligned to ADA’s overall Data Governance policies and processes. Incumbent consistently monitors, tracks, evaluates and recommends improvements to the Business Group based on data that is actionable.

Must Have:

BS/BA in Marketing, Marketing Research, Economics, Math/Statistics, General Business or related field
Minimum 5 years experience in a data-centric position
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written communication, problem solving, team work, organizational, critical thinking and analytical skills
Knowledge of current digital marketing landscape; awareness of trends and emerging platforms
Able to handle several projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines; be detail-oriented with the ability to also see the big picture
Ability to communicate complex ideas and recommendations to a non-technical audience
Adept at compiling data efficiently, analyzing it, and making sure it is accurate and useful
Able to build robust, efficient queries and reports using robust database tool
Proficiency in Excel and business intelligence tools, such as PowerBI, Info Builders, Tableau or similar
Some evening/weekend work; to attend board related meetings
Travel; annual meetings

Nice to Have:

Knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM, basic to intermediate SQL proficiency
Familiarity with web analytic tools like Google Analytics or WebTrends
Experience in market testing and analytics, such as A/B testing
MA/MS/MBA
Experience working in a membership association
Experience in quantitative market research (survey design and analysis)
Experience with data centric position in sales, marketing, analytics, operations, or related field

Just a few of the benefits offered to employees:

Promotes Work/Life Balance
Hybrid Work Schedule (2-3 days from home)
Health insurance/ dental reimbursement plan
Ample Paid time off
401(k)
Pension
Flexible Spending Account
Life insurance
Tuition reimbursement
Paid Parental Leave
Pet Insurance
