Job Description:

At Bank of America, each day brings innovation and opportunity. We are dedicated to turning technological advances into treasury solutions for our clients across all segments and industries, and around the world.

We are looking for highly motivated, self-starters who can advocate for our clients in providing liquidity management, payments and receipts, trade and supply chain finance, foreign exchange payments, and commercial card services, by complementing high tech with a personalized touch. The ideal candidate will be able to influence peers with diverse points of view and challenge the status quo. We are seeking forward thinkers with ability to see what's next in treasury management. The future of treasury management is here at Bank of America - Powered by people, driven by technology. Solving for today, anticipating tomorrow.

The Treasury Sales Analyst (TSA) will be responsible for supporting portfolio of two Treasury Sales Officers managing and aggressively growing treasury revenue across fortune 500 global companies within the Large Corporate Consumer Products and Retail Industry clients. He or she will partner with Corporate Bankers, Trade, Liquidity, Investment, Foreign Exchange, product specialists and service partners presenting customized treasury solutions that meet client objectives.

Responsibilities:

Focus on growth of new client relationships and expansion of existing relationships by identifying and cross selling our global treasury solutions while building a strong sales pipeline
Accountable for responsible revenue growth, profitability, client planning, client calling, portfolio development, pricing strategy, and proposal/presentation development/delivery within the confines of a dedicated client portfolio
Possess strong communication and interpersonal skills and appropriate financial acumen. The TSA must also be motivated to maintain a consistent level of goal achievement and be willing to challenge themselves with performance metrics
Maintain regular client interactions building direct relationships, conducting Treasury Reviews, and proactively identifying new opportunities

Required Skills:

"Must" have these skills to be minimally qualified

1+ years of experience in treasury
B.S. or B.A. degree preferred (or equivalent work experience)
Ability to interact with and influence people internally and externally by expert use of verbal and written communication and through strong presentation skills.
Ability to read and leverage data to proactively identify trends and opportunities
Strong ability to organize, prioritize and balance multiple Sales activities
An understanding of bank structure and the operational aspects of global cash management products and services is preferred
Understanding of and adherence to risk guidelines to proficiently identify, manage and escalate risk to grow the business responsibly
Intrinsically motivated to continuously improve processes and/or one’s own education
Collaborative approach to business in support of a close team environment
Proficiency with MS Office suite of tools, especially Excel and PowerPoint

Desired Skills:

Creativity, futuristic, advocacy
Prior treasury sales/corporate banking experience
Sales and relationship management skills and experience

Inclusive and Inspiring: Seeking motivating team players who value collaboration, celebrating shared success and who actively seek and appreciate diverse thoughts and backgrounds

Authentic and Passionate: Seeking highly engaged teammates whose intensity and intentions align and are enthusiastic about the work we are doing for our clients and in our communities

Innovative and Curious: Seeking teammates with out-of-the box ideas and solutions, who embrace change with a future-forward mindset, and are looking to challenge the status quo

Confident and Agile: Seeking strong communicators who value giving and receiving feedback, easily build relationships, and who are quick thinking, flexible, and always learning and sharing knowledge

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Job Title: Marketing Operations Analyst - Hybrid (Lake Forest, IL)
Job Description:
About Grainger:
Grainger is a leading broad line distributor with operations primarily in North America, Japan and the United Kingdom. We achieve our purpose, We Keep the World Working®, by serving more than 4.5 million customers with a wide range of products that keep their operations running and their people safe. Grainger also delivers services and solutions, such as technical support and inventory management, to save customers time and money.
We're looking for passionate people who can move our company forward. As one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For, we have a welcoming workplace where you can build a career for yourself while fulfilling our purpose to keep the world working. We embrace new ways of thinking and recognize everyone is an individual. Find your way with Grainger today.


Position Details:
Drive overall Marketing department efficiency by establishing important operational analysis and facilitating a diverse range of business process improvement projects. Partner with other Marketing Operations roles to manage the data, processes, and systems to make the Marketing engine as efficient as possible. Support operational analysis and process development across 100+ associates in a wide variety of marketing related roles and across a significant number of systems such as Aprimo, SharePoint, STEP, Literature Toolbox, and marketing automation tools.
You Will:
Implement an analytical toolbox that focuses on key operational measures such as project on-time delivery, process cycle time & efficiency, capacity management, and allocation of resources vs. key business initiatives
Data mine, structure, and standardize information in order to establish operational controls and proactively identify key areas of opportunities.
Partner to identify pain points across marketing, then engage with a team of subject matter experts to address root causes of the pain and deliver sustainable solutions.
Develop and maintain dashboard reporting that provides insights and visualizations into current, projected, and historical performance metrics.
You will report to Senior Manager-Marketing Operations


You Have:
3-5 years hands on experience analyzing operational performance at a macro and micro level
BA in business related field such as accounting, economics, or finance
You have a proven ability to data mine and gain insights from data sets that may not be readily available in a standard reporting environment
You have advanced proficiency in working with data and analyzing using common tools such as Microsoft Excel, Access, SQL, PowerPivot, Business Objects and PowerBI
Rewards and Benefits:
With benefits starting day one, Grainger is committed to your safety, health and wellbeing. Our programs provide choice to meet our team members' individual needs. Check out some of the rewards available to you at Grainger.
Benefits starting on day one, including medical, dental vision and life insurance
6% 401(k) company contribution each pay period with no personal contribution required
Employee discounts, parental leave, tuition reimbursement, student loan refinancing, free access to financial counseling, education and more.
DEI Statement
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
We are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment that includes both providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities during the application and hiring process as well as throughout the course of one’s employment. With this in mind, should you need a reasonable accommodation during the application and selection process, please advise us so that we can provide appropriate assistance.

Utilize DB&A's proven methodology to identify opportunities for improvement through comprehensive studies
Observe, record and analyze operational findings to identify client performance improvement opportunities
Perform client-specific resource utilization analysis and gap analyses
Organize and analyze financial and operational data
Organize, lead and develop a team of 5-15 consultants and senior executives
Demonstrate a client centric approach on all analysis engagements
Build and maintain client communication and foster client relationships
Prepare business presentations and deliver to all levels of management
Generate and negotiate consulting project terms of engagement and deliverables to executive level clients
Position Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Business or technical related field
5-7 years of consulting or relevant experience
Adaptability to change in fast-paced and high-pressure environments
Excellent organizational, written, communication, and presentation skills to interact with all levels of a client organization
Process improvement experience, in-depth financial knowledge and strong problem-solving abilities
Exceptional observation, analytical, numerical reasoning, business acumen and leadership skills
Ability to work independently and within a team setting to enhance the analysis process
Possess a thorough understanding of all aspects of the Analysis process and Analysis tools utilized
The ability and stamina to build and present materials for 60-90 minutes on a daily basis
Strong data analytics and Excel utilization capabilities including statistical analysis, pivot tables, graphing capabilities, etc
Demonstrated ability for abstract thought
Strong ability to review, analyze and present large amounts of data within short time frames
Ability to balance delivery of results, problem solving, and client management
Superior time management skills and the ability to keep the analysis and preparations on schedule to meet critical deadlines
Ability to provide daily constructive feedback to large teams
Strong ability in handling budgets and financial controls to meet cost guidelines
Willing to self-sacrifice personal time & comforts to ensure team success
Proper utilization, management and updating of the analysis database
Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite

JOB DESCRIPTION


Job Summary

As the Product Delivery Manager, you will thrive at managing complex programs that have far-reaching implications for clients, employees, and stakeholders throughout Commercial Bank. You will be responsible for driving efforts for our multi-phase initiatives supporting Unified Desktop, including building business cases using data as a critical source of truth, setting the strategy and execution for product taxonomy, and leading your team to drive the end-to-end execution for the Business Transformation’s vision and it’s prioritized roadmap agenda. You will have line of sight into all Middle Office CB Service discovery and product execution backlogs, and will work to ensure benefits are captured and executed against. You will partner with product and technology to overcome impediments preventing productivity and continuously promote a unified culture by encouraging team collaboration. You will ensure the health and wellness of the team remains on point with transparency and communication of work in flight to closure. This role is heavily invested as a managerial role in our product pillar of Business Transformation and will continue to evolve as business needs grow.

Job Responsibilities:

Build strong relationships with Business, Product and Technical partners, setting clear expectations and providing excellent written and verbal communication
Work with senior executives to develop the strategic vision and roadmap for service
Support the team in conducting deep dive assessments of current state with SMEs, as well as identify opportunities and capabilities to create an industry-leading service experience that exceeds client expectations
Ensure business cases for new initiatives are aligned with the group’s strategy, understand the benefits they would provide, and mitigate risk of subsequent delivery failure; and as initiatives move through their natural lifecycle, ensure a seamless transition from concept through initiation and delivery execution
Maintaining a deep knowledge of area product vision, strategy, roadmap, and operational needs
Core understanding and proven application of Agile project and product management, and process improvement
Deep understanding of business analysis skills that will drive the client journey for CB Middle Office
Deep understanding of data storytelling and visualization to articulate business benefits and process improvements
Identifies risks early on, and works with product cabinet partners to ensure all controls, legal, and compliance needs are met for the business
+4 years manager experience desired
Manager ensures open team communication, and promoting continuous learning and growth for individual contributors of the team; supports consistent and immediate feedback

Required Qualifications, skills and capabilities:

Strong strategic and analytical orientation with innovative mindset
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, able to present complex concepts effectively
A broad thinker who is able to consistently step up to reflect the big picture and drill down into detail to ensure big picture ideas are attainable
Strong leadership and influencing skills, able to take others on a visionary journey
Highly organized with ability to manage competing priorities; strong attention to detail
Comfortable working with multiple stakeholders with proven track record in strategic program development and execution
Relationship & Change Management expertise
Exceptional Organization Skills
Bachelor’s degree required and 6+ years of equivalent work experience

Preferred Qualifications, skills and capabilities:

Highly desired: experience working in Commercial Bank or CIB, and systems these LOBs use

The final officer title and job grade is at the discretion of the firm and will be discussed at the time of offer. It may be different than what is listed on the requisition based on candidate experience level.

Please note this role is not eligible for employer immigration sponsorship

We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. ABOUT THE TEAM

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.



Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients’ needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

Thank you for taking time to stop by and take a look at the BA role I have posted on Indeed. If you have read my job descriptions before, welcome back. If you are new to my job descriptions, welcome to the party.

Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Tom Welke. I am Partner & Vp at RSM Solutions Inc and I have been recruiting technical talent for over 20 years (it was 20 in January) and been in the tech sector since the 1990s. Due to this, I am going to be far more focused on 'fit' than anything else...a fit for you and a fit for the client. I also like to add some humor to job descriptions as well (life is too short not to have some humor), so if you see something that makes you chuckle, that was the intent.

This role is for one of my best friends. Sometimes, when you work on a role, it takes another turn...where you want to not only do your best, but you want to exceed your own expectations...this is such a role. So, as you can imagine, I know the hiring manager for this role very very well. Here are some things that creates a good social fit:

This is a role where we need someone that doesn't need to be micro managed. The hiring manager for this role really enjoys working with people that think through their actions. If you are the kind of person that doesn't like to be micro-managed but can put their big boy pants or big girl pants on and gets their work done, this role will be GREAT for you.
No ego. Let me explain. If you think you are God's gift to IT and believe that the world revolves around you, then you should probably run for Congress (I hear they are hiring)...because you wont be a fit here.

However, we are seeking someone within driving distance to Itasca, Illinois or Hanover Park, Illinois.

Here is what we are seeking: We are seeking a JDE E1 BA that specializes in that wonderful and ever-exciting world of manufacturing. You will do all those key things that 'classic" BA's are involved it...that being requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming (I bet you are getting excited with every word), QA and deployment. If - oh joy of joys - you have combined some of those nifty PM and BA skills together, oh man that would be great. You will assist with trainingand technical support to system end-users as well. As you might have guessed, you will develop test plans and integrate technology into other business operations. Think of this role as a techno functional lead role responsible for providing input and assisting in the development and implementation of business initiatives to support company operations and business decision-making.

Here are some of the key things we are looking for (I am not going to tell you about an exhaustive list of a zillion things, half of which don't exist...so, I will slim this down to the real 'meat':

Real live, and in-depth JDE E1 experience in those nifty manufacturing modules.
Lead the IT Labware support & implementation process.
Experience with all those things that BA's know very very well...requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming, QA and project deployments...with specific focus on JDE E1. that JDE experience is an absolute must have.
Experience writing SQL queries, data extracts, and V-Lookups.
Experience preparing test data to assist technical analyst to debug and troubleshoot issues
Experience analyzing, designing, and writing functional specifications based on business requirements (with focus on ERP).
Experience designing the following: Menus, UXone UDO – (like Watchlist, E1 Pages, Orchestrator solutions, Advanced queries), BIP Output, E1 Batch application, E1 Interactive Applications.
Experience performing unit and integration testing.
Experience working with Upgrade, Migration, Integration projects as required.
Experience with AS IS Analysis, Mapping of JDE within existing systems, creating setups, User Training, Testing (unit and Integration), giving solutions to the client issues, data loading, Creating Menus Versions, Defining setups, Integration with other modules, preparation, and finalization of specs for report, documentation of the Business Processes, Setups, and User Manuals.
Experience with PowerBI would be beneficial.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Family leave
Flexible spending account
Health insurance

Life insurance

Paid time off

Vision insurance

Compensation package:

Join our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and be an integral part of creating innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. Become a part of a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, and North America frozen foods, with iconic, world-class brands including Pringles, Cheez-It and Pop-Tarts.


At the heart of the Kellanova Company is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell, and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe. We have an opening for you to grow with us as a IT Business Analyst Lead on our Collaboration Technologies Global Delivery team. This is a remote position and it is estimated that this individual will be asked to be in office once a quarter. We are looking for top talent in the Chicago, IL or Battle Creek, MI areas however there may be flexibility for individuals in other remote US Locations.


A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing




Release Management - Working with Microsoft to determine the O365 changes to our tenant, together you will work to understand their technology roadmaps. You will collaborate with the global IT teams to review changes and determine impact to the tenant. Managing the established release management process you will also implement ways to improve it.
Governance and Adoption - You will manage all new releases coming in to O365, owning the governance process and committee engagement. Analyzing the current O365 adoption and recommending ways to improve will be key to your success.
Strong Analysis - Your strong Microsoft solutions knowledge will be used to understand and identify changes that will impact our tenant.
Teamwork - Use your IT experience to work across technology and business to bring an understanding of O365 changes. Challenge the status-quo and bring ideas to the table to deliver. Bring improvements to our Communication and Collaboration environments through process automation and innovation approaches.


Your Recipe for Success




High School Diploma or GED
Experience in Microsoft based applications, communications, and collaboration enterprise solutions including strong experience managing O365 in a large enterprise environment.
Ability to work across functional silos and promote adoption of new tools and processes across the O365 environment.
Ability to balance multiple concurrent priorities and deliver results independently.
Strong technical problem solving, teamwork and communication skills.
Able to coach and mentor junior staff and enable them to understand and manage new platforms along with the ability to present to senior leaders.
Must be a confident, self-starter, self-motivated individual who really enjoys the challenges that come with managing a large-scale enterprise collaboration environment.

Job Description:

The Senior Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. Manages the supporting data infrastructure strategy and data, metadata, and metric documentation requirements.

Develops and maintains the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Directly accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, guiding and empowering the team to deliver a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Team processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Develop and coach teams to be effective in their roles and able to identify, manage, and escalate risk. Effectively manage the team to be adherent to regulatory obligations, policy, standard, and procedure obligations, as well as managing inherent risks directly related to the team.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Builds a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related field

8+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading business intelligence teams to develop optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related.

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading data visualization teams using industry leading Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Qlikview to develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related.

In lieu of a degree, 12+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

Strong Tableau Development Skills (Tableau Suite: Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep Builder, Conductor)

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Familiarity with data infrastructure processes, designs, and tools (e.g. ETL)

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $100,500.00 to $170,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Benefits:

We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:

Paid Parental Leave

Paid Time Off

401(k) Plan

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

Job Summary:

The WellBe care model is a Physician Led Advanced Practice geriatric care (care of older adults) team focused on the care of the frail, poly-chronic, elderly Medicare Advantage patients. This population is typically underserved and very challenged with access to care. To address these problems, we have elected to bring the care to the patient, instead of trying to bring the patient to the care. Care is provided throughout the entire continuum of care – from chronic care and urgent care in the home, to hospital, to skilled nursing facility, to assisted living, to palliative care, to end of life care. WellBe's physician/advanced practicing clinician led geriatric care teams’ partner with the patient’s primary care physician to provide concierge level geriatric medical care and social support in the home as well as delivering and coordinating across the entire care continuum.


GENERAL SUMMARY

This role will advance WellBe’s understanding of our patient's healthcare utilization and how we can reduce unnecessary healthcare costs while achieving better patient outcomes, and patient experience. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated proficiency of healthcare data sets, including medical claims, HCC, HEDIS, and be detailed oriented. This role reports to the SVP of Data and Clinical Solutions and works closely with operational and clinical leaders. The Reporting Consultant Sr will have ownership and is responsible for developing all companywide dashboards, reports, metrics and key performance indicators assets while also providing in-depth analysis and recommendations for improving/enhancing market performance. Documents, evaluates, and improves design of reports and processes to ensure that analytical tools evolve as the business changes. Develop trend analyses and other quantitative reports to determine business trends. Is an active participant in process improvement and problem resolution issues. Identify key insights and communicate to various stakeholders through the WellBe organization.

Job Description:

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES

Lead business analysis activities to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements
Translate business requirements into specifications to design and implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources
Develop actionable dashboards and reports to support care management and ACO operations
Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems
Own complex data projects and acts as a lead for other Reporting Analysts
Provide analytical support for business operations in all or some of the following areas: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, HEDIS, pharmacy, external reporting
Ensure compliance with federal and state deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis
Work with key business owners to establish and meet their analytic needs and the analytic needs of the organization
Work with Analytics teams to operationalize analytic and reporting innovations
Lead migration of legacy reports from SQL Server sourced data to Snowflake
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards
Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence
Create training and assist users in the generation of ADHOC reports
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Must be able to perform duties with low supervision
Other tasks needed to accomplish team’s objectives/goals
Job Requirements:

Educational/Experience Requirements:

BA/BS in Computer Science or related field is preferable. Equivalent combination of experience, education and training will be considered
7 years of reporting and dashboard development experience. Healthcare experience required. Deep Tableau experience required
Required Skills and Abilities:
7+ years of experience working with Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and visual analytic applications.
Proficient experience in SQL or other similar programming languages. Some development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus.
Analytical ability required to gather data, perform transformation, perform complex analysis, solve both business and technical problems.
Proficiency with business intelligence techniques & tools for the acquisition and transformation of raw data into meaningful and useful information for business and analysis purposes.
Knowledge of relational databases and EMR data structure.
Advanced ability to problem-solve creatively and analyze processes and systems.
Performance tuning experience related to reporting queries required.
Understanding of data integration issues (validation and cleaning), familiarity with complex data and structures.
Knowledge of project and information management.
Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills are required to support working in project environments that includes internal, external and customer teams.
Requires strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing priorities


Work Conditions: Ability to lift up to 20lbs. Moving lifting or transferring of patients may involve lifting of up to 50lbs as well as assist with weights of more than 100lbs.
Ability to stand for extended periods
Ability to drive to patient locations (ie. home, hospital, SNF, etc)
Fine motor skills
Visual acuity

Demonstrated experience with requirements gathering and documentation, solution design, and GAP analysis

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Operations Financial Planning & Analysis
Job Description:
Extraordinary Careers. Endless Possibilities.

With the nation’s largest home infusion provider, there is no limit to the growth of your career.

Option Care Health, Inc. is the largest independent home and alternate site infusion services provider in the United States. With over 6,000 team members including 2,900 clinicians, we work compassionately to elevate standards of care for patients with acute and chronic conditions in all 50 states. Through our clinical leadership, expertise and national scale, Option Care Health is re-imagining the infusion care experience for patients, customers and employees.

As a proud recipient of the Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award, we recognize that part of being extraordinary is supporting and building a workforce that is as diverse as the patients and communities we serve.
Join a company that is taking action to develop a culture that is more inclusive, respectful, engaging and rewarding for all team members. We are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

Job Description Summary:

Reporting to the Director, Enterprise FP&A, the Senior Financial Analyst, Operations FP&A is responsible for supporting the development, execution, and completion of a portfolio of cross-functional projects. The individual will partner with the Operations and Executive Leadership teams to facilitate financial reporting, forecasting, and budgeting for nationwide operations. The ideal candidate for this position will have a strong financial background, an eye for automation, excellent communication skills and will exhibit persistent intellectual curiosity for business operations.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities (listed in order of importance and/or time spent)

Partner with Operations, Commercial, and Executive leadership teams to support all facets of nationwide operations including budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis.

Collaborate with Operations leadership to drive cost optimization initiatives and identify productivity opportunities through the enhancement and development of financial planning and analysis processes.

Create financial models and ad hoc analysis to improve the interpretation of the current financial position; provide insights and recommendations based on financial analysis to support decision-making.

Analyze monthly performance variances to budget, forecast, and prior year; lead business reviews with Finance and Operations leadership to summarize variances and discuss action plans.

Provide support to the M&A team on ad hoc basis.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Does this position have supervisory responsibilities? No

Basic Education and/or Experience Requirements

Bachelor’s degree and at least 3 years’ experience in an analytical role in finance, accounting, or business

Management.

At least 3 years’ experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve issues and problems.

At least 3 years’ experience in applying analytics principles (Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research,

Business Management, Economics or Finance).

At least 2 years’ experience with project management (for example: planning, organizing, and managing resources to bring about the successful completion of specific project goals and objectives).

Basic Qualifications

Possess knowledge of project management techniques and tools and experience working in cross functional, team oriented, and collaborative environment with the ability to prioritize work and successfully meet tight deadlines

Demonstrated strong finance and accounting skills, including an aptitude for financial modeling

Self-starter with strong analytical skills and decision-making capabilities. Detail-oriented

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills as well as a high level of personal motivation to achieve

Experience presenting to and interacting with C-level executives of organizations is preferred

Proficient with MS Office Suite including MS Project (Excel, Power point & Word)

Travel Requirements: (if required)

None.

Preferred Qualifications & Interests (PQIs)

Master’s Degree or MBA

Description

There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?

We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

The Senior Product Manager will be responsible for enabling United’s customer facing capabilities across all stages of the customer journey. The Digital Product Team is responsible for defining United’s digital product strategy and providing the leadership to complete that strategy with the help of multi-functional resources. This leadership role keeps up with industry trends, manages the delivery and transformation roadmap for our core capabilities and works on guiding initiatives with scoping, business analysis and case development.

Innovation

Participate in key industry forums – be an advocate for United in influencing their direction
Lead all aspects of the innovation agenda for assigned products
Project Delivery
Manage case development for central initiatives
Document scope and conduct business analysis for critical initiatives
Manage scope and delivery roadmap of critical initiatives in alignment with product priorities
Lead the analysis & design phases of initiatives, as needed

Job Summary

This position is responsible for leading strategic, cross-enterprise formation of new products or product enhancements that ensure retention of existing accounts and/or acquisition of new ones, maintaining market-relevant service packages and responding to legislative and regulatory initiatives.

Job Purpose:

This position is responsible for leading strategic, cross-enterprise implementations of new products or product enhancements that are critical to the retention of accounts, maintaining market relevancy and responding to legislative and regulatory initiatives.

This role serves as the business lead on a given implementation within the Product Implementation team and collaborates broadly with business and technology partners to take the project from business case analysis through implementation following the System Delivery Lifecycle (SDLC).

Responsible for building a deep understanding of the scope and member impact of a given business case, leading decomposition of the business case, and driving and providing oversight to planning, requirements gathering and cost/resource estimate breakdowns.

This role is responsible for creating deliverables and presentations that further team understanding and implementation efforts, proactively communicating with stakeholders, and raising and mitigating risks and issues.

Primary focus is on outlining, creating solutions, and delivering on the overall product implementation. Responsible for monitoring compliance and conformity to industry and HCSC standards and processes, with a continual focus on improving efficiencies, processes and documentation.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelors’ degree and four (4) years of experience in business analysis, system implementation efforts or project management

-OR-

Eight (8) years of experience in business analysis, system implementation efforts or project management.

Comfortable with change and working in a flexible and dynamic work environment.

Clear and concise written, presentation, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Experience working across various departments with various levels of management handling sensitive or difficult situations as well as developing and delivering formal training to internal and external customers.

Organizational skills and attention to detail.

Experience working independently and in group settings and responding to rapidly changing priorities.

Experience identifying risks and issues and creating mitigation strategies.

Takes initiative in driving results, asking astute questions, proactively reaching out to stakeholders, and meeting deadlines.

Analytical skills and experience applying business knowledge to solve problems.

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Product development expertise – ability to develop an understanding of market needs and demand and collaborate with internal stakeholders to create customized plan bundles that will meet the market needs.

Demonstrated ability to develop a vision of intangible products and facilitate go-to-market.

Knowledge of healthcare insurance industry and current trends related to new products/ networks, as well as new legislation and interaction with government affairs.

Consulting or client/product implementation experience in a large organization.

Demonstrated critical-thinking and problem-solving skills.

Collaboration, conflict management and resolution skills.

Knowledge of or experience with the SDLC.

Job Description


We are looking for a Senior Data Technical Analyst with hands-on experience that can partner with our business teams to create and implement technically sound business solutions. These solutions will enable and support our effort to enhance every facet of our digital interactions with our customers. This role is based in Chicago, IL.

Responsibilities:

Lead requirements gathering process and participate in discovery workshops
Create and enforce best business practices and processes across the entire team of Business Analysts in C360
Participate in Solutioning sessions with various product teams and ensure that any impacts to our Data products are identified and documented appropriately
Lead project meetings with business stakeholders to ensure understanding of requirements, timing, and resource needs
Create and maintain User Stories in JIRA and participate in agile scrum ceremonies
Maintain expert-level knowledge of McDonald’s customer data ecosystem and of the key business processes and systems that enable it
Identify integration, alignment, and improvement opportunities
Support developers by providing functional clarifications and setting development expectations with internal C360 team and other McDonald’s digital and data product teams · Oversee planning and execution of test plans and test cases; ensure overall quality of solutions
Effectively analyze and prioritize high impact initiatives
Engage with customers, partners, and internal stakeholders to understand the primary use cases
Author and create design artifacts such as: Functional design specifications, source-to-target data mapping and process and data flow diagrams
Work with on-shore and off-shore development teams
Coach and support other business analysts on the team and provide thought leadership in the requirements gathering process across the multiple functional areas that impact C360


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university
3-5 years experience as a Technical Business Analyst or equivalent role
Working knowledge of cloud-based data systems
Experience gathering and documenting business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, methodology development and data modeling
Experience working on an Agile Development team and working with Agile/Scrum management tools such as JIRA and Confluence
Experienced working with Marketing automation tools and event-driven architecture.
Strong knowledge of data Extraction Transformation and Load (ETL)
Strong understanding of application integration and API connectivity.
Ability to perform data analysis, running complex SQL queries from various databases on large complex data sets

Desired Skills

Experience with and/or working knowledge of data warehouse (Redshift, Databricks, Snowflake, or similar) and data integration (Talend or similar) technologies
Skilled at defining and prioritizing product opportunities, building feedback loops, and creating product metrics
Experience working with a large managed services partner with on and off-shore resources
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Strong leadership skills
Ability to work collaboratively with others and navigate complex decision making
Ability to interact with stakeholders/end users at a variety of levels and across function
CRM or Loyalty experience is not required but will be a plus

This is where you save and sustain lives

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.

Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.

Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.

Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.

*We are open to this employee sitting in Batesville, IN, Skaneateles, NY, or Deerfield, IL.*

Your role:

In this high visibility role, you are a critical function in supporting our sales team's Incentive Compensation program. You will help design and drive the process while partnering closely with sales leaders, finance, human resources and incentive compensation (IC) leadership to allocate field quota and design/develop annual compensation and contest plans in alignment with the business’s strategic imperatives. Provide Leadership and coaching on advanced analytical support, performance reporting and field sales variable compensation calculations for the US Baxter sales forces. Database creation and management is required to support all compensation and quota related reporting.

What you'll be doing:

Manage quota adjustments, calculation of monthly commissions and submit commission payouts to payroll in alignment with the published variable payroll calendar

Oversee preparation and publication of monthly performance reporting packages from field sales up to Senior Sales Leadership

Partner within Commercial Insights and Analytics, IT, IC Leadership and our customers to continue to grow the organizational digital transformation journey

Execute payment approvals and coordinate adjustments to quota and/or sales data to ensure accurate incentive compensation payments are aligned with the Incentive Compensation policies and governance

Lead and coach within the organization to analyze and make recommendations on business issues and opportunities

Operate with a continuous improvement mindset to drive a LEAN culture

Lead and sponsor process innovation to develop and identify procedural gaps, drive for improvement, create efficiencies, eliminate waste and enhance customer satisfaction

What you'll bring:

2+ years of Sales Operations/Incentive Compensation experience with bachelor’s degree or 8 years of Sales Operations/Incentive Compensation experience without a bachelor’s degree

Strong leadership, project management, analytical and problem solving skills

Strong working knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and database management

Tableau/Cognos and/or advanced reporting skills

Proficiency with Sales Performance Management (SPM) tools such as Xactly and IBM/Varicent preferred

Attention to detail and strong organizational skills is essential

Dedication to meeting and/or exceeding expectations of internal and external customers

Department

BSD CTD - GDC Project Management

About the Department

The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is a research center whose mission is to develop the discipline of translational data science to impactful problems in biology, medicine, healthcare, and the environment. We envision a world in which researchers have ready access to the data needed and the tools required to make data driven discoveries that increase our scientific knowledge and improve the quality of life. We architect ecosystems of large-scale commons of research data, computing resources, applications, tools, and services for the broader research community to use data at scale to pursue scientific inquiry and accelerate discovery. Learn more at https://gdc.cancer.gov/ , https://gen3.org/ , https://stats.gen3.org/ , and https://ctds.uchicago.edu/.

This at-will position is wholly or partially funded by contractual grant funding which is renewed under provisions set by the grantor of the contract. Employment will be contingent upon the continued receipt of these grant funds and satisfactory job performance.

Job Summary

The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for understanding and meeting organizational and contractual expectations regarding business solution delivery standards, work scope management, solution quality, and client satisfaction. You will lead from a business analyst perspective from the ground up, as a communicator, liaison, and information source for the team. You will be a critical advisor for the agile development team, collaborating to deliver innovative solutions to support the research community. This position will be specific to the Genomic Data Commons (GDC) Project (https://gdc.cancer.gov/; https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/). The GDC Project lies at the intersection of cutting-edge research and production systems, both in terms of the bioinformatics and computer science principles being utilized. Deep technical understanding of the system and software architecture will be critical to success in this role. Additionally, you will be required to gain a working knowledge of cancer genomics to understand the use cases and requirements for the GDC. You will be empowered, decisive, communicative, business-savvy, and highly available to the team, leadership, and stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Work with all stakeholders to define and document the use cases and product requirements that will determine the success of the solution.
Translate product requirements and user stories into detailed functional and/or technical specifications.
Develop and write clear technical tasks and acceptance criteria in JIRA.
Provide other documentation as needed such as API specifications, process diagrams, and other models to clarify the desired solutions.
Work with the team leads, collaboratively using JIRA, to help prioritize stories, tasks, and their dependencies to ensure a smooth agile process.
Provide input in test plans and participate in writing test cases, test execution and defect reporting to ensure that solutions implemented meet requirements and are both of high quality and operationally sustainable.
Identify opportunities and drive solutions for improving current business and technical processes.
Facilitate communication and coordination across business and technical units.
Timely escalation of any concerns, risks and issues pertaining to business analysis.
Support Agile project management processes as needed.
Participate in project meetings and provide insight as appropriate.
Documenting and reporting to project leadership and senior management.
Has a deep understanding of business process analyses, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefit analyses. Solves complex problems relating to computer equipment capacity, limitations, and operation time.
Utilizes thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements to translate business and user needs into system requirement specifications.
Recommends process improvements in existing applications and revises existing system logic difficulties as necessary. Designs, develops, and implements new applications, systems architecture, network systems, and applications infrastructures.
Communicates and presents on system enhancements and/or alternatives to colleagues in IT management.
Performs other related work as needed.

Overview: We are in search of an experienced ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst to join our dynamic Enterprise Applications Team. Position Summary:
We are looking for an outstanding Business Analyst with plenty of creativity, precise thinking, and a love of solutioning in complex situations. If that’s who you are, then we would love to talk to you. We need your talent, and we think you will love the work.
We are a B2B company on a mission to build a truly excellent digital customer experience – from product interest to transactions to customer support. If you know B2B, then you know that creating a seamless customer experience can be an interesting challenge.
We create easy, self-serve, digital experiences in an environment that involves multi-persona buyer journeys, complex account and user hierarchies, intricate product relationships, and customer specific pricing. Mix in some international markets, language translation and localization, a variety of ERPs, and multiple business units, and you have a fun playground in which to solve problems.
We have built sophisticated systems to handle these scenarios, and now we are looking to grow our diverse and global team by bringing on board additional creative, motivated, and analytical people to join the talented team we already have.
We’re an agile shop, so you will collaborate with our product owners to create great user stories, provide customer-centric insights on the why behind features, and articulate acceptance criteria at the right level to allow the team to design the best solutions. You will work with the technical teams to fully explore the business logic and technology, while documenting solutions with air-tight diagrams, inspired wireframes, and clear descriptions. You will work with our QA, infrastructure, and digital marketing teams to ensure that what we make is high quality, scalable, and frictionless for customers.
You will coordinate with other business analysts to blend the needs of multiple business units into elegant solutions. You will use planning poker to create story point estimates, forecast delivery dates and drive achievement planning to innovate your way past obstacles. You will work as a strategic partner to our businesses to help groom backlogs so we can maximize business value in ways that delight customers.
Our technology core is built on Sitecore, SOLR, Informatica, Microsoft technologies, Salesforce and a variety of other tools in our marketing technology stack. We have some unique customizations that allow our technology to scale to hundreds of thousands of SKUs, over a billion pricing records, high availability, and heavy traffic.
This is a key strategic area for us, so if you like to make an impact, then this is a place that will give you challenges to chase and great people to chase them with.
Major Responsibilities:
Lead the documentation of system requirements for select features of our digital properties and ensure timely implementation by working with business, design, development, and QA teams using agile methods and design documents, including:
Themes, epics and user stories
User story mapping, use cases, and wireframing
System and solution diagrams
Workflow diagrams
Domain and data models
Lead estimation sessions and manage scope changes to ensure that budgets and deadlines are met
Inspire and negotiate solution updates to solve design and delivery problems discovered during development
Proactively and clearly communicate changes in delivery dates and manage stakeholder expectations
Facilitate agile sprints by clarifying requirements and unblocking design issues for the team
Facilitate prioritization of the backlog among multiple stakeholders
Identify and recommend improvements to digital properties based on analysis of customer feedback, usability data, and discussions with various functional team members (marketing, sales, customer support, etc.)
Coordinate alignment across multiple business teams when required for shared web functionality or customer experiences
Stay current on marketing technologies and make recommendations for ROI-positive enhancements
Required Education / Experience / Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in business or technology field or equivalent experience in technology consulting
3 to 5 years of experience converting digital functionality requests into functional requirements and/or user stories as part of a formal requirements gathering process that supports full requirements traceability
Experience with agile development methodologies and story point estimation (SAFe experience a plus)
Meeting facilitation skills and ability to collaborate effectively with participants from all levels of the organization
Superior communication skills (verbal and written)
Experience using analytics software to evaluate and analyze user behaviors
Business to business or complex product experience preferred
Project management experience preferred
Experience with formal product roadmap prioritization methods a plus
International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) CBAP a plus
Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) certification a plus
Experience or certification in Design Thinking methods a plus
Travel: Limited
Language: English

Regal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. With the announcement of the acquisition of Altra Industrial Motion, a ~$2B global business with 9,000 associates, focused on Power Transmission and Factory Automation products, Regal Rexnord will become a $7.3B company with 36,000 associates globally.
You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.
Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.

Overview:
DATA ANALYTICS CONSULTANT

Stax Inc., a global strategy consulting firm serving industry-leading corporate and private equity clients, is recruiting a Data Analytics Consultant to join our team. Stax is a fast-paced firm, where actionable results and quality work are valued, and time spent on client sites is kept to a minimum. At all levels of the organization, our people are bright, driven, and able to excel.

Stax recently announced a strategic investment by Blue Point Capital Partners which will fuel a new chapter of growth in key areas across the firm including expanding our recruitment and talent development efforts. To support our accelerated growth, Stax is growing our talented team of Consultants. We are seeking individuals with a passion for learning and the desire to tackle the most challenging issues businesses face today. Consultants play a vital role within the firm and are presented with tremendous opportunities for professional development and personal growth.

During your time at Stax, you will consistently face intellectually challenging projects with clients such as Private Equity funds, Investment Banks, and Fortune 500 companies. Working across a wide spectrum of industries on short-term engagements designed to last 4-12 weeks, you will gain new hands-on experiences with each project you encounter.

You will also have incredible opportunities to jump-start your consulting career. Our staff works side by side with—and learns from—some of the smartest people in the business. Our entrepreneurial approach to work and broad client base creates immediate opportunities for client exposure, providing enormous potential for career progression. Consultants work directly with senior professionals at the firm daily to diagnose our clients’ most pressing issues while identifying new opportunities for value creation and to accelerate growth.

Life at Stax is unique - our goal is to empower and challenge employees, while supporting a reasonable work/life balance. No question: you will work hard. However, unlike other firms, we spend less time traveling, so you can focus on your professional and personal development, grow with your team, and get involved in your community.

At Stax, we have a clear mission: to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay, and do their best work. From such diversity and inclusion comes our unique innovation and actionable insights.
Responsibilities:
WHY STAX


High-profile engagements with large and mid-cap private equity firms and investment banks globally, and the leadership teams of their portfolio companies.
Front-line exposure and leadership roles with our action-oriented, non-bureaucratic client base across sectors and project types.
Immersive learning opportunities in a fast-paced environment.
Content-focused environment which can nourish your analytically driven opinion.
Our consultants are supported by our unique business model with integrated international teams that deliver research, data, analysis, and overnight support to allow you more time to think.
Provide clients with in-depth analysis of and innovative solutions to pressing business, industry, and global concerns leveraging leading-edge methods and tools.
Opportunities for personal growth and career development based on your merits, with upward mobility and the chance to work with good people who are passionate about the firm's success and constantly looking for ways to improve and build upon its accomplishments.
Qualifications:
POSITION OVERVIEW

As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be part of our client engagements working closely with project teams to identify data needs, sources, and structure to support client issues, and to support private equity clients in better understanding and valuing potential investments. You will utilize rigorous business analytics, statistical models, and data science to identify actionable insights and ultimately develop strategic plans from this information to help our clients grow organically and make better investment decisions.

You will help summarize and present key findings, and work closely with managers and directors to convert your team’s findings into valuable insights and actionable recommendations. You will support work streams, modules, and — after a period of time — own work streams. You will have exposure to a broad array of client needs and industries.

This role differs from our regular consultant position in that you will be taking a hybrid role of both a strategy consultant and a data scientist. This means you will work on projects where analytics are critical to our overall analysis & recommendations and will leverage programming/advanced Excel to conduct more advanced analyses.

Specific responsibilities will include:
Conduct in-depth business research and analysis in support of client business objectives.
Work closely with project leads to design and structure research and analysis plan for project work, gather data, perform analysis and interpret the outcomes.
Perform rigorous economic and business analysis, including but not limited to market sizing, forecasting growth, customer segmentation, lifetime value, and supply/demand studies.
Perform data extraction, quantitative analysis and build regression models

QUALIFICATIONS
2-4 year of Experience working in strategy consulting, ideally specializing in PE, Commercial Due Diligence, and Value Creation.
Data analytics experience preferably with a strategy consulting firm, strategic planning/corporate strategy group or private equity/venture capital firm.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Financial Analysis, Business Analysis, or a related quantitative discipline.
Competence with open-source data manipulation languages such as Python and R to analyze data and build predictive models.
Excellent strategic thinking, understanding of business research and analysis.
Proven written, verbal and presentation skills that demonstrate the ability to frame ideas that capture appropriate details and structure output logically and persuasively.
Detail oriented and proven ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint functions.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Demonstrated experience in performing rigorous economic and business analysis including but not limited to market sizing, forecasting growth, customer segmentation, lifetime value and supply/demand studies.
Professional experience building predictive models.
Use of additional analytical tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and Alteryx
Proven ability to quickly gain familiarity and comfort with new datasets

Job Description
Position Overview
As the Analyst II, Tech Project Controls, you will be responsible for supporting the development, implementation, and management of the technology cost governance effort. The Analyst II role will be heavily focused on all enterprise and group project costs for proper reporting, billbacks, allocations, and ROI by creating detailed reports and dashboards to improve the execution of Company Technology projects.
Responsibilities
Monitor project total expenditure including verifying and checking of invoices, vendors, and contractors to ensure that all project expenditures are captured and properly recorded.
Plan and control cost support for all projects which includes variation reporting, financial milestone progress to the overall project.
Assist the Project Manager and management, by preparing monthly financial controls and governance reporting for the monitoring of the project activities.
Perform project cost reporting to the team and management’s review on a monthly basis to ensure that expenditures are kept within the project budget.
Support strategies to manage and report project related and IT tower cost spend.
Prepare ad-hoc reports, as directed by management.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology or related discipline.
2 - 5 years direct work experience in related field.
Excellent solution-seeking, teamwork, collaboration, and communication skills.
Ability to comprehend and carry out instructions and follow tasks to completion with minimal direction.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Preferred Qualifications:
Desire to work in the renewable energy industry.
Experience with project coordination and management with multiple levels of interface between vendors, internal staff, and other stakeholders.
Visualization reporting tool experience.

Under the direction of Managers or Master Consultants, the Senior Consultant associate will collect detailed requirements and direct development of enterprise data-management and business-intelligence solutions for clients in a variety of industries. The Senior Consultant will be expected to conduct and lead development successfully in multiple technology platforms (particularly Snowflake, Microsoft Azure and Power BI, and/or Qlik) and to create solutions that support delivery of analytic products to end users through a combination of dashboards, custom web applications, and packaged data products.

Responsibilities:

Work with clients in the role as Business Analyst to collect detailed requirements to define star-schema data models, integrate data to populate those data models, and deliver results through data visualizations and custom web applications.
Estimate work efforts required to develop these analytic solutions based on Wipfli staffing and project-management models.
Assist Project Managers to develop project plans.
Conduct development, and lead the efforts of data engineers, ELT developers, and business-intelligence developers to develop, test, and deploy analytic applications that combine enterprise data-management and business-intelligence components.
Properly document developed and unit-tested data-management components so that Wipfli managed-services staff or client’s system-administration staff can maintain the system after deployment.
Participate in developing standardized approaches and methodologies for improving the quality and time-to-delivery of advanced analytic solutions.
Earn and maintain certifications associated with enterprise-data and/or business-intelligence technology platforms.
Learn new technologies, or new features of existing technologies, so that Wipfli can incorporate these into our service offerings.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject area.
Four to six years of experience in business analysis, enterprise database development, or business-intelligence development. Preference to candidates with experience in all three disciplines.
Ability to communicate with and collaborate with clients to define requirements for analytic applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving experience and capabilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

One or more vendor data-management or data-engineering certifications (relevant examples include: Snowflake Snowpro Certification, Microsoft Data Engineering or Data Analytics Certification, Qlik Business Analyst Certification, etc.).
One or more documented examples of requirement definitions for enterprise-database or business-intelligence applications.
Experience with estimating work efforts for development and deployment of the same applications.
Training or experience with Agile and/or Waterfall development methodologies.

Skills and Abilities:

Requirements documentation
Work-effort estimation and planning
SQL coding
ELT development (particularly if used with cloud database management systems)
Data profiling
Ability to develop entity-relationship diagrams and ELT requirement documents
Business-Intelligence development
Familiarity with data-source connection options (API, file-base, relational databases, etc.)

Work Relationship Scope:

Position will report to the Performance Coach for priority setting/direction and support. Works closely with project management and development leadership and staff to complete day-to-day responsibilities. Will have frequent contact with clients and works closely with others to ensure seamless client service.
