At Revlon, we create beauty innovations for everyone that inspire confidence and ignite joy every day.

Breaking beauty boundaries is in our company’s DNA. Since its game-changing launch of the first opaque nail enamel in 1932 (and later, the first long-wear foundation), Revlon has provided consumers with high-quality product innovation, performance, and sophisticated glamour. Elizabeth Arden made waves as a woman-led beauty company in the 1920s. In 1931, Almay became the original hypoallergenic, fragrance-free beauty brand.

Today, Revlon resiliently continues its legacy as a leading global beauty company. Our diverse portfolio—which consists of some of the world’s most iconic brands and product offerings in color cosmetics, skin care, hair color & care, personal care, and fragrances—is sold around the world through prestige, professional, mass, and direct-to-consumer retail channels. These brands include Revlon, Revlon Professional, Elizabeth Arden, Almay, American Crew, CND, Cutex, Mitchum, Sinful Colors, Creme of Nature, Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, John Varvatos, Juicy Couture, Ed Hardy and more.

We honor our heritage, embrace change, and applaud diversity. We champion our employees and celebrate our consumers.

We are Revlon, together, transforming beauty.




Position Overview:

Revlon is looking for a proven analyst/insights leader to join our team and help drive our growth agenda at this top tier beauty retailer. This role will leverage his/her strategic thinking capabilities and insights to identify short and long-term growth opportunities based on a comprehensive understanding of the category, the shopper, our brands and customer strategies. Additionally, he/she will work closely with the Customer Business Manager to develop a strong fact-based selling relationship with Walgreen’s buyers and marketing team.

Support delivery of team volume and share objectives by providing analytics to support the strategic business plan and the tactical execution plan for the Walgreens sales team. This role is responsible for developing a fact-based approach of business analytics including customer POS, SKU/Segment/Brand performance, AC Nielsen data mining, category trends, consumer purchase behaviors, competitive landscape, and promotional effectiveness. This analysis will be translated into key insights, strategies, and recommendations for Walgreens.

Major Duties:

Market Performance

Leads analysis of brand’s market performance (POS Sales, $$ and Unit Share, Productivity) and provides strategic recommendations on future plans, opportunities, and risks

Weekly assessment of business performance relative to market/competitive set
Cause of Change relative to forecast assumptions
Insight on future impacts of current trends
Leverages market performance analysis to support future Gross Sales forecasts in collaboration with customer Replenishment team(s)

Business Effectiveness

Supports CBMs in updates to internal NPD forecast tracking, pipe / bottom-up file updates, and display tracking
Leads analysis of promotions, shopper marketing activations, and display programs
Compiles, analyzes, and reports against promotional performance ROI through established Sales/Finance tools (Consumption ROI File)
In partnership with RGM and Sales, manages $50M trade funding (MDF) budget
Portfolio/Wall Optimization
Provides analytics and insights for CPPS, collaborating with CBM and Retail Design on mix optimization
Evaluates MD/Return liability due to POG strategies and advises on rundown strategies
Provides insights on sales impact due to POG versioning/ distribution changes / merchandising elements
Evaluates effectiveness of localization / test door projects / lost doors market transference

Annualized Planning

Leads/supports development of annual budget planning in collaboration with Sales, Trade Marketing, RGM
Spearheads forecasting analysis for NPD

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Must have advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, Vlookup, functions, charting, etc), PowerPoint (graphic presentations, selling stories, etc) and Word
Strong analytical skills with proven ability to interpret data into key selling points that will drive brand and category growth
Experience with analytic/consumer insight tools (i.e. RSI, AC Nielsen, etc.)
Analytical rigor and detail orientation to ensure accuracy and credibility of insights
Ability to think outside the box to identify innovative solutions
Must be a highly motivated self-starter, able to work independently, and someone who thrives on multi-tasking in a fast-paced work environment
Effective communicator with strong interpersonal skills that will drive collaboration across the team and organization
Must be creative and detail-oriented in ambiguous situations, with a focus on execution
Experience

5+ years of sales or analytics support with preference for Consumer-Packaged Goods/Beauty Industry

Education

Bachelor's Degree

About the Department

The University of Chicago Booth School of Business is the second-oldest business school in the U.S. and second to none when it comes to influencing business education and business practices. Since 1898, the school has produced ideas and leaders that shape the world of business. Their rigorous, discipline-based approach to business education transforms students into confident, effective, respected business leaders prepared to face the toughest challenges.

Chicago Booth has the finest set of facilities of any business school in the world. Each of the four campuses (two in Chicago, one in London, and one in Hong Kong) reflects the architectural traditions of its environs while offering a state-of-the-art learning environment.

Chicago Booth is proud to claim:

an unmatched faculty.
degree and open enrollment programs offered on three continents.
a global body of nearly 56,000 accomplished alumni.
strong and growing corporate relationships that provide a wealth of lifelong career opportunities.

As part of the world-renowned University of Chicago, Chicago Booth shares the University's core values that shape the distinctive intellectual culture. At Booth, they constantly question and test ideas, and seek proof. This extraordinarily effective approach to business leads to new ideas and innovative solutions. Seven of the Booth faculty members have won Nobel Prizes for these ideas - the first business school to achieve this accomplishment.

For more information about the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, please visit: http://www.chicagobooth.edu/.

Job Summary

The primary responsibilities of the Senior Business Analyst are to provide strategic business analysis services to business partners. This position will work closely with the business customers to gain in-depth understanding of customer's business processes. This role will be key to understanding and analyzing customer needs which will drive the implementation of new and enhanced technology. The Senior Business Analyst is also responsible for leading efforts to support the testing lifecycle of new technology, enhancements, identifying and managing the elimination of application defects to verify that systems meet specifications and standard.
Responsibilities
Consults with business customers to gather information about system needs and objectives, functions and features, and input and output requirements.
Elicits requirements using interviews, requirements workshops, surveys.
Creates requirements management documents such as business requirements (BRD), scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals and business process documents.
Analyzes, defines, and documents requirements for data mapping, workflow, logical processes and interfaces with other systems.
Designs screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, reports, and interfaces with other systems.
Applies business process reengineering techniques to redesign and improve business processes.
Performs stakeholder management activities to influence customers, meet customer and business needs and manage customer relationships and expectations.
Supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders.
Collaborates closely with developers to implement requirements and provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process.
Creates test plans, test cases and test data.
Creates data mining / manipulation queries to support test prep and execution.
Creates comprehensive Test Plan / Test Approach documentation.
Plans and implements the various stages of test, e.g. Systems Test, Integration Testing, Exploratory Testing, Regression Testing, etc. during the project lifecycle through the creation of test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Provides support and guidance in test principles, techniques and tools to team members.
Coordinates and delegates work to test resources during the running of a project.
Assists with Incident and Problem management activities by diagnosing problems and suggesting viable solutions.
Identifies, analyzes, and documents defects, errors, and inconsistencies in software.
Collaborates with customers to plan and implement comprehensive User Acceptance Testing activities including training materials.
Creates and executes automated test scripts using testing software applications and manual test scripts to support testing, debugging, documenting, and implementing enhancements and break fix solutions.
Partners with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies.
Supports system conversions, upgrades, enhancements and disaster recovery efforts.
Leads business process analyses, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefit analyses. Solves unique and complex problems relating to computer equipment capacity, limitations, and operation time.
Utilizes expertise and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements to translate business and user needs into system requirement specifications.
Performs other related work as needed.

Minimum Qualifications

Education:
Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.
-
Work Experience:
Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 7+ years of work experience in a related job discipline.
-
Certifications:
-
Preferred Qualifications
Education:
Master’s degree.
Experience:
A minimum seven years of recent related business analyst and testing experience.
Working on Agile software development projects.
Working on Waterfall software development projects.
Experience with Defect/Problem Management processes.
Technical Skills or Knowledge:
Demonstrated experience with automated software testing tools and writing basic SQL queries.
Knowledge of multiple project management lifecycles/methodologies including, Software Development Life Cycle, Agile and Waterfall.
Knowledge of Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK Guide) or PMI's Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) processes and standards.
Proficiency with testing backend processes such as system/data flows, feeds and APIs.
Preferred Competencies
Demonstrated ability to gather and manage detailed, accurate requirements through the project lifecycle.
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
Handle multiple detailed tasks/projects simultaneously and meet strict deadlines.
Communicate technical ideas and concepts to non-technical audiences.
Maintain confidentiality and follow IT and other University policies regarding data security and protection.
Excellent analytical thinking, information gathering, problem solving, and persuasion skills.
Influence and manage stakeholder expectations.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and diplomatically with colleagues, as well as with students, faculty, and corporate contacts in a multitude of communication methods i.e., in person, email, phone.
Professional demeanor, including tact, discretion, and a customer service-oriented approach.
Working Conditions
This position is currently expected to work a minimum three days per week in the office.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst on the Information Technology team, your prior Accounting or Finance experience will be valuable as you recommend & implement technology solutions that will make processes more efficient and employees more productive within our Finance and Investments groups. Core responsibilities include translating business requirements into technical documents, mockups, and test scripts; becoming the subject matter expert on how your business partners use our software; and working in a dynamic team of BSAs and developers to deliver technology solutions that empower your business partners.

WHO YOU ARE:

Knowledgeable & Analytical.
Your background includes a combination of Accounting/Finance and Information Technology and you are comfortable with Accounting concepts, specifically the routines related to closing financial books. You re skilled at gathering requirements, data collection & analysis, problem solving, process documentation, and identifying areas for improvement.

Technologically Savvy.
You ve got a solid proficiency in writing SQL queries. You re also comfortable working with relational database concepts and have a knack for quickly mastering new software. You re familiar with how data can flow between systems via integrations/APIs.

Business Liaison.
You re comfortable collaborating with business partners and third party vendors to gather needs, review viable solutions, test new functionality, and track post-implementation results.

Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are clear, articulate, effective, and demonstrate your ability to interact with all levels both within and outside the organization. By delivering clear communication, you help to ensure that projects stay on time, deliverables meet budget, and key stakeholders are aware of project statuses.

Passionate. Motivated. Eager to Learn.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and regularly seek to understand.

WHAT YOU LL DO:

Work closely with teammates and business partners to analyze and document business requirements
for projects and software customizations or configurations. You ll then translate those business requirements into technical requirements for development staff.
Provide project management to coordinate efforts between business partners and IT.
Deliver clear communication on status, timing, deliverables, and budget to leaders, team members, stakeholders, etc.
Implement new technology and evaluate upgrades.
You ll present new features to business partners, test new functionality, and assist with the creation of training documentation.
Identify opportunities for automation.
Implement technology solutions such as workflows or Robotic Process Automation to enhance business processes and eliminate administrative burden.
Document data relationships and write basic SQL statements.
You ll analyze and compare datasets and look for trends, issues, or areas for improvement.
Implement and manage standard testing procedures for system changes.
Create, review and execute test plans and validate that it meets the business and technical requirements. Responsible for proper tracking of test results.
Provide assistance to IT Support to review issues reported from users.
Compare data from multiple sources to reconcile discrepancies, determine cause of errors and establish procedures to correct them.
Challenge the status quo. Be willing to look at processes with fresh eyes and questions on whether there s a better way.
Represent the Company in a professional manner at all times.
Consistently maintain a professional, courteous attitude when dealing with residents, coworkers and the general public.
Perform other duties as necessary.

Previous Experience & Requirements:

A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Business, Accounting, Finance, or computer science with previous business analysis and/or project management experience is preferred.
5+ years relevant Accounting/Finance, business analysis and/or consulting work in related fields is preferred.
Key competencies: requirements gathering, data analysis, conceptual thinking, problem solving, customer focus, managing work efficiently, strong written and verbal communication skills.

Machines, Tools and Equipment, Software:

Experience with MRI or other ERP/Financial Software products strongly preferred
Experience with Blackline Accounting software preferred.
Must be proficient in creating/executing SQL queries and possess thorough understanding of relational database concepts.
Must be adept with the Google Platform and Microsoft Office suite of products.

This Is Who We Are:
Founded in 2013, Home Chef is the leading meal solutions company with both a retail and online presence. Available online at homechef.com and in retail at more than 2,100 Kroger grocery stores, Home Chef is committed to inspiring and enabling more people to cook simple, delicious meals, no matter how busy they are. Similar to our recipes, we recognize that variety is the spice of life; therefore, our employees also bring their uniqueness and color to our fantastic team. We’re eager to work with humble team players and pragmatic next-level thinkers to innovate on Home Chef’s offerings.
Overview:
The Ops Excellence team at Home Chef is a small but growing group of talented individuals that tackle some of our biggest challenges in operations. Sometimes referred to as Home Chef’s operations “SWAT” team, we work on cross-functional initiatives that help to define the future state of the operations organization. Our projects evolve based on the needs of the business – no two days are the same – but we’re always focused on execution and driving towards positive impact. We pride ourselves on being great problem solvers, thought partners, and go-getters.
Responsibilities:
The Operations Excellence Analyst will be expected to wear several hats and will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects. Although different projects will require different skill sets, the high-level responsibilities and expectations for this role are outlined below:

Tool Development & Tech Enablement:
Partner with our plant teams to develop, manage, and continually improve tools used on the floor at our production facilities
Understand challenges in the current technology landscape and work with production management and front-line employees to develop potential solutions
Examples of past projects include: developing, maintaining, and troubleshooting operational dashboards and reports

Data Analysis & Reporting:
Develop models and methodologies to monitor success of multiple facets of the business (facility capacity, machinery usage, labor, production, etc.)
Find innovative ways to make data actionable for our production teams - build processes to better collect, store, and visualize operational data in a meaningful and impactful way
Enable data-driven decision making by reporting on core KPIs and performing ad-hoc analyses
Examples of past projects include: performing analysis for our produce SWAT team initiative, such as a deep-dive analysis into top produce quality errors and identification of root cause issues

Training & People Support:
Partner with our HR teams to establish plant-focused programs related to performance management, professional development, and employee recognition & retention
Examples of past projects include: developing & maintaining attendance tracking tools used by our HR teams, implementing employee recognition programs such as box giveaways and Home Chef “value awards”

Work Planning & Project Management:
Work independently to develop project plans and timelines to drive progress forward, while working with multiple cross-functional stakeholders
Qualifications:
Completion of a four-year degree program in a related field
Entrepreneurial mindset: energetic and able to lead change, create vision, and inspire people to achieve goals in a fast-paced environment
Problem solver: Identify issues quickly and bring recommended solutions backed by logic to the discussion
Interpersonal savvy: Develop rapport across the organization in order to build consensus for implementing new processes and tools
Results oriented: Deal with ambiguity and make timely decisions to get to impact quickly
Attention to detail: Organizational skills and ability to manage details of complex systems and operational processes
Embody the Home Chef core values of customer first, pursuing excellence, taking ownership, and building a best-in-class team
1-2 years work experience in operations, management consulting, or data analysis role; top-ranked candidates strongly preferred
Technical ability: While experience using data analysis programs (e.g. Excel and Google Business Apps) are a must, experience using SQL, Python, and/or JavaScript highly desired
Comfortable working in a manufacturing environment. Travel to our production facilities in Chicago, Atlanta, and Los Angeles may be required as part of this position (up to ~20% travel)
Salary range: $80,000 - $90,000
More About Us:
Perks and benefits:
Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance – benefits start the 1st day of the month following your start date
Company-paid Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, and Long Term Disability
401(k) Employer match
Flexible spending accounts (FSA) for qualified Medical, Dependent Care, Parking, or Transit expenses
Flexible paid time off (PTO) policy, holidays and sick time
Generous Parental Leave

DUTIES: Gather requirements from various internal business users to understand specific data; analytical needs of various IT projects; Identify data from multiple data sources. Create interactive dashboards and business intelligence reports using Tableau and Power BI; Use data analysis software and techniques to identify, analyze, document, and interpret data trends or patterns in business processes to aid with applied business research; Conduct applied data analysis such as data cleansing, data processing, data transformation, and data connectivity. Develop various data trend reports and forecasts and benchmark results against competing data sets for project needs. Use advanced analytics such as Alteryx and SSIS for ETL, data integration, and workflow solutions for data warehouse implementation. Prepare business intelligence reports using Star and Snowflake schema models, multi-dimensional data, and cube design; Use BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and Qlik to analyze data to facilitate reporting, project documentation; project scope to assist with efficient on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; Create views, tables, triggers, user profiles, user-defined functions, and stored procedures.

Manage real-time and batch processing using Azure Cloud services. Synthesize current business intelligence to determine operational impacts and elevate database issues, trends, and areas for strategic improvement of projects.

Manage real-time and batch processing using Azure Cloud services.

Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience.

About the Role

Uber Freight is seeking a Sales Compensation Analyst to join our rapidly growing Sales Operations team. Our priority is to help our customer-facing sales team sell more effectively and efficiently through data, analytics and process improvement.

This position will work closely with sales leadership and sales operations to ensure appropriate administration of sales incentive plans. The ideal candidate will be action-oriented, approach tasks with an analytical and strategic mindset, have the enthusiasm to tackle any challenge and a track record of results.

What You’ll Do

Responsible for the design, planning, implementation, tracking, execution and administration of Uber Freight sales incentive plans
Analyze current performance to identify & implement process improvement opportunities
Effectively partner and collaborate closely with HR, Finance, Compensation, Sales Operations, Sales, and the Executive leadership team




Basic Qualifications

Bachelors degree
Minimum 5 years of experience in one or more of the following areas: sales compensation, sales incentive planning, compensation, or a similar field
Advanced G-sheet or Excel skills including the ability to analyze a large amount of information



Preferred Qualifications

Bachelors degree in finance, information systems, or economics
Experience in sales compensation within a freight organization
Strong desire to take initiative and lead projects through to completion
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Capability to analyze large amounts of data and make thoughtful business decisions based on conclusions
Experience using sales compensation software

Uber Freight is a logistics platform and partner with a mission to reimagine the way goods move to help communities thrive. Backed by innovative technology and a dedicated team of domain experts, we provide logistics solutions that give shippers and carriers of all sizes greater reliability, flexibility, and transparency so they can take control of their freight. Job Title: Financial Systems Manager (SAP S4Hana) – Hybrid (Chicago, IL)
Job Description:
Job information

Financial Systems Manager (SAP S/4Hana) – Hybrid (Chicago)

An exciting opportunity is available with a high growth company with operations across the US. As part of a current SAP S/4Hana reimplementation, the business is looking to streamline and optimize all core finance processes including: – R2R, P2P, O2C, FP&A.

Working alongside their internal program team and finance function, they are looking to hire someone internal with vast functional Accounting expertise to support them with this journey, specifically, with the core finance model design within S/4 HANA. In this role you will have functional ownership of the core finance modules within SAP – GL, AP, AR, FA, Cash, and Banking.

What will I be doing?

Partner with the Group Process Owners (GPOs) across all core processes, to help them rationalize their processes in SAP.

Engage stakeholders to see the value of S4HANA in the transformation process

Bridge the gap between the external partners and the client internal teams

Make recommendations on what to do and not do in terms of the core finance model design

Take a solution-oriented approach to solving problems in the design process

Advise on who, how, where, when, and why with respect to core finance processes e.g. Chart of Account design

Centrally involved in data migration, process mapping, documentation, design, UAT and hypercare phases

What profile will I need?

A senior accountant/finance lead that is an expert on financial processes mapping / optimization

Has led from a finance point of view on single instance SAP S/4Hana or ECC6 solution multiple times.

Must have SAP S4HANA Cloud & understanding of core finance modules from a process perspective

Is based in the US and eligible to work

Excellent business analysis & documentation skills

How do I apply?

Hit the apply button or message conor@systemsaccountants.com for more information!

About the Company

Glen-Gery Corporation is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Brickworks Limited. Brickworks Limited (“The Group”) is a large Australian-listed group of companies. The Group has been in operation since the early 1900s, has a market capitalization exceeding A$2.5 billion, and operates across 3 core business segments: Building Products, Land & Development, and Investments. The Group employs more than 2,000 FTE employees and operates nationally across Australia, recently acquiring Glen-Gery Corporation to add operations in the USA.

Founded in 1890, Glen-Gery Corporation is one of the nation’s largest brick manufacturers and operates nine brick manufacturing facilities and one manufactured stone facility. Glen-Gery products are sold nationally through a network of over 500 distributors as well as in Canada.




Basic Function:

The JDE Functional Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the business through analysis of organizational processes, implementation of enhancements and leveraging reports from JD Edwards EnterpriseOne and other systems. This individual will act as a technical liaison between the IT group and other business groups while providing remote and onsite assistance to resolve user problems, as well as identify opportunities to further leverage JDE EnterpriseOne. The Business Analyst will directly assist the retail project team users in ongoing implementation, training, and support.




Duties include but are not limited to:

Provide subject matter expertise for Oracle JDE EnterpriseOne (E1) Sales Order management, Purchase Order management, Inventory, Transportation, and other modules related to retail project team.
Serve as the subject matter expert by understanding current system functionality and configuration while working to drive standardization and improvement.
Work closely with the retail project implementation team and the business to understand the business requirements and ensuring they are being clearly articulated to the point-of-sale & eCommerce implementation vendors to assist them in their design, development, and testing.
Work with IT, business leaders, and end users to implement projects from concept through implementation, resolve issues, and provide ongoing support.
Influences and contributes to process and organizational continuous improvements.
Test and debug new enhancements and report modifications to ensure compliance with specifications and the generation of accurate information.
Provide end user support on how to optimize the utilization of existing tools and systems.
Plan, test, document and implement changes required by the business to enhance functionality of the system while minimizing the need for system customization and taking advantage of the system’s standard configurations.
Anticipate, identify, and resolve system and report malfunctions.
Develop and maintain technical documentation of systems and reports.
Ensure adherence to IT best practices, standards, and processes.



Success Requirements

Must have been part of Oracle JDE end to end implementation projects and must have worked on Sales Order, Purchase Orders, Inventory & Transportation implementations.
Strong experience in business analysis including modelling techniques to document AS-IS, TO-BE states, gap analysis, document requirements in organization defined standards.
Experience with any eCommerce and POS solutions in retail industry space.
Experience with barcodes and barcode scanning technologies if any.
Experience on acting as a business analyst in JDE integration projects including EDI.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology field preferred
Six to Eight years of JD Edwards EnterpriseOne as a functional expert with implementation and support experience.
Ability to work both independently and in conjunction with others in collaborative teams to meet common business initiatives.
Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple project and support commitments.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal), and other interaction skills necessary for coordinating with sales, manufacturing, marketing, finance, and corporate departments.

Overview:
Collects, tracks, analyzes and reports key strategic and operational data that enables the Clinical Leadership Team to meet their regulatory, workforce, financial and operational goals. Serves as a resource for all levels of the Clinical Operations Divisions related to Action O-I, productivity and workforce analytics and management. Assists with the business function of the Clinical Operations Divisions inclusive of financial monitoring, external reporting and revenue capture. Works collaboratively with other data analyst sources within the organization to pull data for Clinical Operations’ needs. Utilizes their analytical abilities to make a meaningful impact on patient care.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business, information system, or the equivalent required.
Experience:
Three or more years of experience in an analytical capacity is required.
Previous experience with API within a healthcare setting is preferred.
Previous experience with Lean Six Sigma process improvement methodology is preferred.
Previous Charge Master experience is preferred.
Previous Infor/Lawson experience is preferred.
Previous experience using Cerner Revenue Cycle is preferred.
Other Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Strong problem solving skills with a keen drive to learn and improve processes.
Must possess excellent analytical skills and the ability to compile data, analyze and develop recommendations as well as identify errors.

Ability to manage time and workload of multiple projects/analysis effectively.
Basic understanding of healthcare knowledge, such as use of coding data, basic medical terminology, and general stakeholder understanding.
Must be detailed and quality oriented.
Must demonstrate a high level of accuracy.
Ability to work with multiple levels of the organization.
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint is required.
Familiar with Mini Tab & QI Macros
Responsibilities:
Provides ongoing workforce management-related expertise and support to the Clinical Operations Division.



Performs analytical review of data and provides information and recommendations to leadership.



Monitors financial performance and reviews division’s charges for accuracy and opportunities for revenue growth and expense reduction.



Compiles, reviews and submits quality, regulatory and workforce data to external entities: Action OI, etc.



Researches and analyzes external benchmarking data to ensure the division is appropriately utilizing its resources.



Provides analytical support to Clinical Operations Leadership including operational analysis, financial analysis, assistance with business plans, ROI, etc.



Assists with the development of the Nursing Division’s financial budgets and helps monitor financial performance.




Assists with revenue cycle initiatives to ensure the division is appropriately maximizing its revenue potential.



Assists with the data analytic function of division’s process improvement initiatives such as data extractions, control charts, regression analysis, etc.



Interprets mathematical and statistical results into meaningful and actionable information for stakeholders.



Actively supports and reflects the Mission, Vision and Values of MHS.



Performs other related work as required or requested.

Description:

Job Summary

The responsibilities of the Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst will be to understand the metrics and systems driving the business, cultivate data from various sources and present useful reports and data visualizations. To enable operational excellence, the need for meticulous, real-time KPIs and financial statistics has become essential to maximize company performance. The Business Intelligence Analyst will assist Tangent in reaching new growth goals by improving transparency throughout our operations. The successful candidate will be a driven, self-starter, and competitive with 4-7 years of business intelligence oversight experience using data visualization tools. This position will report directly to the Director of IT.

Role and Responsibilities

Engage with business partners, understand needs from KPIs, business results, industry sources and customer information then translate requirements into data driven views or reports
Responsible for maintaining a portfolio of reports in multiple formats and platforms, keeping them current, efficient and usable
Mines and manages data from various sources within databases, data warehouses or data lakes. Extraction and translation of data through BI tools such as Domo, Power BI and SSIS.
Development and support of reports, views, dashboards and metrics using BI tools such as Domo and SSRS that provide business insight and aid decision making
Analyze data that must be organized efficiently and effectively, in an easily accessible manner with a high attention to detail
Assist with the management of Infor SyteLine SQL data, SyteLine reporting and document delivery
Troubleshoots and resolves database issues to ensure data integrity
Maintain documentation of any processes, including development and implementation of effective training materials for users
Requirements:

Required skills/abilities

Strong understanding of SQL. Experience with scripting, Python or R
Experience with visualization tools like Domo, PowerBI or Tableau
Uses statistical methods, modeling, analytical methodologies and data analysis
Database administration or performance optimization
ERP experience. Infor SyteLine or Epicor a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to perform quantitative and qualitative analysis
Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Education and experience

Bachelor’s degree in business information systems, Finance, Computer Science or similar
4-7 years business intelligence oversight
A keen eye for trends and correlating data to business fundamentals
Self-motivated and comfortable working in an independent working environment
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to present ideas

Reporting to the VP, Club Sales, you will provide strategic analysis, business reporting, and project management at a field and executive level. You will develop high impact projects and field level reporting across all departments, ensuring agreement on deliverables and allocation of resources. You will develop relationships across all levels and geographies to maintain the cultural pulse of our performance.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

STRATEGIC PLANNING AND ANALYSIS

Contribute to the development of our long-term strategic missions, goals, and appropriate metrics across business segments.

Develop goal tracking and business metric dashboards

Evaluate proper use and allocation of resources across business segments and provide solutions

Engage and secure leadership partnerships both internally and externally

Provide analysis of our goals; identify helpful and harmful factors contributing to their success

Develop scorecards, trackers, tools, and reports that help teams in assessing national and regional performance.

Support replenishment and PO management across organization ensuring execution and delivery metrics are met.

Coordinate important projects with regions to close opportunity gaps, implement trial programs to quickly test strategic direction.

Provide qualitative analytic support on projects requiring financial or data analysis.

BUSINESS PROCESS IMPROVEMENT

Work with department and headquarter leads to evaluate and improve current business and role processes and provide recommendations to leadership on improvements, automation, or new capability opportunities.

Develop improvements to national accounts business projects and annual BP process to increase focus, efficiency, accountability and empowerment with the field and ensure agreement across all levels of the business

Help identify performance gaps across the mass business and provide solutions to close gaps that increase efficiency and growth.

Provide strategic analysis and important project management at LT and field level.


PROJECT MANAGEMENT



Provide support from project development to implementation including business case proposals, budgeting, scheduling, forecasting, and reporting results.

Partner with project leaders to manage documentation and tracking of project milestones, schedules, and resource needs

Enhance project management methodologies ensuring that a streamlined process exists, and ensure that projects are implemented and delivered to meet standards.

EXPERIENCE

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

2+ years of experience in an analytical or project management role
Project management experience
Understanding of P&L, business drivers, and interactions
Understanding of business insights/ category management principles
Bachelors in Business, Marketing, Finance or related field preferred or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree
Must be fluent in English, additional languages an advantage
Travel 0-10%
Permanent
Benefits eligible

Core Job Responsibilities:

Assist in defining, developing, and preparing business requirements for strategic projects. Drive process improvements and efficiencies throughout the project lifecycle.

Stay current on changes and improvements to project management and business analysis methodologies, as well as understand technology solution best practices being implemented at Modern Woodmen.
Keep the Manager, Enterprise Program Management Office, abreast of business analysis schedules, employee performance concerns or issues that affect the Business Analyst function.

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate and translate business needs through to technical objectives.
Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with peers, employees, and management.
High degree of adaptability and tolerance for ambiguity.
Strong leadership abilities to coach employees to accomplish strategic goals and related tasks, recruit, select, train, motivate and manage employee performance.

The annual pay range for this position is $70,000 - $80,000. The specific rate will depend on the successful candidate’s qualifications and prior experience.

REQ# 31551

Position Overview

The Illinois Department of Children and Family Services is seeking an organized, professional, and results oriented individual with strong clinical assessment and thinking skills to serve as Qualitative Case Reviewer. Under direction, this position will coordinate and conduct evaluations of Department programs and services to include child protection, resources, and child welfare operations. The position will conduct comprehensive reviews of case records, court reports, progress reports, external evaluations, assessments, etc. The position will also interview case-specific internal and external stakeholders to evaluate the overall quality of services being provided and achievement of outcomes to children and families served by the Department and community-based partners. Additionally, the position will synthesize information resulting from case record reviews and interviews into a coherent, comprehensive, accurate story about each case, reflecting the needs of individuals served and whether those needs were met. This position provides a great opportunity for someone who is interested in playing a role in ensuring that quality services are provided to children and families served by the Department. DCFS offers a competitive compensation plan, excellent benefits, and a pension program. The ideal candidate for this position will have excellent writing skills, the ability to accurately, clearly, and concisely present the facts of the case, and the ability to defend his/her position on whether outcomes are being achieved. The ideal candidate must also have high expectations for casework practice and the achievement of outcomes for children and families. We invite you to join our innovative team to help make a positive difference in the lives of the children and families of Illinois.

Job Responsibilities

Serves as Quality Enhancement Support Team Review Specialist

Provides regular case consultation in meetings with managers, field supervisors, caseworkers, and investigators, making recommendations to address negative trends and performance deviations and to facilitate greater consistency and continuity throughout the life of the case

Creates individual team profiles of assigned Department teams on a quarterly basis, including information on both work processes and outcomes

Provides input and makes recommendations to the Field Review Supervisor relative to policies, procedures, and/or rules impacting field review and operations

Identifies to management those benchmarks, timelines, or indicators found to be out of compliance

Attends and provides input into various meetings

Performs other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the duties enumerated above

Minumum Qualifications

Requires knowledge, skill, and mental development equivalent to completion of four years college, supplemented by a master’s degree in business or public administration, with coursework in areas such as economic theory, accounting and finance, organizational theory, and operations research

Requires three years of progressively responsible professional experience in management operations analysis

Preferred Qualifications

3 years of professional experience working with and counseling families and children in child welfare services, child protective investigations, or child welfare licensing services

Completion of a master’s degree in social work or a related human services field

3 years of experience navigating an electronic case record system and utilizing the Microsoft Office Suite of products in an office setting in a public or private organization

3 years of professional experience in a public or business organization utilizing extensive knowledge of the application and conduct of management studies

3 years of professional experience in a public or business organization utilizing the ability to analyze problems and develop systems of action

3 years of professional experience in a public or business organization utilizing the ability to present ideas clearly, both orally and in writing

3 years of professional experience in a public or business organization utilizing the ability to work closely with staff and management professionals in planning and developing assignments and conducting management studies

Conditions of Employment

Requires ability to pass a background check.

Requires ability to travel in the performance of duties. Requires appropriate, valid driver’s license.

The conditions of employment listed here are incorporated and related to any of the job duties as listed in the job description.

About the Agency

DCFS is deeply committed to the welfare and protection of children. Our goal is to protect children by strengthening and supporting families. In every effort, from receiving hotline calls to reaching family reunification or foster care and adoption, children and families are our focus.

Primary Responsibilities:

The Supply Chain Business Intelligence Analyst will be reporting to the Manager, Supply Chain Solutions. The purpose of this position is to support supply chain business analysis requirements, projects and initiatives. The supply chain analyst will work with business partners to design, implement tools & dashboards, and provide data analysis to assist partners with making strategic business decisions. As with all positions at KeHE, we expect that all actions will be consistent with KeHE’s Mission, Vision and Values.

Essential Functions:
DUTIES, TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Define, analyze and track metrics, provide recommendations and business insights based on trends, patterns and gaps to the business partners to improve the key metrics.
Ability to extract data through SQL, DAX, develop reports, queries from various databases (Microsoft SQL, Power BI, Microsoft Access, Cognos) and summarize insights to assist in decision-making for all levels within Supply Chain.
Applies expertise in data mining, quantitative analysis and data visualization to tell a compelling story behind the numbers.
Utilize multiple tools to build & maintain data warehouses, data views, reports, & dashboards utilizing relational databases & data warehouses
Help Supply Chain arrive at business decisions by providing efficient data visualizations. Simplifying business insights and recommendations of complex problems is a key requirement of the role.
Thorough understanding of different roles within the organization Supply Chain and think innovatively automate data needs for these roles.
Experience in key supply chain and operations functions including such as demand planning, purchasing, inbound and outbound logistics, and distribution.
Partner with business teams to gather, document and maintain business system requirements that will inform data modeling decisions for and research and root cause issues that arise.
Validate & perform end to end testing of all work prior to client deployment.
Partner with IT on data requirements needed to support the build of data models. High level understanding of data engineering and ETL mechanisms to transfer data between different databases or data warehouses.
Ability to work with data scientists and understand or interpret the results from various statistical algorithms and also apply the results towards Supply Chain KPI improvement.
Coordinate data feeds and updates
Support any other identified supply chain/logistcis projects.
Other duties and projects as assigned.
Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, Aptitude:
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:
Comfortable taking loosely defined business questions and translating them into clearly defined technical/data/report specifications
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to manage large volumes of data.
Proactive and assertive in follow-through with colleagues and business partners.
Proven ability to effectively manage a wide variety of tasks simultaneously and often with time conflicting pressures.
Possess a sense of urgency and high attention to accuracy and detail.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to write clear and concise business communication.
Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes.
Ability to understand and translate moderately technical concepts verbally and in writing.
An ability to evaluate complex issues and develop actionable plans
Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
A four-year college degree in Business or related field is required i.e. business, finance, math, economics.
2-4 years of experience in an analytical role preferably in supply chain or logistics
Basic understanding of transportation, warehousing, supply-chain execution software and third-party logistics.
Experience with analytic software applications, i.e. Power BI, Tableau, Excel, Access, COGNOS
Experience with development of visuals and dashboards/scorecards using Power BI.

Job Details

Description

Who We Are

Milliman Financial Risk Management LLC (Milliman FRM)—an SEC registered investment advisor—is a global market leader in risk management and hedging support services. The Milliman FRM team is passionate about transforming the way the world manages portfolio risk and plans for retirement. Established in 1998, the Milliman FRM practice includes more than 100 professionals from around the world, operating from three trading platforms (Chicago, London, and Sydney). This global platform allows the firm to monitor and maintain hedge portfolios around the clock greater than US$600 billion in underlying account value.

What You Will Do

As part of the Trade Operations Group, you will be responsible for enhancing the efficiency and reliability of our Middle and Back Office operations through automation and systemization. You will be involved in designing and building scalable solutions for trade lifecycle processes as well as assisting with data management strategy. You will also be involved in supporting the day-to-day trading operations for our clients.

You will:

Perform root cause analysis on current infrastructure design weaknesses and provide feedback on future state design.
Work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders to help design and deploy a data operating model across the front, middle and back offices.
Identify, perform analysis, and resolve trade and settlement breaks.
Oversee high level account balances and margin requirements; execute transfers to meet margin requirements.
Work directly with counterparties, custodians, banks and other interested parties to ensure all actions on behalf of the client are resolved and reconciled in a timely manner.
Produce and distribute reporting to clients and third-party service providers.
Collaborate with other areas of support including Governance & Risk Management, Portfolio Management, Capital Markets and Trading, Actuarial, Trading Technology and Legal/Compliance
Create procedures and document process flows.
Additional responsibilities as group continues to expand in business and complexity.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, or other relevant programs of study
1-3 years of experience in treasury, trade, or investment operations
VBA knowledge strongly desired
Prior experience in data management that may include data design, governance, operations or architecture. Experience with SQL, Python, and other programming languages a plus
Basic to Intermediate knowledge of one or more of the following products: Futures, Listed Options, Cleared OTC Derivatives, Fixed Income (Bonds and ETFs), Mutual Funds, UIT(s), Equities, and Bilateral Non-Cleared OTC Derivatives.
Basic to Intermediate knowledge of cash and collateral management in one or more of the following areas: FCM Margin (Futures, Cleared OTC), PB / Portfolio Margining, Reg T, OTC Collateral including US/EU/APAC Reg IM and FX.
Experience with managing different aspects of the post trade life cycle from beginning to termination including allocation, confirmation, reconciliation, clearing settlement, valuations/exposure management, and corporate actions for Derivatives, Fixed Income, or Equity products in domestic and international markets.

Experience and Soft Skills Required

Experience with Acadia, TriResolve or TriOptima platforms is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where the client is always our first priority.
Proven record of reliability and dedication to high quality work
Sharp critical thinking skills, sound judgment, and decision making ability
Both the ability and willingness to clearly articulate your ideas and provide and accept feedback
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work both collaboratively and independently

Additional Knowledge and Skills to Build

Sharp critical thinking skills, sound judgment and decision-making ability, and both the ability and willingness to clearly articulate your ideas
Demonstrated aptitude for quantitative and critical thought
Experience with financial markets, mutual funds, portfolio management, and derivatives
Experience coding complex projects in VBA
Experience working with databases (SQL, Access)
Experience coding in C#, Python or R.



Candidates hired into this role will be required to work in-person in the Milliman office in Chicago, IL on a weekly basis, but flexible work arrangements will be considered.

Air Refueling Operations Intelligence and Acquisition Analyst

The Opportunity:

As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe.

As an Intelligence and Acquisition Analyst, you will bring in-depth understanding and expertise in multiple intelligence disciplines, including GEOINT, SIGINT, and MASINT. You’ll perform research and apply advanced analytical principles, concepts, and methods to identify and analyze complex multi-source intelligence information. You will provide Intelligence support to assure that threat requirements impacting future air refueling systems are identified and recommend solutions for identified gaps. Travel to client sites as required to meet with key stakeholders, participate in working groups, and support information road shows.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience with multi-source intelligence support

Experience with supporting Combat Air Force (CAF) or Mobility Air Force (MAF) domains

Experience with IC research tools and databases

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Top Secret clearance

HS diploma or GED

Nice If You Have:

Experience with Air Refueling operations

Experience with program management offices

Experience with DoD Acquisition policy, guidance, and processes

Knowledge of performing analysis of alternatives

Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills

Bachelor's degree in a science or engineering field preferred

Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.

Position Overview:

The Sales Analyst is a critical role supporting the Sales Team to grow our business and establish relationships with our customers. As part of the role, the analyst will capture and organize relevant data into actionable insights that support sales priorities and initiatives including customer planning and forecasting. This position will report to the Director of Sales Capabilities.

Able to compile, analyze and clearly communicate analytical findings of large amounts of data.
Provide ad hoc analytical support and insight generation.
Track pricing including pricing changes with both customers and the competition.
Capture assortment changes and translate into shipment impact, performance vs. expectations.
For new items, validate forecast volumes, track shipments vs. forecast post launch, as well as set-up and manage product inquiries.
Engage in S&OP process to provide input to monthly and annual forecasts, including supporting forecasts of new items.
Pull monthly P&L reports, highlight drivers and drags for channels and assist in pricing quotes.
Support the development of customer presentations leveraging PowerPoint.
Attend and support customer meetings and trade shows as needed.
Act as point of contact for internal and external communications to and from the customers and other departments; cross-functional liaison to the other departments and a secondary contact when the salesperson is traveling.
Provide sales and customer POV when collaborating with cross functional partners including Marketing, Finance, Demand Planning and Customer Service

2+ years of relevant experience

Demonstrated proficiency in Office applications, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Experience with BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau
Strong presentation skills
Strong ability to work effectively and collaborate across the organization
Experience supporting forecasting efforts
SAP experience is a plus
Ability to occasionally travel for customer meetings and events

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Description:

The Senior Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. Manages the supporting data infrastructure strategy and data, metadata, and metric documentation requirements.

Develops and maintains the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Directly accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, guiding and empowering the team to deliver a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Team processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Develop and coach teams to be effective in their roles and able to identify, manage, and escalate risk. Effectively manage the team to be adherent to regulatory obligations, policy, standard, and procedure obligations, as well as managing inherent risks directly related to the team.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Builds a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related field

8+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading business intelligence teams to develop optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related.

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading data visualization teams using industry leading Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Qlikview to develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related.

In lieu of a degree, 12+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

Strong Tableau Development Skills (Tableau Suite: Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep Builder, Conductor)

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Familiarity with data infrastructure processes, designs, and tools (e.g. ETL)

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $100,500.00 to $170,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Benefits:

We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:

Paid Parental Leave

Paid Time Off

401(k) Plan

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

JOB DESCRIPTION

As aSenior Business Operations Analyst(AKA: Sr. Business Analyst),you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

This position requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem solving abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations. You will be responsible for analyzing data, identifying trends, and providing and presenting strategic insights that will enable data driven decision-making. We are looking for a proactive professional with a strong analytical and collaborative mindset, excellent organizational and communication skills, and an interest in Operations. As a Senior BusinessAnalyst, you will have regular interactions with stakeholders and functional business unit leaders and will have the opportunity to impact important go-forward business decisions. Each day will be unique, requiring an ability to think strategically and on your feet, be creative, take initiative, and employ a diverse set of skills.

WHO YOU ARE

Knowledgeable, Analytical, and Solution-Oriented.
Without a doubt, you ve got strong quantitative skills and are comfortable analyzing large data sets, spotting trends and patterns, and synthesizing relevant observations.
Intellectually Curious.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, and regularly seek to understand.You're inherently interested in the "why" so that you can identify opportunities that represent unconventional solutions to the problems you are trying to solve.
Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are concise, articulate, and effective, providing an ability to interact with all levels/various teams across the organization, be understood, and develop trust and rapport within the organization. You are facile with creating and communicating a clear project plan, tracking progress, and keeping your business partners in the loop along the way.
Technologically Savvy.
Microsoft Excel is a basic tool to you that you know like the back of your hand. You also have a strong skill set in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools and techniques.
A Trusted Team Player.
You enjoy partnering with others and build constructive working relationships that foster the collaboration necessary to deliver great results. You are accountable to your teammates and follow through on commitments.
Organized and Confident.
You are flexible, composed, and able to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously, while confidently interacting with a variety of individuals, across all levels of the organization. You handle pressure well and do so with confidence.

WHAT YOU LL DO

Perform moderate to complex research and analyses
by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include internal operational and financial data (as well as relevant external data), coupled with feedback from business partners, in order to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights.
Develop presentations and share findings
, as well as recommendations.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to answer ad-hoc business questions
and drive business decisions.
Track, analyze, and report on KPIs
used to determine operational performance, staffing needs, productivity, or other measures deemed valuable to the business.
Research and present options for achieving desired metric-driven outcomes
to operations business partners.
Partner with the greater Data Analytics team
on necessary report development, modification, or enhancements.
Identify and utilize resources
within the various departments and platforms to deliver information and quantifiable financial detail.
Utilize Equity Residential systems and software to create and run reports
to aid on the analysis of performance.
Act as a trusted advisor
to the COO and VP of Revenue, providing valuable insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
Partner and collaborate with Operations leadership and Regional teams
to drive cross functional initiatives that deliver impactful results.
Ask critical questions
, create alternatives, react to changes in business conditions,
and propose actionable outcomes.
Stay up to date on new technologies and trends
relevant to the multifamily real estate industry.
Support special projects and ad hoc requests,
as needed.


PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree required, preferably in math, finance, statistics, business or related discipline is required
5+ years of experience in an analytics role. Real estate experience preferred.
Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Strong attention to detail and ability to think critically/conceptually.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Excel, and data visualization required. Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies is also a must.
Must be able to effectively organize and prioritize workload for numerous projects/tasks simultaneously.
Must be able to exhibit flexibility, working with different teams in multiple and diverse work environments.
Effective written and verbal communication skills required.
PrimaryLocation Chicago, IL, United States ABOUT THE TEAM As a Senior Business Operations Analyst (AKA: Sr. Business Analyst), you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Business Analyst in Chicago, IL.

Position Summary

As a member of the Operations, Administration team, the Financial Analyst-Operations Administration, position is responsible for supporting the Procurement, Facilities and Operations functions on matters pertaining to accounting and procurement. To include annual budgeting, facilitating procurement activity across the enterprise and conducting 1st line of defense financial oversight for the Operations and adjoining areas. Primary Accountabilities



Assists in the development and monitoring of the annual budgets for the Procurement, Facilities and Operations functions.
Participates directly in establishing and maturing the bank’s newly formed Procurement function across the enterprise.

Demonstrated ability to learn and utilize new software and programs.
Experience in Procurement for a service organization is a plus.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, with a strong focus on Excel and PowerPoint.

Summary:
Job Summary:
At our Company, we grow People, Brands, and Businesses! We are seeking a dedicated Senior Business Analyst to support the National Director of Retail Operations to make a discernible difference across operations with accurate and insightful data analysis. As a Business Analyst at Advantage Solutions, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that drive informed business decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and implement effective solutions. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with excellent analytical and communication skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable recommendations.

What we offer:
Full-Time Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life)
401(k) with company match
Training and Career Development
Unlimited Paid Time-Off

Responsibilities:
o Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and gather detailed requirements for projects and initiatives.
o Utilize analytical tools and techniques to interpret and analyze complex data sets.
o Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to provide meaningful insights.
o Evaluate existing business processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.
o Recommend and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
o Create detailed documentation of business requirements, process workflows, and system specifications.
o Ensure documentation is kept up-to-date and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
o Develop and present reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to key stakeholders.
o Identify the specific needs of the business and create user stories.
o Work in align or scrum product team environment.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
2+ years of experience in an analytical position
Analytical & problem-solving skills
Excellent time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to make oral presentations.
Strong critical thinking skills
Recommended but not requirement: Advance MS Excel, including pivot table creation, advanced formulas, vlookup function; Intermediate to advanced MS Access, including importing large data files, query creation, create macro, read/edit/write VBA in modules.


Responsibilities:
The Company is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods. The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

Job Duty

Identify, gather, and write business and functional requirements by breaking features down into user stories

Serving as the liaison between business owners and Scrum-based BI development teams

Write ad-hoc T-SQL of a complex nature to support reporting needs

Develop product ownership by continuing growth in understanding of BI reporting systems and interdependencies with other corporate and external systems, business processes, and data; identifying opportunities for documentation of tribal knowledge for long-term organizational ownership

Create indexes, tables, columns, and stored procedures as needed in our database environment

Collaborate with developers, stakeholders and subject-matter experts to establish technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs

Develop models and identify trends in support of the business using statistical analysis against data

Implement and work with Microsoft Business Intelligence and/or Tableau tools (SQL and Excel) and dashboard reports.

Direct Reports

5+ years of experience in with data mining and quantitative analysis
5+ years of experience writing complex SQL against large relational database systems, preferably

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

Microsoft SQL Server 2008 or above
Expert skills with Microsoft Excel; ability to create pivot tables, charts, and graphs; formatting documents, formatting cells, entering and modifying complex formulas, creating and modifying basic charts and graphs, and creating and modifying Pivot Tables
Ability to develop efficient and self- documenting solutions

Ability to independently read and develop in following technologies: SQL, SSIS, SSAS, and SSRS
