JOB DESCRIPTION


CB Client Onboarding - Technical Implementation VP - 603

Role Summary:

The Technical Product Implementation Vice President will be responsible for the overall client experience and project management of technical commercial product implementations. This role will contribute expertise to defining new J.P. Morgan Chase Commercial Banking solutions in conjunction with Sales, Consulting and Product teams. Manage client solutions from inception to completion within specified timeframes.

Job Responsibilities:

Participate in New Hire Training covering the introduction to our onboarding organization, project management tools, end-to-end process flows, and additional resources to help you work smarter
Engage with senior leaders to review our Vision and Strategy
Get to know your partners by attending regular calls to review active implementations
Begin to build your brand and establish valuable relationships
Understand how we implement Mixed payable solutions
Learn how support our clients with file mapping exercises
Gain knowledge & experience in utilizing our l banking tools, shadowing skilled and knowledgeable peers

Ultimately, you’ll be expected to own our Client’s Technical Onboarding experience, end-to-end. This includes:

Representing us as the client facing, technical contact responsible for a successful end-to-end client experience during complex treasury product implementations with Commercial Banking clients around the world. Managing client and internal partner expectations with consultative advice regarding technical aspects of treasury solutions including – RFP responses, client presentations and client visits. Scope client requests and translate business requirements into detailed technical specifications for treasury services. Use Microsoft Office tools to document scope, meeting agendas and minutes and project plans. Use workflow tool for status updates and document repository. Manage client and internal partner expectations by establishing timeliness and dependencies with the goal to exceed expectations. Demonstrate creative problem solving and judgement. Be empowered to escalate when support is needed to remove obstacles to success

Required Qualifications, skills and capabilities:

An appreciation for being a ‘keeper of our brand’ with 6+ years of applicable experience and a passion for delivering a consistent, stellar client and partner experience
Technical project management experience or experience with complex treasury implementations and comfort in a fast paced, dynamic client-facing environment
Ability to clearly communicate, partner and influence - leading others to a common goal
Exhibit adherence to policy and procedures and meet or exceed established SLA
Comfort in using technology such as WebEx, Zoom and other collaboration tools for enhanced client discussions
Microsoft Office Suite experience and project Management, Payments and Receivables experience or eagerness to learn
Technical Consulting or business analysis experience in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), systems integration or Application Programming Interface (API) space

Preferred qualifications, skills and capabilities:

Passion for learning new operating models, technologies, and industry trends
Technical client consulting experience to support technical roles

Joining our diverse and innovative global organization will provide you with endless opportunities for career and personal growth.

Become a part of our many Business Resource Groups, employees who come together on topics such as ethnicity, gender, age, accessibility, special interests and more
Help the community through expansive volunteer opportunities
Join one of our focus groups aimed at Innovation and Transformation, creating the future experience for our clients and employees

Some travel may be required to support various clients and coverage team

*Final Job Grade and officer title will be determined at time of offer, and may differ from this posting.*

ABOUT US

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. (If you are a US or Canadian applicant with a disability and wish to request an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us by calling the Accessibility Line (US and Canada Only) 1-866-777-4690 and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed.)

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans







ABOUT THE TEAM

Commercial Banking is focused on helping our clients succeed and making a positive difference in our communities. We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.



Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients’ needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Reporting & Analytics (Azure) Senior Consultant
Job Description:
JOB REQUISITION
Business Intelligence Reporting & Analytics (Azure) Senior Consultant
LOCATION
CHICAGO
ADDITIONAL LOCATION
JOB DESCRIPTION
Are You Ready to Live Protiviti?
The Protiviti Career provides opportunity to learn, inspire, and advance within a collaborative and diverse culture. We hire curious individuals for whom learning is a passion. Together, we focus on our mission of delivering confidence in a dynamic world – and the world has perhaps never been more dynamic.
At every level, we champion leaders who live our values of integrity, inclusion, innovation and commitment to success. Imagining our work as a journey, we believe integrity guides our way, inclusion moves us forward together, and innovation creates new destinations.

Where We Need You:
The Chicago Office is seeking an Azure Intelligent Data Platform Senior Consultant to join our growing team.
What You Can Expect:
The Senior Consultant coaches Interns, Consultants, and facilitates the successful completion of project work plans. Serving as both role model and trainer, the Senior Consultant demonstrates the attributes of excellent client service and assists team members in developing technical and professional competency. The Senior Consultant learns to identify areas of risk and opportunities to improve efficiencies. Relationships with client personnel and professional associates strengthen as the ability to communicate, gain trust and network improves. At the direction of managers, the Senior Consultant may accept responsibility for decision-making, ranging from staffing and preparation of deliverables to application of methodologies.
What Will Help You Be Successful:
You have some experience assessing, architecting, implementing, or migrating data solutions with the Microsoft Data Platform.
You enjoy identifying areas of business risk, potential technical problems, and opportunities to improve the efficiency and profitability of the client’s overall business processes.
You participate in the initiation and development of new products and services.
You are passionate about evaluating, synthesizing, organizing and interpreting data and information.
You create a positive work environment that fosters open communication among all engagement team members.
You effectively build relationships with your clients and provide them with timely top quality service.
You have an inherent interest in project management and team leadership. You seek new ways to create extraordinary development opportunities and ways for your team to make an impact on our clients and communities.
Do Your Talents Include the Following?
Ability to articulate the value of Business Intelligence solutions to customers and colleagues, and experience with data storytelling to guide decision-making.
Familiarity with the process to formulate, communicate, and execute data strategies that align with organizational goals and objectives.
Hands-on experience assessing existing data solutions, whether on-premises or in the cloud, to inform improvement initiatives.
Some knowledge of architecting future state data solutions on Azure based on the Well-Architected framework.
Exposure to planning and migrating data solutions from various sources, including on-premises, other cloud platforms, or legacy systems, to Azure.
Hands-on experience implementing ETL processes and databases on Azure.
Some experience optimizing existing data implementations, including pipelines, queries, and data models, to enhance performance and delivery of value to the business.
Practice in administering and maintaining data solutions to ensure stability, security, scalability, and affordability.
Experience with the essentials of data engineering, including data movement, data integration, transformation, and cleansing.
Ability to contribute to the design and management of data warehousing solutions that optimize data storage and retrieval.
Some skills in data modeling, including entity-relationship diagrams, dimensional modeling, and semantic modeling.
Track record of creating engaging data visualizations and interactive dashboards.
Proven ability to perform data analytics, including exploratory data analysis and leveraging data for actionable insights.
Some experience with implementing data governance frameworks and policies, including an understanding of managing data assets.
Understanding of data security practices, including encryption and access control.
Basic knowledge of networking as it applies to configuring Azure data solutions.
Some experience with of DevOps or DataOps concepts or experience with the deployment of Azure data solutions.
Hands-on experience with SQL; Bonus for any familiarity with any of the programming languages utilized within the Microsoft Data Platform stack, such as Python, C#, Java, Scala, R, DAX, MDX, or M.
Advanced certification is preferred (see Recommended Qualifications).
Bonus: Implementation experience with Data Science and/or Machine Learning.

Hands-on experience with at least 3 of these technologies:
Azure Storage
Azure Synapse Pipelines or Azure Data Factory
Azure Synapse Analytics or SQL Server Administration and Querying
Azure Databricks
Power BI
Git-based version control and deployments for Azure Data Solutions
Microsoft Purview
Microsoft Fabric
Bonus: Azure AI tooling

Your Educational and Professional Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required
3+ years in a related field; preferably in professional services and/or industry
Recommended Qualifications:
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Developer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
Exam AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions
Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert

Do You Love Exploring New Places?
Protiviti operates in a hybrid environment. Travel can occur throughout the month based upon client requests/commitments. Travel may include suburban, regional, or out of state locations.
Protiviti is not registered to hire or employ personnel in the following states – West Virginia, Alaska.

Job Title: Sr. Business Application Analyst - Salesforce (Remote) - Temp-To-Hire
Job Description:
About Us:
We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you’re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply. We’d be thrilled to receive applications from exceptional individuals like yourself.

Discover a world of endless possibilities at Gallagher Benefit Services, where you'll have the power to shape the future of workplaces across industries. As a member of our team, you become the driving force behind positive change, helping clients build environments where employees thrive. Embrace the opportunity to impact lives, unlock potential, and create a legacy of remarkable transformation.
Overview:
The Sr. Business Analyst manages business/IT related projects through the entire life-cycle from strategic scope definition to requirements gathering, analysis, timeline and budget definition, implementation support, user training and status reporting. This role also works with a variety of technical and functional partners within the business to define requirements for process improvement projects, develop required documentation and communicate status in order to ensure business requirements are met. Experience with CRM applications such as Salesforce.

Please note additional position details below:
This is a Temp-To-Hire, W-2 position. We are not able to do 1099 or C2C.
It is a fully remote role that will need to be based in the U.S.
You must meet our U.S. Eligibility requirements for work authorization as noted under "Additional Information" at the bottom of the job description.

How you will impact the Business?

You will collaborate with IT Leadership, practice area leadership, our merger partners, and external vendors.


Ensure all work is executed and detailed to keep projects moving forward.
Assist Divisional and Regional leadership with coordination of project plans, action items and communications.
Guide and assist in developing documentation for processes, including reference manuals, instructional materials, communication presentations, and support manuals.
You will develop an integrated and standardized project plan that includes status reporting, progress reports on project health and risk and issue mitigation, as well as leading project budget and resources
You will define and gather detailed functional and technical requirements, analyzes business needs, and validates solutions with our internal/external clients
Responsibilities:
Subject Matter Expertise
Serves as subject matter expert associated with content, processes, and procedures.
Identify best practices that support business performance related to efficiency and customer service to drive improvement.
Requirements Gathering
Drive requirements gathering process by meeting with project stakeholders to define business and functional requirements, prototypes, and training materials.
Work collaboratively with internal departments in the planning and analysis of requirements, process changes or enhancements.
Business Analysis
Defines detailed requirements, analyzes business needs, and validates solutions with our internal clients.
Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering technology solutions.
Retrieve and analyze data from multiple systems for trends and exceptions and help determine business impact.
Recommend solutions to problems based on business-specific facts.
Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
Exceptional Business Requirements Gathering capabilities
Superior presentation skills (in-person and utilization of web conferencing platforms)
Preferred 7+ years Business Analyst global enterprise-level experience in employee benefits insurance, financial services or related industries
Strong ability to learn, adapt and contribute in challenging environments
Self-motivated and able to work independently
Flexibility to shift priorities as needed to facilitate business requirements
Excellent oral and written communication skills (ability to grasp, breakdown and convey complex concepts and ideas)
Comfortable leading team project meetings and debriefing sessions between both C-level business executives and technical audiences
Proficient PC skills (Windows, Word, Excel, Outlook, Acrobat, etc.)
Working knowledge of financial industry terminology (e.g. retirement plans, executive benefits, investment consulting, life insurance, etc.), as well as regulations from the perspective of the SEC and FINRA organizations
Experience managing technology related projects and coordinating/collaborating between technology professionals and business executives

Communication, Analytical, and Organization Skills
Strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills
Must be independent, self
motivated, and goal and people oriented
Proactive approach with attention to detail and proven ability to follow through

Work Execution
Change agent with ability to influence others outside of a direct reporting relationship
Proven relationship building skills and high energy level
Co-operative with colleagues, strong consultative approach working closely with IT and business constituents at all levels
Supports execution of business unit goals and Dominant Priorities

Standards and Practices
Ability to manage/balance multiple priorities
Assigns work and manages projects on a timely basis
Excels in a self-service environment and has a “no job is too small” attitude

Use of Time
Ability to lead and participate in cross functional team based projects
Can manage/balance multiple priorities
Can prioritize and manage through constant change

Customer Service and Business Strategy
Commitment to and record of strong customer service
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to translate short-term business goals into team and individual performance goals
Ability to conduct performance management discussions
Excellent customer focus
Excels at understanding and articulating strategy, positioning and messaging

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, Engineering or related field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite & Outlook
Expertise using common project management and flowchart software (MS Project, Easy Projects, DevOps, MS Visio, Gantt Charts, etc.)
Additional Information:

We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including: medical/dental/vision plans, life and accident insurance, 401(K), employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function), training programs, matching gift program, and more.

Job Title: Associate Client Manager, Business Intelligence (US GfK & NIQ INTERNAL ONLY)
Job Description:
Company Description


REFID772355

Must be physically located within the US

Please kindly note, the following job advertisement is intended exclusively for internal combined-Company existing employees of NIQ & GfK. If you are not an existing NIQ or GfK employee, we regret to inform you that your application for this position will not be considered. However, we encourage you to explore other opportunities that align with your qualifications and career aspirations within our organization.



Job Description


NielsenIQ's Business Intelligence Analytics Team works with companies to provide regular reporting, insights and thought leadership. Our insights help clients set pricing strategies, launch new products, and determine what products you ultimately see on the shelf and online. Our Business Intelligence team members are experts on NielsenIQ Solutions and Services and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients.

Be curious. Be collaborative. Be forward thinking. Join the Business Intelligence Team and work with our clients as a consultant, a problem solver, the voice of NielsenIQ at our clients.

When you join the NielsenIQ team, you’re signing up for an experience that requires flexibility, curiosity, and passion.

Responsibilities

Using your consultative expertise, previous Business Intelligence experience, and familiarity with NielsenIQ data, you will develop purposeful business insights to help your client make action-oriented business decisions. You have well-honed consulting skills that enable you to establish credibility with senior client leadership and deliver measurable business results.

Support achievement of external Joint Business Plan with client for assigned solution or area
Support achievement of internal Joint Business Plan with Sales Leaders & Practice Areas for assigned solution or area
Apply market and industry knowledge with client expertise to conduct issue-based analyses that deliver proactive insights and action-oriented recommendations
Establish positive client relationships through consistent delivery of on-time reporting and insights
Identify sales opportunities for NielsenIQ Services and Solution to help client achieve strategic objectives
Participate in collaborative cross account forums to create and promote the development of best practices
Achieve targeted goals for client retention, expansion, satisfaction, and advocacy
Work closely with functional teams to ensure client needs are being prioritized and addressed appropriately



Qualifications


Bachelor's degree
Proficiency in Business Intelligence Tools (Discover, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python)
2-3 years’ applicable industry experience: CPG/ FMCG, consulting, information, technology, and analytics
Strong Analytical aptitude
Proficiency with demonstrated expertise in syndicated data analysis (NielsenIQ, IRI, Kantar)
Collaborating with teams and working in a matrixed environment
Highly Proficient in a variety of Software Solutions and Digital Technologies: Microsoft applications including Excel and PowerPoint
Strong logic, deductive reasoning, problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to communicate NielsenIQ solutions that help our clients meet strategic goals
Strong project management skills & "story-telling" abilities
Skilled at developing relationships with clients to become a trusted and value-added business partner
Excellent oral and written communication skills and strong presentation skills, particularly with clients
Retailer knowledge, including knowledge of consumer and category insights a plus

Additional Information


Our Benefits

Flexible working environment
Health insurance
Parental leave
Life assurance

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™.

NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com.

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook




Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.

Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/

NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

Location: Des Plaines, IL Category: Staff Posted On: Thu May 11 2023 Job Description:



Basic Function and Responsibilities:

The Senior Business Analyst/Software Developer completes all phases of enterprise systems development including business case justification, requirements definition, system design through prototyping, code development and testing, documentation, user training, and software evaluation.

Characteristic Duties and Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze, and document business and user requirements related to the new development or enhancement of critical business systems.

Design, build and modify applications (including analysis and coding), using the appropriate programming language and tool set.

Design and develop user-friendly interfaces to systems, applications, and databases.

Recommend and develop modifications to third party software to meet user needs.

Verify (test) programs and applications utilizing appropriate test plans, data, and procedures.

Prepare and maintain system and user documentation and procedures.

Provide ongoing support for production systems and assist with the resolution of production problems.

Work with User Services and Networking & Operations personnel in understanding the functions and procedures of the supported systems; support user and technical staff training on developed applications.

Develop and maintain documentation, including program operating procedures, program changes and other relevant information to accompany designs and changes to codes developed or modified.

Complete work according to project plans and time frames.

Perform other job-related duties as assigned.


Job Requirements:


Qualifications:

Three years Oracle database programming experience, preferably with PL/SQL, or an alternate report development tool, Oracle Reports C, C++, or Java.

Attention: Insurance Professionals and Business Analysts!

Preferred Risk Insurance Services is seeking a bright and highly motivated Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for developing test scripts, testing, and qualifying software for various products and releases on different platforms. This individual is responsible for ensuring that software functionality meets or exceeds requirements, with the highest quality from the companies' perception. The Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Analyst will work on a team of analysts to learn our business and full life-cycle analysis, using testing tools and quality practices to deliver end-to-end customer satisfaction.





Duties and Responsibilities

Learn the functionality of the insurance administration system being implemented and serve as a functional expert to help the business identify the best ways to use the system.
Work with the business subject matter experts to define business requirements and document them using the defined process.
Work with the business subject matter experts to define requirements for forms and map the data contained in the form.
Work with outside vendors to define requirements for integrations and map the data required for the request and response to that vendor.
Assist in triage of issues coming from production or testing.
Write and execute test cases for functional testing using the standardized process and tools.
Work closely with developers, product owners, vendors and business SMEs to define effective solutions in the system being implemented; design test cases to ensure solutions are working as expected.
Support the business in conducting User Acceptance Testing.
Perform peer review on work products produced by other business analysts.
Make recommendations on acceptable risks in the application.
Track and provide Status and Metric Reports as requested.




Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Insurance Industry experience (Underwriting, Claims and other areas considered) or two years of experience as a Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Analyst
Bachelor's Degree - Business and IT Majors
Ability to use standard project tools including Microsoft Office, Jira and SharePoint
Ability to proactively communicate and escalate issues
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple releases and priorities being worked at the same time

Competitive Salaries

And so much more!

John Crane is a global leader in rotating equipment solutions, supplying engineered technologies and services to process industries. Job Description


Job Description

This role will support the Morton Grove Plant Manager in reviewing the integrity of the business system data and in supplying accurate and timely key performance indicators (KPI’s). Support the Operations Director in the interpretation of the data and delivery to senior management in order to identify areas of opportunity and to drive cost saving and efficiency initiatives, develop and manage value added financial analysis and reporting and measuring performance to goals.

Duties & Responsibilities

Assist senior management to understand positive/negative trends and to identify areas of opportunity.
Provide high-level detail and analysis to senior management for special projects such as production scheduling, insourcing of product and staffing levels.
Analyze the integrity of the data inputted into the QAD MRP system and work with department managers and supervisors to correct discrepancies and drive process improvement.
Be a part of several continuous improvement teams/projects to help drive a positive change in operational efficiency and accuracy.
Utilize analytical skills to assist in the operational monthly rolling forecast and annual budget process.
Support operations in generating and quantifying savings opportunities as well as support to management in the implementation of cost reduction initiatives.
Monitor and validate operational efficiency saving initiatives.
Prepare for publication monthly financial and business schedules/charts required as part of the book utilized for monthly operations business review meeting held by senior management.
Participate in monthly financial performance reviews with each Business Unit manager
Assist with Capital Investment Project and any special manufacturing operations requests by preparing the appropriate cash flow analysis documents to ensure adequate financial data for obtaining investment approval by senior management.
Oversee approved Capital Investment Project spend until placed in service and perform return on investment analysis as required.
Lend support of newly developed operational key performance metrics that are reported at a global level.
Assist in generating and publishing weekly, monthly and fiscal year-end schedules and reports required.
Assist in continuous improvements to the monthly and annual forecasting/budgeting process.
Develop and maintain and utilize SQL queries to enhance the process of analyzing data as required. Utilize tables within access for quick data extractions when feasible.


Qualifications


The Individual

Bachelor’s Degree in Operations, Engineering, Business Administration, cost accounting or related field.
A minimum of 3+ years of professional experience in an analyst role. Preferably Operations, cost accounting, Inventory or Project management in a manufacturing environment.
Experience working with MRP system; QAD preferred
Experience with is TM1 is required
Strong analytical, problem solving and presentation skills.
SQL writing experience is preferred
Strong Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel demonstrating a working knowledge of pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s and other Excel functions & formulas. PowerPoint. Ability to use SQL or Crystal report writer is preferred although the ability to develop reports would be a plus.
Excellent analytical, communication and influencing skills (both written and oral).
Proven ability to work well under pressure to tight deadlines while maintaining a high level of accuracy and focus.

Seeking a self-starter willing to drive change, positive outlook and detail oriented

About Us: Altair Advisers is an independent wealth advisory firm providing investment management, financial planning and client education services. We counsel a select
group of individuals, families, foundations and endowments. As a fiduciary, we serve as an advocate for our clients, providing objective advice and comprehensive guidance across all aspects of our clients’ financial lives.
Position Summary: The Client Operations Analyst is part of the Client Operations team, a group whose purpose is to carry out various investment-related tasks assigned by the firm’s consultants. The Analyst will work primarily with Altair’s consulting team, third-party account custodians, and third-party investment managers. There will also be some interaction with the firm’s clients during the course of completing their responsibilities. Analysts are required to be accountable for their queue of tasks for an assigned set of Altair clients. Some of the more common duties and responsibilities performed by the Client Operations Analyst include:

Responsibilities
Implement new client accounts
Prepare all paperwork necessary to specific needs (custodial contracts, manager forms, client information sheets, transfer forms, termination letters for existing managers, cost basis requests and other various authorization letters)
Other new client implementation processes
Facilitate and track account transfers
Monitor transfers of cash/securities to ensure completion
Reconcile assets and cost basis at new custodian/account
Manage tasks to effect portfolio reallocations according to instructions provided by consulting staff, including:
Buy or sell Mutual Funds, ETFs, stocks
Raise cash from investment managers
Transfer money among accounts
Coordinate with custodial banks and separate account managers to establish client accounts
Review and approve contracts prepared by the Client Operations Associate
Send new client information sheets and any supporting documents to the manager
Monitor and ensure sub-account openings in specific foreign markets for global accounts
Prepare & process updates to client account information
Act as liaison between consultants and custodians/managers
Arrange & facilitate movement of funds between client accounts, money managers and custodians
Request cash disbursements (including wire transfers, journals, moneylinks) and security transfers
Implement trading instructions for ETFs, Mutual Funds and Stocks
Coordinate with investment managers for the availability of cash and securities for transfer
Review and approve wire instructions to/from hedge funds and other limited partnerships
Facilitation of requests
Willingness and ability to communicate with clients to carry out administrative and routine requests from clients regarding wire transfers, change of address and other matters
Account Maintenance
Perform updates to account profile information, including addresses, legal titles, authorized signers, trustees, web access, reinvestment options, beneficiaries, etc.
Facilitate Interclass Exchanges and Corporate Actions processing
Close client accounts
Prepare all necessary paperwork
Monitory any related transfers and reconcile as needed
Monitor account closing process
Monitor, track and retain all paperwork as needed
Assist in training new members of the team
Perform other client portfolio duties and tasks as assigned
Independent project work
Participate in projects for the consultant group such as compiling client data into a central database; reviewing documentation for each client to determine if documentation is missing; preparing such documentation as necessary to form a complete permanent record
To improve various processes as deemed necessary by Client Operations Team & Client Operations Manager
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferred
3+ years of experience in the financial or professional services industry
Preferably in an operational or service capacity at a RIA, family office, investment manager or brokerage firm
Prior experience working with an investment custodian, broker/dealer, or investment manager
Proficiency with Microsoft Office; Outlook, Word, Excel, Adobe Reader and SharePoint
Excellent communication and organizational skills needed to carry-out instructions which may change after submission
Meticulous attention to detail
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal and verbal communications skills to keep team members informed of progress and overall workload
Ability to work in both an independent and a team environment to ensure adequate coverage
Candidate must be prepared, willing and able to:
Prioritize workload so as to meet critical same-day deadlines
Accountability, organization and time-management skills are a must
Manage competing deadlines for different Altair clients at the same time
Manage increased volumes at the end of each year, as well as during global portfolio rebalancing

Description

There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?

We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Product Owner - IT holds a central position in each of the product/application development cycle with an in depth knowledge of Airlines operations. A key strategist in developing functionality, based on full understanding of specific business functions, taking into account all of the associated business & technical dependencies involved. Excellent communicator with outstanding analytical skills in order to collaborate with business users, technology teams and leadership in an Agile environment. Drives agile development & testing teams by creating detailed requirements in the form of user stories from inception to delivery. Builds vision and create roadmaps, based on business priorities, supervise and manage progress of the product deliverables. High-level knowledge of the system design architecture to facilitate discussions needed for systematic updates to technical components, that deliver key functionalities to the user. Possesses deep knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies, DevOps & Quality Assurance processes.

Translates high level business requirements into detailed requirements (user stories) to be consumed by development pods in each sprint, while ensuring stories and features are added iteratively to the product to add overall value
Manages a story backlog to ensure readiness of user stories for the upcoming sprint and creates acceptance criteria that is clear, concise and actionable
Contributes to overall definition of strategy and scope, including working with stakeholders to understand ‘why’ we are working on something before development begins
Works closely with business partners and business analysts to ensure that business requirements are translated into accurate, actionable user stories
Works with User Experience (UX) analysts to ensure prototypes convey story intent
Works with Dev and QA to understand the boundaries of any given story
Finds opportunities for improvement across product, process and team
Analyzes data to ensure features are aligned with product goals/objectives and delivering the most business value
Provide project support during release and implementation periods

United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!

Qualifications
What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant filed is required
4-5 years digital experience required
2-3 Agile/Scrum experience preferred
2-3 years in business analyst role preferred
Experience managing project budgeting
Experience collaborating with vendors and handling vendor deliverables
Demonstrate exceptional knowledge of
SDLC processes, inputs/outputs, standards
Agile & Scrum Knowledge
Business/System requirements
DevOps Process
Airline Operations
High-level understanding of Cloud Computing
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong project organizations skill, including prioritization, planning and organization required
Able to Work with distributed teams (on shore and off) required
Ability to understand, communicate and engage effectively with multiple partners and interactions
Strong problem-solving, listening, written and verbal communication, and decision-making skills
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):
Certifications are plus
Prior Experience in Airport Operations and an understanding of how United Operations work
Deep knowledge TFS/Client or related tools

Aleysian will be the most rewarding experience of your professional life

Aleysian offers a unique opportunity to challenge yourself professionally while having a once in a lifetime chance to be at the core of a growing company. Aleysian is still a small company but we very much feel as if we are at the inflection point where major growth is set to begin. This role is vital in allowing for us to grow our team and take on more projects across more customers. As such, this is truly a key role where we are looking for someone that is able to lead engagements with limited oversight and help grow our relationship within those accounts.

Aleysian is currently seeking a Principal Consultant with Salesforce experience to work out of our Chicago office. The Principal Consultant will be responsible for leading project teams gathering requirements, designing solutions, and implementing configurations on Salesforce. The ideal candidates will have a minimum of 6 years consulting and project experience implementing Salesforce and/or other software solutions.
Responsibilities
Client delivery is paramount
Lead teams with multiple consultants on an engagement from Start to Finish, ensuring quality of work and continued growth
Able to handle Requirements Gathering and Solution Design for Salesforce Implementations to best serve a clients desired goals and addressing pain points
Must be able to handle project management planning and execution around for software implementations
Must be willing to perform hands on work throughout all phases of the project
Communicate and report project status to client leadership including budget, risks and general business issues
Respond to client needs quickly in a professional manner
Business Development
Participate in business development with prospective clients including solution definition, pre-sales, estimating, negotiating and project planning
Understand client business process and technology needs in concert with the Salesforce product to create work plans, pricing estimates, and long term program road maps
Should be motivated to look for business within your own personal network to leverage past relationships for new business
Company Culture
Need to embrace the small business culture to grow our company and contribute to our identity
Should be motivated to work in the office with the team as much as possible. This is not a remote job, and it is important that you want to work in a very team oriented environment
Qualifications
Candidates must have 6+ years of experience working in a business analyst/consulting manager role on projects dealing with Software implementation
Strong understanding of Salesforce Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Force.com Platform and other CRM technology solutions
Lead discovery workshops with Client Resources as part of project scoping, and also project delivery
Proven track record of successful project implementations as the Project Lead
Experience with Customers as the primary point of contact
Ability to travel an average of 50% (We are not at this number yet, but this is reasonable to assume we could get there shortly)
Being a part of a small company is what you make of it. The ability to grow is unparalleled, and the opportunities afforded within a small company are something that just can not be found at larger organizations. If you are someone that wants to bet on yourself, this is the perfect place for you.

About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
We are looking for a Specialist Business Architect in Northern Trusts’ Asset Servicing business.
The role of Specialist Business Architect is a senior role within the team. The successful candidate will have responsibilities across 4 competencies:
Provide a bridge between strategy & execution:
Stay connected with industry developments.
Deliver assessments that inform strategy & support improved decision making.
Collaborate with other architecture practices to lead the development of best practice and ensure consistency across the wider Asset Servicing business.
The key responsibilities of the role include:
Business Architect on large strategic initiatives, working across the business architecture methodology.
Facilitate workshops to support delivery of the Definition, Assessment and Design phases: responsible for the production of Business Architecture artifacts in all phases.
Provide oversight and mentoring of other Business Architects on assignments where multiple resources are required.
Responsible for creating & maintaining business architecture blueprints and applying business architecture techniques to deliver assessments
Support the team in continuing to enhance Business Architect methods and processes; includes collaboration with other teams helping to establish a more enterprise wide standard.
Participate in Industry groups / Trade Associations and track regulatory, market and economic trends and changes. Evaluate the impacts on Northern Trusts strategy, projects and processes.
Skills / Qualifications
Background in Securities Services / Financial Services with a good overall understanding of the relevant functions and processes within Custody including Trade & Settlements, Entitlements, Tax and Cash
Experience within an Architecture type role, on a variety of large and complex related projects impacting capabilities within Securities Services / Financial Services
Experience of working in a change environment, with knowledge of project management (Agile would be beneficial) and business analysis practices.
Experience with process mapping and process re-engineering including use of business process modelling tools.
Experience applying Domain Driven Design and Scaled Agile principles would be beneficial
Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
Reasonable accommodation
Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at
MyHRHelp@ntrs.com
.
We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

At CF Industries, our mission is to provide clean energy to feed and fuel the world sustainably. Our employees are focused on safe and reliable operations, environmental stewardship, and disciplined capital and corporate management. By joining CF, you will be part of a team that brings their varied experiences, wide-ranging knowledge and diverse talents together to deliver important work and you’ll be able to pursue complex, exciting opportunities that help you continue to grow and achieve your potential in different areas. You’ll take pride in working for a company that lives its values and where you can be yourself at work, as part of an authentic team that encourages you to share your views and opinions. Our eight manufacturing complexes in the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom, an unparalleled storage, transportation and distribution network in North America, and logistics capabilities enabling a global reach underpin our strategy to leverage our unique capabilities to accelerate the world’s transition to clean energy.

Function:

Information Technology

Job Summary:

The Sr. IT Business Systems Analyst knows how to drive initiatives of all sizes across the Business Function. You are a self-starting individual with an aptitude for creative and critical thinking. You use your business expertise and enjoy collaborating with partners and helping implement positive change.
You envision solutions that follow good data design and create insightful data visualizations to drive impactful business decisions.

You love to collaborate with techies and subject matter experts to establish the vision. You balance tradeoffs with partners between development time, usability, and performance needs. You think critically, plan and execute effectively and collaborate cross-functionally with business and IT peers. You nurture positive, professional relationships, acting as a trusted partner and a respectful challenger.

CF Industries has a cloud first IT Strategy. We've invested in the good stuff; SAP, Salesforce, Workday, Azure, ServiceNow and Tableau and the teams are working to get all our business units integrated.

:

JOB DESCRIPTION

POSITION SUMMARY
The Manager, Project Management Office position requires leadership in both business analysis and project management functions. The role is responsible for the overall management of the Information Technology Project portfolio and ensuring all projects are delivered using a “best-practice” project delivery approach and delivered within the agreed scope, time, cost and quality. This will be achieved through collaboration with business stakeholders and technical staff to gather and translate business requirements into technical definitions which will be used for implementing a solution that aligns with the CHA’s overall strategic objectives.




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Oversees the business analysis and project management of major projects. Proactively identifies projects and programs throughout the organization that can benefit from PMO support and consults with stakeholders to prioritize projects in alignment with strategic goals.
Establishes/enhances processes to manage all programs/projects/work streams effectively.
Provides leadership and guidance to the Business Analysts and Project Managers for traditional and Agile project management framework.
Establishes industry standard processes and techniques for scoping/requirements gathering and project management. Verifies and validates the program/project plans, ensuring adherence to standards and alignment with the vision.
Guides the PMO teams in continually managing project expectations. Identifies risks, oversees development of mitigation strategies, and provides objective reporting to stakeholders.
Collects, analyzes and reports on project successes, hurdles and failures, including lessons learned, to improve management and delivery of future projects.
Oversees development of RFPs, vendor selection process and subsequent Statement of Work development.
Responsible for hiring, development, evaluation, and performance management within the department.
Maintains an environment to support professional development and growth of employees to their fullest potential.
Collaborate with Applications Development manager on project-related initiatives
Work with the Director, Resource Planning & Management to implement project management and business analysis best practices, standards, processes and tools within the Information Technology department.
Maintain an in-depth knowledge of project management and business analysis methodologies and tools and make recommendations for improvements.
Maintain awareness of new and emerging project management and business analysis technologies and their potential applications.



QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in business or Information Technology and a minimum of Five (5) years of project management and business analysis experience in IT fields, or the equivalent combination of education and experience; PMP’s preferred. A thorough understanding of project management and business analysis skills, tools, techniques, and formal project methodologies; thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements; This individual must have strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively convey information to audiences of varying technical aptitude and organizational levels. Demonstrated excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills focusing on consensus building, facilitating collaboration between IT, the business units and the vendors, conflict management and change management. Proven success as a supervisor, coach and developer of professional staff.

Able to continuously assess performance, research and develop new capabilities, and systematically apply learning and knowledge to the projects. Successful track record in implementing/enhancing project management process. Professional credentials highly preferred (such as PMP, Six Sigma, Scrum)

Strong knowledge of the entire Software Development Lifecycle and/or the Agile Software Development Project Management Methodology. Understanding of Public Housing and Housing Choice Voucher Program business and processes preferred. Must have the ability to lead people, gain consensus and foster teamwork among the various technical and business groups. Working knowledge of core systems (i.e., Yardi, Lawson and SharePoint) preferred.

Grade: S9

FLSA: Exempt

Union: None

Your Role

The Sales Contract Analyst is responsible for the implementation and maintenance of low to medium complexity direct and Regional or National Account bids, contracts, pricing agreements and contract analysis with the support or direction of others where needed. Works collaboratively with the various Business Operations functions, Sales, Marketing, Finance and Legal departments to resolve contract issues, eliminate billing delays and process contract payments accurately. Position is accountable for timely milestone completion and short-term initiatives in support of contract timelines and goals.

Your Team

We provide analytical and strategic support to the Sales Operations functions, and work collaboratively with various other functions including Sales, Marketing, and Corporate Legal teams. We are an essential part of the sales journey. We value teamwork, are detail-oriented, and believe personal and professional growth!

What You'll Be Doing
Serve as a key contact for assigned agreements and perform ad-hoc analysis /reporting as requested.
Process all assigned contract related payments.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of training documents and other supporting materials and templates as assigned.
Support the analysis of proposals for variance from guideline pricing, rebate methodology, member enrollment and other operational requirements. Offer alternative or creative solutions as necessary.
Research and resolve pricing and billing issues for assigned accounts.
Assist with monitoring the GPO roster maintenance process and general contract maintenance activities to ensure GPO administration fees, rebates and chargebacks are paid timely and accurately.
Conduct all contract maintenance in compliance with SOP’s and minimize the negative impact of errors to Baxter and the customer, maximize overall quality.
Support quality improvement processes, SOP’s or guidelines based on the analysis of performance information.
Utilize and offer improvement recommendations to ad hoc reporting and/or procedures for their use.
Follow all S-Ox related practices and reporting requirements.

What You'll Bring
BS / BA and 1+ years of experience in a related role.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of JD Edwards or similar enterprise system, BAMS or other contract/pricing system is a plus.
A strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word as well as experience with data and reporting tools such as Cognos or Tableau is highly desirable.
Must demonstrate the ability to follow prescribed processes and contribute to on-going process improvement.

Description & Requirements

The Customer Sales Analyst (CSA) is an internal sales position that provides business insights and volume growing recommendations through category research to Customer Business Teams. The CSA ensures that customer, consumer, and internal information are used to build actionable insights that can be used to improve overall performance and results.

The CSA identifies and addresses new and existing business opportunities across all Kraft Heinz categories through data analysis, and ensures that customer, consumer, and internal information are used to build knowledge and insights that can be used to improve overall performance and results.

The position is fast paced and works closely with Customer Sales Leadership, reporting directly to the Associate Sales Director. The CSA must be comfortable in tackling ambiguous business issues with significant autonomy.

The position also coordinates information-training activities, steers data for sales planning, and continually works to improve sales management value to the team. The CSA is an information expert, skilled in the use of systematic tools, and can execute grocery industry category management standards.

Area expert in the use, study and application of syndicated data and household panel data.
Steers key insights and business recommendations on the key sales controllable of distribution and assortment, pricing, and promotion.
Conduct detailed category decompositions and reporting leveraging appropriate information resources to include: IRI POS, IRI Panel, and Custom Shopper Research to drive insights to action
Support in building and maintaining long-term relationships with Albertsons Buyers through detailed analysis, insights development, and recommendations
Supports ad-hoc reporting request and leverages internal and external data to ensure program execution and develop post-event analyses

Market Pricing Reporting & Gap Analysis

About Us

Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.

Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.

Why Us

We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.

Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

Description & Requirements

This Senior Analyst position supports the Kraft Heinz Not Co joint venture formed by Kraft Heinz and The Not Company to develop superior plant-based versions of co-branded products at a level of speed, taste, quality, and scale yet to be seen in the industry. NotCo brings its patented, first-of-its-kind technology and proven artificial intelligence (AI) solutions, while Kraft Heinz offers its iconic brand portfolio and scale. To achieve our big ambitions, we are building a team that brings unique perspectives and skills. When we come together, we are a fast paced, consumer-first, and product-centric company that will satisfy our customers and consumers with delicious plant-based alternatives to your favorite Kraft Heinz products. We are looking forward to starting this journey with you!

The Senior Sales Analyst will lead the analytical, reporting and planning needs of the joint venture sales team. This critical role will require a self-motivated individual that is able to proactively identify needs & opportunities and provide an actionable sales oriented solution. Through reporting & analytics, this individual will work cross functionally to ensure the team has the business insight and plan to deliver the operating plan.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities

Deliver critical category information vital to flawless execution of category priorities (e.g., SKU rankings, new item information, competitive information, consumer and shopper insights etc.)

Track sales execution versus the annual operating plan, proactively identify risks / opportunities

Understand, identify, and apply category analytics to deliver key insights and recommendations to enhance the category impact on merchandising, assortment, pricing, and promotion on a national and localized level

Key Point of contact on the standardized reporting of customers plan, and variance to business plan; Partner with the joint venture and Kraft Heinz teams to build, communicate and track plan

Able to convert analytical findings into key actionable business insights and clearly communicate results / next steps

Ensure steps are completed throughout the commercialization process of a product for proper sales support

Expected Experience & Required Skills

2+ years of professional experience in sales using data; prior experience in category management or sales analytics preferred

Excellent analytic / problem-solving capability with solid understanding of syndicated and panel data

Ability to partner with cross functional teams, handle simultaneous projects, and deliver within agreed upon time frames

Outstanding verbal, written and interpersonal communications skills with an expertise in organizational and project management skills

Proficiency in Excel & Power Point required

Work Environment & Schedule

This is a remote role, with limited travel or visits to external locations. Additionally, this role requires working a salaried, exempt schedule to best execute against customer and internal expectations

Physical demands include but not limited to

Willingness to drive and/or travel as needed - 10-20%

Operate a computer and view screens for ~100% of work schedule

LI-Remote

About Us

Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.

Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.

Why Us

We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.

Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

Office Collaboration & Hybrid Work Environment

We believe our office environment fuels our collaboration, connection & community as an organization and allows our employees to grow toward greatness. We also believe providing a more flexible and agile model is essential in today’s workplace. A majority of our office-based employees will be able to work remotely for up to two days each week. Additionally, employees who are subject to this hybrid model will be eligible to work from anywhere for up to six weeks in a rolling 12-month period (in maximum two-week increments and according to benefits and tax guidelines). Some jobs may be required to be performed fully in office depending on the role’s responsibilities and requirements.

About Old World Industries:
Old World Industries is among the largest privately held companies competing in the automotive aftermarket. The Northbrook, Illinois-based company enjoys a presence in various consumer product markets around the world. Old World’s brands include a full line of PEAK® Performance Automotive Aftermarket Products including Antifreeze/Coolant, Washer Fluid, Lighting and Wiper Blades; BlueDEF® Diesel Exhaust Fluid and Equipment; FINAL CHARGE® PRO-SERIES Heavy Duty Extended Life Coolant and Fleet Charge® SCA Precharged Heavy Duty Coolant.

Position Overview:
The Sales Analyst is a critical role supporting the Sales Team to grow our business and establish relationships with our customers. As part of the role, the analyst will capture and organize relevant data into actionable insights that support sales priorities and initiatives including customer planning and forecasting. This position will report to the Director of Sales Capabilities.

Primary Responsibilities:
Able to compile, analyze and clearly communicate analytical findings of large amounts of data.
Provide ad hoc analytical support and insight generation.
Track pricing including pricing changes with both customers and the competition.
Capture assortment changes and translate into shipment impact, performance vs. expectations.
For new items, validate forecast volumes, track shipments vs. forecast post launch, as well as set-up and manage product inquiries.
Engage in S&OP process to provide input to monthly and annual forecasts, including supporting forecasts of new items.
Pull monthly P&L reports, highlight drivers and drags for channels and assist in pricing quotes.
Support the development of customer presentations leveraging PowerPoint.
Attend and support customer meetings and trade shows as needed.
Act as point of contact for internal and external communications to and from the customers and other departments; cross-functional liaison to the other departments and a secondary contact when the salesperson is traveling.
Provide sales and customer POV when collaborating with cross functional partners including Marketing, Finance, Demand Planning and Customer Service

Bachelor’s degree Required
2+ years of relevant experience
