Demonstrated proficiency in Office applications, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Experience with BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau
Strong presentation skills
Strong ability to work effectively and collaborate across the organization
Experience supporting forecasting efforts
SAP experience is a plus
Ability to occasionally travel for customer meetings and events

Job Title: Operations System Support Analyst - (Back Office Trading Platform)
Job Description:
Marex is a diversified global financial services platform, providing essential liquidity, market access and infrastructure services to clients in the energy, commodities and financial markets.

The Group provides comprehensive breadth and depth of coverage across four core services: Market Making, Clearing, Hedging and Investment Solutions and Agency and Execution. It has a major franchise in many major metals, energy and agricultural products, executing around 50 million trades and clearing 205 million contracts in 2022. The Group provides access to the world's major commodity markets, covering a broad range of clients that include some of the largest commodity producers, consumers and traders, banks, hedge funds and asset managers.

Marex was established in 2005 but through its subsidiaries can trace its roots in the commodity markets back almost 100 years. Headquartered in London with 36 offices worldwide, the Group has over 1,800 employees across Europe, Asia and America.

For more information visit www.marex.com (http://www.marex.com/)

Purpose of Role:

The Operations Systems Support manages operational systems and static data associated to XTP back-office platform. The role requires the individual to work with different functional areas to provide training and production support The role require the ability to perform deep analysis within the system and within the issues that arise.

Marex has unique access across markets with significant share globally both on and off exchange. The depth of knowledge amongst its teams and divisions provides its customers with clear advantage, and its technology-led service provides access to all major exchanges, order-flow management via screen, voice and DMA, plus award-winning data, insights, and analytics.

The Operations Systems Support department sits within the operations function, with its focus being the XTP back-office platform and associated static data management. Maintaining robust procedures and controls to ensure the firm meets the high-level expectations.

Responsibilities:

Monitor critical system import feeds associated to the XTP back-office platform.
The ability to work with end users of the system, analyse their issue and put that into requirements for the vendor.
Manage several projects including improving existing processes.
Maintain systems and required static in line with any new or changing regulatory reporting regimes.
Manage XTP back-office system changes and upgrades in line with business and exchange requirements.
Create daily control framework and daily processing efficiencies associated to client static data and regulatory reporting submissions.
Assist compliance with regulatory audit requests and queries.
Ensure written procedures are in place and up to date for the Department.
Efficient email management, including both personal and group mailboxes.
Ensuring compliance with the company's regulatory requirements under the SEC, FINRA, NFA, CFTC and other applicable exchanges.
Adhere to the operational risk framework for your role ensuring that all regulatory or company determined parameters are complied with.
Role model for demonstrating highest level standards of integrity and conduct and reflecting Company Values.
At all times complying with Marex's Code of Conduct
To ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to you, your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility
To report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/ or your supervisor as require
To escalate risk events immediately
To provide input to risk management processes, as required.

The Company may require you to carry out other duties from time to time.

Competencies, Skills and Experience:

Competencies



Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrates curiosity.
Resilient in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
Ability to take a high level of responsibility in a fast pace and high-volume environment.
Excels at building relationships, networking and influencing others.
Attention to detail.
Ability to resolve issues in a timely and efficient manner.
Strategic collaborator with insight and agility, able to anticipate future challenges, ensuring operational effectiveness.

Skills and Experience

Enhanced understanding of Futures & Options industry in areas including Reconciliations, Position Maintenance, Regulatory Reporting, and static data.

Knowledge of XTP Back Office system.

Experience with Microsoft Office.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working in a regulated environment and knowledge of the risk and compliance requirements associated with this.

Here is a great opportunity to join a great company! Medline Industries has enjoyed DOUBLE DIGIT GROWTH for 55 of the past 56 years! We've again been named to the Chicago Tribune's Top Workplaces, and we're again on the list of Becker's Great Places to Work in Healthcare.

Medline Industries, Inc. is seeking a talented individual with knowledge of and experience working with custom applications using techno-functional skills. This System Analyst role collaborates with business partners (Sales and Sales Operations) and application development teams to deliver and maintain pricing applications. This role works on Medline’s pricing applications which include quoting, goal management and conversion tools. This individual will work as a System Analyst on the Pricing Scrum team to deliver incremental product releases, refine the product backlog, lead sprint planning sessions, participate in sprint retrospectives, showcase new work in sprint demos and support our 2000 sales reps daily. This is a great opportunity to work with a fast-paced team of 30 analysts, developers and QA analysts who thrive on agile practices and producing business value on a two-week sprint basis.
Job Responsibilities

System Analysis and Administration:

Engage with multiple business sponsors (Sales, Product Divisions, Sales Operations, and Customer Service) to understand and analyze business issues, goals and requirements.
Serve as a Functional Expert with the business in Sales Documents and Pricing areas within SAP.
Ability to articulate business solutions and to communicate with technical teams to develop and configure solutions.
Convert business requirements into user stories with appropriate acceptance criteria that can be converted into technical tasks.
Create supporting mockups for business requirements and gain approval on designs.
Collaborate with application architect on complex stories and solution design.
Work with scrum master and business partners to plan and refine upcoming sprints.
Participate in sprint planning sessions with developers to clearly explain the business reasons behind the functionality as well as the detailed functional requirements.
Liaison with ABAP, JAVA and UI full stack developers as they develop new features and enhancements.
Review test plans and test scripts with QA leads for quality delivery of new functions and features.
Perform detailed testing on functionality of stories before migration to the TEST environment.
Perform validation in the TEST environment before features are promoted to production.
Monitoring and Support:

Provide post-implementation support for the pricing applications.
Respond to inquiries from business partners, requests from users, support calls/tickets escalated by help desk.
Respond to any system anomalies like performance or vulnerability alerts and partner with respective teams to remediate them.
Off hours support for migrations typically 1-2 nights / month (9pm – 12am).
Infrastructure and Compliance:

Ensure all software and infrastructure components have the required patches. Plan and deploy updates along with partner teams as needed.
Contribute to system compliance audits (Ex: HITRUST). Create and maintain proper standard operating procedures as needed.
Release Management

Understand and adhere to IS change management policies.
Identify and execute best practices to ensure a streamlined, reliable deployment and a streamlined, reliable roll-back process.

3+ years of experience in a business analyst role
3+ years of experience working in SAP SD functions

Strong analytical skills to understand business goals and design appropriate solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication. Able to articulate technical information in the language of the audience (business leaders vs technical personnel).

Medline is the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare supplies in the United States, providing more than 550,000 products that serve the entire continuum of care. Our innovative products and programs can be found in most hospitals, extended-care facilities, surgery centers, physician offices, home care dealers, home health agencies and retail outlets.

Founded in 1910, Medline has grown from a small manufacturer of aprons, surgical gowns and uniforms to a thriving $20 billion global enterprise because of our dedicated people, entrepreneurial spirit and honest values.

Again named one of the country’s "Best and Brightest Companies to Work For,” and once again named to Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces, Medline has experienced fifty-plus years of consecutive annual growth, and is headquartered in Northfield, IL.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

As a member of the Service Management office, you will have a lead role in driving the healthcare transformation at CVS Health as the enterprise looks to leverage ServiceNow as the system of record for all things technology, HR, and Procurement. You will be engaging with 700+ Service Owners from IT, Catalog Services and our Business Partners. You will also partner with colleagues (Developers, Engineers, Business Analyst, Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Testers) on the platform supporting ITSM, Catalog Services, Platform Engineering, Operations, HRSD, PSM, CMDB, APM, and SPM.

This position is a lead role in the application management of our portal initiatives Service Catalog in ServiceNow. The individual in this role will lead the governance, communication, design, and maintenance of our ServiceNow Portal initiatives to ensure our colleagues have the best experience and our COEs are supported in meeting their business needs. Liaising with Service Owners and Colleague Experience counterparts to inform and partner on our enterprise strategy and manage application sustainment, enhancement, and/or new development.

Reporting to the Lead IT Director, ServiceNow Delivery, this position is critical in supporting the development and implementation of the overall ServiceNow Portal strategy while operational objectives and strategic business initiatives are met. This role will also have indirect management of technical staff. Including but not limited to being the first point of escalation, prioritizing, and managing assignments from the product backlog.

Job Responsibilities

Lead the technical governance, delivery, maintenance, and prioritization of enhancements, and other responsibilities for ServiceNow Catalog Services
Lead the technical alignment for launching the product and subsequent future enhancements or other product roadmap implementations.
Develop, implement, and maintain a governance strategy to achieve consistent and efficient standards for decision-making, escalation, and issue management for both autonomous ServiceNow Catalog Services matters and collaborative with Catalog Service Owners, IT counterparts and other ServiceNow Product Owners.
Own production support for the Service Catalog. Monitor the health of the system, break/fix resolution
Develop and maintain a strong partnership with key stakeholders on the overall platform strategy and architecture.
Accountable for keeping current on new ServiceNow releases and enhancements.
Ensuring the technical aspects of future releases or upgrade implementations are in line with security, best practices, and meet the expectations of our business.
Contribute to the enterprise strategy for Colleague Experience (within ServiceNow) and lead execution of enhancements and projects.
Lead a group of business analysts and developers to support the sustainment of the product along with managing releases and regular business requests utilizing SAFe Agile Methodology.
Liaise with the ServiceNow Platform team to coordinate all production migrations, governance on shared architecture, and general collaboration where needed.
Manage the communication of the priorities to stakeholders in a proactive manner.


Required Qualifications

5+ years of managing delivery of ServiceNow Catalog Services
5+ years of product owner type roles which involves governance, management, and driving alignment on ServiceNow initiatives.
5+ years of experience managing best practices for Catalog Services
5+ years of experience implementing complex services within Catalog Services
5+ years of experience enhancing the user experience for the service portal
5+ years of experience managing development of ServiceNow Catalog Development via forms, fields, views, lists, UI policy & actions, and client/server scripts as well as integrating ServiceNow with other tools.
5+ years of experience working in a SAFe or Agile team
5+ years of experience leading, engaging, and developing business analyst and developers.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic delivery environment with versatility to manage multiple projects, priorities, and urgent issues successfully and simultaneously.
Customer obsessed. Experience influencing and consulting while solving business processes and / or technical problems to meet our customers where they are.


Preferred Qualifications

ServiceNow Business Analyst experience
ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist
Extensive ServiceNow governance experience
Program/Project Management or Scrum Master experience with strong skillset in communications, tracking, reporting, risk management, and negotiation skills


Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, related field, or equivalent experience.

Summary:
The Neuberger Berman Operations Team is responsible for all aspects of operational support associated with our high net worth and institutional asset management teams. Responsibilities would include oversight of the set-up, maintenance, and exception monitoring of security master across all products and ensuring data quality in the trading and accounting platforms across the firm. We are looking for an experienced candidate to support the ongoing implementation and evolution of our enterprise data platform. The candidate should be able to perform the necessary facilitation, analysis and design tasks related to the development of master and reference data solutions for equities, fixed income, and derivatives. Responsible for working with both functional and technical personnel to translate business requirements, assist with the creation of functional specifications, provide master and reference data management expertise into the design process, help create solution test cases and testing plans, and create and maintain related documentation. This role can lead to a management opportunity for an individual who displays leadership and team-building characteristics as the role progresses.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for set up, maintenance and review of securities in trading and accounting systems, leverage subject matter expertise in these areas.
Day to day manager of the security control function across systems and products across all locations.
Face off with business and technology delivery managers as a subject matter expert around security master.
Translate business needs into reference data solutions utilizing process and data flow techniques.
Instrumental in setting up Service Level Agreements with business partners, scheduling the work to meet expectations.
Provides business/process insights for architecture of business, process, and systems through their subject matter expertise.
Maintains standardization, consistency, and continuous improvement of processes.
Assist with design of the governance activities associated with ensuring integrity of master data.
Responsible for producing quality and quantity metrics measuring performance.
Timely escalation of issues and resolution to Senior Management.
Key contributor to firm wide Enterprise Data Management project, in particular Security Master.
Analyze current business practices and procedures and define and implement processes and procedures to ensure data integrity.
Define and document policies and procedures, including the designing and documenting of process flows across multiple functions within Operations.
Identify and manage the resolution of data quality issues, recommending appropriate corrective action.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree, B.S or B.A.
Minimum 7 years of experience in Financial Services / Asset Management Operations, especially around security data.
Expert knowledge of Equity, Fixed Income and Leveraged Loans.
Strong understanding of data management and data platforms.
Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Thorough knowledge of master and reference data management concepts and methodologies and ability to apply this knowledge towards the building of enterprise data management solutions.
Acuity to understand fixed income analytics and their relationship to asset master setups.
Excellent spoken and written communication as well as receptive listening skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a concise and objective manner to both technical and business audiences.
Prior personnel management experience a plus.
Project management experience and business analysis skills a plus.
Knowledge of business process re-engineering principles a plus.
Excellent team player able to work with virtual and global cross-functional teams.
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Experience with Aladdin preferred, experience in platforms like Bloomberg and Charles River IMS a plus.
Effective time management skills; strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
Ability to multi-task and function well independently in a dynamic, changing environment.

Job Description:

Sr. Salesforce BSA/Admin, minimum 10 years of experience as BSA, with 10 years of experience in Salesforce as an administrator. Potential for long term contract, supporting new implementation of Salesforce for the Bank. Required to work central time with up to 5% travel expected in case of remote location.

The position will require the following Salesforce certifications: Certified Advanced Administrator Certified Marketing Cloud Administrator Certified Business Analyst Experience translating business requirements into best in class configurations on Sales cloud, Marketing cloud, Service cloud and Experience cloud 5+ years experience working in the Financial services industry. Experience working in an Agile/scrum environment decomposing work products and writing user stories. Experience in Software development processes like data recovery, version control, code branching, code reviews, etc.

Preferred requirements:

Experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps for Application Life Cycle management including CI/CD.

The BSA/Admin will:

Collaborate with business stakeholders and product owner to gather and refine requirements. Work on creating Epics and features and authoring user stories within Azure DevOps. Run metrics on the Azure DevOps board Create and manage documents such as business workflows, data maps, training manuals, etc. Experience with the deployment of custom objects in Sales cloud using Azure CI/CD pipelines. Help establish Business standards and processes in alignment with Salesforce best practices.

Overview:

Nippon Express Company, Ltd. (“NX”) was founded in 1872 in Japan and is headquartered in Tokyo. NX employs approximately 72,000 employees at 733 locations, in 47 countries and 314 cities around the world.

Nippon Express U.S.A., Inc. (“NEU”) was incorporated in New York in 1962 as a fully owned subsidiary of NX. NEU provides logistics solutions and comprehensive transportation services through its international freight forwarding and logistics network, including specialized handling of: air, land, sea and express packages; all types and sizes of cargo; personal effects and household goods; fragile and perishable freight; and livestock. NEU also provides related services, such as warehousing, distribution and customs brokerage and clearance. NEU operates at 55 locations in 27 states within the U.S., with approximately 1300 employees. NEU has enjoyed tremendous growth and success as one of the top five international freight forwarders in the world. We connect people with products throughout the world.

Summary
Work directly with Sales leadership teams, providing timely analytics and business insights to drive successful performance against established Objectives and Key Results (OKRs). You will be a trusted business advisor that takes initiative to drive the operational rigor around our forecasting cadence, sales performance metrics, analysis on sales incentive plans and execution of Go To Market planning. This position requires critical thinking skills to perform analysis of recurring and ad hoc sales reporting. The ideal candidate knows data definitions and data relationships to integrate complex or diverse information using intuition, research and experience to complement data provided. This candidate requires Salesforce and strong database knowledge. Use of Access, Excel, PowerBI and data visualization skills are required to leverage data to provide insights, while being able to effectively communicate with executive leaders to inspire change and performance to company targets. This is an individual contributor role with visibility and influence at an enterprise level.

This position will support our Sales Enablement team. It is eligible to work a hybrid schedule, generally working in-office 2-3 days per week. The ideal candidate will be based out of any of the following locations:
Dallas, TX

Chicago, IL
Orlando, FL
Washington D.C.
Nashville, TN
Atlanta, GA

Alexandria, VA
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Create and maintain standardized reporting for sales to measure individual, teams, department and company performance across several reporting platforms (Salesforce/CRM Analytics and PowerBI).
Provides analysis of sales performance & pipeline (week over week; month over month, year over year), trends, gaps, contract expirations and related reporting to sales/leaders.
Analyze sales pipeline data for Leadership to provide recommendations on sales goals and incentive plans.
Create, analyze and recommend actions based on trends within key sales performance metrics.

Elicit, document, and validate reporting requirements - business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, input and output requirements, data scope including archiving and quality requirements, usage, formatting, and security requirements.
Act as a mentor to fellow business analysts and provides informal coaching.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Education & Experience

Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work under pressure.

We are looking for a curious, creative, and business oriented Data Scientist, to work within our BTS US Commercial Patient Services organization to provide technical expertise in Advanced/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. Key responsibility will be to help execute Data Science projects for the highly visible Data Quality Management (DQM) and Data Governance initiatives. For this role, you should be highly analytical with a love and high affinity for analysis, math, and statistics. A strong candidate for this position should not only be skillful in quantitative methodologies and programming, but also have a keen business acumen. One should have a passion for analysis, data exploration, machine-learning, and out of the box thinking. Utilization of related technical skills and methodologies and strive to remain abreast of leading-edge data science technologies.

In this role you will be responsible for:

Serve as a key team member on the Data Science arm of the BTS HCP Data Analytics team, working in close partnership with the Commercial Data Management (CDM) and ML Ops teams, and becoming a trusted partner to business leadership, ensuring data and key deliverables reflect advanced data science best practices.
Define and implement data science architectural framework and operating model for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Develop innovative predictive models that are reliable, scalable, and modular and drive business relevant outcomes.
Maintain, optimize, scale, and operationalize existing machine learning models in concert with key partners such as the CDM team, BTS, and external vendors/partners.
Improve existing AI/ML techniques by promoting new methodology and best practices from the industry.
Provide technical leadership in feasibility study of data science use cases to business functions and work with developers across teams to design, build and implement data science solutions and capabilities.
Proactively identify new data science approaches that would improve our ability to answer commercial business questions by closely collaborating with key stakeholders to transform business questions to algorithms and further support the business needs.
Work with stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives, and success criteria for data science initiatives.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in time series forecasting and data engineering to drive innovation and continuous improvement.
Ensure project activities are conducted on time, accurately, within budget, and in accordance with financial and ethical compliance guidelines.



Tools and skills you will use in this role:

Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Qlik, Power BI and technologies like AWS S3, EMR, EKS.
Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen, and creativity in problem solving.
Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally and in writing) all levels of the organization.
Ability to be agile & nimble to changing business conditions, strong collaboration, and teamwork across functional groups to contribute to a productive work culture. Lead strategically and create trust and respect within the department.

Experiences that make you a strong candidate for this role:

Bachelor’s Degree equivalent education and typically 5 years of experience, Master’s Degree or equivalent education and typically 4 years of experience. Background in life sciences or work experience in the pharmaceutical industry preferred.
Experience in data management, business analysis, and developing analytical models using statistical, machine learning, and data mining methodologies to drive business impact.
Experience with machine learning algorithms for data science, e.g., Linear and Logistics Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Neural Networks, etc.
Experience in relevant languages and databases (Python, SQL, Snowflake, Snowpark etc.) for data manipulation, data storage and automation tasks.
Experience with advanced analytics platforms such as Dataiku.

If you believe you’re a great fit for this job but don’t have all of the experiences listed above, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Position Description:

The Marketing Analyst is a key role in driving our business performance – and will contribute to the development of our market intelligence and customer conversion drivers. This role will use quantitative and data analytics skills to solve complex business problems and contribute to corporate strategy by exploring relationships within our organization’s data warehouse.

Scope of Responsibilities:

As our Marketing & Sales Analyst you will:

Gather and analyze relevant business sales and marketing data using database systems, data warehouse queries, data mining, statistical analysis, and marketing research. Present findings to marketing and sales leadership and collaborate with marketing channel owners to implement recommendations to drive improved business performance.
Apply quantitative methods to our marketing and sales operations and drive data-informed decision-making using queries from marketing, social media, sales, finance and other systems.
Perform market & competitive research through interrogation of Circana, Nielsen and IRI databases and analyze benchmarking data. Present findings to marketing, product development and sales leadership to influence new product development pipeline, marketing budgets & product positioning.
Measure & analyze brand awareness through NPS+ scoring, brand lift studies and Amazon Marketing Cloud. Present findings to marketing leadership to inform marketing budget allocations and optimizations and overall marketing plan approach.
Manage retail portal data feeds, including Amazon data APIs, Target, Walmart and other retail data. Ensure integrity of feed data.
Support Google, Amazon, Resonate and other platform pixel & tag management and tracking.
Report on marketing KPIs, including traffic, conversion rates, detail page views, engagement – across Google Analytics, Amazon Ads, Target Kiosk, Walmart and more. Present results to marketing leadership & marketing channel owners to inform future marketing budget allocations. Collaborate with sales on analysis of retail performance.
Work closely with marketing & sales stakeholders to identify goals & best practices for data collection, and to improve business outcomes.
Work closely with peer data analysts, leading projects as assigned. Oversee work of data analytics interns.

Requirements/Preferences:

Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in Marketing Business Analytics, with STEM-academic focus.
Coursework in advanced Excel spreadsheets, data warehousing – including SQL, Tableau and Power BI, statistical queries, data visualization, business forecasting and marketing research.
Additional coursework or two-plus years experience digital marketing strategies and digital marketing analytics.
Internship or one+ year of marketing analytics experience at a CPG or retail company preferred.
Experienced Excel user, with advanced knowledge of functions including vlookups, pivot tables, and macros. Experience in Microsoft Access is a plus.
Working knowledge of Amazon ARA Premium, Amazon Advertising portals or APIs, Target Partners Online, or Walmart Retail Link a plus.
Strong communicator with ability to partner closely with multiple marketing teams to review data and to respond in detail to C-level data requests; two-plus years experience presenting data storytelling & visuals within executive facing Excel and PowerPoiint reporting.
Well organized with ability to manage multiple projects at once; detail-oriented and deadline focused

Ideal Attributes:

Results-driven attitude; a self starter who thinks and participates effectively, both independently and as part of a team
Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to articulate her/his views crisply and convincingly
Takes action: proactive and resourceful in solving problems, making decisions and executing on goals
Owns results—remains focused and follows through on commitments, takes responsibility, and produces quality results
Connects inside and outside the team; shares information, transfers knowledge and seeks diverse input from others within the team and across the organization


We are a drug-free workplace and an EEO employer.

This role strategizes with senior leadership and decomposes business problems into deliverable pieces of work with a development team, prioritizing and sequencing development activities to ensure optimal delivery.

Monitor competitive landscape to ensure products stay ahead of the curve
Facilitate story writing and requirements definition with a development team to ensure software development activities align to business objectives

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management

To help save our customers green, we need an amazing team who knows all about it. Our National Finance & Administration Services department oversees the management of the critical resources and infrastructure that our people need to get the job done at every level. This service department is designed to make sure our retail divisions and executive leadership receive the support they need to run a successful operation. This role is eligible to participate in ALDI’s Hybrid Work Program, which allows remote work up to 3 days per week (i.e., work remotely up to 3 days per week; work in-office at least 2 days per week).

Job Description:

The Senior Manager Business Intelligence role will be responsible for leading an Enterprise-level Business Risk Program team that designs, develops, and supports dashboard, analytic and reporting solutions across a wide variety of topics and related business intelligence data sets. Manages the supporting data infrastructure strategy and data, metadata, and metric documentation requirements.

Develops and maintains the strategic vision and operational road map for business intelligence, identifying new opportunities and prioritizing incoming project requests based on strategic goals, business unit needs, resource availability, and overall cost and benefits to the company. Directly accountable for the successful execution of the strategic vision, guiding and empowering the team to deliver a high throughput of projects while expertly managing around obstacles to deliver best in class solutions that increase speed of understanding and enable rapid decision making.

Proactively builds collaborative partnerships with Enterprise leaders to design and deliver business intelligence projects that advance their decision-making capabilities while ensuring adherence to analytical best practices. Data should be derived from relevant sources of truth. Team processes should be highly efficient, automated where possible, maintain pristine data integrity, and involve a high degree of collaboration both within the team and with relevant business partners. Results should be consistently relevant, accurate, timely, well-documented, and actionable.

Develop and coach teams to be effective in their roles and able to identify, manage, and escalate risk. Effectively manage the team to be adherent to regulatory obligations, policy, standard, and procedure obligations, as well as managing inherent risks directly related to the team.

Responsibilities

Leverages in-depth knowledge of industry best practices and technical expertise to develop and execute the strategic vision for business intelligence, guiding and empowering the team to develop creative and innovative ways to answer business questions efficiently and effectively.

Develops highly effective, collaborative relationships with business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage business intelligence projects to increase operational knowledge, improve data access efficiency and enable rapid decision making.

Develops Agile practices to ensure effective time management, project standards, and processes are in place. Empower the team to execute the strategic vision while maintaining engagement with all aspects of the team’s work. Adopt changing analytical industry trends and best practices as needed.

Ensures the effective support of all developed Business Intelligence assets, guiding rapid issue resolution and root cause identification processes to completion and ensuring appropriate control processes are in place to prevent further occurrences.

Builds a culture of Continuous Improvement, driving incremental changes through the collaborative assessment of processes and actions, the measurement of overall project effectiveness, and solicitation of feedback from business partners.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or related field

8+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading business intelligence teams to develop optimized, complex SQL queries across large volumes of data in both relational and multi-dimensional data sources such as Teradata, Hadoop, Amazon Redshift, or Hyperion Essbase or related.

6+ years of experience in hands on experience leading data visualization teams using industry leading Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Qlikview to develop robust, interactive and visually impactful dashboards or related.

In lieu of a degree, 12+ years of experience in Data Analytics and Query Design in a quantitatively driven industry or related

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Tableau Certification

Strong Tableau Development Skills (Tableau Suite: Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, Tableau Prep Builder, Conductor)

SQL or SAS Coding Skills

Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean project management frameworks

Familiarity with data infrastructure processes, designs, and tools (e.g. ETL)

Strong Excel Skills

Strong PowerPoint Skills

Critical Thinking/Problem-Solving/Analytic Mindset

Strong Collaboration Skills

Strong Communication (verbal and written)

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $100,500.00 to $170,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst on the Information Technology team, your prior Accounting or Finance experience will be valuable as you recommend & implement technology solutions that will make processes more efficient and employees more productive within our Finance and Investments groups. Core responsibilities include translating business requirements into technical documents, mockups, and test scripts; becoming the subject matter expert on how your business partners use our software; and working in a dynamic team of BSAs and developers to deliver technology solutions that empower your business partners.

WHO YOU ARE:

Knowledgeable & Analytical.
Your background includes a combination of Accounting/Finance and Information Technology and you are comfortable with Accounting concepts, specifically the routines related to closing financial books. You re skilled at gathering requirements, data collection & analysis, problem solving, process documentation, and identifying areas for improvement.

Technologically Savvy.
You ve got a solid proficiency in writing SQL queries. You re also comfortable working with relational database concepts and have a knack for quickly mastering new software. You re familiar with how data can flow between systems via integrations/APIs.

Business Liaison.
You re comfortable collaborating with business partners and third party vendors to gather needs, review viable solutions, test new functionality, and track post-implementation results.

Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are clear, articulate, effective, and demonstrate your ability to interact with all levels both within and outside the organization. By delivering clear communication, you help to ensure that projects stay on time, deliverables meet budget, and key stakeholders are aware of project statuses.

Passionate. Motivated. Eager to Learn.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and regularly seek to understand.

WHAT YOU LL DO:

Work closely with teammates and business partners to analyze and document business requirements
for projects and software customizations or configurations. You ll then translate those business requirements into technical requirements for development staff.
Provide project management to coordinate efforts between business partners and IT.
Deliver clear communication on status, timing, deliverables, and budget to leaders, team members, stakeholders, etc.
Implement new technology and evaluate upgrades.
You ll present new features to business partners, test new functionality, and assist with the creation of training documentation.
Identify opportunities for automation.
Implement technology solutions such as workflows or Robotic Process Automation to enhance business processes and eliminate administrative burden.
Document data relationships and write basic SQL statements.
You ll analyze and compare datasets and look for trends, issues, or areas for improvement.
Implement and manage standard testing procedures for system changes.
Create, review and execute test plans and validate that it meets the business and technical requirements. Responsible for proper tracking of test results.
Provide assistance to IT Support to review issues reported from users.
Compare data from multiple sources to reconcile discrepancies, determine cause of errors and establish procedures to correct them.
Challenge the status quo. Be willing to look at processes with fresh eyes and questions on whether there s a better way.
Represent the Company in a professional manner at all times.
Consistently maintain a professional, courteous attitude when dealing with residents, coworkers and the general public.
Perform other duties as necessary.

Previous Experience & Requirements:

A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Business, Accounting, Finance, or computer science with previous business analysis and/or project management experience is preferred.
5+ years relevant Accounting/Finance, business analysis and/or consulting work in related fields is preferred.
Key competencies: requirements gathering, data analysis, conceptual thinking, problem solving, customer focus, managing work efficiently, strong written and verbal communication skills.

Machines, Tools and Equipment, Software:

Experience with MRI or other ERP/Financial Software products strongly preferred
Experience with Blackline Accounting software preferred.
Must be proficient in creating/executing SQL queries and possess thorough understanding of relational database concepts.
Must be adept with the Google Platform and Microsoft Office suite of products.
PrimaryLocation Chicago, IL, United States

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

Job Summary:

The WellBe care model is a Physician Led Advanced Practice geriatric care (care of older adults) team focused on the care of the frail, poly-chronic, elderly Medicare Advantage patients. This population is typically underserved and very challenged with access to care. To address these problems, we have elected to bring the care to the patient, instead of trying to bring the patient to the care. Care is provided throughout the entire continuum of care – from chronic care and urgent care in the home, to hospital, to skilled nursing facility, to assisted living, to palliative care, to end of life care. WellBe's physician/advanced practicing clinician led geriatric care teams’ partner with the patient’s primary care physician to provide concierge level geriatric medical care and social support in the home as well as delivering and coordinating across the entire care continuum.


GENERAL SUMMARY

This role will advance WellBe’s understanding of our patient's healthcare utilization and how we can reduce unnecessary healthcare costs while achieving better patient outcomes, and patient experience. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated proficiency of healthcare data sets, including medical claims, HCC, HEDIS, and be detailed oriented. This role reports to the SVP of Data and Clinical Solutions and works closely with operational and clinical leaders. The Reporting Consultant Sr will have ownership and is responsible for developing all companywide dashboards, reports, metrics and key performance indicators assets while also providing in-depth analysis and recommendations for improving/enhancing market performance. Documents, evaluates, and improves design of reports and processes to ensure that analytical tools evolve as the business changes. Develop trend analyses and other quantitative reports to determine business trends. Is an active participant in process improvement and problem resolution issues. Identify key insights and communicate to various stakeholders through the WellBe organization.

Job Description:

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES

Lead business analysis activities to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements
Translate business requirements into specifications to design and implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources
Develop actionable dashboards and reports to support care management and ACO operations
Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems
Own complex data projects and acts as a lead for other Reporting Analysts
Provide analytical support for business operations in all or some of the following areas: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, HEDIS, pharmacy, external reporting
Ensure compliance with federal and state deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis
Work with key business owners to establish and meet their analytic needs and the analytic needs of the organization
Work with Analytics teams to operationalize analytic and reporting innovations
Lead migration of legacy reports from SQL Server sourced data to Snowflake
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards
Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence
Create training and assist users in the generation of ADHOC reports
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Must be able to perform duties with low supervision
Other tasks needed to accomplish team’s objectives/goals
Job Requirements:

Educational/Experience Requirements:

BA/BS in Computer Science or related field is preferable. Equivalent combination of experience, education and training will be considered
7 years of reporting and dashboard development experience. Healthcare experience required. Deep Tableau experience required
Required Skills and Abilities:
7+ years of experience working with Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and visual analytic applications.
Proficient experience in SQL or other similar programming languages. Some development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus.
Analytical ability required to gather data, perform transformation, perform complex analysis, solve both business and technical problems.
Proficiency with business intelligence techniques & tools for the acquisition and transformation of raw data into meaningful and useful information for business and analysis purposes.
Knowledge of relational databases and EMR data structure.
Advanced ability to problem-solve creatively and analyze processes and systems.
Performance tuning experience related to reporting queries required.
Understanding of data integration issues (validation and cleaning), familiarity with complex data and structures.
Knowledge of project and information management.
Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills are required to support working in project environments that includes internal, external and customer teams.
Requires strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing priorities


Work Conditions: Ability to lift up to 20lbs. Moving lifting or transferring of patients may involve lifting of up to 50lbs as well as assist with weights of more than 100lbs.
Ability to stand for extended periods
Ability to drive to patient locations (ie. home, hospital, SNF, etc)
Fine motor skills
Visual acuity

Job Description

Description

As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purposely-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade and we are growing our company and capabilities. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day, and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge. Come join us as we lead energy, together.

Constellation has been the leader in carbon-free energy production for more than a decade, and generates 50% more clean, carbon-free electricity than any other company in America. We're generating power 24/7 with the nation's largest emission-free nuclear energy fleet, providing enough clean energy to power 15 million homes. Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build, and power a successful career.

TOTAL REWARDS

Constellation offers a wide range of benefits and rewards, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick days; and much more.

Expected salary range of $110,700 to $123,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k).




PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

This position has a unique blend of business and financial analysis, reporting, and relationship management within the Chief Information Officer’s (CIO) Strategy Enablement organization. Lead and perform support activities for Strategic Vendor Management Office (SVMO) which sets and drives the standards and processes with the focus on operational execution, governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple Strategic Partners (SPs). Build and maintain relationships with SPs, Constellation IT Service Delivery, and supporting organizations to deliver high-quality IT services within a risk managed environment.

Perform detailed analysis and prepare comprehensive reports/charts/graphs to support business operations. Conduct complex modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, and other general financial and operational analysis. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information on operational scorecards and/or service level agreements (SLAs). Support the design, development and implementation of digital technology and automation related to our data collection, analysis, and presentation processes.

PRIMARY DUTIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Lead the Financial Services function:

Ensure financial adherence to the contractual terms and conditions. Support organizational studies, research, and initiatives that could potentially improve operations and/or result in cost reductions.

Deliver a flexible consumption model able to support the changing needs of the business, provide on-demand spend analysis, administer consistent change request process, track savings, validate accuracy and timeliness of invoice submissions, develop, and maintain an innovation program, and sustainment and continuous improvement activities related to Management Model core functional processes.

Compliance & Oversight: Development and implementation of program financial processes (service fee credits, accruals, invoicing) and procedures that support oversight, conform with financial policies, and support auditing. Serve as liaison between Finance, IT Service Delivery leads, Accounting, Supply, and external vendors on a day-to-day basis for program related financial inquiries. Maintain strong relationships with external vendor administrative personnel in Finance, Accounting, Supply, and IT Service Delivery, ensuring adherence to contractual terms.
Financial Planning & Analysis: Lead development of forecast and Long-Range Plan (LRP) outsourcing cost for IT Strategic Partnering Program (SPP); determining and communicating projections in accordance with contractual terms. Manage the delivery of key program metrics and information supporting audit request, benchmarking, cost, and resources for IT senior leadership, business office, and portfolio owners.
New Business Valuation: Collaborate with Finance and IT Business Office to construct business cases, obtain funding authorization, and manage project implementation budget for outsourcing initiatives. Lead cross functional teams through the development and implementation of program processes.
Data Analytics and Reporting Services: Perform detailed analysis and reporting in support of business operations for the SVMO which governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple SPs. Develop models depicting trends and projections that are translated into analytical information for business stakeholders. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information related to operational performance. Develop and maintain various reports/charts/graphs.
Financial Services: Lead performance measures with related financial impacts e.g. Credits/Earn Backs. Work in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP financial information as required.
Innovation Management: Lead the contractual innovation framework to drive innovation and continuous improvement. Effectively leverage the SPs’ capabilities to meet Constellation IT’s strategic objectives; ensures the SPs’ performance continuously improves throughout the term of the services and across all Constellation IT’s business units.
Support of Contract and Performance Services: Work collaboratively with IT SVMO Performance Lead on performance measures with related operational impacts e.g. KPIs/CPIs. Works in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP performance information as required.
Tools and Reporting Automation and Continuous Improvement: Work with internal and external organizations to develop tracking and reporting mechanisms to provide multi-dimensional views of financial data. Drive continuous improvement through the design, development and implementation of digital scorecards and dashboards. Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and drive self-service reporting.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 5 to 8 years experience in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel to retrieve and analyze data in support of business needs.
“Tech Savvy” - Able to leverage technology to solve business problems with proficiency with specialized business technologies (Power BI and other MS development tools).
Ability to provide in-depth analysis analytical and statistical problem solving, financial and business analysis.
Comprehensive knowledge of the practices, procedures, and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and complex problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action.
Strong leadership, organizational, and project management skills.
Excellent writing skills, as well as excellent written and oral presentation and communications skills.
Strong emotional intelligence, including a demonstrated ability to manage confidential, sensitive, or proprietary information in a discreet and professional manner.
Ability to navigate/build relationships and to collaborate at all levels across the organization.
Ability to build consensus, find common ground, and influence outcomes.
Strong initiative, with self-drive and ability to independently manage time, priorities, and deadlines.
Flexible and comfortable navigating through ambiguity or shifting priorities.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of 8 or more years of relevant experience in IT or a business area performing financial activities.
Graduate degree
Demonstrated experience performing vendor management with outsourcing agreements and associated operational processes.
Financial and contractual acumen and negotiation skills
Proficiency with MS 365 Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Teams)

About this job

The Director, Delivery Solutions will be accountable for overall portfolio health with a focus on profitability, operational excellence, risk mitigation and resolution, and overall delivery of the assigned portfolio. He/she/they will build strong relationships with all parts of the business and the client to define viable approaches/methodologies for delivery in line with relevant industry standards and best practices.

Candidate will have a proven record of accomplishment in leading, structuring, delivering, and managing complex integrated digital solutions for large multichannel clients, with teams based around the world. Candidate should have the ability to lead multiple projects through scope/discovery, estimation, design, development, implementation, and post deployment activities such as maintenance and enhancements. Candidate will have experience supporting and making significant contributions to pursuit of new business and organic growth opportunities.

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in Iterative / Lean / Agile methodologies as well as experience managing repeatable executional processes; especially the management of multiple and simultaneous development projects. He/she/they should have significant experience in client relationship management, people management, strong team leadership, and complex delivery management with both internal and external teams.


What you’ll do

Lead end-to-end the direction and day-to-day execution of client digital marketing transformation program, including direct management of the Delivery Solutions team members on the account.
Ensure resources are allocated and staffed to facilitate delivery, including collaboration with Discipline Leads to ensure alignment to delivery plans
Build dynamic partnerships across iCrossing practices and client teams to best support program goals and evolve delivery approach to stay in alignment with client business needs
Partner with Client Solutions to manage account health and setup business up for continued and future success
Manage cross-functional teams (including direct and matrixed)
Manage budget; resources allocation and balance across multiple client business units and contracts.
Manage and report on the overall business’ health of your portfolio, both operationally and financially (profitability, burn, efficiency)
Interact with senior and executive level management (as needed) regarding project, expected business outcome, contract/ engagement administration (SOWs, Change Orders, etc.)
Enforce delivery excellence and compliance while managing the quality and timeliness in order to deliver on time, within budget, meet revenue / margin targets and meet contractual obligations
Identify risk and develop plans for risk mitigation. You are someone who can successfully lead recovery of a project crisis situation.
Research and propose cost effective solutions to address client business challenges
Use and improve standard delivery methodology for delivering program goals (e.g. agile, waterfall, iterative) while effectively using program management tools, technology management tools, knowledge repositories and team collaboration systems (Smartsheet, Jira, Confluence, Teams, Slack, Box, etc.)
Conduct account/ engagement reviews with client on periodic basis
Travel 2-3 times per quarter for client or team workshops or planning sessions.
Participate in and be a core contributor to iCrossing’s community


Who you are

You have been working in program/project/team management for 12+ years
You have 5+ years of Digital/Marketing Agency experience managing large engagements. Experience in consulting or business analysis is a plus.
Your knowledge of Scaled Agile is strong.
You possess strong client, project management, technical project management, and organizational skills
You have a proven ability to multi task and manage a portfolio of projects (multiple work-streams) effectively and efficiently
You have demonstrated leadership ability, especially to drive action within a matrixed organization
You coach, mentor, train and manage multiple teams by empowering and guiding them
Your experience in technical projects combined with your client interfacing experience allows you to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
You effectively manage and set client expectations with client project owners and client management leadership providing strategic thinking and planning
You regularly interact, manage and influence key stakeholders including executive team members
You are known for your ability to provide proactive and assertive leadership in problem solving, managing financial success of projects, and maintaining timelines
You have a strong understanding of financial, budget and vendor contract management
You plan, scope out and estimate complex strategic, creative, technical development, and media engagements
You have an understanding of business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria
You understand and have overseen UX/Design processes. You understand how to facilitate effective interactions between UX/Design and Technology.
You have exceptional verbal, written and communication skills
You have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. Coursework in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field is a plus.
You have the ability to adapt to rapidly changing business needs and priorities.
You have a positive “can do” attitude with a focus on the success of the team over individual successes.
You apply ingenuity and determination to find the best possible options to support business needs.
You take ownership of outstanding issues, is accountable, and establishes a high level of credibility with others in the organization
You respect other people's opinions and suggestions and work to create an “environment of trust.”


Our Mission & Values



The iCrossing mission is to Transform Experiences. The “we” is implied, but never taken for granted. This mission impacts the way we work, the way we think, the way we treat one another, and the way we evolve into what we want to be. We operate as a community of humans, and we can adapt and evolve because we are guided by values not rules. Our core values map back to our vision.


Be Kind: lead with compassion. What you truly know about someone’s life is very little.
Lead with Candor : know the line. Is what you say true, good, and useful?
We Before Me: lead for others. The sum is always going to be greater than the parts.

We evolve clients for a human-centric future - creating a better world for everyone.

About the Company

Following the 2019 merger of Anvil International and Smith-Cooper International, our unified company relaunched in March 2021 as ASC Engineered Solutions. Under a single name and logo, ASC Engineered Solutions continues our focus on improving the customer experience every day and striving to deliver service excellence. For more than 150 years we have provided the finest-quality pipe products and services with integrity and dedication to superior customer service at all levels. ASC Engineered Solutions provides expertise and product solutions for a wide range of applications, from plumbing and mechanical, HVAC, industrial and fire protection to mining, and oil and gas.
