ADP is hiring a Senior Financial Analyst - FP&A.

Are you a financial analyst with expertise in Excel and creating financial models from scratch?
Are you highly skilled in partnering with business units to provide critical analysis and support?
Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging?

Well, this may be the role for you.

As a Senior Financial Analyst - FP&A, you will lead the forecasting, planning and analytical support for one of ADP's business units. You will analyze drivers of expense within your business unit and use historical performance, operational business decisions/assumptions, and macroeconomic conditions to project future outcomes.

You will build, review, and enhance expense models. Collaborating with Finance business unit partners to build and share knowledge will be critical. You will also oversee storytelling, including connecting results and key metrics to provide a detailed, but concise explanation around performance and forward-looking projections.

The day to day of this role will depend on which part of the financial life cycle we are in. While the day to day may shift, common to all these activities is one thing: becoming the subject matter expert for your business unit.

What you'll do:

Here's what you can expect on a typical day:

Operating Planning and Forecasting. You will support leaders in creating an annual operating plan that is aligned to the strategic plan and perform forecasting that provides visibility into business results to enable business decisions.
Management Reporting and Financial Close Activities. You will produce and distribute recurring and ad hoc management reports ensuring financial reporting accuracy. You will assist in presentation preparation on results, forecasts, and plans to senior management.
Business Analysis. You will employ a deep understanding of objectives, issues and root causes and provide insightful, fact-based data analysis to help solve complex problems. Additionally, you will assist in managing KPI's such as backlog reporting, staffing requirements, starts, weeks to start, no starts, labor productivity, analysis of implementation, survey scores and client satisfaction.
Strategic Planning and Initiatives. You will assist leaders in developing strategies and initiatives to drive growth and margin improvements and execute on strategic initiatives such as M-A support, product launches, market entry, and process improvement efforts. Additionally, you will provide analytical support, conduct research as required, and help to develop and coach new and junior associates.
Business Partnering. You will partner with key stakeholders to align on business priorities and drive effective solutions/execution. You will make compelling arguments based on facts and data and obtain necessary buy-in to deliver on business objectives.
Financial Operational Policy. You will establish and maintain consistent financial operational policies and procedures to govern related practices and comply with all departmental financial operations, policies, and practices.
Experience. You have 5+ years of experience in relevant skills gained and developed in a Financial Analyst, Senior Financial Analyst, or similar role.

TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:

Experience in corporate FP&A, including proven proficiency in performing complex financial analyses and building financial models from scratch.
Advanced Excel experience, including VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, and Index Matching. For extra comfortability in the role, experience with SQL, Power Query, Tableau, Power BI or similar would be helpful.
Experience with Hyperion to input financial data, Oracle to pull general ledgers, or similar tools.
Experience presenting to senior leadership.
Ability to think critically and work within set guidelines, but also able to work within the "gray area" when historical trends do not produce reasonable results or projections.
Exceptional and effective communication skills, including being able to challenge assumptions and drivers while explaining your position on expense metrics and drivers.
Ability to work well both independently and within a team environment, understanding when best to collaborate to achieve optimal results.
You will have a Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. An MBA or credits towards an MBA will allow additional comfortability in the role .

YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:

Have courageous team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to net out the best solution.
Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.
Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.
Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to leading change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft.
Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation.
Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.

What are you waiting for? Apply today!

Job Title: Senior Consultant, Enterprise Architecture and Governance
Job Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit
CIBC.com
Job Description:
The Senior Consultant, Enterprise Architecture & Governance is a seasoned expert who will help advance our IT practice to deliver business needs and fulfill CIBC’s brand promise. This role will work with key stakeholders across the enterprise to align our enterprise architecture related principles, policies, and procedures for CIBC's US Region. This also includes managing across topics such as Technology Operational Resiliency, Business Managed Technology Policy, and supporting Regulatory processes. This role works with minimal direction using deep knowledge in their field of expertise, conducting research into current state capabilities to understand existing gaps and areas for improvement, taking a more proactive role in managing EA practice.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 2-5 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.
Enterprise Architecture Governance
Support governance of architecture strategy, principles, policies, procedures and associated business capabilities/requirements and tools
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of enterprise technology strategy roadmaps, policies, standards, and governance representing US region
Planning & execution of continuous improvement for Architecture governance processes and practices
Support the development/refinement of the process to develop the model for inclusion of application categories such as the concept of business managed technology, and associated governance impacts
Do assessments of the applications in the portfolio to determine any gaps to be remediated and support the creation of business cases to plan the migrations
Monitor and support responses to regulatory and audit requests and manage remediation for timely completion
Support the learning and development of the practice across the organization to ensure adoption and alignment of key stakeholders
Operational Resiliency
Help identify resilience risks in the technology portfolio, lead discussion on remediation of the identified risks and evaluate the overall potential solutions to mitigate.
Monitor remediation action plans for timely completion and escalate any known weakness in the overall resilience landscape in technology
Manage and support Technology resiliency assessments, support creation/reviews of Critical Business Services(CBS) and Critical Shared services(CSS)
Ensure new architecture solutions adequately consider operational resiliency risks
How you'll succeed
Communication - Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation combined with the ability to express oneself and communicate with others verbally; recognizing that verbal communication is more than just language - it includes tone, style and structure.
Teamwork & Partnering - Ability to establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with clients, vendors and peers.
Decision Making and Critical Thinking - Knowledge of tools and techniques for effective use of a broad range of factors, assumptions, frameworks and perspectives when solving problems.
Impact & Influence - Ability to impact decisions within and outside own organization.
Adaptability - Responding to changing business priorities and needs by re-planning, reprioritizing, re-allocating resources, etc.
Leadership-Knowledge of approaches, tools, and techniques for gaining the cooperation and support of others.
Who you are:
You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
You demonstrate a strong knowledge of IT Architecture-Knowledge of concepts, philosophies and tools behind the design of applications, information and underlying information technologies. IT Environment-Knowledge of organization's total information technology (IT) environment.
You meet the following qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Technology
7-10 years of proven experience in Enterprise Architecture or related position
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Should feel comfortable interacting with business and technology resources at all levels
Expert with interface design/architecture, integration technologies development, and enterprise application integration
Knowledge of banking industry domain highly desirable
Up to date on current technology trends, vendors, design etc.
Advanced knowledge of Visio, PowerPoint & Power BI reporting preferred
California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
Subject to plan and program terms and conditions
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact
Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

IL-70 W Madison St, 10th Fl
Employment Type
Regular
Weekly Hours
40

Analytical Thinking, Business Analysis, Business Architecture, Creativity, Ensure Compliance, Problem Solving, Researching, Strategic Objectives

Zurich North America is looking for a Senior Data Scientist, Deep Learning to join our growing Data & Analytics Team. While this position will be based out of our North American Headquarters in Schaumburg, Illinois, we are offering the flexibility to work both in the office and remotely. You will collaborate with your manager to set a schedule that supports you, your customers, and the team.


You will join a team that uses that uses a combination of machine learning, deep learning, and statistical analysis to solve our business partners’ most pressing problems and help our customers better understand their risks. This individual should be an independent leader who is capable of driving our advanced AI initiatives, particularly around NLP and document understanding. Successful individuals will have past experience deploying real world deep learning models to production, having functioned in roles such as machine learning scientist, machine learning engineer, applied AI scientist, or similar.




In this role you will:




Use state-of-the-art deep learning approaches (e.g. CNN, transformer, RNN/LSTM/GRU, GCN/GNN) to extract value from massive amounts of unstructured data (text, images).
Design and develop machine learning and deep learning systems to deliver meaningful technology to the business.
Mentor junior team members in the formulation, execution, and delivery of machine learning models. Operate as a technical leader on the project scrum team.
Write production-ready code to deliver end-to-end AI solutions, working closely with Software, Data, MLOps, and ML Platform engineers.
Create large, well curated datasets for training models, often using advanced methods to obtain sufficient annotations.
Contribute to the development of our model monitoring framework to ensure the algorithms are performing as intended.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and develop leading technology that delivers business impact.
Support stakeholders after deployment to ensure impact is achieved.
Contribute to the development and adoption of best practices and tooling.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in the field and how they can support a variety of initiatives.




Basic Qualifications:




High School Diploma or Equivalent with 7 or more years of experience in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics and experience transforming data in the business analysis area
OR
Zurich Certified Insurance Apprentice including an Associate Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics and 5 or more years of experience transforming data in the business analysis area
OR
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics and 5 or more years of experience transforming data in the business analysis area
OR
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics and 3 or more years of experience transforming data in the business analysis area
OR
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics and 0 or more years of experience transforming data in the business analysis area


Preferred Qualifications:




Demonstrated experience delivering deep learning-based solutions to solve business problems.
Experience deploying machine learning models to production, particularly in a cloud environment (i.e. Azure, AWS, GCP).
Significant experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks such as sklearn and PyTorch/Tensorflow/Keras.
Significant experience working with large amounts of unstructured data such as images and text. Experience with unsupervised, self-supervised, semi-supervised, contrastive learning, and transfer learning methods is a plus.
Advanced knowledge of fine-tuning (e.g. PEFT, LoRA, RLHF) and customizing large language models (e.g. GPT, BERT, Flan-T5, Llama, Dolly, BART), embedding approaches (e.g. Word2Vec, t-SNE), prompt engineering, and vector databases.
Strong software engineering skills including familiarity with best practices around version control (e.g. Git, Azure DevOps), testing (e.g. PyTest, unittest), containerization (e.g. Docker), and experiment tracking (e.g. MLFlow).
Experience with distributed data processing technologies (e.g. pyspark).
Prior experience building NLP data pipelines using a variety of data sources.
Familiarity with graphical methods, graph-databases, and pattern mining techniques.
Advanced knowledge of statistical and predictive modeling techniques such as machine learning, decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, GLMs, SVMs, HMMs, and neural networks and their application to business decisions.
Ability to explain deep technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Past experience as a technical lead, scrum master, or technical product owner.
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to mentor more junior team members.
Experience working in an agile framework such as scrum or kanban.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Now is the time to move forward and make a difference. At Zurich, we want you to share your unique perspectives, experiences and ideas so we can grow and drive sustainable change together. You have a clear vision of where your career can go. And we have the leadership to help you get there. At CNA, we strive to create a culture in which people know they matter and are part of something important, ensuring the abilities of all employees are used to their fullest potential.
CNA seeks to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to our employees that helps them — and their family members — achieve their physical, financial, emotional and social wellbeing goals.

Candidate Guide

The Architecture Consulting Director will join CNA as a proactive, hands-on individual contributor who will lead our technical vision and strategies for various technology disciplines, while crafting standards, best practices, and building reusable components. This role will guide how CNA builds, ships and runs software faster, with higher quality, while more secure. It is also pivotal in steering Agile architecture practices at CNA in partnership with delivery teams and prioritizing technical enablers to synergize delivery across portfolios.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Visionary Technology Leadership:
Drive technology vision and strategies and be the subject matter expert in the aligned technical disciplines.
Collaborate with and influence peer architects and shared service partners across technical disciplines to continuously maintain and improve the robustness, currency and simplification of the overall CNA tech stacks.
Enable innovation by monitoring technology trends, identifying and adopting new technologies and practices that deliver business value.
Embody servant leadership by prioritizing support for the development teams, facilitating collaboration, and empowering team members to enhance performance and achieve their full potential.
Strategic Planning & Delivery Alignment:
Construct and manage technology roadmaps that integrate with agile workstreams.
Prioritize technical enablers and facilitate the identification of interdependencies across delivery portfolios.
Connect dots across delivery portfolios, ensuring technical strategies support and enable business objectives.
Agile Best Practices:
Advocate and apply Agile architecture practices to ensure that technical capability planning extends the architectural runway for the delivery teams.
Collaborate with stream-aligned teams to solve real-world problems and discover new technical standards and best practices and harvest reusable assets from the emerging solutions.
Facilitate the reuse of existing standards, best practices and reusable components by the stream-aligned teams.
Standards, Best Practices & Reusable Components:
Develop technical standards and best practices, advocating for engineering excellence.
Establish guardrails on applying standards to real-world use cases while enabling decentralized decision-making by the delivery teams.
Champion the design and lead the hands-on implementation of reusable components for efficiency and standardization across the enterprise.
Continuous Learning:
Lead technical discipline guilds to facilitate community engagement, pursue engineering excellence, and advocate open, transparent sharing and contribution via innersourcing.
Promote a culture of continuous learning and improvements by sharing knowledge and expertise in various forums.

Typically AVP or above

Strategic and innovative leader within a technology organization, passionate about advancing technical vision and strategy.

Ability to design target state solution architectures leveraging modern decoupled, event based, API enabled architecture frameworks.
Strong knowledge of contemporary technology and business trends that allows architecture to solve problems in a creative and cost-effective manner.
Solid understanding of insurance functions and processes, both within the organization and across the industry
Excellent communication and interpersonal and consultative skills to work effectively and build partnerships and relationships across the organization.
Complex problem-solving skills with the ability to effectively and succinctly articulate an approach and solution for solving to both business and technology partners.

Who We Are:

We believe a workplace food program is something employees should love and look forward to every day. Powered by technology and a network of over 2,000 restaurants, Fooda feeds hungry people at work through our ongoing food programs located within companies and office buildings. Every day, each Fooda location is served by different restaurants that come onsite and serve fresh lunch from their chef’s unique menus. Fooda operates in over 25 major US cities and plans for continued expansion.


About the Team:

Our Data Science & Analytics team is changing the way Fooda uses data. The company has placed a strategic focus on building out our data science and analytics capabilities and you will be core to this growth. The team is responsible for all reporting & analytics for the company, partnering closely with Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations to drive innovative analytic solutions. Will you join us?

As a Sales Operations Analyst, you will work on the Data Science and Analytics team to turn data into actionable insights to achieve our sales and marketing goals across Fooda. This role is responsible for gathering and preparing insights to drive improvements across the sales and marketing processes and to measure the impact of improvements over time.


What You'll Be Doing:

Assess Fooda’s current sales and marketing performance and strategy by compiling and analyzing data. E.g., lead segmentation, sales channel effectiveness, sales productivity, etc.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in sales and marketing to define opportunities to increase productivity through data-driven decision making

0-3 years experience working in sales and marketing operations
Experience using excel or a business intelligence tool (E.g., SQL, Tableau, Power BI) to analyze data and trends

Strong oral/written communication skills, specifically the ability to communicate and translate data trends into actionable insights


Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in a field in marketing, business, or a quantitative field (E.g., mathematics, statistics, or information systems)
Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects: work prioritization, planning, and hitting deadlines
Experience diving into data quality and data profiling analysis to ensure data consistency and accuracy

Comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance plans
401k retirement plan with company match

Job Title: Instructional Technology Facilitator - Engineering IT Shared Services
Job Description:
Instructional Technology Facilitator
Engineering IT Shared Services
The Grainger College of Engineering
University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign

Engineering IT Shared Services at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign seeks applicants for an Instructional Technology Facilitator. We are the IT services provider for the nationally-ranked Grainger College of Engineering, providing services for teaching, research, and learning. Our mission is to be a trusted academic partner in support and service to over 1,100 faculty and staff, and over 10,000 students. We pride ourselves on a customer-centric approach, with emphasis on effectiveness, transparency, and accountability to furnish innovative solutions to the needs of a college dedicated to ingenuity.

You will enjoy energetic and challenging work running and supporting our IT services, along with a transparent and respectful work environment built upon partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. We care deeply about supporting the growth of our employees and invest in employee development through mentorship, cross-functional teams, and professional development and career-advancement opportunities.

Engineering IT Shared Services values employees who are able to work autonomously and on a team with integrity, honesty, comfort with ambiguity, and a growth mindset. Individuals that demonstrate commitment and determination in their work will find this a rewarding and supportive environment.

The Instructional Technology Facilitator focuses on obtaining IT services for faculty and instructors to enhance their teaching activities in the Grainger College of Engineering. This role will be primarily to learn about each instructor's work and identify and locate solutions to support this work. The position also works to identify and advocate for new and/or modified IT services that will be required to support evolving instructional programs. This position engages regularly with the Director of Engineering IT Shared Services on forward‐looking strategy for Instructional Technology.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Customer Service and Support
Meeting regularly with faculty/instructors to learn about and understand their current and future instructional activities and needs, without assuming any particular solutions.
Providing instructors with information on services and resources available to them at the local, campus, regional, and national levels.
Assisting instructors with identifying technologies, resources, and services to support their instructional activities. Connect them to identified resources and services as well as experts on and off campus who can assist with using those resources and services.
Bridging connections between individual instructors throughout Engineering and the broader campus who have similar technology needs and interests.
Maintaining the level of confidentiality required by each individual instructor regarding the information shared about their instructional design, including course content and assessment methods.
Maintaining awareness and understanding of the general instructional activities within Engineering at Illinois.
Staying current with trends in instruction and information technology that may impact the future needs and interests of instructors.
Advising and assisting instructors in addressing University policies and state and federal regulations regarding information technology (e.g. data security, access controls, licensing, accessibility, privacy).
Building and maintaining partnerships and a presence with stakeholders across the college, on other campuses, and nationally.
Actively engaging with campus instructional technology activities such as MOOCs (Coursera), Canvas, Kaltura, and organizations such as CITL, AE3, and Tech Services.

Project and Task Delivery
Managing projects at the organizational, divisional, or team level and drive deliverables and results by designated deadlines.
Completing individual projects and tasks assigned by supervisor on time with quality.
Actively seeking out and delivering solutions to unresolved problems inside and outside of the organization.

Organizational Support
Initiating action with various teams within Engineering IT Shared Services to ensure outstanding service delivery to customers.
As needed, serving as a trainer, mentor, or coach to junior staff.
Promoting use of and implementing centralized services where practical and align them to the unique needs of unit or customers.
Working and leading cross-functional teams, with limited authority for final decision making.

Services & Resources Development
Advising Assistant Director of Instructional Services on long-term strategic planning and emerging technologies and practices in the field.
Identifying gaps in available IT services and resources based on feedback from instructors about their needs and developing proposals, position papers, and whitepapers to define the requirements for services and resources to fill these gaps.
Participating, leading, and partnering with college units, faculty, and colleagues in Engineering IT in R&D initiative to develop new resources, services, and practices for researchers and instructors.

Other Duties as Assigned

Minimum Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent.
Four (4) years of professional experience in an Information Technology (IT) related profession in a higher education setting.
College coursework that includes Information Technology (IT), IT Management, Programming, IT systems, or a closely related discipline, as measured by the following conversion table or its proportional equivalent:
30 semester hours equals one (1) year (12 months)
Associate’s Degree (60 semester hours) equals eighteen months (18 months)
90 semester hours equals two (2) years (24 months)
Bachelor’s Degree (120 semester hours) equals three (3) years (36 months)
Experience in IT operations or service delivery.
Customer service experience.
Experience with learning technologies related to research.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in STEM field.
Experience as an instructor in higher education, particularly teaching in STEM fields.
Professional experience and/or training in facilitation.
Experience writing technology proposals.
Advanced business analysis, project management, and/or planning certification.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Familiarity with campus instructional resources, available LMSs, instructional technology.
Familiarity with university policies and state laws related to information technology and research.
Strong active listening skills.
Demonstrated ability to build professional networks and relationships.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written).
Demonstrated requirements-gathering skills.
Ability to translate IT issues and services for non-IT audiences.
Ability to perform in-depth research on topics and issues.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven record of customer service excellence.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, prioritize requests, and escalate appropriately.

Job Title: Sr Services Business Analyst - Life Sciences -Remote
Job Description:
Welcome to Veradigm! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Veradigm is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.




Veradigm Life Science

The Veradigm Network is well-positioned to address the unique needs of Life Sciences customers. By leveraging the Veradigm Network, research data and associated insights become both an output of care delivery, as well as additional knowledge to improve quality of care, a true virtuous cycle.

Our portfolio of solutions provides insights using real-world data directly sourced from the Veradigm Network. These solutions can help Life Sciences customers discover timely, actionable real-world evidence to improve patient experience and outcomes, and demonstrate how their products can benefit appropriate patient populations.

Support our Client Success team as they help our Life Sciences clients leverage RWD in the research and commercial ecosystem.

The Senior Services Business Analyst role anticipates and enables the creation of data elements that directly supports the financial, operations and business success of the Client Success Organization.

Are you the right fit?

Are you passionate about how real-world data can help address the unique needs of our life sciences customers? Do you have a life sciences background with strong project management skills? Do you enjoy using your analytical skills to solve problems?

What you will contribute:

Understands the trade and workflow of Life Sciences companies
Facilitates clear communication inter and intra-departmentally to promote collaboration
Assists senior project managers to maintain project documentation
Adapts learning to independently prepare common deliverables needed for business effectiveness
Connects business data elements and articulate impact to variations found in metrics
Demonstrates a complete knowledge base of insight to the Life Sciences Business Unit by anticipating potential business issues before realized
Influences needed decisions to allow for near and long-term resolution to challenges and opportunities presented in the business
Seeks out creative means to thoughtfully support the Client Success Organization in operational and business best practices, ensuring compliance and success
Measures and articulates business benefit(s) and outcome(s)
Initiates tool enhancement design suggestions and scope and sees development through completion and production
Leads the ongoing need to continuous process improvement of the organization and function
Anticipates business trends based on industry knowledge and market climate for preparedness and organizational awareness
Creates creative means to describe and represent compelling business issues to leadership leveraging data accurately with insight and context
Demonstrates flexibility and open to evolving roles and responsibilities as need to support Sales, Client Success, and the Business Unit.

The ideal candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent Technical / Business experience (Required)
4-7 years relevant work experience (Preferred)
Life Sciences background (Required)
Project Management experience (Required)
Understanding of data elements within life sciences and how they move through the ecosystem (Required)
External certification in Project Management (Preferred)
Up to 10% travel may be required

Compliance

Job responsibilities include fostering the Company's compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, adherence to the Code of Conduct and Compliance Program requirements, policies and procedures. Compliance is everyone's responsibility.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
PC skills including spreadsheet, all Microsoft Office Suite applications and database applications
Experience with Salesforce and JIRA (Preferred)
Power BI


Enhancing Lives and Building Careers

Veradigm believes in empowering our associates with the tools and flexibility to bring the best version of themselves to work and to further their professional development. Together, we are In the Network. Interested in learning more?

Take a look at our Culture, Benefits, Early Talent Program, and Additional Openings.

We strongly advocate that our associates receive all CDC recommended vaccinations in prevention of COVID-19.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

Salt Flats is an innovation platform with a diverse, creative group of disrupters who challenge the status quo and create tomorrow’s future, today. We develop and apply innovative ideas and accelerate value by accessing the power of emergent thinking within our curated ecosystem. The result is developing breakthrough strategies and building solutions at rapid speed. At Salt Flats, we offer Consulting, Venture Studio, and Venture Capital services.

PURPOSE




Our team is looking for a Manager specializing in business transformation, the ideal candidate will be responsible for guiding organizations through strategic changes, process improvements, and operational optimizations to enhance a client organization’s overall performance and achieve their business objectives. The candidate’s expertise will be crucial in analyzing existing business processes, IT applications, organizational roles and responsibilities, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing innovative solutions to drive sustainable growth and efficiency. As a business transformation Manager, you will play an active role in supporting the selling and delivering business transformations projects to our clients’, working side by side with other company leaders, and taking the responsibility for leading projects and teams in delivering for our clients. This position is located in Chicago.




RESPONSIBILITIESProject Delivery and Management

Develop and execute business transformation programs and projects and evolve client organizations to a future state of improved operating performance tailored to each client’s needs.
Collaborate with clients to understand their business challenges, objectives, and goals.
Work closely with clients to define clear objectives and key performance indicators (KPIs) for transformation initiatives.
Build and maintain strong client relationships by providing expert advice, insights, and strategic recommendations.
Identify opportunities for innovation, cost reduction, and revenue enhancement.
Own change management as clients adopt the new future state.
Lead a project team to deliver client value.
Facilitate client engagement sessions, workshops, and disruptive discovery sessions to deliver future state strategies and outcomes.
Manage budget and plan projects.
Demonstrates cross functional leadership by directing diverse teams across our clients.
Be a subject matter expert across industries for business transformation projects.




Company and Internal Growth Contribution

Support business development efforts including preparing client proposals, RFP responses, and statements of work.
Collaborate with other leaders and team members to develop marketing materials including creating social media posts, blogs, whitepapers, webinars, and case studies.
Regularly participate and contribute to internal team meetings.
Support training and development opportunities for consulting practice.
Lead and contribute to internal work groups and project efforts.



NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Data Gathering & Business Analysis
Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret both quantitative and qualitative data from various sources such as surveys, interviews, market research, and internal documents.
Root Cause Analysis - Capability to identify the underlying causes of problems or inefficiencies within a business process by using techniques like Fishbone diagrams or the 5 Whys.
SWOT Analysis - Understanding and application of SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) to evaluate a company's internal strengths and weaknesses and external opportunities and threats.
Data Analysis Tools - Familiarity with data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or data visualization tools like Tableau for deriving insights from data sets.
Process Mapping & Optimization:
Proficiency in mapping out business processes using tools like flowcharts or process diagrams to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.
Able to analyze existing processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.
Able to design and implement streamlined processes, leveraging best practices and industry standards.
Able to develop and document new processes and procedures, ensuring they are sustainable and scalable.
Systems Analysis:
Proficiency in analyzing existing IT systems, understanding their functionalities, and identifying areas for improvement or optimization.
Ability to gather, document, and validate detailed technical requirements from stakeholders, ensuring a clear understanding of project objectives
Understanding of data modeling concepts and tools to design database structures, ensuring efficient storage and retrieval of data.
Ability to analyze integration points between different IT systems and ensure seamless data flow and communication between applications.
Requirements Elicitation: Skill in interviewing stakeholders to elicit and document clear, concise, and actionable business requirements for projects or process improvements.
Project Management: Basic understanding of project management principles to organize and oversee tasks related to problem-solving initiatives, ensuring timely completion.
Critical Thinking: Strong critical thinking skills to assess situations, identify problems, and evaluate multiple solutions objectively.
Creative Problem Solving: Ability to think creatively and generate innovative solutions to business challenges, considering both conventional and unconventional approaches.
Decision Making: Capability to make informed and timely decisions based on available data, analysis, and considering the potential impact on the organization.
Risk Management: Understanding of risk assessment techniques and the ability to identify, analyze, and mitigate potential risks associated with proposed solutions.
Prioritization: Skill in prioritizing tasks, problems, and solutions based on their impact on the organization's goals and objectives.
Communication of Solutions: Proficient in clearly communicating proposed solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, or visual aids.
Stakeholder Management: Ability to engage effectively with diverse stakeholders, understanding their perspectives, and aligning proposed solutions with their needs and expectations.
Continuous Improvement: Willingness to assess the effectiveness of implemented solutions and make adjustments based on feedback and evolving business requirements.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in a related business or technical field (e.g., engineering, computer science, mathematics).
6- 12 years of relevant work experience in strategy consulting, management consulting, or IT/technology environment including expanding opportunities within a client account, selling projects, and leading teams and project delivery
Travel is required
Authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Masters’ Degree from an accredited university or college in a related field of study
8+ or more years of relevant work experience in strategy consulting, management consulting, or IT/technology environment including identifying new clients, selling projects, and leading teams and project delivery.
Project management certification, e.g., PMP.



We look forward to connecting with you.

We’re in the business of Good

Lions Clubs International is the largest service club organization in the world. Our 1.4 million members are serving locally and globally to help take on some of the biggest challenges facing humanity.

Every Lion and club is supported by our international association. More than 300 Lions International staff members are constantly working on tools and technology to enhance Lions’ service. When caring people join together, roll up their sleeves and take action to make their community better, it’s an incredible feeling for everyone involved.

Here's how you can help. We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst to join our team and rise to the challenge of empowering service.


Position Highlights:

We are looking for a skilled Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst with excellent SQL skills to join our team. As a business intelligence and reporting developer, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to provide necessary data sets for the business as well as identify trends, patterns. Develop reports using Crystal Reports and Dashboards using Power BI. If you have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for data-driven insights, we would love to hear from you.


What You’ll Do:

Utilizes knowledge of data in Data warehouse and leverage Business Intelligence tools to create standard reports, dashboards and other components.
Apply knowledge of SQL programming to create/edit queries and build data models.
Implement data extraction scripts to retrieve and transform data as well as perform performance computations using SQL.
Develop reports using Crystal Reports.
Work with different Functional Units to understand their reporting needs, on-board new recruits, conduct training as necessary and provide BI guidance.
Understand the Business challenges in terms of reporting across the organization and work on standardizing.
Work with BI Administrator and Architect to leverage the existing Business Intelligence tools and enhance/improve value to Business.
Analyze large data sets and report on data to various teams and projects.
Understand and comply with Data Privacy and GDPR regulations.
Effectively utilizes helpdesk software to manage support cases assigned.
Participates in technical team meetings and provide updates to the team as needed.
Provides regular status reporting (verbal and written).


We’re Looking for Someone With:

Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S) from a four-year college or university or equivalent experience. Area of study in information technology or data analytics preferred.
Minimum 5 plus years of related experience.
Strong hands-on background in writing T-SQL, Stored Procedures and Functions.
Hands on with business objects designer, crystal reports and SSRS.
Background in Dash boarding tool, Xcelsius, Power BI, Crystal Reports.
Advanced-level knowledge and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite with emphasis on Excel.
Understand the existing BI Deployment (Business Objects + SQL Server), BI Publisher.
Exposure to other industry leading BI Tools a plus.
BI certifications desired such as: SAP Business Objects, Web Intelligence, Power Bi, SSRS.
Python programming language knowledge, Tableau, SOQL and other Salesforce reporting tools including Salesforce Einstein is a plus.
Willing to work a hybrid schedule and based out of Oak Brook, IL or surrounding area.


Why You’ll Love Working Here:

Lions Clubs International has excellent benefits for you and your family. We believe in a balanced work-life and have programs and benefit plans to support our employees, such as:

Three weeks paid time off plus time off for volunteering
Flexible and hybrid work schedules
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans
Flex spending accounts for medical and dependent care
401K with employer match
Reimbursable training
Casual dress


Local candidates are strongly preferred.

Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of who we are. Diverse and inclusive teams have a positive impact on the work we do, and we know that having varied perspectives helps generate innovative ideas to solve complex problems in an ever-changing world.

Olin Winchester, LLC (“Winchester”), considered one of the world’s leading ammunition manufacturers, is seeking a Sales and Replenishment Analyst. This position will be located at the East Alton, IL facility. With a reputation steeped in tradition, we have earned the moniker, ‘The American Legend’ by delivering on our commitment to excellence in everything we do – including staffing our state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities with diverse, energetic employees. Read on to learn more about this exciting opportunity and join our quest for the best.

Essential Functions*:

Analyze sales and inventory at the SKU level at key accounts to create new orders under a vendor managed inventory program.
Review production needs for key customers and trade channels, including special make-up, and makes recommendations before and during production planning meetings.
Develop seasonal and other customer opportunities utilizing SPS Commerce, Scope, etc.
Monitor point of sale at key retailers and provide daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
Assist sales managers with new product set-up and new pricing establishment.
Interact with sales managers, product management, and marketing personnel to develop and execute business plans.

Solid knowledge of the shooting sports category, emphasizing ammunition products preferred.
Must be proficient with MS Word and Excel; SAP skills preferred.
Superior organizational, communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, and analytical skills.
Self-motivated and able to balance multiple tasks/deliverables with minimal supervision.
Occasional travel required.

C5T Corporation is a Woman-Owned, Certified Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business headquartered at Scott AFB, Illinois. Founded in 2005 by three veterans, we value practical, innovation-minded people with a passion for successful mission accomplishment. We bridge the gap between operational and technical domains.

Our core values are: Integrity...Excellence...Patriotism

C5T is currently seeking an Information Operations Analyst for our USTRANSCOM Mission Assurance Team. This department synchronizes risk management activities across the Joint Deployment and Distribution Enterprise to provide actionable risk information to key decision makers. This is accomplished through numerous actions including Mission Decomposition, Risk to Mission/Risk to Force assessments, Continuity of Operations Planning, Emergency Management, Information Operations, policy and governance reviews, Mission Assurance Assessments, and the inclusion of cyber risk across the spectrum of Mission Assurance related programs and activities.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Provides management and technical direction to multiple complex project personnel.
Regularly exercises independent judgment, as well as high level of analytical skill, in solving complex and unusual technical, administrative, and managerial problems.
Provides overall direction of program activities.
Responsible for all aspects of performance (i.e., technical, contractual, administrative, financial).
Consults with the customer to ensure conformity to contractual obligations. Establishes and maintains technical and financial reports to show progress of projects to management and customers.
Organizes and assigns responsibilities to subordinates and oversees the successful completion of all assigned tasks.
Assumes the initiative and provides support to Marketing personnel in identifying and acquiring potential business.
Ensures the development, maintenance, and implementation of a Program Management Plan; a document which guides the performance of all functional activities performed.
Ensures that maximum service is obtained from all operations through efficient use of personnel and equipment.
Works with managers to develop operational plans.
Responsible for the leadership/training of line personnel.

Qualifications:

Secret Level Security Clearance required. - The applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for classified information access. Please refer to the following website regarding Federal Security Clearance Questions: Security Clearances - United States Department of State
The qualified candidate must have five years of direct mission assurance experience and a bachelor's degree in a business, engineering, cyber security, or a related field. (Experience in place of education will be considered.)
Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Preferred qualifications include experience coordinating issues with multiple military services and combatant command staffs.
Exceptional time-management and task prioritization skills required.
Experience at USTRANSCOM or its Component Commands preferred.
Confidence in drafting/briefing analysis to senior executives (General Officer), a plus.
All C5T team members must have strong interpersonal skills to interact with our customers and team members. Strong communication, leadership, and presentation skills, along with analytical and problem-solving capabilities, are a must.

Benefits:

A competitive salary
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance and Disability Plans
Responsible Paid Time Off (RPTO)
Ten paid holidays
401(k) with an exceptional company match

Job Title: D365 Production and Warehouse Business Analyst
Job Description:
The Company

Heico has a history of success. Since its founding over 40 years ago The Heico Companies has grown from a single business to over 79 separate companies through a strategic acquisition policy, and by reinvesting its earnings into internal growth and new prospects. Historically talented at restoring distressed companies, Heico now strategically targets acquisitions that will complement its ever-growing portfolio of companies in manufacturing, construction, and industrial services.

These four core operations are organized into groups: Metal Processing Group, Construction Solutions Group, Applied Solutions Group, and Industrial Technologies Group. Once acquired, new Heico companies are assigned to a group and run on a stand-alone basis, allowing for great independence as well as the opportunity to share knowledge about markets, production processes, and management practices across other Heico groups and companies. Each Group has its own corporate team.

Heico continues to seek out new opportunities and maintain its standard of success. The Heico Companies has remained a privately held company since its creation and maintains a majority ownership in each of its operations, which generates more than $3.3 billion dollars in revenues. Many of our businesses are certified Woman-owned Business Enterprises (WBE).

More information about the holding company and overall organization can be found at www.heicocompanies.com.

The Position

The D365 Production and Warehouse Business Analyst plays a vital role within Heico Companies, holding pivotal responsibilities. This position involves implementing, configuring, and optimizing the D365 system with a focus on Production and Warehouse functions. It requires understanding and translating the organization's unique needs into effective system configurations, ensuring operational efficiency, and streamlined processes. As a part of the D365 Application Managed Services Team, the Business Analyst collaborates with various internal stakeholders, troubleshooting system issues, providing technical solutions, and consistently driving enhancements to system functionality. This role contributes not only technically but also strategically, making significant contributions to the overall operational excellence of Heico Companies.

Job Description

Primary Responsibilities

Serve as the primary liaison between the Production and Warehouse teams and the IT department to understand and translate the business needs into system requirements.
Configure, test, and implement Dynamics 365 solutions, ensuring alignment with company objectives and efficient resource utilization.
Monitor and review system performance, troubleshoot issues, and provide technical solutions to optimize system functionality.
Collaborate with multiple teams across the organization (including Finance, Sales, Operations, etc.) to drive process and operational improvements through D365 implementations.
Develop training materials for end-users on D365 functionalities and applications related to Production/Warehouse use.
Provide ongoing system support, swiftly and effectively troubleshooting and resolving system issues during various testing cycles.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to drive continuous improvement initiatives, enhancing system functionality and operational efficiency.
Accurately document system changes and developments for future references and compliance
Offer guidance and best practices for the implementation of supply chain management.
Job Requirements

Education

Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred.
Alternatively, Microsoft certification or APICS certifications are also acceptable.

Skills & Relevant Work Experience

5+ years’ experience with full life-cycle implementation of MS Dynamics D365 F&O Finance modules
Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics 365 (F&SCM and CE) and related technologies.
Azure DevOps
Strong understanding of Production and Warehouse workflows.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

EOE M/F/D/V

Western Door Federal is part of the Seneca Nation Group (SNG) portfolio of companies. SNG is the federal government contracting business wholly owned by the Seneca Nation of Indians. SNG meets mission-critical needs of federal civilian, defense, and intelligence community customers across a variety of domains. The SNG portfolio receives shared services support from its parent company Seneca Holdings and is comprised of multiple companies that participate in the Small Business Administration 8(a) program. To learn more visit www.senecanationgroup.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

The Seneca Nation Group companies offer competitive compensation and a strong benefits package including comprehensive medical and dental care, matching 401K, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, and other benefits that help provide financial protection for you and your family. We pride ourselves on our collaborative work environment and culture which embraces our mission of providing financial and non-financial benefits back to the members of the Seneca Nation.

Western Door Federal is looking to hire a Business Systems Analyst – Intermediate to support our Army contract at Rock Island Arsenal, Rock Island, IL. This position supports the Knowledge and Data Management Branch (KDM) of DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center located at Rock Island Arsenal, IL. KDM develops and maintains information systems for several government customers. The majority of the KDM mission supports the Joint Executive Program Office for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear Defense (JPEO-CBRND). This mission directly supports the acquisition programs for CBRN Equipment (CBRNE) for the Warfighter. KDM requires contractor support using non-personal services contracts to execute their mission of developing accredited information systems.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Utilize change management and testing tools such as Microsoft Team Foundation Server, Azure DevOps, GitHub, Jira, etc.
Understand and examine business processes, identify solutions for improving efficiencies, and prepare necessary documentation for enterprise projects.
Participate in multiple/concurrent projects from business analysis through project completion.
Deliver and prepare hardware, software, and system audits; software test plans; and software documentation.
Conduct root cause analysis, and how systems should work to provide support to web-based software users.
Maintain awareness of information system up status. If down, determine why rapidly with all due haste and inform the government and customers immediately.
Provide support Systems Development Life Cycle security and DoD Information Assurance controls in the Security and Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIG) applicable to Application Software.
Manage work items and tasks to meet deadlines established with the government for software releases and other planned scheduled events and deliverables.
Apply knowledge of an information system and its functions to perform data maintenance and content reviews, determine if business rules are maintaining the correct data, evaluate information audits, determine cause of any inconsistencies or issues, and communicate / document findings to fix / resolve issues found.
Work in a software development life cycle, apply security and vulnerability best practices, and require little or no instruction and guidance in performing routine tasks and updating change management systems to document system changes.
Collaborate with other members of the DEVCOM CBC KDM, understand and implement change requests, have superb interpersonal and communication skills.
Document requirements utilizing various business requirement elicitation techniques. Collect, analyze, and develop these requirements ensuring alignment with the business strategy.
Help identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with each solution/design accurately.
Assist in developing and implementing test plans/scenarios to ensure successful project delivery.

Basic Qualifications:

Active Secret Clearance
Bachelor's degree in business management or related discipline.
Must be proficient, and able to work independently on developing information system design artifacts, such as process maps, UI wireframes, etc.
Must have proven time and work management experience managing multiple customers, and changes for multiple information systems with little to no instruction and technical guidance in performing work.
3-5 years related experience in business systems and analysis of complex applications.
Experience in using change management and testing tools such as Microsoft Team Foundation Server, Azure DevOps, GitHub, Jira, etc.; database tools such as SQL Server Management Studio, or other DB client software to examine data in tables and understand database schemas and design; Business office software such as Microsoft Office as well as experience with diagraming tools and standards such as Balsamiq Mockups, Visio, UML, etc.
Promote a positive and professional image and develop productive relationships.
Ability to adjust and be flexible in a rapidly changing environment.
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to relate business requirements in a clear and concise manner.
Inquisitive and persistent – by seeking to understand the real issues and not take things at face value; able to interpret requirements.

Job Title: Web and Database Analyst (Part-time/Temporary Position), ECCE
Job Description:
Web and Database Analyst (Part-time/Temporary Position), ECCE
Job Number: 220003TT
Posting Date: Sep 19, 2022, 5:05:30 PM
Primary Location: Central-42 West Madison Street (CW - Early College and Career)


JOB DESCRIPTION -


Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.

Career and Technical Education (CTE) programs at Chicago Public Schools (CPS) are part of the department of Early College and Career Education (ECCE) within the Office of Career and College Success (OCCS). CTE programs for CPS high schools serve 15K+ students across 70+ schools with the goal of enhancing student preparation for college and career success, as evidenced by increasing graduation rates, college enrollment rates, employment rates, and earning levels of CPS CTE students.

Job Summary:

The Web and Database Analyst (Part-Time/Temporary) role is a part-time/temporary position designed to assist with the maintenance and enhancement of the workbased learning cloud based software Salesforce. Salesforce is leveraged to capture student internship data, workbased learning opportunities and various touch points with internship partners. The analyst will also develop key reporting templates as well as provide analysis for critical academic readiness related projects as outlined in the Roadmap. The part-time analyst will report directly to the Roadmap Director.

The Web and Database Analyst (Part-Time/Temporary) will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:

Develop processes to strategically and systematically collect, archive, and report key postsecondary metrics in an accurate and timely manner, using automated processes where possible.
Develop practical and clear reporting templates that reflect important trends for critical Roadmap outcomes/KPIs to various stakeholders.
Serve as primary consultant for the Work-Based Learning team’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) System needs.
Analyze and visualize data on a project basis to enhance understanding of and usage by key stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and integrity across Offices.
Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council
Work with approved enterprise analytic tool sets. (SAS, SQL)

In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Web and Database Analyst (Part-Time/Temporary) must possess the following qualifications:

Education Required:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university is required; Focus in education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or a related field requiring quantitative coursework, is preferred.

Experience Required:

A minimum of two (2) years of professional experience in a relevant field and a role requiring data analysis skills is required
One or more years of experience as a business analyst or systems analyst preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Ability to use or learn SAS required
Advanced experience with Excel and gSuite applications
Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and data quality assurance
Ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines
Able to lead independently under general guidance and as part of a team

Conditions of Employment

As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to:

Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois.
Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters. Unvaccinated staff with an approved exemption must submit to weekly testing.

Title: Sr. VP, Procurement@ Chicago, IL
Terms of Hire: Full Time.
Salary: $Open+ Benefits.

Job description:
The Senior VP, Strategic Procurement and Sourcing is responsible for managing the execution of strategic and innovative activities related to the procurement of all assigned categories, labor, technology, consulting, and business services. Responsible for overseeing contracts negotiations for the procurement of supplies and services for Client Trust spend.
This position involves working with management to develop fully integrated global sourcing programs including determining scope and objectives, driving demand management, ensuring administrative compliance, partnering with risk and audit, and interpreting broad best in class industry standard strategies and philosophies.
Consults on sourcing solutions, negotiates agreements, and manages relationships to optimize return and mitigate risk. Supports value generation sourcing and profitability improvement initiatives to enable business leaders to supplement the workforce, scale business operations, deliver operating efficiencies, and better serve our partners through global service providers. Serves as a sourcing and contracting expert in meeting client needs while adhering to the end-to-end procurement and third-party risk management lifecycle and applicable laws and regulations. Optimizes use of third parties and collaborates with appropriate personnel within Procurement and across the Enterprise to drive compliant sourcing and contract execution activities.
Will establish objectives for the spend categories along with developing the strategy for the short term and long term sourcing plans. This role will define procurement requirements and operational needs, implement enterprise wide strategic sourcing tools and systems as outlined in the Global Procurement long range plan. This position will be based in Chicago, Illinois with direct management and administration of >$1.5b category related spend.
Conducts the performance management process, identifies training and development needs, and establishes performance standards for the function. Develops, implements, and communicates the direction of the team's procurement global processes and strategies to meet both the function’s and the corporation’s strategic plan.
Major Duties:

Manages a Procurement unit or group. Conducts the performance management process, identifies training and development needs, and establishes performance standards for the function/group.
Creates collaborative business plans with strategic suppliers, develops negotiation strategies, and directs the execution of strategic programs.
Provides direction and oversees that Sourcing Managers develop and maintain positive supplier relationships.
Approves Sourcing Manager supplier contract negotiations, guaranteeing the attainment of the most advantageous pricing, terms, discounts, allowances, quality, delivery, service and demand
management

Establishes and maintains the sourcing strategy for the enterprise including the shaping of supply chain strategies and metrics for assigned categories.
Directs and approves the planning process with Sourcing Managers in developing and recommending sourcing solutions, distribution channels, and execution of best practices. Applies analytics to
enable optimized cost savings and supply base. Collaborates closely with supply teams to establish inventory/replenishment metrics and drive supplier performance.

Collaborates with internal and external resources and to champion enterprise wide cross-functional sourcing initiatives
Contributes to the formation of budgets and effective P&L management by the business units supported.
Directs and executes budgetary cost reduction programs and initiatives that facilitate business owners achieving their business unit goals and financial targets.
Directly manages complex negotiations with key suppliers that require a detailed strategic plan and that have a direct correlation with Corporate operational needs and/or goals.
Sets the example and conducts training sessions for negotiations, financial reviews, business analytics and general management, and is a role model of ethical behavior. Establishes and trains staff on
methodologies for change management, contract reviews and supply base optimization.

Provides continuous leadership to business units to assist in the achievement of their goals and the overall corporate strategies/targets across assigned categories. Consults and advises business unit
senior leadership teams/executives on the impact of procurement activities on projects, budgets, and select sourced retail goods.

Collaborates with APAC Regional Procurement for resource allocation, budgetary control, staff development and sets enterprise wide sourcing plans
Manages capacity through effective demand planning and prioritization in collaboration with business stakeholders and sourcing team to ensure operational efficiency, drive value, and reduce cost.
Acts as a change agent by proactively seeking voice of the client and acting on opportunities for improvement in the sourcing and contracting process, or within specific third-party relationship agreements.
Qualifications:::
Knowledge/Skills:
Possesses an advanced, in depth knowledge of supply chain management, procurement, sourcing, contract management and supplier management. Excellent project management, facilitation, negotiation, analytical, change management and interpersonal skills. Must be an excellent motivator and communicator to manage staff and cross functional teams. Strategic as well as operational expertise is necessary to provide long term planning and execution in supply chain attributes to meet corporation and business unit profitability, efficiency, and risk mitigation goals. Technically adept with basic application software; proficient in MS Office Suites with advanced Excel skills. Experience with ERP systems / Peoplesoft and contract management systems. Demonstrated success in people management, superior leadership skills. Candidate must have strong attention to detail and be well organized. Detailed knowledge of the strategic sourcing procurement lifecycle and procurement best practices and methods and can demonstrate how this knowledge has been applied to optimize category profitability and supplier performance. Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. Experience coordinating and facilitating executive management meetings.
Experience Required:

Minimum of 10 years of experience in procurement/sourcing and managing project teams, or an equivalent combination of education and work experiences.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Finance, Computer Science, or related discipline preferred. The preferred candidate will have an MBA or other advanced degree and
a professional Procurement/ Supply Chain Management designation (e.g. CSCP, CPM).

Must have led organizations in similar types of transformation in the past and have experience with strategic and highly complex business program/projects that may include client
relationship management, strategy, planning, product management, consulting, strategic sourcing, or related work experience

Effective human relations skills in order to direct, motivate and lead staff effectively.
Ability to present professionally to executive-level management and contract providers and vendors.
Experience managing multiple projects and/or vendors as project leader.
Ability to work with diverse groups of internal and external management and associates, especially in times of conflict and pressure to adhere to project and contractual obligations.
Demonstrated financial and business analysis skills at complex levels, while able to clearly communicate information from team member to senior executive. This includes written and spoken
communication.

Demonstrated excellence in managing and leading organizations of similar size and scope
Demonstrated high level of alignment to our Core Values with unquestioned ethics and integrity.

Where does this position fits in your organization?:
- The position is Manager - Procurement with a SVP title. The role is 4 down the CFO and has 4 managers and 3-40 indirect reports.
What are the 3-4 non-negotiable requirements on this position?:
Sourcing background Contracts/Vendor management experience Procurement with Global exposure
What are the nice-to-have skills?:
Financial Services industry background
You Will Enjoy:
An opportunity to be a part of a great culture, an awesome team, a challenging work environment, and some fun along the way!
Apply today to learn more and be part of our Growth story.
All applications will be kept strictly confidential and once shortlisted, our team will be in touch with you for further discussions.

Duration: 12+ Months
Direct client

Description:

Description

Performance Trust Capital Partners is seeking an analyst to join their Financial Institutions Group sales team. We are pursuing candidates with strong quantitative and problem-solving abilities to be an integral member of the group. We specialize in highly analytical methodologies to help clients understand risk/reward alternatives in constructing their fixed income investment portfolios and managing their balance sheets to achieve high-value strategic goals. Our core clients include community and middle market banks, credit unions, insurance companies and other institutional investors. Our professionals use proprietary tools based on the application of quantitative cash flow math to source and place fixed income securities, capital markets transactions, loans, and other select products with our clients. Our mission is to significantly enhance the performance of our clients’ bottom-line results and long-term enterprise value. This role is designed to give exposure to consultative financial sales and provide long-term career opportunities to successful candidates with an interest in institutional sales.

Responsibilities

Acquire a working, technical knowledge of fixed income products, investment portfolio and balance sheet strategy, technology resources and the firm’s operating model
Understand the inter-connected, collaborative roles of our sales, trading, and analytics organizations to address client interests
Research, compile, and present data aimed at improving client outcomes, trading efficiency, sales effectiveness, and business intelligence
Frame and integrate findings into coherent presentations, identifying trends, action steps and investment considerations for clients
Evaluate the potential viability of new product opportunities and the means to effectively deploy resources to develop and launch those initiatives
Develop selling, trading, and analysis skills appropriate to your individual talents and interests
