Job Title: Senior Manager of Business Intelligence and Forecasting - (Remote)
Job Description:
OpticsPlanet, Inc has a great opportunity for a Senior Manager of Business Intelligence and Forecasting. This is an excellent chance to feel the heartbeat of one of the world's largest and most data-driven online retailers, and make an impact on the company's success, by overseeing the analysis of the operational and financial performance of the company, and providing actionable suggestions.
In this role, you will see a direct link between your work and company growth. The role is highly cross-functional and will require coordination with several departments such as Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and others. This role conducts a wide range of business analysis, defines and communicates the appropriate metrics that are needed to accurately and objectively measure business performance and execute on the company’s goals. The role’s activities include interpreting financial and operational trends, identifying deviations from the expected performance, and conveying results to various departments within the organization. This hands-on management role will challenge the candidate to understand and contribute to many facets of the company including business analytics, risk and revenue forecasting, data management, and executive reporting. You would be managing a team of professionals utilizing advanced SQL skills, statistical analysis, and MS BI stack to achieve these objectives.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Directing and overseeing high level strategic and tactical decisions for business intelligence tools and applications.
Organizing the work of 6 team members in 2 locations (with the help of an associate manager).
Coaching a team on the pros and cons of different types of analytics, data modeling, and providing mentorship on extrapolating and examining insights from large data sets.
Coordinating a big number of one-time custom activities concerned with data collection, analysis, reconciliation, trends investigation.
Organizing the metrics and dashboards setup for various areas of the business using MS BI Stack and other custom reporting tools.
Managing the creation and maintenance of SSRS reports and subscriptions.
Building long-term high-level forecasts for major financial metrics. Maintaining the model, monitoring trends compared to the model, and digging into issues.
Keeping track and managing high-level company KPIs.
Providing guidance to our Procurement teams during large purchasing campaigns and strategic buys.
Driving projects related to the design and development of automated decision-making systems for the business. Answering questions and suggesting improvements on the proprietary systems created earlier, such as Product-level Demand Forecasting, Net Margin calculations system, Lead Times calculation system, Automatic Pricing system, etc.
Acting as a liaison between our Finance and the Business reconciling financial and operational reports and KPIs.
Participating as an SME and helping in other company-wide projects. Providing expertise for other departments when it comes to profitability measurement, ROI measurement, understanding impact on cash conversion cycle, etc.
Providing leadership in the development, implementation, and ongoing management of all key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting capabilities for a number of operational areas. Using insights to challenge the organization to be more efficient and cost-effective.
Researching, analyzing and explaining the current and past activity, expected trends, and the potential effect of the changes made. Presenting and supporting findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization.
Qualifications, Skills and Requirements
3+ years of managerial experience in the BI field
MA/MS or higher degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other technical field
Understanding of Ecommerce, Retail, Supply Chain Management, Finance and Marketing
Strong MS SQL/MySQL skills
Experience or deep understanding of Microsoft BI tools: SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, PowerBI
Advanced MS Excel skills
Experience solving analytical problems using other technical field approaches
Excellent Communication skills
Proficiency in utilizing Google Analytics. Google BigQuery expertise is a plus
Experience in Ecommerce is a major plus
Expertise/background in artificial intelligence/machine learning is a plus
Some programming experience is a plus (PHP, C++, Javascript, VBA, or others).

Job Title: ERP Senior Consultant - Business Central / NAV
Job Description:
Job Summary:

BDO Digital, LLC., a wholly owned subsidiary of BDO USA, P.C. is a rapidly growing digital advisory organization dedicated to helping middle-market organizations capture the full power of technology, to adapt to disruption, increase operational efficiencies, improve risk management effectiveness, and uncover new sources of revenue. Our collaborative, cross-disciplinary team is comprised of digital strategists, systems integrators, data scientists, software developers, change management professionals, and industry-specific advisors who work together to solve clients’ immediate digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. Our goal is to help our clients become faster, smarter, and more resilient to change.

To support our double-digit growth goals, BDO Digital seeks an Experienced Senior Consultant will be part of an Enterprise Business Applications (EBA) team supporting projects in the areas of EBA strategy and implementation, in addition to Business Transformation and Operational Excellence efforts. This role will conduct discovery, requirements gathering, process documentation, configuration, and implementation management of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), CRM (Customer Relationship Management), and other related business applications functioning as a key resource for our clients spanning, finance, product distribution, manufacturing, job costing, field service, sales, marketing, service, and reporting.

Job Duties:

Strategy, Requirements & Selection:
Participates in defining needs for existing and new EBA solutions
Documents existing enterprise business applications, related business processes, and personas impacted
Identifies existing inefficiencies, potential improvement opportunities, and critical differentiating business requirements
Envisions and develops representations of recommended future state options for evaluation by clients
Understands related security structures and best practices
Designs and develops scorecards for evaluation of candidate business applications
Creates dashboard presentations of quantitative and qualitative scoring of candidate options
Supports Technical Leads, Developers and Managers by providing functional clarifications and setting expectations with team and client
Solution Functional Design:
Performs functional (business process) solution design in business applications (ERP, CRM, & related) contexts, to provide maximized business value and deliver strong business agility while meeting applicable requirements and constraints
Consulting:
Gains a deep understanding of client needs, analyzes best practices, and plays an integral part in defining and proposing business value solutions that meet or exceed client expectations
Program & Project Management:
Supports, and manages aspects of business applications implementations
Documents and maintains project milestones, phases, elements, and budget
Monitors project progress by tracking risks, actions, issues, decisions, and other activities
Develops references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users
Implementation and Support: Functional support of EBA solutions and related technologies
Manages and resolves issues, defects, and change requests
Manages and performs systems configuration tasks (but not coding/development) for process workstreams as directed
Provides on-going support during project implementations and post-go-live support
Responsible for configuration of solution based on requirements
Fosters a positive demeanor, learning attitude and client service mentality with the team
Travel – up to 25%, as needed
Other duties as required

Supervisory Responsibilities:

Owns and drives completion of key workstreams as directed by project leaders
Manages project workstreams as directed
Mentors and develops entry level consultants and senior consultants



Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Education:

Bachelor’s degree, required

Experience:

Five (5) or more years of business process analysis and/or business application education or experience, required
Two (2) or more years of education or experience with ERP or CRM Product, required
Some client facing best practice consulting experience, preferred

License/Certifications:

N/A

Software:

Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, Word, and SharePoint, required
Smartsheet, preferred
CRM experience (Microsoft Dynamics or Salesforce), preferred
ERP Experience (Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, NetSuite, or Acumatica), preferred
Enterprise software strategy, selection, and implementation experience, preferred
One or more current business applications technology certifications, preferred

Language:

N/A

Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Strong analytical, problem solving, facilitation, documentation, and communication skills, required
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written, preferred
Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills, preferred
Business process analysis, design, and process flow skills, preferred

Job Description:

Be a part of a world-class academic healthcare system, UChicago Medicine, as a Pharmacy 340B Program Audit Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting audits and supporting (third party) audits of the pharmacy 340(b) program for all qualified entities within the organization, including retail and contract pharmacy relationships. This is a remote/hybrid position.


Job Summary




The Pharmacy 340B Program Audit Analyst will be responsible for auditing to ensure qualifications for the program are met and maintained; auditing to ensure that related records are complete and accurate; and audits to ensure all primary objectives as defined by leadership are consistently achieved. Three primary objectives or goals include:


Compliance Audits - Assuring all use of 340(b) throughout the institution (including retail and contract pharmacies) is fully compliant with all federal regulations and related interpretations for the program.
Maximum Participation Audits - Assuring the institution is achieving maximum utilization of 340(b) pricing through full participation in all qualified areas with all applicable products, including inpatient contracts, to ensure greatest cost savings returns throughout the institution
Efficiency of 340(b) Processes Audits - Assuring that all policies, procedures, and related approaches to 340(b) include the most efficient use of resources.


Essential Job Functions

This person will be a member of an audit team responsible for being an institutional “compliance expert or authority” on 340(b) regarding everything from qualifications to the details, policies, and procedures of the virtual inventory processes required for mixed areas.
Strong emphasis on retail and contract pharmacy transactional and operational compliance (audits) and recommendations.
This person will attend 340(b) conferences, routinely monitor Apexus, 340B Health, OPA and other industry-related publications and websites as well as the professional media, literature, and peers to assure the institution has the latest information regarding interpretations, rulings, suggestions, and advanced ideas for ensuring audit activities are comprehensive and align with compliance objectives.
Routinely audit and monitor all points of service (ex. Retail, Specialty, Emergency Department, Contract, etc.) where 340(b) participation occurs to insure policies and procedures are followed, entities qualify and all patients qualify as “covered patients”. Includes inventory replenishment audits, audits of entity details on HRSA OPAIS database, etc.
Routinely audits utilization records and 340(b) purchasing accounts to insure software or tools are working properly and accurately, performing audits or compliance assessments internally as needed; also supports external compliance assessments where appropriate with outside firms to validate internal processes.
Assists in developing and routinely monitoring monthly and annual audit reports on 340(b) participation which clearly documents audit findings, problem areas and exceptions or discrepancies, to be passed to pharmacy leadership and administration for final resolution.
Provide insight into consistent policies and procedures for 340(b) that assure productivity and efficiency so that long-term management of the program does not hamper operations and/or create unnecessary costs.
Support proper implementation that assures full compliance without additional steps, paperwork, or manpower, including the proper use of software or related tools to manage a virtual inventory.


Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance, Business or Accounting with exposure or limited experience with 340B program experience including 340B Prime Vendor Certification
Minimum three years’ experience in business analysis in a healthcare environment.
Proven success in the following job competencies:
Auditing, analysis, and reporting
Communication and presentation skills
Customer focus and relationship building
Analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Teamwork and strong collaboration skills.


Preferred Qualifications

IL tech license preferred.
Epic experience preferred.


Position Details

Job Type/FTE: Full-time (1.0)
Shift: Day Shift
Unit/Department: 340B Pharmacy
CBA Code: Non-Union

In this role, we anticipate that you will generally work approximately 40 hours per week. We anticipate that you will generally be scheduled to work the day shift, from approximately 8:00am-4:30pm, you will be scheduled to be on-call one day a week. We anticipate you will be scheduled to work a remote/hybrid schedule, with some onsite requirements. The days of the week that you are scheduled will rotate during the week, Monday-Friday.


Must comply with UCMC’s COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.

Why Join Us:
We’ve been at the forefront of medicine since 1899. We provide superior healthcare with compassion, always mindful that each patient is a person, an individual. To accomplish this, we need employees with passion, talent and commitment… with patients and with each other. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. If you’d like to add enriching human life to your profile, The University of Chicago Medicine is for you. Here at the forefront, we’re doing work that really matters. Join us. Bring your passion.

________

Bring your career to the next level at a hospital that is thriving; from patient satisfaction to employee engagement, we are at the Forefront of Medicine. Take advantage of all we have to offer and #BringYourPassiontotheForefront.

University of Chicago Medicine is growing; discover how you can be a part of this pursuit of excellence at: www.uchospitals.edu/jobs

The University of Chicago Medical Center is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, civil union status, parental status, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.

Job Description:

The Senior ERP Business Analyst will provide global IT operations and project support related to business processes and systems, which includes SAP Materials Management (MM), SAP Sales and Distribution (SD), and Production Planning (PP) functionality

Experience in interfacing SAP MM/SD/PP functionality with 3rd-party tools is preferred.

Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:

At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!

Job Description:

Crowe is a leading accounting, consulting, and technology firm that provides innovative solutions to help healthcare organizations improve their financial performance and operational efficiency. Our team of experts delivers exceptional service and results to our clients, which include hospitals, physician groups and other healthcare providers. As a Product Owner in the Healthcare delivery unit, you will be responsible for delighting customers with impactful products that reduce risk, drive data driven results and ultimately decrease hours spent on tedious manual processes. You will work collaboratively with product management, cross-functional teams, and clients to gather requirements, refine user stories, prioritize and continuously refine the backlog utilizing Agile/Scrum methodologies. You are a critical team member that negotiates and collaborates to bring products into the market.

The ideal candidate should have:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience – certified Product Owner

1-2 Agile/Scrum experience OR 2-3 years in business analyst role

You thrive in fast-paced environments

You have experience leading an Agile scrum team

You enjoy collaboration and owning outcomes

Possesses deep knowledge of SDLC processes, Agile/Scrum methodologies, DevOps & Quality Assurance processes

Experience managing customer expectations

Possess technical acumen, the ability to describe and gather product requirements and get feedback from technical staff

Understands the value in making decisions utilizing data to support your path forward.

Advanced experience working with large, complex data sets within large organizations

Able to Work with cross functional and international teams

Ability to understand, communicate and engage effectively with multiple stakeholders and interactions

Acts as a servant leader to the team, creative thinker with an innovative mindset.

Learning to utilize the tools and techniques available to gather customer/user feedback and data and apply it to your product backlog items.

Strong project organizations skill, including prioritization, planning and organization

Strong problem-solving, listening, written and verbal communication, and decision-making skills

Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively

This position requires up to 10% travel.

What will set you apart from other candidates for this role:

Have 3+ plus years of healthcare revenue cycle industry experience is a must

Experience working with healthcare providers, health systems or the healthcare industry

Experience developing/implementing a revenue cycle product

Experience translating revenue cycle business needs into technical requirements to build and transform data into valuable, easy-to-understand insights

Expert in communicating and collaborating with international resources

Understanding of revenue cycle consulting

Strong financial, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills

Your responsibilities will include but not limited to:

Translates high level business requirements into detailed requirements (user stories) to be used by the development team in each sprint, while ensuring stories and features are added iteratively to the product to add overall value

Drives agile development & testing teams by creating detailed requirements in the form of user stories from inception to delivery

Ability to create space for others in your team to do their best work by managing client or stakeholder relationships

Contributes to overall scope and planning of a project, including working with business stakeholders and partner with product management to understand ‘why’ we are working on something before development begins

Analyzes data to ensure features are aligned with product goals/objectives and delivering the most business value

Analyzes product data to make decisions and report to stakeholders “why” decisions are made.

communicate changes of plan or slip in timelines to a broad group within your organization and manage expectations effectively until resolution.

Holds a central position in each of the product/application development cycle with an in-depth working knowledge of Revenue Cycle in Healthcare

You help your team to make decisions in a timelier manner, breaking down assumptions about the shape of the work and encouraging people to value done over perfect.

Makes improvements to maintain the product's competitiveness, adds new features or functionalities or enhance the existing ones to attract more customers.

A key strategist in developing functionality, based on full understanding of specific business functions, considering all of the associated business & technical dependencies involved

Plays an active role in creating requirements and roadmaps based on business priorities, track and manage progress of the product deliverables

Manages a story backlog to ensure readiness of user stories for the upcoming sprint and creates acceptance criteria that is clear, concise, and actionable

Works with other product owners when necessary to ensure that business requirements are translated into accurate, actionable user stories

Works with Dev and QA to understand the business need and requirements of any given story

Identifies opportunities for improvement across product, process and team

Provide project support during release and implementation periods

What does it mean to be a Product Owner at Crowe?

Visionary

Imaginative, can see the product vision

Good at story telling

Organized

Understands how the solution will solve the problem

Collaborator/ Liaison

Negotiator

Facilitator

Understands the value from different perspectives

Presenter

Influencer/Communicator

Clear communicator and bridge from business to technical

Active listener

Multi-tasker

Can articulate ideas into manageable stories/tasks

Leader/Decision Maker

Works well with technical associates and business associates

Planner

Empowered to make decisions

Calm, patient and supportive

Customer Representative/Marketer

Understands the customers’ needs

Meets and exceeds customer expectations

Empathetic and guiding

Experimenter

Creative

Continuous learner

Problem Solver

Contributes to innovation

#LI-hybrid

Job Title: Head of Wholesale Client Onboarding - Executive Director
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Join our dynamic Global Services Finance & Business Management team as the Head of Wholesale Client Onboarding Metrics & Analytics, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of business analytics programs for our Commercial Bank and Corporate Investment Bank.

As a Wholesale Client Onboarding Manager in Global Services Finance & Business Management, you will lead both strategy and execution of business analytics programs for Commercial Bank and Corporate Investment Bank. You will partner with senior leaders in Finance, Technology, Strategy, and Operations to ensure high quality, efficient, and insightful reporting and analysis programs are in place to enable strong business performance.

Job responsibilities

Manage a ~10 FTE global reporting/analysis organization. Hire, lead, develop and coach diverse & high-performing teams of data and analytical talent
Manage a high-volume and high-complexity reporting book of work, leveraging strong project management discipline and strong controls
Demonstrate a high level of responsiveness and credibility in response to senior management on-going and ad-hoc requests
Develop a deep understanding of Client Onboarding systems and processes in order to extract insights from data while identifying and recommending transformation and operational efficiency opportunities
Define, monitor, and report key operational metrics, mining data from available data sources; create a robust documentation suite to clearly articulate data definitions while highlighting data quality gaps for inclusion in Technology and Process Improvement roadmaps
Accountable for an Executive Management Reports, incorporating key people, productivity, efficiency, client experience, finance, and control metrics. Review in senior manager forums and speak fluently to patterns in observed data
Define, design, and manage high priority strategic initiatives with senior level visibility in areas above

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

12+ years of experience within MIS, analytics, business management or consulting roles
Ability to serve as a strategic business consultant, working with executives to guide improvement of reporting while using new tools to streamline existing processes
Program management experience with history of leveraging project management discipline to deliver complex initiatives
Experience developing complex business analysis models by being resourceful, consulting with others and considering alternatives
Demonstrated ability to set a strategic management reporting vision from scratch
Outstanding technical skills to access complex data sources to solve problems, with hands-on experience in use of Business Intelligence toolsets and database platforms; examples include Hadoop (SQL-like), Alteryx, Qlik Sense, R, Python, etc.
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite of products such as PowerPoint, Excel and Visio

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

Leads the execution of initiatives/programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution
Defines business requirements for analytics & reporting to ensure data insights inform business decision making
Encourages staff, colleagues, team, and senior management to challenge and improve upon status quo
Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field; advanced study a plus

Morgan and Chase brands. We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.

Thank you for taking time to stop by and take a look at the BA role I have posted on Indeed. If you have read my job descriptions before, welcome back. If you are new to my job descriptions, welcome to the party.

Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Tom Welke. I am Partner & Vp at RSM Solutions Inc and I have been recruiting technical talent for over 20 years (it was 20 in January) and been in the tech sector since the 1990s. Due to this, I am going to be far more focused on 'fit' than anything else...a fit for you and a fit for the client. I also like to add some humor to job descriptions as well (life is too short not to have some humor), so if you see something that makes you chuckle, that was the intent.

This role is for one of my best friends. Sometimes, when you work on a role, it takes another turn...where you want to not only do your best, but you want to exceed your own expectations...this is such a role. So, as you can imagine, I know the hiring manager for this role very very well. Here are some things that creates a good social fit:

This is a role where we need someone that doesn't need to be micro managed. The hiring manager for this role really enjoys working with people that think through their actions. If you are the kind of person that doesn't like to be micro-managed but can put their big boy pants or big girl pants on and gets their work done, this role will be GREAT for you.
No ego. Let me explain. If you think you are God's gift to IT and believe that the world revolves around you, then you should probably run for Congress (I hear they are hiring)...because you wont be a fit here.

However, we are seeking someone within driving distance to Itasca, Illinois or Hanover Park, Illinois.

Here is what we are seeking: We are seeking a JDE E1 BA that specializes in that wonderful and ever-exciting world of manufacturing. You will do all those key things that 'classic" BA's are involved it...that being requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming (I bet you are getting excited with every word), QA and deployment. If - oh joy of joys - you have combined some of those nifty PM and BA skills together, oh man that would be great. You will assist with trainingand technical support to system end-users as well. As you might have guessed, you will develop test plans and integrate technology into other business operations. Think of this role as a techno functional lead role responsible for providing input and assisting in the development and implementation of business initiatives to support company operations and business decision-making.

Here are some of the key things we are looking for (I am not going to tell you about an exhaustive list of a zillion things, half of which don't exist...so, I will slim this down to the real 'meat':

Real live, and in-depth JDE E1 experience in those nifty manufacturing modules.
Lead the IT Labware support & implementation process.
Experience with all those things that BA's know very very well...requirements gathering, documentation, process flow diagramming, QA and project deployments...with specific focus on JDE E1. that JDE experience is an absolute must have.

Summary:The Industrial Sales leader has overall responsibility for sales in new business and Food Service channels. This position is a leadership role requiring the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate across the organization to ensure alignment and delivery of revenue growth.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.

· Process and enter all Industrial sales orders to ship.

· Set up trucks for industrial shipments that are PPD/ADD.

· Follow up with customers to ensure pickup and delivery of shipments.

· Work with sales team on daily requests on issues pertaining to their customers.

· Enter all contracts in ERP System.

· Customer Service on daily requests through emails or calls regarding ship status, pricing, product availability.

· Follow up and resolution on any issues pertaining to pricing, delivery dates, contract pulls and so forth.

· Build relationships with key customers across channels to launch new business lines and increase current book of business.

· Manage key customer relationships at both strategic and executional level to deliver results.

· Design and develop a high-performance sales team with a focus on execution and results.

· Work closely with product management, marketing, and operations to align sales plans with internal activities to maximize business performance and company profitability.

· Effectively manage new product launches working closely with internal teams from idea through successful in-market performance.

· Develop and manage a trade marketing budget for all channels including return on investment analysis to ensure effective deployment of funds.

· Participate in strategic planning, development of staffing, capital and operating budget.

· Work with management and other departments to establish KPIs, particularly with

· Finance and Operations to ensure clear and timely reporting on measures critical for company success and profits.

· Develop annual business plans for key accounts across all US sales channels, including detailed trade marketing programs, pricing, trade promotion budgets, comprehensive annual account level plans and forecasts.

· Establish and monitor performance requirements for direct reports and external partners (distributors, brokers, etc.).

· Coach, mentor, and raise the team’s ability to meet and exceed plan.

· Perform other duties as assigned.

· Demonstrated success in building and managing a high-performance sales organization.

· Proven leadership and experience with managing effective client relationships.

· Demonstrated leadership skills with a broad knowledge of management practices and good business analysis/project management skills.

· Demonstrated ability to grasp a complex, fast moving food manufacturing business and use this understanding to set overall strategy and drive business process improvement.

· Demonstrated business savvy to effectively communicate and work with other executives in support of achieving business and systems goals.

· Strong business planning skills to execute strategic projects with implications for business areas with rapidly evolving business processes.

· Must possess a balanced perspective on strategic and tactical issues.

· Proven ability to manage numerous projects, as well as resources, remotely in a dispersed organization.

· Proven ability to select top talent and create a productive environment that promotes initiative, innovation, continual learning and development of key personnel for future advancement.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst on the Information Technology team, your prior Accounting or Finance experience will be valuable as you recommend & implement technology solutions that will make processes more efficient and employees more productive within our Finance and Investments groups. Core responsibilities include translating business requirements into technical documents, mockups, and test scripts; becoming the subject matter expert on how your business partners use our software; and working in a dynamic team of BSAs and developers to deliver technology solutions that empower your business partners.

WHO YOU ARE:

Knowledgeable & Analytical.
Your background includes a combination of Accounting/Finance and Information Technology and you are comfortable with Accounting concepts, specifically the routines related to closing financial books. You re skilled at gathering requirements, data collection & analysis, problem solving, process documentation, and identifying areas for improvement.

Technologically Savvy.
You ve got a solid proficiency in writing SQL queries. You re also comfortable working with relational database concepts and have a knack for quickly mastering new software. You re familiar with how data can flow between systems via integrations/APIs.

Business Liaison.
You re comfortable collaborating with business partners and third party vendors to gather needs, review viable solutions, test new functionality, and track post-implementation results.

Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are clear, articulate, effective, and demonstrate your ability to interact with all levels both within and outside the organization. By delivering clear communication, you help to ensure that projects stay on time, deliverables meet budget, and key stakeholders are aware of project statuses.

Passionate. Motivated. Eager to Learn.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, challenge the status quo, and regularly seek to understand.

WHAT YOU LL DO:

Work closely with teammates and business partners to analyze and document business requirements
for projects and software customizations or configurations. You ll then translate those business requirements into technical requirements for development staff.
Provide project management to coordinate efforts between business partners and IT.
Deliver clear communication on status, timing, deliverables, and budget to leaders, team members, stakeholders, etc.
Implement new technology and evaluate upgrades.
You ll present new features to business partners, test new functionality, and assist with the creation of training documentation.
Identify opportunities for automation.
Implement technology solutions such as workflows or Robotic Process Automation to enhance business processes and eliminate administrative burden.
Document data relationships and write basic SQL statements.
You ll analyze and compare datasets and look for trends, issues, or areas for improvement.
Implement and manage standard testing procedures for system changes.
Create, review and execute test plans and validate that it meets the business and technical requirements. Responsible for proper tracking of test results.
Provide assistance to IT Support to review issues reported from users.
Compare data from multiple sources to reconcile discrepancies, determine cause of errors and establish procedures to correct them.
Challenge the status quo. Be willing to look at processes with fresh eyes and questions on whether there s a better way.
Represent the Company in a professional manner at all times.
Consistently maintain a professional, courteous attitude when dealing with residents, coworkers and the general public.
Perform other duties as necessary.

Previous Experience & Requirements:

A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Business, Accounting, Finance, or computer science with previous business analysis and/or project management experience is preferred.
5+ years relevant Accounting/Finance, business analysis and/or consulting work in related fields is preferred.
Key competencies: requirements gathering, data analysis, conceptual thinking, problem solving, customer focus, managing work efficiently, strong written and verbal communication skills.

Machines, Tools and Equipment, Software:

Experience with MRI or other ERP/Financial Software products strongly preferred
Experience with Blackline Accounting software preferred.
Must be proficient in creating/executing SQL queries and possess thorough understanding of relational database concepts.
Must be adept with the Google Platform and Microsoft Office suite of products.

Data Engineer

The Opportunity:

Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need a data professional like you to help our clients find answers in their big data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.

As a big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll use your skills and experience to implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll develop and deploy the pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful.

Here, you’ll work with a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll sharpen your skills in analytical exploration and data examination while you support the assessment, design, development, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients.

Work with us to use big data for good.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

2+ years of experience utilizing programming languages, including C++, Java, or Python
2+ years of experience developing and maintaining scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis
Experience creating software for retrieving, parsing, and processing structured and unstructured data
Experience developing scalable ETL and ELT workflows for reporting and analytics
Experience creating solutions within a collaborative, cross-functional team environment
Ability to develop scripts and programs for converting various types of data into usable formats and support project team to scale, monitor, and operate data platforms
Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:

Experience in application development utilizing SQL or Scala
Experience with data visualization technologies, including Tableau, PowerBI, QlikSense, Grafana, or Kibana
Experience with a public cloud, including AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience with distributed data and computing tools such as Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience working on real-time data and streaming applications
Experience with NoSQL implementation using MongoDB or Cassandra
Experience with data warehousing, including AWS Redshift, MySQL, or Snowflake
Experience with UNIX or Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting
Experience with Agile engineering practices
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph

Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll develop your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $58,300.00 to $133,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

We are a cutting-edge fintech company located in the heart of Chicago. Our primary focus revolves around leveraging bank transaction data for consumer risk analysis, making finance more accessible and secure for everyone.




As we continue to grow, we are keen to onboard a Senior Data Analyst or Sales Engineer with a proven ability to lead and drive customer engagements.

Key Responsibilities:



Serve as the lead technical consultant for both prospective and existing customers, translating intricate data insights into actionable strategies and solutions.
Independently conduct in-depth data analysis on financial datasets, unveiling insights to bolster customer growth and drive product adoption.
Partner with the sales and customer success teams, spearheading technical discussions and ensuring our offerings align seamlessly with customer objectives.
Develop and deliver high-impact presentations and reports for a diverse set of customers, underscoring the unparalleled value of our data-driven propositions.
Take the initiative in educating and mentoring customer technical and business resources, ensuring they derive the utmost value from our suite of solutions.

Requirements:

3-5 years of experience in a senior role within sales engineering, risk analysis, analytics consulting, or lending.
Medium to advanced proficiency in data analysis tools, particularly Python and SQL.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with a talent for elucidating complex concepts to a varied audience.
Proven capability to function independently, owning customer engagements from inception to completion.
Familiarity with AWS will be considered a strong advantage.
Prior experience in the lending sector or an in-depth understanding of its landscape will be given preference.
A foundational grasp of data science and machine learning methodologies is highly desirable.

Fun, fast-paced work environment

Dynamic start-up culture

At Instawork, we’re driven by our vision to create economic opportunity for local businesses and skilled hourly professionals in communities around the world. With a growing number of hub cities across the world in the U.S., Canada, India, and beyond, we’re looking for top talent to help rapidly scale our high-tech and high-touch labor marketplace. Our accomplished and dedicated team is passionate about our mission and committed to crafting revolutionary products, all with the backing of our world-class investors, including Benchmark, Spark Capital, Craft Ventures, Greylock Capital, Y Combinator, and more!

The mission of the Business Operations team is to create strategic clarity and alignment to accelerate Instawork’s growth, and we tackle company-critical work in three areas:

Business health & day-to-day operations. Define critical KPIs/metrics, stay on top of key trends in the business, perform analyses to unearth new insights and support important decisions, and design/own the "operating systems" that help run the business effectively.

Strategic planning & goal-setting. Manage the processes that enable teams to produce clear strategic plans connected back to broader company strategy, and translate these plans into forecasts and ambitious goals/OKRs.

Special projects & initiatives. Answer critical questions about our market and growth opportunities, drive complex projects that help us run/scale better as a business, and incubate 0->1 initiatives that lack clear owners.

As an Associate on our small, growing Revenue Operations & Analytics team, you will work closely with leaders across our go-to-market (GTM) functions on initiatives that help scale the demand side of our marketplace during a period of rapid growth. You will be given the autonomy to lead projects that are critical to the success of the business, the guidance to develop into a business leader in your own right, and the opportunity to eventually step into functional leadership roles within the business or more senior roles within Business Operations.

We have an immediate opening for a Sales Operations Analyst, with a proven track record of success to join our rapidly growing team. Reporting to the Head of Revenue Operations, this role serves as a critical member of the sales operations team and is responsible for building an operations function that will support and accelerate the success of our growing sales and marketing teams. This role requires prior sales operations experience. This is a results-driven position that requires high integrity, high EQ, an openness to feedback, and a willingness to learn and grow.

What You'll Do

Build an operations function that will support and accelerate the success of our growing sales and marketing teams
Assist in designing, onboarding and maintaining key sales operations systems, including Salesforce, SalesLoft, LeanData, Gong, Chili Piper, ZoomInfo, etc.
Analyze, develop, and improve operational processes and systems
Partner with other team members across GTM to define dashboards, metrics and KPIs and to surface business insights
Support commissions design & process, pipeline management, and sales forecasting
Own our tech stack and reporting tools - data systems, excel models, data warehousing
Be the subject matter expert and proven leader on sales performance, processes & systems at Instawork

Who You Are

2+ years of experience in sales operations
Operates with high integrity, high EQ, an openness to feedback, and a willingness to learn and grow
Experience with Salesforce (required), SalesLoft (preferable), and SQL (preferable)
Detail-oriented, with a strong passion for analytics and problem-solving
Excited and passionate about working in a fast-paced environment with the ability to pivot quickly, is comfortable with making decisions in ambiguity, and has a strong bias for action while understanding the bigger picture
Excellent interpersonal skills to build positive working relationships across the organization

Instawork Values

Bias for Action - We are a growing team and an evolving product. We want a team of do’ers to drive the company forward, even if it means making decisions with incomplete information or being wrong.

Act Like an Owner - Treat this company as though it is your own. Execute on the fundamentals, and act creatively to drive growth. Your ability to drive impact in any part of our company is only limited by your courage and conviction, not your job title.

Always Be Learning - We are changing an entire industry. We strive to learn from each other and get better each day, week, and month, so that our team’s learnings can compound and we can all improve, together.

Empathy, Trust, Candor - Empathy for our business partners and professionals means we put ourselves in their shoes. Empathy for our colleagues means we are always upfront and honest with each other, which comes from trust.

#LI-JG4

About Instawork

Founded in 2016, Instawork is the leading flexible work app for local, hourly professionals. Its digital marketplace connects thousands of businesses and more than three million workers, filling a critical role in local economies. Instawork has been featured on CBS News, the Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, Associated Press, and more. In 2022, Instawork was ranked among the country’s top 10% of fastest-growing companies by Inc. 5000 and was included in the Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup list. Instawork was also named the 2022 ACE Award recipient for “Best Innovation” and one of the “Best Business Apps” by Business Insider. Instawork helps businesses in the food & beverage, hospitality, and warehouse/logistics industries fill temporary and permanent job opportunities in more than 25 markets across the U.S. and Canada.

For more information visit www.instawork.com

We value diversity on our team and firmly believe Instawork is stronger when we hire people who make their own unique contributions to our culture. We welcome all applicants and encourage candidates from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

JOB SUMMARY:

Analyze transportation and distribution systems and procedures to ensure the efficient and economical delivery of the organization's products. Evaluate freight classifications, tariff rates and operating efficiency to ensure the proper delivery of products.

Responsibilities:

Generate transportation cost and service performance metrics for internal division, operations team and carrier review meetings.
Help maintain service levels while achieving route guide compliance targets by working with the branches and Transportation Operations.

Leverage analytics tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, SAP, Webfocus to develop and implement reporting that allows Medline to improve operations and reduce cost across the inbound transportation network.
Monitor carrier performance and generate scorecards to drive continuous improvement across cost and service. Assist in the audit and payment of freight bills.
Collaborate with BI, Inventory Management, and other internal teams to participate in projects to drive transportation improvement

Personal experience with varied transportation modes, methods, and best practices
Basic knowledge of Transportation Management Systems
Advanced level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: Pivot Tables, VLookups, formatting cell types, creating and interpreting graphs and charts, complex filtering and sorting, using SUM function, setting borders, setting column width, inserting charts, using text wrap, sorting, setting headers and footers and/or print scaling).
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Access (for example: designing and creating simple queries, modifying data types, adding dates, working with required fields and/or creating labels).

Develop, share, and incorporate organizational best practices into business applications
Diagnose problems and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvement
Formulate and update departmental policies and procedures
Serve as the subject matter expert on the assigned function product to ensure operational performance.
Ability to travel

Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 4-6 years of business process or data analysis experience, preferably in healthcare. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access preferred. Project management experience preferred.


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Why iCrossing


For over 20 years, iCrossing has been partnering with the world’s largest B2B and B2C brands to provide connected marketing & technology solutions that transform brand experiences and marketing strategies into superior business outcomes. Our human centric approach evolves customer experience, employee experience, and user experience across digital and physical channels powered by data and intelligent creative.

We believe our biggest asset is our combination of different backgrounds, cultures, and disciplines that come together to form iCrossing community. What we do starts with our people.

We are part of the Hearst Corporation, the world’s leading media, entertainment, and content company, which gives us access to the most valuable data and insights, talent and audiences.


About this job

The Associate Director, Delivery Solutions will be accountable for overall program health with a focus on profitability, operational excellence, risk mitigation and resolution, and overall delivery of the assigned program. He/she/they will build strong relationships with all parts of the business and the client to define viable approaches/methodologies for delivery in line with relevant industry standards and best practices.

Candidate will have a proven record of accomplishment in leading and managing complex integrated digital solutions for large multichannel clients, with teams based around the world. Candidate should have the ability to lead multiple projects through scope/discovery, estimation, design, development, implementation, and post deployment activities such as maintenance and enhancements. Candidate will have experience supporting the pursuit of new business and organic growth opportunities.

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in Iterative / Lean / Agile methodologies as well as experience managing repeatable executional processes; especially the management of multiple and simultaneous projects. He/she/they should have significant experience in people management, strong team leadership, and complex delivery management with both internal and external teams.


What you’ll do

Lead day-to-day execution of assigned client program, including direct management of the Delivery Solutions team members working within that program.
Ensure resources are allocated and staffed to facilitate delivery, including collaboration with Discipline Leads to ensure alignment to program delivery plans.
Build dynamic partnerships across iCrossing practices and client teams to best support program goals and evolve delivery approach to stay in alignment with client business needs.
Collaborate with portfolio lead to ensure program aligns to client and portfolio outcomes.
Manage cross-functional teams (including direct and matrixed)
Manage budget; resources allocation and balance across multiple client contracts.
Manage and report on the overall business’ health of your portfolio, both operationally and financially (profitability, burn, efficiency). Proactively identify action plans to resolve program issues.
Interact with day to day client contacts regarding projects/program, expected business outcome, contract/ engagement administration (SOWs, Change Orders, etc.)
Enforce delivery excellence and compliance while managing the quality and timeliness in order to deliver on time, within budget, meet revenue / margin targets and meet contractual obligations.
Identify risks. Develop and execute plans for risk mitigation.
Research and propose cost effective solutions to address client business challenges.
Use and improve standard delivery methodology for delivering program goals (e.g. agile, waterfall, iterative) while effectively using program management tools, technology management tools, knowledge repositories and team collaboration systems (Smartsheet, Jira, Confluence, Teams, Slack, Box, etc.)
Contribute to engagement reviews with client on periodic basis.
Travel 2-3 times per quarter for client or team workshops or planning sessions.
Participate in and be a core contributor to iCrossing’s community


Who you are

You have been working in program/project/team management for 8+ years.
You have 4+ years of Digital/Marketing Agency experience managing large engagements. Experience in consulting or business analysis is a plus.
Your knowledge of Scaled Agile is strong.
You possess strong client, project management, technical project management, and organizational skills.
You have a proven ability to multi task and manage a portfolio of projects (multiple work-streams) effectively and efficiently. You can balance both managing projects directly and supervising project managers on your program.
You have demonstrated leadership ability, especially to drive action within a matrixed organization.
You coach, mentor, train and manage your team by empowering and guiding them.
Your experience in technical projects combined with your client interfacing experience allows you to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
You effectively manage and set client expectations with client project owners and client management leadership providing strategic thinking and planning.
You regularly interact, manage and influence key stakeholders.
You are known for your ability to provide proactive and assertive leadership in problem solving, managing financial success of projects, and maintaining timelines.
You have a strong understanding of financial, budget and vendor contract management.
You plan, scope out and estimate complex strategic, creative, technical development, and media engagements.
You have an understanding of business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
You understand and have overseen UX/Design processes. You understand how to facilitate effective interactions between UX/Design and Technology.
You have exceptional verbal, written and communication skills.
You have the ability to adapt to rapidly changing business needs and priorities.
You have a positive “can do” attitude with a focus on the success of the team over individual successes.
You apply ingenuity and determination to find the best possible options to support business needs.
You take ownership of outstanding issues, is accountable, and establishes a high level of credibility with others in the organization.
You respect other people's opinions and suggestions and work to create an “environment of trust.”


Our Mission & Values

The iCrossing mission is to Transform Experiences. The “we” is implied, but never taken for granted. This mission impacts the way we work, the way we think, the way we treat one another, and the way we evolve into what we want to be. We operate as a community of humans, and we can adapt and evolve because we are guided by values not rules. Our core values map back to our vision.


Be Kind: lead with compassion. What you truly know about someone’s life is very little.

Lead with Candor : know the line. Is what you say true, good, and useful?

We Before Me : lead for others. The sum is always going to be greater than the parts.


We evolve clients for a human-centric future - creating a better world for everyone.


Benefits

iCrossing offers a range of employee benefits including generous PTO, 11 paid holidays, 401k + company match, full medical/dental/vision coverage, FSA & HSA options, family leave, commuter benefits, and more.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)
Work together with Automation, Cloud Security Posture Management and ITS Global Operations teams on the implementation, automation, and maintenance of new Cloud security monitoring policies within our cloud environment
Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process
Coordinate with platform Information System Security Officer with the daily management of information security related queries and requests

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of recent security and IT experience is required
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer networking, computer security or a related field, or equivalent work experience
Experience with Microsoft Azure is preferable: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Policies, Azure Application Gateways, Web Application Firewalls, Network Security Groups, among others
Network infrastructure knowledge on TCP/IP and Internet protocols
Experience with Palo Alto Prisma is preferable
CISSP, CISM, CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional) or CCSK (Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge) certifications or equivalent experience is preferred

Job Title: Senior Associate, BTS Technical Business Analyst
Job Description:
At KPMG, you can become an integral part of a dynamic team at one of the world's top tax firms. Enjoy a collaborative, future-forward culture that empowers your success. Work with KPMG's extensive network of specialists & enjoy access to our Ignition Centers, where deep industry knowledge merges with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative tax solutions. Join a diverse team helping high-profile clients understand, analyze, and respond to complex business opportunities and challenges. Develop your career through a range of multifaceted engagements, formal training, and informal mentoring. At KPMG, we believe nothing is more important than investing in our culture because it's an investment in our people, our future, and what we stand for as a firm

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate to join our Business Tax Services practice.

Responsibilities:

Prioritize work to meet milestones and complete deliverables in a timely manner while adhering to the business requirements throughout the project lifecycle
Prepare documentation, presentations, charts, tables, and diagrams and conduct reviews for scope, business justification and business requirements including use cases, design documents, prototypes, and business rules
Review test plans and scenarios to help ensure an accurate, effective product and participate in functional and system testing as needed, identifying, and documenting system deficiencies and recommending new methodology
Document and track the status of client inquiries, enhancement requests, change requests and defects
Prepare detailed specifications for developers and apply technical experience in evaluating software modifications that will enhance operating and development activities
May oversee work product, manage deadlines, expectations and often contributing to staffing decisions and supervising the work performed by more junior staff

Qualifications:

Minimum three years of recent hands-on experience using Microsoft Office Suite, UML, flow charting software, change control/defect tracking software, project management methodologies and design tools
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline from an accredited college/university
Skilled in organizing information based on reviewing meeting notes, specifications, interviewing clients, architects, and developers
Understanding of SOA (Service Oriented Architecture), ASP.NET, SQL, XML and Design Patterns
Experience in researching, planning, and recommending software and systems solutions

Are you an IT Project Manager who enjoys leading high-visibility projects for organizational success? If so, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! We invite you to play a crucial role in integrating business processes, system requirements, and project executions. Your strategic leadership will drive the success of critical business system solutions, leading a team of four business analysts and key partners, driving an impactful outcome.


This role is based in our Rosemont, IL office, with the flexibility to work remotely up to three days a week, and reports to the Director of IT.


IN THIS ROLE, YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE:

Lead global business system implementation projects by providing strategic direction.
Build and maintain comprehensive project plans, schedules, and estimates for tracking progress.
Facilitate the implementation of critical systems worldwide, leading business group programs and collaborative discussions.
Collaborate with third-party vendors to ensure seamless integration and achieve successful project outcomes.
Establish and uphold processes to meet project plans and client expectations throughout the program lifecycle, operating at both strategic and tactical levels.
Implement program communication plans, ensuring effective leadership engagement and providing regular status updates.
Conduct risk analysis and review progress against project landmarks and budgets, maintaining high-quality standards.
Provide day-to-day direction to project resources, identify key collaborators, and guide project teams.


WHO YOU ARE:

You strategically handle conflicts by foreseeing issues, encouraging consensus, and ensuring everyone feels heard and valued. Comfortable when navigating ambiguity, you make informed decisions, handle risks, and demonstrate agility for effective operations amidst incomplete information. Using business insights, you align technical projects with broader organizational goals seamlessly. Navigating complex problems, you decipher detailed information to achieve successful project outcomes.


FOR THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED:

Established capability in leading system implementation projects.
5+ years of experience in business analysis, project management, or related roles.
Strong proficiency in project management software tools, methodologies, and standard processes.
Ability to travel internationally, up to 10% annually.
Legal Authorization to work in the United States – sponsorship will not be provided for this role


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS THAT SET YOU APART:

One or more of the following is preferred, but not required:

Bachelor's Degree
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
Experience in leading ERP implementations (e.g., Oracle, SAP, JDE, Microsoft Dynamics, or other ERP systems).
Previous work experience within a manufacturing or supply-chain-centered business model.

OUR OFFER TO YOU:

We recognize the importance of employee wellbeing and know that to do your best you must have flexible, competitive benefit plans to meet you and your family’s physical, mental, financial, and social needs. We provide a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage. Employee Assistance Program, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. Our culture prioritizes work-life balance and offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspire innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

The philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson .

Our training programs and initiatives focus on end-to end development, from onboarding through senior leadership. We provide a wide range of development opportunities, including face-to-face and virtual training, mentorship, and coaching, project management, and on-the-job training.

Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

Join our team – let’s go!

The opportunity

At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:

The life we create within our virtual walls, every day
Our B Corp certification

The role

The ideal Content Management System (CMS) Platform Delivery Lead is innovative, working as a servant leader of their team, leading the team through refinement, planning and delivery of scope. Focused on facilitating the successful delivery of CMS Platform experiences that serve the needs of authors and end users. Working closely with client stakeholders, business users, and cross-functional delivery teams over the lifecycle of a project to gather and document solution requirements and to drive solution design in partnership with product ownership, UX design, and technical leadership. This role manages in partnership with client product ownership.

Role responsibilities
Manage CMS Platform projects from UXR through Design and Build
Serve as an expert in the functional use of the client’s chosen CMS platform
Understand CMS Platform and lead with platform knowledge driving UI / UX best commerce experience.
Driving system demonstrations and training to client business users.
Facilitating all necessary team meetings (sprint planning, daily standups, sprint reviews/retrospectives, etc.)
Facilitating Agile release planning and helping the PO manage the release backlog.
Coaching the team in Agile relative estimation techniques, cross-functionality and self-organization
Identifying, managing, and mitigating project issues and risks
Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially with respect to defining and prioritizing the product backlog
Ensuring transparency into the team’s work through the Sprint Backlog, Burndown Chart and other Agile metrics
Leading by example - knowing when, and how, to push for more results
Proactively identifying and removing impediments that interfere with the ability of the team to deliver Sprint commitments
Being the coach and all around advocate for Agile delivery methodology amongst project team and client stakeholders
Influencing software development lifecycles (plan, design, development, testing, and deployment) and work with both the business and technology teams
Facilitating necessary team meetings including Sprint Planning, Daily Standups, Sprint Reviews & Retrospectives, along with ensuring effective backlog refinement
Conducting business analysis and translating business requirements to customer experience and development needs
Building roadmaps and advising clients on future strategies and execution
Providing recommendations catered to client industries and their customers
Minimum qualifications

We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.

4+ years of experience in a delivery lead role within a software development Agile environment, product experience is a plus
4+ years of experience with a Content Management System; Contentful, Adobe Experience Manager, Optimizely etc.
5+ years of consulting experience
Experience leading global Agile team of 10+ developers and designers to develop the client’s prioritized features with product owner responsibility of feature sign-off and approval
Demonstrated success in iterative release of software systems
Experience managing project budgets of $8 million+
Deep understanding of empirical data needed for stakeholder reporting and team measurement.
Proven ability to manage budget, forecast, margin and utilization of project team in a Fixed Fee setting
Experience working with Rally/Jira or a similar project management software
The ability to collaborate with a team in the UK with overlapping working hours between 8 AM - 12 PM EST
Preferred qualifications
Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Certification or project experience in Content management / commerce systems
Knowledge of traditional SDLC
Prior experience in the Financial Services industry
Proven ability to bring transparency to the business team about development; growing trust while demonstrating your commitment to deliverables to the business team.
Experience with identifying delivery issues and risks, and a sense of urgency for removing blocks and driving continuous improvement
PMP & CSM or other Agile certifications

Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. We build digital solutions that connect people, data and technology for some of the world’s most influential companies.
